From the tour of the market, to coffee at the family compound and of course the expert cookery class and delicious lunch that followed, this experience delivered on all accounts.Our group consisted of novice cooks (such as us) to restaurant owners and chefs; it appeared everyone learnt something and took new skills and knowledge away with them.I would say a must for any trip to Ubud and the area and great value for money.

Great day at Lobong. Highly recommend signing up.. This goes far beyond a cookery class. It's really an introduction to Balinese family life and culture done over an excellent cooking demonstration and finished off with a delicious meal. I highly recommend doing it while in Ubud. Learnt so much about the food at the markets, family life in a Balinese compound, the 1.5 hours it takes to cook rice! and so much else besides. Just do it!

Fantastic experience, highly recommended.. We booked into this course after reading its reviews and it lived up to expectation in every way. We were picked up from our homestay in ubud, for no additional cost, and taken to the local market. Here we were shown around by our guide who explained every detail of the market keeping it both interesting and fun. We then went back to his amazing family home where we were treated like royalty by the whole family who were so kind. The cooking course consisted of 4 dishes with lots of different elements and skills to learn and ended with a lovely meal in the beautiful gardens. My girlfriend and I have loved Bali and this was definitely one of the absolute highlights.

Wonderful introduction to Indonesian culture. Thoroughly reccomend this course as an insight into the real Balinese way of life.It is not just a cooking class but also an education into the customs/religion of the locals.Even our 15 & 11 year old i-Pod/Smartphone daughters found it interesting-high praise indeed!The trip to the market is a real eye opener into the non-tourist Bali,with lots of interesting facts revealed by our host "Sunday"(Definitely the wrong spelling) in his near perfect English.You then go back to the family compound where he explains the reasons behind the layout of the buildings/temples(each compound has its own temple)and you learn about the family way of life in Bali.Later you are honoured to enter the temple whilst the family Matriarch carries out a blessing,which is fascinating to witness first handYou are then handed over to sunday's brother Made who is the ChefThe cooking class itself is very enjoyable.All the ingredients are explained to you and you each take part in various stages of the food preperation/cooking.All in an amazing courtyard setting.There are several staff constantly bringing/removing ingredients/utensils,everything is extremely hygenic. Then the best bitYou get to feast on the fruits of your labour-DELICIOUS!If this is what we will be eating for the rest of the holiday i am in food heaven!Thank you Sunday(sorry about the spelling)Made and the rest of your family for a truly unforgettable experience

Awesome! Best activity we did in Ubud.. Through the class we gained a greater understanding of the labour required to place these dishes on the table, as well as the cultural place of food in the Balinese way of life. Our Lobong Culinary Experience was an excellent, enlightening day. Very highly recommended. Full review and photos at foodgoldcoast(dot)com(dot)au(slash)lobong

Wonderful activity!. This was so fun and the family that runs the school is extremely nice. You get to enter their home, have the daily worship at their home temple explained and see how they live as well as cook (chop, chop, chop) and eat the result. The trip to the market was wonderful and the explanation of the spices very clear.
Loved It. Really laid back day that is both informative on Balinese culture and cuisine. The food was great as well!

A true highlight. We (two couples) all considered this class one of the highlights of our Bali vacation. The market tour and information about Balinese families and home life was fascinating and enriching. The cooking was very hands on and the chef was obviously well-versed in various types of cuisines. We also oved the sweet mom demonstrating Balinese offerings before lunch and enjoyed eating a fabulous lunch and chatting with other travelers from Europe and Asia. Don't hesitate, just book this!

Very good day out. This was a great experience and we learnt a lot about the balinese culture. We visited a local market before going to a family compound where we were treated very well by the family. The cooking was fun, the food was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed our day. My one small gripe would be that there are quite a few people (12 in our case) on the class. Although this isn't a lot, it does mean that you essentially cook a meal between all of you and a lot goes on behind the scenes to get things ready. I have to say that I didn't really do an awful lot of cooking which was what we really paid for. It was still a lot experience and I would recommend it although I think the class size is a lite big for the people who go there to cook.

Fabulous day on many levels.. My sister, Pip and I booked for the Lobong Cooking School and we both enjoyed every minute from the tour of the local markets where we learnt about the ingredients used in Balinese cooking to the sit down meal at the end of the session. Lobong Cooking School staff were exceptional and the ten persons in the group participated in the making of 5 dishes learning lots of techniques along the way. We were welcomed into the family compound and told of the history and religious ceremonies which are so important for the Balinese people. At the end we were each presented with a gift bag containing a recipe book of the dishes prepared and a bottle of pure coconut oil. Many thanks to all the members of the Lobong compound for welcoming us and making our visit so special. Jane Thomas

Delicious. Anybody who is searching for some old fashion Balinese culture should be participating in this cooking school! It was a marvelous day spent in a family compound cooking and eating. The entire activity ran seamlessly and the kitchen facilities were spotless. With a maximum of 12 students we all experienced a very hands on morning. If your time in Ubud is limited then put this class on top of your list you will be very well fed and learn a great deal about the traditional Bali which is thankfully a world away from Kuta, bars and nightclubs.

Great afternoon of cooking!. Felt welcome from the moment we walked in. Great people, warm staff and run very professionally. Interactive setting with other participants made a really interesting class even more fun! Highly recommended...

Highlight of my stay in Ubud . The family who run Lobong are very passionate not only about their food but about sharing all the cultural heritage of Bali. The visit to the market in the morning was enlightening and it was really nice to go somewhere outside of Ubud where locals come to shop rather than tourists. The cooking experience was really great fun and we learned all about the different technics used for steaming rice (80mins!!) and preparing the sambal olek and the peanut sauce etc... The menu is very extensive so make sure you don't have a big breakfast in the morning. It's worth it. Thanks a lot for this great authentic balinese experience.

A cooking and cultural experience I'll always remember.. This was a fantastic experience I will recommend to everybody that visit Ubud! The classes are no more than 10 -12 people and everybody get a chance to cook. A true Balinese culture and cooking experience. Thank you to Sang Made and his family. I cant say anything more that already have been said in all the other reviews!

5 star experience!. From the moment we were picked up, this proved to be a fantastic experience. We were lucky enough to get a place with only a days notice, and thank goodness we did! From the local market tour (a genuine local market!) to the introduction to the family compound - this cooking class taught us so much about the Balinese lifestyle and values - it was much more than just cooking! However, the cooking was the highlight - as someone who is a confident cook, I still learnt a lot of different things and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. But don't worry, less confident cooks were equally accommodated, and everyone was given a number of opportunities to be hands on throughout the lesson. Cannot wait to try out the chicken satay (sate) and peanut sauce at home! Thank you Sang de and family for welcoming us into your home and providing an experience we will never forget!

A true taste of Balinese cuisine and culture. Absolutely fantastic!!Began with a hotel transfer to a food market full of locals and no other westerners. Sang, our guide, was great and very informative. From here our group of around 12 were driven to the family compound (home) with cold water and towels in the cars. Here you are welcomed into the beautiful family home and given information about Balinese culture which is totally unique.For the cooking class you are handed over to other family members and you make a full meal completely from scratch. It is informative and fun and everyone gets really stuck in. And the results are absolutely delicious!! At the end of the experience you are given a recipe book so you can make the meals at home too.Overall the day is from around 8am to 3pm including hotel transfer. Honestly it was unforgettable, the family couldn't have done anything more to improve the day, make sure you book for a fantastic day in Bali.

Fantastic Culinary Experience. I booked the Lobong Cooking Class via the internet prior to arriving in Bali, Sande's communication via e-mail was first class with very quick confirmation of the class.Sande's picked us up at our hotel in Ubud and took us to the market on the other side of Ubud picking up other people on the way. The market visit was very informative with Sande explaining all the local produce that we would be using to make our lunch.On arrival at his family home we were given an explanation of the typical Balinese home and their culture. Following this we were introduced to Sande's brother in-law who hosted the cooking class. The class was fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed the fantastic lunch that we had all prepared, the highlight was the chicken satay, the peanut sauce is to die for!!!!!! Once we were finished lunch, we were all given a recipe booklet with alternative ingredient suggestions, coconut oil and the contact e-mail details should we wish to contact if we have any further queries when we try the cooking at home.If you are going I to try a Balinese Cooking Class whilst you are in Bali I would definitely recommend you give this one a try, trust me you won't be disappointed.

The highlight of my Bali trip. Every disappointment is for a good,we tried getting accomodation to 2 other cooking class to no avail,but on our third attempt Lobong was availbale,and the Gods were on our side.Sang de(Sunday) picked up my daughters and I, and the moment we entered the vehicle he started to impart facts on balinese culture,we visited the market outside of Ubud no hasslingencountered and he gave us an isight into the diffrent ingredients we would be using in our cooking class along with other traditional balinese products,quite informative,we wer then taken to the family compound after a cold towel to cleanse our hand and a btl of water,beautifulfamily home,the restrooms were spotless,were given an insight into the Hindu cultures and customs prior to being turn over to his brother in law for our cooking adventure,and a wonderful experience it was,hands on and all our questions were answered in the event there were any,since he did explain everything we did in details.Once done we were all experinece'Sang de Mom dressing us in order to give blessing in the temple prior to digging in the deliciousmeal our hands made,along with complinmetary drinks.We were then given a gift of cocnut oil which I've been using since I returned home along with a recipe book of all the dishes we made.We were also accomodated with a ride back to where we staying..I for sure will definitely do this again with lobong on my next trip to Ubud,and would highly recommend anyone visitng this area to do themselve a favour and give yourself a extraordinary experinece with the Lobong family...A cultural experince of a lifetime..

Cultural experience with cooking included. Thank you Sande and your family for hosting us for a cooking class at your kompong. We booked our cooking class via the internet and they were very responsive and happy to accommodate our timetable. The day started with pickup and we went to a market outside of Ubud. No tourists around and Sande explained how the market worked. We met many of the people selling their products and it was very informative. We then went to Sande's beautiful family home for the cooking class. Everything was explained in detail and every question answered. We were shown around the kompong and the layout and family structure was explained to us. After our cooking class, which was very enjoyable and hands on, we participated in an offering with Sande's mother, with the whole process explained to us. After that we enjoyed the beatiful food we helped prepare. The chicken satay was a standout - delicious! We were offered complimentary drinks and could also have a beer (charged) if that was wanted. We were all given a gift of coconut oil and a recipe book, and dropped off at our accommodation afterwards. All the ingredients were of high quality and very clean, including the bathroom facilities. Wear comfortable shoes as you will be walking and standing a bit. Highly recommended!

Highlight of our time in Bali. This cooking class was superb from start to finish. It started with pick up from our hotel, taking us to the market where we met up with the rest of our tour group (there were 12 of us altogether which was a good number). We did a 30-40min tour of the market which was a local market so not touristy the back to the family compound for the rest of the experience. We spent the next few hours learning about Balinese culture and traditions, cooking and then eating a beautiful meal. The hygiene standards were high throughout - from the preparation of the food through to the toilets. Before we left we were given a small gift and a booklet with ingredients and instructions for each of the items we had cooked that day. Our car was waiting for us and took us back to the hotel. It was fantastic value for money.We would highly recommend this experience and would like to thank the family for welcoming us into their home. We have nothing negative to say about the day - It was the highlight of our stay in Bali.

Much more than cooking!. From the fantastic and hands on tour of the market, to the great explanation of key elements of Balinese cooking, they've seriously gone above and beyond to deliver this experience. I slashed my finger pretty good right in the beginning and they were so kind and helpful about it (sorry again for that, will be sure to work on my knife skills!) Honestly though I have absolutely no negatives to add. Fantastic experience, and I wish your family all the best!

Fantastic cooking experience. This was my second cooking class experience over the years I have been coming to Bali and Lobong Cooking Class was the best. The day started with pick up from hotel and then the drive through to Ubud. We met up with the rest of the class at the market and ventured through with explanations of different foods and spices etc. From the market we drove to the family compound and there began our cooking experience. A menu had been prepared of delicious foods all of which was to be consumed a la carte at the end of the "hands on" preparation of the food. The food was so delicious and something I have promised myself to tackle on my return home. Upon asking for a few extra recipes, these were emailed as requested. A great day and something I would recommend to travellers for something a little bit different to try on their holidays

Best Cooking Class and All Around Ubud Culture Experience. My husband and I took this cooking class on our honeymoon in November 2013. This was definitely one of the highlights. First we went to a local market where we saw where the locals actually purchased their ingredients and learned of all the different ingredients that go into balinese cooking. Then we were taken to the family compound where we were welcomed into their home, learned about family culture in ubud and then began the cooking class. We also learned more about the offerings in balinese culture and experienced it first hand in the temple in their compound. It was by far the best cooking school experience I have encountered and the food was absolutely delicious - we hope to actually be able to recreate it at home one day. I highly recommend this.

Highlight of my Ubud trip. Partaking in a cooking class during my Bali trip was on the top of my list. Found this one through trip advisor and it was amazing! I didn't really have any expectations leading up to the class other than walking through the market and cooking some tasty food. The class ended up being so much more than that with in-depth explanations throughout the local's market and learning about Balinese culture at the family's compound. The hosts are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. And the food is so delicious!

Great experience and delicious food. Bali cooking school reviewI've been to Bali a few times and never done a cooking class. I now wish I'd done this on my first trip. The experience is an enlightening and warm introduction to Balinese cooking and culture. I feel privileged to have gained a small insight into some local traditions.Sang De was friendly, helpful and informative. From the moment he picked us up at our hotel we felt genuinely welcomed by him and his family. The walk around the market was fascinating. It's more than an introduction to local spices, but a bit of culture and tradition too. The food was fantastic and having gotten involved in the cooking means I'm much more likely to try some of the recipes when we get home. A great morning followed by a lovely lunch in a beautiful setting welcomed by warm and gracious hosts. Highly recommended.

Terrific Cooking Class and Amazing Family Compound Experience!. We were traveling as a large group in Ubud and decided we wanted to do a Cooking Class. The folks at Lobong put together a private cooking class for us at their facility which included a sit down dinner. The experience was excellent! We had 7 kids with us (ages 6-16) and 6 adults and the folks at Lobong worked hard to ensure that everyone enjoyed the class and participated. The time we spent learning about life in the family compound was as cool as the time cooking! Overall, a great experience and we would highly recommend to anyone wanting to learn more about Indonesian cuisine.

Best activity we did on our Bali Holiday. We had the most lovely time learning about the indonesian culture and cooking on this fantastic experience. The whole planning from booking the class to the collection and drop off services was perfect. Sang De was such a fantastic host of the tour of the market and his detailed and patient explanation of Balianese Traditional Culture including answering many questions from everyone, really meant we walked away feeling we had learnt much more about Bali than just having a touristy holiday. The meal we had was really excellent and we walked away feeling absolutely satisfied that this experience was great value for money. Thank you very much for our cooking class Lobong Family. It was a great and memorable experience!! We would recommend to anyone coming to Bali.

Amazing class, Favorite Part of Ubud. I agree with all the great reviews. This experience was definitely the highlight of my visit to Ubud. We arranged the class last minute and they easily made accommodations for us to be picked up the next morning. Sang De picked us up on time and another couple and brought us to the local market and explained to us all about the different foods and culture. We even got to try some fruits at the market. Everyone was so friendly and it was so neat to see this side of Ubud rather than the tourist sections.Next we were welcomed to their family compound where we learned the culture and history behind the compound and were welcomed with coffee and banana fritters. We then started the cooking class and it was so informative and fun. They explained every step thoroughly and everyone got a chance to participate in the cooking. My favorite part was seeing how the satays wre grilled and how the rice was cooked.After the cooking was done and before we ate we got to experience giving gifts to the gods in the family compound. It was very neat to see. Then we got to enjoy an amazing meal where they served us. As apart of the cost, you get the cookbook from the recipes you made and a sample of hand made coconut oil. I highly recommend going here. The people are so friendly and it such a full cultural experience. They really care about sharing the Balinese culture and cooking with others!

Fantastic cooking class. My fiancee and I booked this cooking class based off other TripAdvisor reviews and all of those reviews are 100% right. This is such a fantastic class! We arranged transport, which was on-time. Sang picked us up and filled us in on Balinese culture and food on our drive to the market. We met up with the rest of our group there and got an informative tour of the market. Then they took us back to Sang's family compound, which was quiet interesting and really beautiful. Sang's brother in law took over with the cooking class. He's an excellent chef and makes sure everyone gets included. You definitely don't need to be a pro to do this class. It's very much for amateurs as well. Everything is very clean and comfortable. We were picked up at 8a and got back to our hotel in Ubud around 2:30p. You get pretty hungry during the class, but the end result is SO much great food!I would definitely recommend this class! We're still raving about the food!

A highlight of our time in Bali.. We did this as a family. My husband, 21 year old daughter and myself. I looked at reviews of the different cooking schools in Ubud and chose this one and so glad I did. I sent a booking via their website and received a prompt reply. We were picked up on time and from then on had a wonderful experience. With very good English, Sang Made told us so much about the culture. We had to stop for a long procession and he explained about the mass cremation, which was going to take place. The local food market was fascinating and he showed us different ingredients we would be using. The actual cooking is done at the family compound and it was an honour and a pleasure to be there. Dee War was so pleasant and passionate about Balinese cuisine. It is simple, but the prcocesses are very important. Loved learning how to make Sate sauce from scratch. Sitting down to the beautiful food at the end after mother gave the blessings was so enjoyable. Recommend this so much.

A Perfect Day!. What a great experience! This day was terrific from the 8.00am start to the 2.30pm finish. Snag De is a wonderful host - engaging, knowledgeable, and with great English - and Dee War is a great teacher ensuring that our dishes all turned out perfectly. The market tour was a great insight into a local Balinese market and the family compound was beautifully presented and informatively explained.The day finished with a lovely meal in a great setting. One of the best value experiences in Bali.

No need to be a cook. All you need is a half day and an interest in Balinese culture...oh and an appetite. Our day started at 8 with a pickup from hotel, off to the local food markets where all the ingredients and strange fruit and spices were explained to us. Chatting with the local vendors was fun and interesting. We then were welcomed into the family compound with a drink and an explanation of how the family live in the compound. Our cooking class began and everyone had a a few small tasks to do that contributed to completing a fantastic feast. Before we ate we were invited into the family temple to experience and learn about the tradition of placing offerings to the gods. The family then served us the delicious feast that we had helped to create. This was a wonderful experience with beautiful and welcoming hosts.My daughter and I didn't want to return to our villa after the class, but head into Ubud for a massage, Sande phoned ahead to the spa for us and made our appointment and delivered us there on time. Don't miss this if you are in Ubud.

A whole culture package!. From the start, Sang Made has been very friendly - the reservation process was easy on the internet and the confirmation was quick too. This allow easy planning for our time in Ubud.Our little group of 7 was taken to the local market to look at various things! Sang Made was very knowledgable and could answer every single questions that we threw at him! He also got us to try the local fruits and was very patient in explaining the various local norms - the warungs that the local hang out, the snacks that they have, the sate stall.. It as such a culture treat!When we arrive at their house, we were treated with either Bali coffee or the ginger tea with banana fritters. While we eat, Sang Made explains the culture of names, the house that was handed from one generation to another and also the family temple.The cooking class was enjoyable and easy and we were given a lot of explanation on what substitute that we can use in the cuisine. There was as so much care taken into making sure that we learnt the cuisine and was able to replicate it back home.Before we sat down together to have lunch, we were treated to witness how an offering to God was conducted by his mother which was really interesting.All in all, we had a great time and it was more than just a cooking class - it was a truly cultural experience!

A fantastic culinary and cultural experience. There are many cooking classes to choose from in Ubud, and here are the reasons that Lobong Cooking class ultimately won us over:- Small classes of 10 people max, which makes for a pleasant, intimate setting conducive to learning. - Menu seemed interesting (this was before we landed in Bali and became familiar with the local foods) and the family took allergies seriously. No shrimp paste was used during the class, and this was reassuring, especially with my shellfish allergy.- Free pick up in Ubud.Of course, I can name you even MORE reasons now after having taken the class why you should choose Lobong Cooking class over the rest. Besides the local market tour, the delicious ginger tea and banana fritters that have been offered to us before we got our hands ''dirty'' + parting present (coconut oil + recipe booklet), I'm thankful for our teacher who offered a clear, hands-on experience to those attending the class (enough for us to be able to recreate the menu at home -- thank goodness, as the Kare Ayam and Dadar Gulung were fantastic). We also appreciated the ingredient substitutions they provided and the patience they demonstrated to the culinary-challenged (i.e. ME) Best part of the class was stuffing your face with the scrumptious feast, of course!

One of the very best travel experiences ever. After reading the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor our group of two families booked the Lobong experience and we were not disappointed. We were picked up from our accommodation in Ubud, and enjoyed the trip out to Payangan village, about a half hours drive. It was good to go to a place where there are not so many tourists. The trip to the morning market was so interesting and we really appreciated being guided around by Seng De who had lots of personality and was a mine of information. Lots of good photo opportunities there too, and friendly interaction with stall holders. The lady selling piglets even held one squealing piglet up for us to take a photo! We were also fascinated by the coloured chicks, and painted crabs! Not to mention hearing about the suckling pig, how to kill eels and what fruits make good offerings!! After that we had the privilege of visiting our host family's home compound - a beautiful and interesting place where we had the chance to learn about "real Balinese" people. The cooking school is brilliantly run by the whole family who take different roles but have complimentary skills. After being served with a coffee or ginger tea, we were shown around and then started on the cooking. The array of foods and spices etc all laid out was wonderful and again, lots of photo opportunities.The facilities were professionally geared to a cooking class but yet authentically local. There was a good balance between being instructed and shown a demonstration on the one hand and having a chance to do the hands on work oneself. The main chef, Dewa, worked as a chef for many years and knows what he is doing but has a relaxed and friendly manner making it easy to ask him questions. We also appreciated meeting the elderly mother of the family who had prepared offerings for the family temple - we were then allowed to accompany her into the temple while these were made. This was also very interesting.After jointly preparing the food we ate lunch - one of the most delicious meals ever. Our own group included two teenagers and four adults - all of us had a great time. We are so pleased that we managed to get a booking for what is one of our best travel experiences ever. Very highly recommended and extremely well priced, especially considering that the meal is included as well as travel etc. You won't be disappointed if you manage to get a booking.

Best cooking class... ever !. We have done a cooking class last year at another place and decided to try a new one this year.. Seriously, do yourself a favor and book with Lobong, you won't regret it ! We went to the market and Sang De explained to us everything we will use for the cooking class. Have to mentionned his english is very good and all the information he gives is more than interesting. I've learn more in a couple hours about balinese culture and food than in our entire trip. The family compound is beautiful and the kitchen very clean. One of us has allergies to peanut and seafood and at Lobong it was taken very serioulsy. Apart from the peanut sauce, they don't use nut/peanut/shrimp paste in any of the dishes, so it was very safe. Chef Dewa was also very knowledgeable and a good host. Now the food,.. it was DELICIOUS and we had big portions, so you won't leave hungry. The food was just spicy enough and every ingredient was fresh. Honestly, it was one of our best meal in all our trip and we made it ourselves. What is also nice, is that you leave with a recipe book and also some homemade coconut oil. The price is very decent for the service and quality of food you get. I recommend Lobong to everyone, it is a must do in Bali. It's not just a cooking class but a great way to learn about balinese culture and food. Thanks to Sang De and his family for this amazing experience ! Merci beaucoup !

Highly professional yet friendly. One of the highlights of my trip to Ubud. The staff were sincere, caring and very professional. The food we prepared was delicious. I would recommend this experience to anyone interested in food.

Special in every sense . What an incredible experience! Start off with a pick up from your hotel and then to an authentic market tour. No touristy junk here, just down home Balinese items. Sang Made lead us through the market carefully explaining ingredients and allowed us to taste along the way. Then, he took us to his home, a beautiful family compound just minutes from the market. Here he and his family welcomes us as family. They toured us around their traditional home explaining the intricate details so foreign to western culture. Then the cooking began! We met Chef Dewa, another member of the family. He carefully guided us through every step including traditionally steaming rice, making sambal, curry chicken, vegetable salad and chicken satay. All the ingredients were impeccable; so fresh, flavorful and fragrant. Finally we made creeps stuffed with coconut and sugar- wow! This class was certainly a highlight of my honeymoon and would suggest to anyone looking for a true cultural experiment in Ubud!
Fantastic Cooking Experience !. Loved the experience to cook traditional Indonesian cuisine! Everything was perfect. Must do while in Ubud.

Amazing experience at Lobong Cooking class. The staffs were really friendly as well as knowledgable. In the morning, the staff came to pick us up right infront of our villa even though it is difficult to access. He drove us to the designated market to let another staff to bring us around the market and explain the ingredients that we will be using in our food. His explanation were thorough and he was well liked by the people in the market as well. Also, he let us touch and smell the ingredients we are using. Questions were also asked so that we will be able to remember the information given.Back to the home, we were greeted with coffee/ ginger tea as well as banana fritters. The staff was also explaining about the culture of Bali housing. It is a brilliant touch on top of learning solely how to cook. He was also very open to questions asked about the place.Next, it was time to cook hands on. The chef who taught us explain how to do the dishes steps by steps. We were able to understand as well as follow his pace. He is also very encouraging, so first timer don't have to feel pressurize to do well or to catch up with the speed of others. Similarly, questions were also asked so that we will remember the technique acquired. In this class, we are able to have hands on activities such as frying, stirring, slicing, dicing the ingredients. All the cooking only took us 2 hours, to prepare 7 dishes. Lastly, we are served with the food that we cook and we are given a recipe book and a bottle of coconut oil as a gift to bring back. Overall it was a brilliant and amazing experience in Bali. It is not to be missed!

A great experience. I tried this class before checking out reviews. As a result I was going to review it but what can I say that has not already been said. Faultless. Don't miss it if you are in the area.

Fantastic experience! A must do!!!. I can't say enough about the experience you'll have if you attend this cooking class. It is SO much more than a cooking class--but rather a comprehensive lesson on Balinese culture. The class occurs at a family compound with a VERY professional cooking school built to suit about 10 people. The whole family is involved in setting things up, assisting, teaching & support. It is a beautiful home/compound with an equally beautiful family. My wife and I own a travel company and brought a group of 11 people to the class. It was a highlight for everyone. Can't wait to go back!

The best Cultural & Food Experience!. When I returned to Bali this year, LoBong Cooking Class was a must re-visit! I took two retreat groups from the USA to experience this cultural and cooking experience. It is one of the best ways to understand the cultural along with learning to cook their wonderful, fresh and flavor dishes. Sang Made treats each group as family and shares many details about the Balinese way of life and Chef Dewa makes you feel like a pro in the kitchen. At the end of your efforts you sit down for a fine meal and take home recipes so you can impress your friends and family when you return home. Each time I return to Bali, I will return to this class!

Highlight of Bali Experience. When my sister advised us she had booked a cooking class on our holiday,I was "yeh ok" and after just contracting Ross River Virus 6 weeks before was wondering if I would stay upright for whole day.But it was just the remedy I needed.From meeting Sang Made & off for the tour of the local market, to look at the fresh produce we would use in our cooking that day, stopping to taste, smell & learn what some products were.Then back to his car for fresh hand towels to wash hands & continue to his family home "Lobong"As we descended into the Kampong the tranquility immediately enveloped us. Little birds chattering, beautiful gardens, water features, temple areas.While we sat & enjoyed a Balinese coffee & Pisang Goreng, Sang Made explained the home set up from the patriarchal family system to how every house designed with North/ East aspect.Then we were handed over to Chef Dewa & the team for a morning of cooking the best meal of the trip, cooked by ourselves & a lovely couple from Perth Sarah & TroyThe whole experience was a blessing, to be invited into their beautiful home & shown true Balinese culture & food.Meeting the Matriarch of the family with kindest smile, showing us the blessing of the food before we sat down to eat this beautiful meal we had all created.I would highly recommend this experience to anyone who is looking to learn more about Balinese culture & cooking. Than you Sang Made, Chef Dewa & family for welcoming us into your family home & enlightening us about your culture & cooking Wendy, Sue & Jo from Darwin, Cairns & Sunshine Coast (QLD)

Incredible. Brilliant from start to finish. Wasn't expecting to learn so much about Balinese culture in general, the tour of the market and home before cooking was really well done. You all cook communally a meal for lunch so not tasting as much along the way but it's worth the wait. A great set up.

Must Do Cooking Class!. My husband and I took the Lobong cooking class at the end of May and had a fabulous time. They picked us up at our hotel at 8 am and took us to the local markets where Sang Made walked us around and explained all of the different ingredients we would be using that day. We are able to interact with the vendors and get a true Balinese market experience. Sang Made's English was excellent and it was a perfect introduction into an amazing day.After the market, we went to Sang Made's family compound where we were greeted with delicious coffee, tea and fried banana. Then we got right to work chopping and making the different sauces for the day. Chef Dewa did an amazing job explaining the different Balinese techniques and walking us through the different dishes we would be making that day. We made several dishes including chicken curry, sweet potatoe rice, chicken satay with peanut sauce, vegetable salad and a delicious coconut crepe for dessert. There was woman who was vegetarian and gluten free in our group and they were so accommodating to her restrictions. They had her make vegetarian curry instead of chicken and made a vegetable kebab for her. TBefore we ate, they had their mother made a sacrifice in their temple and then served us at a beautiful table in center of the compound. It was a true Balinese experience from start to finish and even gave us some coconut oil to take home!

The Highlight Of Our Trip To Bali. What a wonderful day, the is experience is so much more than just a cooking class! Everything was so well organised and we gained a wealth of cooking & cultural experience. I honestly couldn't fault anything about our trip to Lobong Cooking Class. Our guide Sang Made was very welcoming and spoke perfect English. Our Chef Dewa was very knowledgeable and was happy to answer any questions we had. Water was available all day and the compound was very clean so you felt very at ease eating your lunch. This was a great experience that I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Bali. Don't forget to bring a camera, the lovely staff are more than happy to take photos for you.

An introduction to Balinese cultural traditions, market ingredients as well as cooking. What a wonderful way to spend a morning. The hosts all spoke excellent English and were great at explaining and demystifying Balinese traditions and cooking. Chef Dewa offers not only a great course in Balinese cooking but also had great advice on cooking techniques in general. Everything was so well organized I felt I was on one of those cooking shows on tv. Their family compound was lovely and I loved the tour of the market. Overall a very educational morning in a beautiful setting with great food at the end. What's not to love!

Must do!!. This was such a fun way to spend the afternoon. The host Sang Made was very informative and friendly. His English was excellent and he was a fantastic host.The chef and other staff was also very good at lookin after the group.It was more than just a cooking class, you get to learn about the spices in the market and family traditions. AMAZING food at the end of it all! I would definitely recommend lobong!

Must do in ubud. I think everyone should do a cooking class with Lobong when you are in ubud. It is so much more than just a cooking class. You get to see the local market and learn about local produce. They then welcome you into their unique home and you learn a bit about traditional balinese customs/rituals. They teach you cooking techniques that can be easily adapted into your own home. We had so much fun cooking and learning with others. And of course, the food we cooked was phenomenal. Overall it was a worthwhile experience and not to miss.

A. Maz. Ing.. Do not leave Bali without doing this. The cooking is only a small part of what you will experience. Starting with a trip through the market to see how the locals shop for their produce and staples, you will truly experience the life of the Balinese. Back at the Lobong compound, you will learn about daily life, family traditions and spiritual practices. This is the real deal.The hosts couldn't be more genuine and gracious. The food is spectacular. It may well be the best meal you eat in Bali, and you'll be utterly amazed that you helped create it. It's a bit of a time commitment, but definitely worth it.

Best cooking class. I was impressed by how responsive Sang Made, our family host, had been to my emails and this also proved to be true during the cooking class. There were 8 students and we started by visiting the Payangian Market where we got to see different roots, herbs, varieties of rice, palm sugar, and much more. Afterwards we went to the family compound where Chef Dewa (20 years of experience) and 3 assistants taught us how to prepare seven dishes. This has to be one of the BEST cooking classes I have ever taken. It was definitely hands on and everything had been arranged and prepared just right to facilitate preparing all the dishes.This class is especially worthwhile because you get to visit the family compound (a very nice one), hear about the family history, and see how Sang Made’s mother does the ceremonial offerings at the family temple before the meal was served. You are basically getting a lesson in Balinese culture and traditions as well as a cooking class. Tip: you will receive a gift at the end of the class, make sure you put the liquid one (won’t tell you what it is) in a Ziploc bag to prevent any leakage in your suitcase.

More than a cooking school!. I have travelled to Bali frequently over the past 20 years and this is one of the best tours I have experienced. More than a cooking school, this is a fantastic day spent learning local produce, culture and cooking with a beautiful sharing family. Thank you Dewa for sharing your passion and cooking wisdom and Sang De for your highly professional delivery of local customs and culture. An awesome day!

Balinese cooking classes at its best. Wow what a positive and enlightening experience ! My mum and I learnt our Balinese spices first hand and the smells of these ingredients at the local Balinese Food Markets where the locals go shopping for the basic ingredients to Balinese staple food diet. Back to the Balinese compound where we learnt Balinese family traditions . First hand experience in preparation under careful guidance of a Balinese chef with over 20 years experience in culinary hotel cooking . To top that off we got to eat these experiences of different Balinese traditional dishes !!! Absolutely a must to do in Ubud with this very professionally run, but still with a lot of personal Balinese touch with the Lobong cooking family

Memorable, delicious, class act experience. I am driven to write a review, something I've only ever done once before. I was picked up by the lovely Agung promptly yesterday morning from my villa and transported to meet others at a market outside Ubud. There we met Sang De who gave us a really educational tour around the markets, showing us the ingredients that were going to go into our food for the day. We got to taste lots of things, lots of guessing what things were etc. so brush up if you want to be top of the class! Sang de has brilliant English and a great sense of humour. When we got back to the lovely family compound we were able to use their beautiful clean, modern facilities and then served tea or coffee and the yummiest banana fritters (which I really appreciated because I hadn't had breakfast.Dewa then took over seamlessly and began taking us through all the dishes we were making beginning with the spice paste. He explains and shows the techniques very well, it was a lot of fun and everyone gets plenty of turns.When we finished we watched Sang de's Mum give offerings in their temple and then sat down to our yummy lunch. I will definitely be trying to reproduce some of the dishes at home, the chicken curry was particularly delicious. And don't worry, the food is definitely not too spicy.The whole thing was wonderful, great job Lobong Cooking School.

Fantastic for foodies!. If you're looking for an authentic Balinese cooking class then this is it! Starting at the market, you are guided round, stopping at specific stalls to see, smell and feel some of the ingredients that you would later be using. The class itself is then held in a family compound where you are given an introduction to Balinese family life, their culture and a small snack of pisang goreng with coffee or herbal tea. The word 'compound' doesn't do it justice as it was a beautiful series of houses where each family unit of the wider family lives, with a family temple and ceremony spaces for everyone to share. This is the traditional way that Balinese people live and when a woman marries they move in to their husbands family compound.Then the cooking begins! For 2-3 hours you are taken through each of the 7 dishes step by step and for each one every person in the group gets the chance to cook. This part is led by a brilliant Balinese chef who has cooked in a top local restaurant for celebrities. He was very clear, his English excellent and he made it an easy and enjoyable experience. It was a fascinating experience to learn of all the stages involved in some key Balinese dishes and at the end you are given the recipes for them all so that you can replicate them at home. After all the cooking, everyone sits down to a feast of the dishes you have just prepared and this was easily one of the best meals we had in our two weeks in Bali. Our absolute favorite dish was the satay lilit and peanut sauce. So tasty that I am salivating just thinking about it!Every little detail was taken care of throughout the day from providing cold towels and water after the trip to the market, to the little gift given to everyone at the end. These touches were what made the day extra special for us and I can not recommend it highly enough!

A trip highlight. Lobong Cooking Class was a highlight of our visit to Ubud. A very informative trip to the market followed by a cold flannel to cool off and a bottle of water - a nice touch! Then to the family compound to partake in the cooking class. Lots of hands on cooking with very helpful and experienced instructor. The food we all made together was delicious. There were only 10 people participating in the class, and we all had plenty of work to do in preparing the food. Great activity for experienced and non experienced cooks. Also a great activity for children who are welcome. In summary I cannot recommended this class highly enough, great tour guides, cooking instructors and a generous family to allow us to share their compound for the day. Bring your camera and an empty stomach!!

Excellent and educational cooking class = Delish foods. I can't wait to take home the techniques we learnt at this class! If only Canada had a better selection of fresh Asian produce to buy. This family run business is professional and knowledgable in what they teach you. Everything from pick up to drop off was spectacular. You visit their local market (none of this touristy Ubud market stuff), and their home compound which is beautiful and they explain the typical Bali layout well. They let you see how locals produce and give offerings to the Gods. These are just extra added values to the whole cooking experience. The teachers and guides spoke English well and were very attentive to people needs and answering peoples questions. They add on a 10% service charge that is well worth the IDR.

One of best activities in Bali. My friends and me had an unforgettable time with Long bong Cooking class from beginning to the end of cooking course .Very interesting to visit local market to buy foods and back home and learned many from helpful and knowledgeable chef !

Great Cooking Class and Tour. We had a fabulous experience at the cooking class. The day began with a tour to a local market where we learned about ingredients in Balinese food. The rest of the time was spent at the family compound. It was a wonderful cultural experience to see how a Balinese family lives. A special thank you to the Mom for sharing the offering ceremony with us. The coffee and banana fritters were a tasty start to our cooking class. The class was amazing. The chef was incredibly knowledgeable and explained each step of the food preparation very well. All 10 guests participated in the food preparations. I learned why I love Balinese rice so much. The method for steaming rice is well worth the effort as the final product is so much better. We prepared a spice base, soup, sates with a dipping sauce, salad, curried chicken, and dessert. We sat down to a feast for lunch. All round, this is an excellent tour.

Best experience in Bali!. We thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class we did in April. It started with a visit to a local market, then off to the family compound which was absolutely breathtaking, some tea and appetizer before we started and finally an introduction to Balinese cooking by a knowledgeable chef! We learned hands on how to make 7 (SEVEN!!) dishes including my two favorites: chicken sate (that peanut sauce is magical!) and a Balinese coconut crepe that was out of this world. The chef was very knowledgeable and made the class a lot of fun by having us get involved in every dish. The staff were super friendly and made it easy for us to learn. Also the compound was quite beautiful and incredibly clean! I would highly recommend this class to anyone looking to experience real Balinese cooking! We really enjoyed it!

This is more than just a cooking class!. WOW! Great day, great experience, very professional and very authentic! We enjoyed our day with Lobong cooking class. The Day started at the local market with explanations about ingredients used in the Indonesian but also other kitchens. After the market we were invited in the Lobong family compound - wonderful setting! We got a tea/coffee and some cultural explanations which were very interesting to listen too. After that the cooking started. We were a small group and could do loads ourselves! After cookign we could watch an offering just before tasting our selfmade, really nice tasting food! In the end we got a little cooking book with all recepies and a little present. SUPERB

Genuine experience. This is the real deal. Seemless transport arrangements, real life market, cultural family experience and authentic setting. Skilled chef teaching the class and full communal Balinese experience. First class.

Don't hesitate. You get to experience a complete balinese cooking day! They open the doors of their home and show the guests their lovely traditions. Sang Made is a great host, and everything is very clean and neat. The Chef was willing to explain all the steps and any questions that we had. We really liked that they organize a small group per class (around 8 people). We were outside from the pick up area, so they set our transportation from Nusa Dua (around an hour and a half away) with an extra cost, so we could make the most of that day! If that's also your case, we highly recommend you organize transportation with them. Thank you from the gifts to bring home!

A must whilst in Ubud!. This cooking class takes you to the chefs family home compound. It is a beautiful compound. The family all take part in each step of the day. The eldest brother takes you to the local wet market to pick up the spices, the mother takes you to the temple to bless the food for lunch before you sit down to eat what you have prepared in the morning. The food is delicious. Will be using the recipe booklet to prepare dishes at home. By western standard it is a 4.5 star experience and in terms of hygiene. Will be bringing friends back!

One of the best Experience i had~. Lobong cooking class lives up the review on tripadvisor!Defo come back!Best meal we had in Bali, so organic, beautifully tasted. The class is taken place in a very nice compound, detailed walk through step by step.A tour in the market gets us a flavour of local Bali life/food. Defo worth a day!!! good value for money too!! we have so well taken care of!

Wonderful cooking class with very friendly professionals. Highly recommended cooking class, a lot of tips, a warm welcome in a local home, a nice visit of the local market.... and amazing balinese food in the end. The class is only 12 people maximum so you have the opportunity to ask all the questions you wish. If you love cooking, go for it!

Cultural beyond cooking experience. If you are looking to single-handedly create and prepare all the dishes, this is not the place. However, you do get a chance to be involved in at least 1-2 dishes and everyone gets to "chop chop chop" as per the friendly host, ma de:) I believe the max class size is 12. what I like about this cooking class was it extended to some cultural experience as well when ma de explained the structure of a Balinese compound, his mum's daily offering of prayers and the visit to the local market. All in all, a pleasant experience, I would recommend doing it if you are in ubud for a couple of days.

Excellent cooking & cultural class of Bali. Even though I am traveling quite frequently, it was only our very first experience joining a cooking class and my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed it and would probably do more in the future due to the excellent experience we had at Lobong. As a HK Chinese, going to the wet market is not something that we anticipated would exceed our expectation. It is the daily life of my mother frankly. However, with Sang De's introduction, we still found the trip to the market very interesting.We spent slightly more than half a day and were very satisfied with the taste of the dishes that we prepared. Sang De and his family were all passionate to introduce to us not only the way of Balinese cooking but also their culture as well as architecture. After the class, everyone got a little souvenir - a very natural and beautifully scented coconut oil and a menu, even though we probably would not be able to prepare exactly the same dishes due to the challenge to find those fresh spices and ingredients back home.We had a very lovely time at the class! Thank you!

Do it. You won't regret it . Spent a really lovely day here learning all about Balinese culture and how to make their delicious food. More hands on than I expected after reading some reviews which was a really pleasant surprise. Also the market you go to is the local one out of town and not the one tourist thronged one at the top of ubud. This was our highlight of our whole stay in ubud. Lovely family, opening and sharing their home and very interesting. The food is also delicious!

A Must Try Balinese experience. Thank you to Sang De and his family for an unforgettable Balinese cultural and culinary experience. Sang De brought us to the market then took us into his home where his family gave everyone a taste of wonderful Balinese hospitality. Sang De explained in great detail the Balinese way of life and his brother in law very professionally guided us in preparing and cooking a wonderful and delicious meal. HIs mother led the offering ceremony in their family temple- imbuing the experience with Balinese spirituality. Since Sang De and his brother in law worked with five star hotels previously, they spoke very good English and conducted everything in a very professional manner. We had been to Bali a few times before but this experience stood out and is something that we would highly recommend. Well done, Sang De! Congratulations!

A must do in ubud. One of the best experiences I've had in bali. You start at the markets where all the food is explained to you then you are invited into the family compound to experience a true Balinese dining experience. The food is amazing as were the family who took the time to explain about the Balinese culture also. The entire experience was exceptional!

Not only food but culture. What I have learned from this cooking class is not only the cooking skills, I have learned the culture and spirit of Balinese life. The class stared from market tour, in a very local market, we are the only foreigners there. Sang De shared many knowledge of foods and customs with us, then the cooking class stared in the traditional Bali house. Chef and staffs are very friendly and professional, with clear explanations and practice, I have learned a lot from the class. After cooking, they showed us how Balinese offer foods to the spirit in house temple, then we had the dishes made from the class as our lunch. It's a very great experience and very worth to try it.

Lobong Cooking Class - great experience. My wife and I really enjoyed this experience, from start to finish. The tour of the local market was an eye opener and very informative, in regard to local produce. This was followed by a tour of the family compound with Sang who gave a concise and clear explanation of the family structure and customs.Made then took us through the preparation of the meal, from basic ingredients. This was followed by the actual cooking part and then the meal - I can't believe how good it was.I recommend this experience to anyone looking to get an introduction to Balinese cuisine and culture.

Highlight of Ubud, wonderfully organized. I wish we had gone there sooner instead of on the last day! Hearing about the balinese culture was extremely interesting. Cooking food was fun. The whole day was superbly organized, and I also found that Made was very responsive to inquiries and e-mails. I really recommend this to everyone, especially if you're interested in the culture!

Wonderful way to understand Balinese culture, through food, fun and laughter. The whole day was spent getting a real sense of Balinese culture. The food was simply the medium for the true understanding. The market trip started the day, seeing the locals in their everyday lives was fantastic. Nothing prettied up, it was warts and all. I have been to Bali three times, and only now do I see the culture more clearly.

If you like food you will love this. A really excellent experience conducted by very friendly guide, chef and staff. Market tour very interesting, this is where the locals shop, no other tourists here. Cooking was entertaining, interesting and great fun and we made (with much guidance and assistance) the best food we've had in Bali. We also gained a great insight into Balinese culture by cooking in a traditional family compound. Highly recommended!

A highlight of our Ubud holiday. If you are looking for something to do whilst holidaying in Ubud, I highly recommend Lobong Cooking Class! With a visit to the local market and the class taking place in a family home, you are treated to a cooking and cultural lesson in one. Our guide, Sang De, is so kind and knowledgeable. The chef, Dewa, really knows his stuff and the food we cooked and shared at the end was simply divine. I can't wait to recreate the recipes at home.

Best time with Dawa & Lobong crew !. In short.....if you are a foodie/love cooking.....book a class with these professional, super friendly Lobong staff. Wear GOOD/STURDY footwear for market trip. Then change into thongs/sandles when you get back to LOBONG house where you will prepare/cook & eat the BEST "Balinese" food ever !!!! Value for money. Excellent time we had. Mother & Daughter....loved it !!!! Thank you sang De & Dawa (Bali Best chef) this guy knows his stuff/loves food. Skilled operator....and level of professionalism , very high & CLEAN !!!! Extremely Impressive !

The Perfect Compliment To Your Bali Stay. The people who run this cooking school are consummate professionals. Every aspect of the experience is choreographed, thought out, timed and executed. You are picked up at your hotel and brought to the market where a highly professional and knowledgable guide leads you through the different ingredients. The market is not touristy at all and really helps you to see how people in Bali truly live. Then it's onward to the family compound where over banana fritters and coffee the guide tells you all about Balinese life and religion -- a wonderful perspective that added so much to my knowledge of the place. It's one thing to hop around Ubud shopping and eating. This tour gave me so much insight into the religion and traditions of the Balinese which I glimpsed but never fully understood on my own. The cooking course is so much more than food -- the family are cultural ambassadors as well! I think this aspect is essential as tourists can gain deeper respect through understanding of where they are visiting. This is not to downplay the cooking and eating part of the tour! The kitchen is spotless and well-run and the chef guides you through each step with clear instructions and helpful tips to modify the recipes for home. There's more watching that cooking to be honest so serious chefs beware. I think the school is more geared towards the casual cook who wants a bit of cooking experience without too much challenge. Fair enough as this is probably describes the majority of people. Anyway, it's not as if the course is lightweight. The chef is serious about imparting techniques and information about the ingredients, it's just that the hands on time is minimal. While the food is being served up you get to witness offerings being given at the family temple and you're given further information about Balinese Hinduism -- fascinating. The meals are served up beautifully in a gorgeous pavilion. You'll enjoy a relaxing meal and a chance to chat with other travellers. Complimentary coconut oil and a recipe booklet finish off the day and you're whisked back to your hotel.This cooking course is a bit more expensive than others but it's worth every penny for its professionalism and the quality of the food and guiding. It will probably be the highlight of your trip, as it was of mine.

WOW the best cooking experience I have had.. The Lobong cooking school ensures you learn to cook and get to eat some of the best food in Bali. The day starts with pick up from you hotel and then a foodies tour of the local markets to locate and learnt all about the ingredients you will use in the day...then it's off to the Sang Made family compound for a welcome drink and a tour, before getting stuck into the cooking. The cooking class caters for all levels and gives you the chance to learn some great cooking techniques. The highlight is sitting down as a group to eat the wonderful meal you have prepared. The cooking facility is exceptionally clean and well set up, bathroom facilities were also exceptional, and the family so friendly and welcoming. You leave with full tummies, a recipe book. Coconut oil, photos and memories of a wonderful experience.

Familiar atmosphere, experienced cook. One of these very well organized young Balinese family businesses: Made collected the participants and gave us a tour around the morning market to show us where to get the ingredients for Balinese cooking. Then his brother-in-law Dewa awaited us with his assistants to teach us what to make from them.The cooking class is held at their own family compound which gave us an interesting insight into Balinese traditions. Before eating we even followed Made's mother to do the offering at the family temple. Nevertheless the cooking pavilion has nothing to do with a usual family kitchen but is newly designed for its purpose as a show kitchen. And Dewa is an experienced cook who has worked in restaurants both on Bali and abroad.After a delicious breakfast of coffee and fried bananas we worked together on the dishes, chopping and mixing the ingredients, taking turns at the stove. Only processes that would have taken to long were finished by Dewas assistants, like the barbecuing of the chicken sate. Dewa explained everything in a very nice and helpful manner and gave us also ideas how to substitute ingredients we could not get in our home country. They never take more than 12 participants so the group is small enough for everyone to follow his instructions.At the end we had a very delicious lunch together and were handed out the recipes in pretty cooking books. Thank you, Dewa and Made, for this great experience!

A must do! Perfect for all levels of cooking ability.. The best food I tasted in Bali - and we prepared and cooked it ourselves! After a trip to the local markets, we went to the families compound and were treated to banana fritters and coffee while learning about the cultural and historical aspects of Bali, the locals and the family. We went on to cook some amazing dishes with the assistance of a chef and then their mother came out and took us to their temple to give offerings to the gods. Once this was done, we sat down to our delicious meal and a cold beer. The hosts are fantastic and the food is delicious. They provide a cookbook so you can try everything at home, along with information about food substitutions for items unavailable at home.Perfect for all ages and skill levels (I can't cook and my boyfriend is a fantastic cook - we both had a blast and learned a lot).

An wonderfully intimate culinary and cultural experience. After being picked up from our hotels, our friendly guide Sang De took us to a local market outside of Ubud and familiarized us with the different Balinese cooking ingredients. He did a wonderful job of answering our questions and drawing comparisons between the ingredients we find in our own countries. Upon reaching the family compound, we were made to feel right at home as Sang De explained the division of labor in Balinese families, the reasons behind different cultural practices and the layout of Balinese traditional homes. Our chef was very informative as well, and great about coaching us through the different steps of the cooking process. You were always encouraged to ask questions so that you could apply what you learned in your own kitchen. We had a group of 6 people and everyone of us was able to fully participate in the cooking process of all the different dishes. My only disappointment was in waiting until later in my trip to schedule this cooking class. Schedule this early on in your trip and you're likely to have a much more informed understanding of Balinese life and cuisine for the rest of your stay in Bali.

Not to be missed!. This is not just a cooking class. Visiting the local markets with our wonderful guide, Sang De, was an amazing experience, colourful, authentic and extremely informative. Then we were taken to the family compound where we were taught about Balinese family life before being taken under the wing competent wing of our brilliant chef who took us through six dishes. Everything was absolutely delicious and our group of 6 was lovely, a great opportunity to hear what other seasoned travellers are experiencing. I did not want to leave, I learned so much and felt so welcome.

Authentic and delicious. Such a lovely way to spend the morning, capped off with a delicious lunch we prepared ourselves. From the moment Sang De collected us from our hotel we enjoyed every moment of this experience. The trip to the market, the welcome drink/fried banana on arrival into the family compound, our fabulous chef and all the things we learnt. We particularly loved learning more about the Balinese culture. Participating in the offerings ceremony was a highlight. Good for all ages, mum dad and two early teenage girls. Highly recommended.

A wonderful experience. Our family group of four were collected from our villa and taken to a local market where we met guide Sang De and the other four members of the group who were all lovely.The local market was a fantastic experience, we were shown around and able to touch and taste many different fruits and vegetables. We were the only tourists at the market which also added to the experience. Sang De spoke with such passion about the food, culture and daily life as we walked through the market that we were completely engaged right from the start, he was also happy to answer our many questions. From the market we were taken back to the family compound a short drive away. We felt warmly welcomed and enjoyed a delicious morning tea while Sang De explained more about the compound, his family and Balinese culture.We then met Chef Dewa, we were first shown through the many ingredients we would be using and the menu for the day then our team effort began. Lots of hands on, chopping, pounding, stirring, frying and preparing the rice in a steamer over the fire. Chef Dewa provided many tips, sharing his knowledge and experience answering our many questions along the way.Before our meal we joined Sang De’s mother at the family temple for the daily offerings, a very special experience.We enjoyed our delicious meal in a beautiful setting and went home with a lovely gift and great memories. The entire day was well organised and informative and the excellent facilities were immaculate. A fantastic experience not to be missed. Many thanks to all at Lobong Cooking Class for a wonderful day.

Perfect day of cooking and learning!. Wow! You should really do this! We had a wonderful time and met some really great people. 10 people max for the cooking class which was really informational. We went to a small local market, learned about all the interesting ingredients, lots of chopping, and eating. The school is in a family compound that is very impressive. They shared their traditions and culture. At the end we ate our fantastic meal and toile home a complementary goodie bag. I think I learned the most about Bali here.

Absolutely Wonderful. Our driver (Kadek from the "Off the Tourist Trail" forum topic) booked this class for us after recommending Lobong, particularly due to their 7 max. in a group. Thank goodness he did!We were picked up at our resort by Sang De and taken to the Payangan Markets where we (a group of 5) were the only non-locals. Sang De expertly explained the various ingredients that we would be using later and mingled easily with the stall holders.After the market we were taken to the family compound where we were offered tea or coffee and served pisang goreng. We were then introduced to Sang De's brother-in-law, Dewa, who was a chef at an international resort. Dewa then went through the menu for the day and the ingredients that we would be using. His knowledge was fantastic, he explained each step patiently and was very clear with his instructions. We all contributed to each dish (cram cam gedang mekuah, kare ayam, sate lilit ayam, jukut urab, sambal ulek, nasi sela and dadar gulung) which we feasted upon at the completion of our preparation.Before we ate, however, Sang De's mother made offerings in the family's temple that included pieces of the food that we had prepared and we were able to witness this.The food was served to us a la carte style and every dish tasted amazing! When we were finished we were presented with a booklet that included the recipes for each dish and a small bottle of coconut oil and then Sang De transferred us back to the resort after a most wonderful half day experience.

Great experience, cultural & cooking.. I have been here in december. Great experience. I have done more cooking classes, difference between this one and the others is that it is very much focussed on the cultural aspects. If you know this already or really want a cooking class instead of demonstration, you might be disappointed. Otherwise good experience.

One of the highlights of our trip. This was a great experience! It was well organised, informative, fun, and a highlight of our recent trip to Bali. You have plenty of opportunity to be hands-on with the preparation and cooking of the food. We felt very welcomed to the family compound where the class takes place. Great meal at the end! Our hosts also looked after us very well with transport from our hotel in Seminyak in the morning, then back to our hotel later in the day. Highly recommend this experience!
Great Experience. I did several cooking classes while in Bali, and this was one of the best. They hit the right balance of information, fun and culture all in a beautiful Balinese compound.

A very cultural experience. I agree this should be one of the very top activities to do in Bali. It's more than a cooking class. It's an introduction to the culture, daily life, understanding traditions and the food. The class is held in a family compound/home, and the experience is priceless. The hosts are gracious, warm, welcoming, well spoken, and genuinely eager to teach you about the culture and the food. We learned so much about these amazing people and culture, we really learned some wonderful cooking tips, and we had an amazing meal in the end. We are truly grateful we were able to experience this! Thanks to the entire staff for a memorable day, we loved it.

Lobong Cooking Class. I just came back from Ubud where I spent a day at the Lobong cooking class. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to everyone; cooks and non-cooks. Sang de showed us around the market, letting us smell and touch the special Balinese produce. The best part of the whole experience was coming to his home, meeting his family and learning about the traditional way of life. He was very informative, engaging, spoke excellent English and answered all of our questions. My only regret is that I did not have a pencil and paper with me during the day to take notes. We did not receive the recipe booklet until we left. Now that I am home, there is so much that I have forgotten.

More than 'just another' cooking class. Also suited for Vegetarians.. We really enjoyed doing this Balinese cooking class!We were with two people and signed up an evening before (we had our hotel call). The following morning we were picked up at 8am at our hotel by the Lobong team and were dropped off at a market nearby Ubud where we were received by our host Sang De and where we met the rest of our cooking class.The course starts with a market tour. Sang De talks about herbs and spices with love and explains which ones we will be using during class > we would be preparing a Balinese meal.After the market, the food preparation takes place at the beautiful family compound of Sang De. Sang De explained about the traditional lifestyle of his family on the compound and about Balinese culture. Which was interesting to hear. The food preparation had a hands-on and interactive approach and was led by Sang De's brother, Chef Dewa. Chef Dewa shows you how to use and prepare fresh spices. No bottled sauces! You do everything yourself. The chopping, the mixing, the cooking. We prepared a full course meal - which we ate in the end. The instructions were clear and Chef Dewa shares many tips and tricks. You're invited to ask many questions.It was taken into account that I'm a vegetarian. I could fully participate. No problem whatsoever.Before tasting the result of our cooking, Chef Dewa and Sang De's mother performed a daily ritual of thanking the gods (before you have the first rice meal), which also included the family temple. It was special to be part of this.After our meal, we received a little book with the recipes, so we could continue our practice at home! In a nutshell:1. Clear English spoken. 2. More than just cooking/ Personal touch - Introduction Balinese family lifestyle and culture.3. Clear instructions / hands-on / interactive.4. Only use of fresh ingredients. 5. Suited for Vegetarians and Non-Vegetarians.6. Recipe book as a gift.7. Schedule: 8am -2pm. Pick up and drop off at hotel.Our conclusion:We definitely recommend the Lobong Cooking Class. You won't regret doing this. It was very eductional and we had lots of fun. Chef Dewa, Sang De and the entire cooking team are friendly and welcoming. Loved the family compound. Cooking in a beautiful surrounding!

Easily our best experience in Bali. The entire course was very well thought out - from the market tour to the food preparation to the dining. Sang De was an engaging guide who explained the cultural aspects of Bali as well as the culinary. His educational background is in sociology and anthropology, and he can add depth and insight beyond the usual rehearsed tour. We wish we had more time to just sit and chat!Onto the food - the food was the best we've had in Bali. Dewa (the chef) has worked as a chef overseas as well as locally and has a depth of cooking knowledge beyond Indonesian. His instructions were clear and entertaining. We particulaly liked how he taught us certain kitchen tricks - like how to save a split curry sauce!All in all a great day and unique experience. Thanks to everyone at Lobong.

Amazing experience. This was so wonderful, clear English spoken, but authentic Balanese experience, market, homestead, food, chef, guide fabulous. The food was beautiful, alternative for non meat eaters, just wonderful. Recommend and at the end a nice surprise. This really did feel like a genuine intro to Balanese cooking and lifestyle. Do it!

Most Culture-Filled Experience We Had in Bali!. We signed up for this cooling class based on a friend's recommendation and the great ratings from Trip Advisor. Both sources were spot on! From the punctual pick-up by Sang Made, to the interesting tour of the local market, and the hands-on cooking of authentic Balinese cuisine, the experience was unforgettable. The goody bag as a souvenir was very professionally done! Highly recommended! Would love to do a homestay if they offer it in future.

Great mix of food and culture. I've been to Bali many times before and this is a great way to spend a day in Ubud. Highly recommended.Family members worked in high-end hotels and they got the tone right- fun and informative. The cultural information started from the moment they picked us up at our hotel and was really interesting. The lunch at the end had many courses, so don't plan any other activities until after 3pm.

More than a cooking class!.
