I strongly recommend this cooking class!We were picked up at our hotel and headed for a local market tour, I really must say to know one's culture one must visit its local market. We learned so many things as the guide explained to us. Our guide told us we are doing 8 dishes, I was quite shock at first because I seldom cook back home so I was worried BUT all went well and I felt like a pro at the end. LOL.Even though we were the only 2 participants they still gave their best. =) Before the start of the cooking, we were given a tour in the owner's place and we learned soooo many things about a traditional balinese family! I really enjoyed the session!Then the work starts. After we finished all the cooking, we were seated at a nice place with nice set up, and they served us the food we cooked like as if we were in fine dining restaurant!I must repeat, do this tour if you are in Ubud! Best experience ever!

A must do if in Bali - A+ Experience for all. My partner and I have been to Bali many times, nothing 'touristy' for us this time we thought - but we booked this and it was well worth it. I agree with everyone else's comments on here - a wonderfully informative, educational, fun and yummy experience all round. The cooking was good, the market was good, but the highlight was meeting Sunday's (?) family and compound, understanding their religion and offerings. First opportunity to really understand their beautiful culture first hand. Congratulations to the whole family for getting involved and thanks for allowing us into your home.

So much fun. What a great day, it started at 8am with a pick up from our hotel. The guided tour at the local market by Sundai (?) was a great way to start, he is a font of knowledge on the local foods and spices and the market stall owners made us feel very welcome. There were 10 in our class and we were welcomed into the family compound where the hands on classes took place. Sundai's mother showed us how to make coconut oil, what a lovely touch, and Chef Dewa instructed us in cooking a Balinese feast. Everyone assisted and we had some good laughs throughout the morning. The facilities are well set up and the ingredients we worked with beautifully fresh. At the end we all sat down to enjoy our labours which were delicious. I would highly recommend this as a great way to spend the day.

Amazing Day!. Dragged my husband to the Class for the day and he loved it! So professional, clean, great - informative staff, fun and the food was the most delicious we had on Bali. Learnt far more than just cooking, visited the market and toured the Compound and heard about family life in Bali.Very reasonably priced too.

A welcoming vegetarian experience and cultural delight. Can't rate this high enough. From the moment we arrived at the markets Sang Made immersed us in the sights and smells of Indonesian cooking. It was a great introduction to the foundations of this cuisine and set us up perfectly for the rest of the day. After the markets we went to the family compound where he gave us great insight into Balinese culture, family and community. It is easy to come to Bali and appreciate the natural beauty and enjoy the hospitality of the tourism industry. It was fascinating to get an understanding of Balinese life, which enriched my trip beyond the cooking class.As the only vegetarian in the group I wasn't sure what to expect. What I got was exactly what everyone else did, veggo style. Instead of chicken they presented me with tofu and tempeh. There was also a delicious fern tip salad and then Balinese pancakes for dessert. Our chef, Dewa, made the experience very inclusive and fun. He is a wealth of information, and very patient with all of the students.Thank you for a great day. Was truly one of the highlights of my trip.
Best thing to do in Ubud. Lobong offers an authentic cultural experience of Balinese livelihood through their professional and well run cooking class. A must for every visitor to Ubud.

Balinese Cooking & a Bit of Culture Too. What a great half day. It started at 8am with a pickup from our resort and a drive to the local street markets. Our 'guide' Sundai (?) walked us through these traditional markets, telling us about the unusual fruits and vegetables on display, and arranging the odd sample here and there. He also told us a little bit about the daily life of the people at the markets, both sellers and buyers. From there we drove a short distance to his home, which also doubles as the cooking school. The compound was beautiful. Here we were given welcome drinks (juice, Balinese coffee, tea) and told more about how a Balinese compound is structured in terms of building layout and who lives where. Fascinating stuff. We also started to meet some of the cooking school staff and find out what our program was. There were just the 4 of us today, so we felt like a very special little group.After coffee we headed over to the cooking area and met Chef and the team, including Sundai's mother, who was in charge of making coconut oil.Then it was over to the cutting boards, knives, wood fired ovens, pots and pans - our tools for the next couple of hours. We were to prepare about 5 different dishes, including a soup, several meat dishes, and a sweet, and then have it all served up to us for our lunch.We learnt the 'proper' way to cook rice, chopped and diced various vegetables, prepared a 'basic' paste for use in several dishes, fried our chicken pieces, hand mixed pastes, crushed up peanuts with a mortar and pestle, and generally had a great time, ably led by our enthusiastic chef and his team of assistants. After all the prep work was done we sat down at a lovely wooden table, had cold drinks, and were served our beautifully presented culinary masterpieces. I must say, they were all pretty darn tasty :-) We were then presented with a small pack containing the recipe book for what we had prepared, and a 100ml bottle of coconut oil that was produced on site. After saying thank you and goodbye to everyone involved, we were taken back to our resort feeling very full from our feast, and quite tired from concentrating when using the extremely sharp knives and very hot pans. No fingers were lost in the making of any of our dishes :-DThe Lobong team were professional, pleasant, prepared, and enthusiastic, and made us feel most welcome into their home. I would not hesitate in recommending them if you are at all interested in gaining some insight into the Balinese way of life and the delicious foods they eat.

A favourite day in Bali. A group of 6 of us went to Lobong Cooking Class. We had an early pick up from our hotel in Tuban and drove up to the Ubud area to the local markets. We joined three others and thoroughly enjoyed the markets and the explanation of the foods that they use in their cooking. After the markets we were given some cold bottled water which was most welcome! We then travelled to the local home of a Balinese family and were given welcoming drinks and cold towels plus an explanation and tour on how the Balinese home works, it was informative and a great addition to what we thought was a cooking class. We then started the cooking class. It was fantastic, even some members of our group who don't often cook enjoyed it. After cooking we sat down with cold towels again and were served the food we had helped prepare. We could also purchase some cold Bintangs which was most welcome. The food was delicious and the best meal during our two weeks in Bali. We could not fault the day and was one of my most favourite days in Bali. Lobong Cooking Class add in some unexpected extras which was fantastic, they sent us home with our own coconut oil (which they showed us how to make) and recipe books detailing what we had cooked. Highly recommend!

Our best day in Bali. This is more than just a cooking class. What we experienced that day was Balinese family life and culture. The meal we cooked and shared together was the best that we had during our whole stay in Bali. It was an awesome day. Thank you so much for your hospitality, guys.

Informative and fun. If you go to Ubud you should really do this cookery course. Not only do you learn about the food and how to cook it but you also learn a lot about Bali, its people and culture.We were picked up at 7:30 and then met with the rest of our group before we were taken to a market to learn about the food we were going to cook. This was a typical market and had no other tourists there apart from ourselves. We then returned and had a brief explanation of the day and the compound we were in. This gave us details about family structure, beliefs and was really interesting. The cooking itself was fun and we got involved and prepared and cooked a lot of the food either individually or as a group. The choice of dishes suited us as my wife doesn't like fish and isn't too great with spice. This didn't matter and what we prepared and ate was just great. You get a recipe booklet so you try at home and they are constantly telling you about alternative ingredients you can use if you can't get hold of the local ones they use.We had fun, learnt a lot and the food was great. It was a fantastic day and a great experience and we cannot recommend it enough.

A Must do in Ubud. My wife and I have never taken a cooking class but this class exceeded our expectations in every category. Gave us some great perspective on Bali's culture and how the family system works. Got to cook in their family's beautiful compound. Great kitchen and set-up, enjoyed going to the market and making everything from scratch... Just a great way to learn about Bali food and make some great dishes with a great family. A MUST DO...

Great way to spend a day in Bali. I did this cooking class and certainly enjoyed my day. Began with a trip to the markets where you see and learn about all the produce. My group was 10 so a nice number not too crowded and a good mix of people. The menu was lovely real Balinese food no packets or canned ingredients were used we had to make the sauces from scratch. I have been spreading the word about my fabulous day would recommend this to anymore for something different.Thanks to Sang Made and his family for the wonderful experience.

Fantastic. The Lobong cooking class was the highlight of my trip to Ubud. Very professional and well run, beautiful relaxing family compound and lovely hosts. The smells from the cooking were devine and the food we made was delicious. Definitely recommend!

Deserves more than 5 stars!!!. Just got back from our cooking class and wish I didn't have to leave. What a fantastic opportunity, and a must do for any trip to Bali. Our hosts and everyone involved we absolutely perfect. Visiting the markets in the morning and learning about all different ingredients was a wonderful experience. I am hoping I can track down as many ingredients as possible once back in Canada. I really can't say enough just how perfect this day was. Thank you thank you thank you, I will never forget this. Can't wait to try this out at home!

Amazing day. As everyone else has said, it was fantastic. Great insight to Bali life, clean, organised and very welcoming. Catering for all ages and cooking skills. Since coming home i have recreated the meal we cooked and enjoyed it again! Will be going back again, on next trip to Bali ( as were another family the day we were there) An amazing family business, providing 1st class cooking experience, so much more than just a cooking class!! loved it and recommend to everyone!! :)

The best foodie experience you can have in Bali. We have done other cooking classes on previous Bali holidays that were really good I can say without reservation that the Lobong cooking class is by far the very best. You could not ask for a better experience. This is no cooking demonstration, it is a professionally run hands on cooking school where we prepared all of the ingredients, made the most delicious meal and shared it in magnificent surrounds. The cultural experience is wonderful and the hosts amazing but what really surprised was just how good the facilities were and how well we're were taught the skills and techniques to create great Balinese food. Whatever else you have planned to do in Ubud make time to do this cooking class, you will have one of the best Bali experiences possible. Do not miss this.

A great day. Booked this cooking class after researching a few, and we weren't disappointed. You start the day with a trip to the locals market where the guide explains some of the spices used and what they look like in their raw forms. Then you go to he family compound for a snack and to start cooking. It was a really entertaining day, and I felt like we got some good technique advice on cooking the dishes. There were also 9 of us (the classes a re restricted in size) so we all got to participate. The coconut oil parting gift was a nice touch. I'd recommend for a days entertainment.

(vegetarian) cooking class. When we booked the cooking class, we told them that we are vegetarians. It was n't a problem at all; in fact we made a delightful diner.Ours looked even better than the " normal' dinner. We really enjoyed it! Everything was well taken care of and we 'd like to recommend it to everyone!

Amazing Day in Ubud. This cooking course is highly recommended, even if you're not a great cook. The tour of the market was great - it gave us a good grounding in both the ingredients and the way of Balinese life. The food we made was easy to do and delicious and both the tour and the class helped explain some of the Balinese culture in a way that reading can't do. All of the staff was incredible and really made this a wonderful experience. Thanks for sharing your home with us! Highly recommended.

Highlight of my trip to Bali. I booked the Lobong cooking class having read the great reviews it had received on TripAdvisor and I wasn't disappointed. This was more than just a great cooking class, it was an insight into some of the family culture of Balinese people and their relationship with religion and food. There were 8 of us participating in the class who only met up the morning of the class but we were made completely at home and relaxed. The class was so personal to each of us which was a great credit to everyone involved from the trip to the market in the morning to the cooking of the food. All the food was delicious and made from fresh vegetables, herbs and meat sourced from the market that morning. I can't wait to make some of the recipes we received when I get home, especially the satay with peanut sauce, hhhmmmmmm!

Really Tasty Meal!. I have taken many cooking classes when I travel, and I always find them fun and interesting. This one falls under that category as well since I am not that familiar with Indonesian recipes. The day started with a market tour, but this is not like most of the ones I have been on...this market was for locals only, which was interesting.We then were taken back to the family compound and treated to Bali coffee and then started cooking. Everything was delicious and it was wonderful to meet his entire family, which is involved with the cooking class. Very fun way to spend the day!

Best Bali experience!. What a wonderful day we spent with our guides and chefs at Lobong Cooking Class. They picked us up at 8 am and returned us to our hotel around 3 pm (though I wasn't watching the clock as the day was so amazing!) The trip to the local market learning about local produce and spices, hearing first hand about Balinese family, culture, traditions and worship while sampling Balinese coffee and banana fritters, watching the process for making coconut oil, cooking rice the Balinese way, and all of the knife prep, grinding, cooking and eating were just top notch. They provided vegetarian options, and were very kind and helpful with my 7 yr old daughter. The family were very polite answering every question. I really enjoyed seeing the inside of a traditional Balinese family compound. The cooking and bathroom facilities were modern and clean. There were ample prep and cooking stations to accommodate everyone in our class (we had 6 participants). The resulting food was the best we had in Bali. Bring extra money for a cold beer or soda to go with your meal, or to purchase your own Lobong apron to take home with you. We easily booked through their website the day before and paid about $35 for the entire experience including Ubud hotel pickup/dropoff, and half price for kids.

More than a cooking course - a cultural experience. The Lobong culinary experience is more than just a cooking course. It offers an insight into both traditional and contemporary Balinese life. The day begins with a visit to the local market. It is followed by morning tea (ginger tea or coffee with small banana fritters) at the family compound, some hands-on prep of the local ingredients and then offerings are made at the family temple before a fantastic lunch in the garden. The courses include minced chicken satays (with the best peanut satay sauce ever), braised chicken leg in coconut sauce, mixed vegetable salad, and Balinese crepe - all with a cold Bintang if desired. Getting the basic spice paste (18 ingredients) right is the key to a successful dish. This was a return visit for our family. We first visited Lobong Cooking Class in 2011 - and our second visit in October 2013 was even better. Participants always leave with more than just a handful of great new signature dishes to try out at home. They also leave with a privileged insight into Balinese life and culture through the Lobong culinary experience courtesy of Sangde and his family. Highly recommended.

Excellent day spent discovering the local market, cooking & eating !. We had an excellent day during the Lobong Cooking Class. The discovery of the local market was really interesting and then, the cooking class in the family house was really pleasant. Finally the degustation was really delicious and we came home with a really nice little attention and a cooking book from the family recipes and secrets ;) I recommand +++

Great day - immersed in Balinese food and customs. Excellent food!!. This cooking class is professional, great fun and a lovely way to learn about Balinese cooking, home and family life. It was a highlight of my recent holiday! I can't wait to do it again. Sangde and his family are generous hosts - sharing their family home, teaching about food preparation and Balinese customs. I was impressed with the cleanliness and beautiful cooking environment and with the exquisite ingredients used. One of the best meals I had in Ubud!

Fantastic. They have really thought of everything - very well planned cooking class from start to finish. Easy to book via email and good value. Make sure you have a big breakfast as it is quite a while before you get to eat lunch but well worth the wait. The level of explanation and opportunity to join in with the cooking was well balanced between listening watching and doing. I don't think there's much more to add that hasn't been said in other reviews - overall a very professional company whilst still feeling like you are getting a genuine cultural experience. Thank you for a memorable day!

My children loved this. We almost went with another company because it was slightly cheaper. But we found out that there are up to 20 people in that class. Lobong limits it to just 12 people. Also the other company would not allow my children (ages 9 and 11) to participate in the chopping/cooking, whereas Lobong let them participate fully, and only charged half price.The market tour was very interesting, we learned so much about Balinese cooking. In their family compound, we learned a lot about Balinese life. All in all, we were treated very respectfully, as honored guests. We felt welcome in their family compound, not just paying tourists that they had to tolerate. At the same time, they acknowledged that we were tourists, and allowed plenty of time for questions and pictures.Could I reproduce these dishes? Possibly, but not likely, even though we were given a booklet of recipes and a nice bottle of fresh coconut oil. But that's okay, we all enjoyed chopping and stirring and mixing, learning about the food, and of course, tasting it.After we were finished with our cooking, we were invited to their family temple to watch his mother make offerings. Meanwhile they plated up the food...it looked almost too delicious to eat.Highly recommend!

Professional outfit. This is as good a cooking class you can do. Friendly and informative staff - travel to a locals market to understand the produce used later in cooking. The venue for the cooking classes is fantastic, clean and comfortable. You eat what you make - the end result was amazing ... Best food I ate in Bali! Well rices consideringick up, drop off and an amazing meal. I highly recommend using this cooking school. I took my kids - 13 & 16 and they loved the experience.

The best Cooking Class plus Cultural Experience. I cannot rate this activity high enough. For under AUD$50 per person, it is the best value cooking class I have ever been on. Starting off in the REAL local markets - no tourists in sight - you are shown the various ingredients that will be used in the cooking rhat day. Then off to a REAL family compound, you are given a true insight into the Balinese way of life. Incredibly interesting. Sung Dei, the main guide is very knowledgeable and speaks excellent English. You are shown the traditional ways of cooking various dishes and after helping to cook the 6-7 dishes, a blessing is offered in the family temple before you sit down to enjoy the delicious dishes you have cooked. They will also cater for various food allergies/intolerances. Pickup included from Ubud, but for an extra AUD$40 per car, they will transport you to and from Seminyak (total 9 hours). A truly fascinating and memorable experience.

The best cultural experience I've had in Bali.. This is an amazing day. Guided by the lovely Sang De (pronounced Sunday) we were taken to a traditional Bali market and explained all the foods. Then off to Sang De's home for the cooking class. Greater by his family members we were told all about the different ceremonies and traditions of balianese living. Sang De and the families English is FANTASTIC. We were able to ask many complicated questions and get full comprehensive responses.This is the second time I have done their family cooking school......and I will come again!

Memorable experience. It is getting more and more difficult to get a true cultural experience in Bali but this was the real thing. Run by a lovely family and well-organised. It's a lot more than just a cooking lesson. The family compound is a gorgeous outdoor setting for the food preparation and you're learn a lot about the Balinese culture. Lots of opportunity for questions. And the meal we prepared was fantastic if I do say so myself!

Great Cooking Experience. It was the best part of our 2 week holiday, Sang and his entire family from the moment we were picked up until we were dropped off taught us many things not only how to cook Balinese food but also many of the cultural aspects of Balinese family life. From the visit to the local food market to the preparation, cooking and eating of the meal was an experience not to be missed. Throughly recommended and would love to do it again next time.

Educational, Lovely Hosts, Great Food. We had an exceptional experience at the Lobong Cooking class. We were picked up at our hotel, taken to the location of our host, oriented to a traditional local market (no tourists in sight but our cooking class of 12). Brought by van to the home/compound of our host and then spent the morning learning, experiencing and eating a great traditional Balinese menu. Cleanliness was paramount as was the attention to details of the cultural experience. We would highly recommend this as an activity in Ubud.

An Experience not to be missed. I am from Chicago and was visiting the region spent a week in Bali.The class exceeded by expectations as I learned much about Balinese culture and cooking. The explanation of a Balinese compound was very interesting.This was a wondeful experience with a great introducton to Balinese cuisine including visiting a local market devoid of tourists. I have successfully recreated these recpes at home.

Best Cooking and Culture Course Ever!!!!. My wife and I've been looking for a place to have a cooking course and learn about the Balinese culture. We signed up for the Lobong Cooking Course only expecting to learn about food. We were blown away by the experience we incurred. Sang, his brother, mother and his entire family opened there home and taught us no just cooking but the Balaniese culture. We were greated at our resort by one of Sang friends, a professional taxi, and headed straight for the Market. After the market we were invited in for tea/coffee in the family' compound and learned a large deal about his family and the culture. The cooking class was very well organized and informative. This is definitely a must anyone in the Ubud area!

Excellent Bali cooking adventure. This is a great class to take while in Bali. We visited a local outdoor market, learning about the various spices used in Balinese cooking. We got to interact with the people as well as taste some of their local fruit. After the market, we went to the family compound to start our cooking class. We went through and cooked a full menu and the class ended with my favorite part...eating!! Definitely worth the visit :)

Great way to spend a day. I really loved the day I spent at Lebong cooking school. The market we went to was non touristy and our "guide" was filled with interesting information and a love for his community. The home whe we cook provided warmth and was quite educational. It was fun. With regards the actual cooking part, i would say that the recipes were pretty simple and the food could have been more flavorful. I think 12 people is too much for a class to feel personable but I still enjoyed myself even though it wasn't really an activity for real foodies. The food was average. I would actually give Lebong 4 stars if I had not been so sick off the uncooked chicken (I projectile vomited for several hours after the class from bad chicken). I would not normally recommend a place after getting violently ill but I really did have a great time up until I got sick. The family is wonderful.

Highlight of my vacation...Do it!. If you enjoy cooking and eating then do this while in you're in Ubud. Try to do this early on your vacation as it really gives you an appreciation of the both Balinese culture and cuisine. The day starts off with doing a tour through an authentic Balinese market and then to Made's home where we begin the cooking lesson. Dont worry if you dont typically cook... they make it pretty easy for everyone to do. My girlfriends and I had a wonderful time and I'm sure you will too!

Brilliant Day. Very enjoyable experience...all the staff were very friendly and spoke excellent English...whole day was very well organised and ran smoothly.Very interesting tour and information given during the visit to the local market...the family compound where the cookery took place was beautiful and you were given a great insight into Bali life within their compound.The cooking class was very hands on and everyone mixed well and had lots of opportunities to help prepare the dishes.The final meal was delicious and you received some nice parting gifts...very good value.Would highly recommend this for couples, singles or small family groups!

Cooking Class in Ubud. The Lobong Cooking Class is more then a cooking class. The hosts do such a good job of sharing their traditions and culture while you are with them. Everything from beginning the day at the local market to ending the say at a beautiful sit down lunch were you taste your creations, was just perfect! My friend and I really enjoyed our experience at Lobong Cooking Class and spent the rest of the time in Bali identifying ingredianes in our dishes after our class. If you have the time it is a must do!

My third Lobong experience which was just as fantastic as the first. !!. I can't recommend this experience enough after yet another enriching cultural, spiritual and inspiring culinary delight. Selamat makan!!! Thank you Sang :)

Believe the hype!. This class was a highlight of our trip to Ubud. It's half culture/half cooking and really gives insight into Balinese daily life. Questions are encouraged throughout the class and are answered thoughtfully. It is a family business, and that comes across in how warmly each student (guest) is treated.

Fantastic. What a great thing to do! Not just a cooking school but a wholistic look into Balinese culture.From the 8am pick up till the 2.30pm drop off back at the hotel this was an excellent experience . 6 people attended on the day we were there and they only cater for a max of 12, so it's hands on!

Very interesting and hugely enjoyable-faultless.. There are already plenty of good reviews on here so we would just like to say thanks to the superb people who work on this course. The trip to the local market and the authentic family compound venue were the highlights for us.

Get to know the real bali - not only the food. This is more than just a cooking class. The day starts with a visit of an original local market outside of touristy ubud together with a perfectly English speaking guide. Here you are introduced to the ingredients of typical balinese dishes. After that you are invited into a family compound where you learn about balinese culture and traditions. The groups are rather small (9 participants in our case) and you get to ask everything you ever wanted about life in bali. The actual cooking class is very professional and the meals are delicious! All in all a 5 star experience!

More than just cooking!. The cooking class begins with a local market visit. Sunday showed us every corner of the market. It is interesting to see another side of Bali's local life. Sunday is funny, informative and friendly. He also introduced us many local plants, culture and language. The cooking class was conducted in their lovely complex. The environment is so good and relaxing that you will feel very happy and peaceful cooking and eating there. The chef is professional. He introduced every step in details. The foods we cooked are so delicious. I feel very glad I had taken take this class which made my Bali trip much more memorable!

Great Bali experience. Fantastic cooking and view into local Bali life. We had a great time at the local markets and then learning to cook local dishes. It was lovely getting an insight into the Bali family life. Made, his family and staff were all lovely and welcoming. Highly recommend.

Perfect Bali insight!. Very warm and heartfelt cooking class! It was a great experience and a perfect insight into balinese family life and cooking! Really recommend it! Many thanks to Sang Made& Family!
Christina&Oliver

Great experience. What a good time spent with this friendly family introducing us to more than just balinese cook. They took us to a local market (not touristic at all) and then presented us some of the traditions related to the balinese life at their home. The cooking class was nice and the food delicious. Can only recommend this place!!

A wonderful experience. Thank you Sand Made and Dewa. A memorable day. My children and I joined a class at Lobong hoping to learn how to make some of the wonderful dishes we'd experienced in Bali. We weren't expecting to walk away having learnt so much about Bali, its society and culture. Thank you to Sand Made, Dewa & the team for a really memorable day. Thank you for your patience with us, especially our youngest, who, at 7 years old, managed to remain enthralled for the entire programme. Now let's hope we can re-create the deliciou dishes on our return home.

Fantastic Experience. The Lobong cooking class was definitely a highlight of our trip. Sand Made and his family are so wonderful. They really give you a lesson inauthentic Balinese culture, family and cooking. And we really did do all the cooking, which is the best way to learn. I love the fact they keep the groups small, ours was 8 and everyone was so fun, freindly and interesting. The food we made was also delicious and pleniful.I look forward to making a Balinese feast for my family and friends. It was a day I will always remember.

Knowing Bali. If you want to know about Balinese culture, the structure of the traditional family compounds and have a great time learning how to cook Balinese then this Lobong Cooking Class is a must. We also enjoyed the Balinese banquet the night before the cooking class.Fantastic value! Sang Made, Dewa and their helpers are competent, informative and fun to be with. Thank you for a wonderful day.

Incredible cooking class!. This is beyond a cooking class - it is an experience! This is soo well organized and so intimate! The class is small, you get to tour the local market, get a cultural lesson, class takes place in the family compound. Incredibly hands on, much of the family is involved in the process. Everyone gets an opportunity to participate. It is a great lesson, wonderful food, and incredible experience! Would absolutely recommend. Beyond leaving stuffed, you are also given a book of recipes, and homemade coconut oil. To say that it is run by a family gives the wrong impression.. it is incredibly well organized, like a business, with a familial feel. You feel right at home, and are given an incredibly unique experience with lasting memories. Absolutely would recommend!

Best day out in Bali. My wife and I had a fantastic day with the Lobong Cooking School. A driver picked us up from our hotel and took us to the local market, we were shown through market and learnt of all the different ingredients and customs associated with the food we would cook and then eat later in the day, The market tour was fascinating, we loved learning new ingredients and trying various fruits berries and nuts. Once the tour was completed we were transported back to the family compound where we enjoyed coffee and banana fritters whilst learning the customs of the family and the compound. We were then led to an amazing outdoor kitchen, and introduced to our chef for the day Dewar. Dewar was extremely generous with his tie and nothing was to much trouble for him whilst he explained the ingredients, the best way to prepare them and how to cook them for best results, it is a very hands on experience and I have taken several new techniques away with me to use back at home. The afternoon was completed when we all sat down at a beautifully prepared table and treated to a three course meal that was second to none, the food was simply to die for. Lobong Cooking School was the highlight of our trip and we recommend this fantastic day to anyone that loves Bali culture, cooking and eating authentic Indonesian food, we cannot wait for our next visit to enjoy it all over again.

Excellent. All I can say is excellent as well as the cookery class we learnt about the culture and customs of Bali, would recommend trying to book on a Wednesday as this is when the big market is on rather than the usual local market.

An excellent activity. This was the highlight of our trip to Bali. The hosts are generous and welcoming and their English is excellent. The market tour was informative and food was delicious and it was wonderful to get out of the tourist trap that Ubud has become. I have only two suggestions to improve the day and they would be to get a native English speaker to edit the recipe booklet (it was a little bit hard to follow once we returned home) and to hand out the booklet at the beginning so that we could take notes (I have forgotten so much already!). Thanks again for a great day.

A must-do in Bali. Really great time spent; we were treated like honoured guests from the start. The day starts with an educational and fascinating market tour looking at all the fresh ingredients that we'd later be cooking with.Then a welcoming coffee in the family compound; with great explanations regarding Balinese culture.Then 2 great hours preparing the food under the fantastic guidance of Dewi the chef. He's an experienced hotel chef who is more than happy to explain all.We then had a great feast of the food prepared. It was very impressive.All in all a great time was had and we recommend 100%!!

Eye opening, fun, with a delicious meal to enjoy at the end. I REALLY enjoyed this 'must do' experience. We were picked up by a driver from out hotel in Ubud, and taken to a local market. My boyfriend and I met with 6 others, and we spent just over an hour walking around a local market. That was an experience not to forget. I don't know when I would have had another opportunity to discover what it's really like for those, who live their days trading in the early morning markets. Its not clean, its open to the elements, the ground is muddy, there is rubbish everywhere, yet the produce is so fresh and very cheap (in Australian terms). It was a real eye opener. We were then taken back to a wonderful bali compound, and we were shown the basics of cooking, where the 8 of us, prepared all the food, put everything together, and ate our 10 dishes for lunch at the end. Our guides and main chef, were very knowledgeable and accommodating, and it was a very comfortable and fun experience. We were given the recipes, and a gift of coconut oil to take home! Absolutely worth it! I would recommend it for anyone who is interested in learning more about balinese culture and learning some cooking skills :)

A must do experience.... AMAZING. Firstly, I would like to thank the Sang Made/family for such a wonderful experience. Our family of 6 enjoyed the cultural and culinary experience very much. We highly recommend this excursion as a must do for anyone visiting Bali. The family is warm and very experienced in offering a unique experience for any traveller. Thanks again for making our son experience a wonderful birthday also.

Delicious experience. We thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class we attended recently, from the visit to the local market through to preparing and cooking the delicious traditional Balinese food. Sitting down at the end and sharing a feast with other travellers was a real highlight. The insight into Balinese culture and their housing arrangements was fantastic. We came away with a recipe book and a little gift and also a true appreciation of Balinese life and food. You must do this cooking class!

Authentic yet professional. Thoroughly recommend this cooking class (and I am fussy!) It was informative, entertaining, delicious and authentic. The tour of the local market gives you an insight into the ingredients used in the class. What a refreshing change from tourist markets which are full of tacky souveniers. There was enough hands on experience to keep you occupied at a relaxed pace with a team of workers behind the scenes checking the rice on the wood fire, cleaning dishes and barbecuing the satays. Best satays of the trip too! Sang De is charming and quite professional with his customer service. Bathrooms are immaculate with overall hygiene of food preparation excellent. The only negative is that the food here shows how bad some of the restaurants are in town!

Simply Wonderful. This amazing culinary experience was the highlight of my holiday. The families experience in hospitality was evident as every detail of the day had been carefully planned. I really felt like a guest in the family home and learnt a lot about the structure of the Balinese family compound and some traditions as well as a number of delicious dishes that I will do my best to recreate. The menu changes every month. If I was staying longer I would have done another class for sure. This is definitely an experience I would recommend to any of my foodie friends visiting Bali.

An excellent traditional cooking class. Such a great day fulfilled not only on how to cook Balinese food but the tradition behind it. I recently attended with my family, the day started off at a traditional market that gave insight behind the culture. Then off to their home to learn the recipes. I would recommend this as it was great day as I left graciously with joy, experience and gratitude for such generosity that was given to us on this day by the hosts who are very humble and kind

Highly recommended. Our group of three did the cooking class as part of a group of 9 people and totally enjoyed every detail. Not only do you get to enjoy the cooking component and the end products of your labours, but you also get an insight into a traditional family lifestyle, all done with a thoroughly professional and caring approach. The host Sang Made & Chef Dewa are informative and entertaining and every family member involved, from the driver that picked us up and returned us to our villa to the kitchen hands who assisted, were friendly and welcoming and extremely professional in every aspect. Not sure if we read the small print but were expecting a half day and didn't finish until about 3.00, so apart from everything else it is great value for money.We also did the compound dinner offered by Lobong which included the insight into family and tradition as well as a really fantastic meal, so I can highly recommend that as well.

Absolutely Yummy, best cooking experience. We are so happy we ended up choosing the Lobong Cooking Class, what an amazing experience, an experience that shouldnt be missed. From the moment we got picked up from our hotel to the moment we got dropped off we were well looked after. Sang Made host was delightful, the chef was amazing and the food was absolutely superb. The family have really made this an ultimate experience and thought this through. The amount of love that is put into their food is wonderful. We had an awesome crew and we have been talking about making the food at home - if we had a spare 8 hours. You can buy the wooden chopping block for $8.00, couldnt get a better chopping board. You also get to take home the recipes and coconut oil. AMAZING, would do this again in a heartbeat.

Highlight of my Holiday!. Wow, what an amazing time my Mum and I had at Lobong Cooking School. I loved visiting the local market and our time at Sang Made's family compound was truly memorable. They have really thought about everything and all the small thoughful touches made a real difference to the overall experience - a cool face washer and drink after the market tour, ginger tea and banana fritter while talking about Balinese family life, take home gift, etc. The class was exceptionally well run and organised, and I love that it is a family business. Above all else, the food we made was so incredibly delicious! I will definitely be trying out the recipes at home with confidence. The class sizes are small which means everyone has hand on practical experience. I loved everything about this cooking class experience and can't recommend it highly enough! With many competiting cooking schools, I am so happy we chose Lobong.

Perfect day. This experience is not to be missed. They pick you up from your hotel, take you to a local food market where you are shown all the local produce. Then you head to there family compound to create some really good food. They also have vegetarian options. The service is second to none! You can tell they have worked in western hotels and restaurants and bring this experience with there local knowledge to create and excellent day

Good but not great. This is a great option in Ubud if youre looking for culture - you not only get to understand what goes into a Balinese meal and try cooking it for yourself - you also get to see a non-touristy marketplace where the ingredients are sourced. In fact, the trip to the market was the best part of they day, since the actual cooking can drag on a little (3+hours). It's a lot of time to spend on your feet in the midday sun, even in the shade. Also, the portion sizes are pretty small per person, and I recommend you don't go if you only like mild food, as there isn't a 'no chilli' option! Overall, a great market tour with a decent cooking class and mediocre meal at the end of it.

AMAZING Cooking class and excellent cultural experience. My husband and I chose Bali for our honeymoon, and having traveled before, we knew wanted the best of relaxation and cultural experiences during our stay. Lobong Cooking Class was really a great experience - professional, great customer service and overall just a friendly and welcoming family. Sang Made and his family do a great job of giving you insight into the Balinese culture and sort of the "daily life" of a village family. The food was delicious, the chef very informative, and the meal afterward together with the group was delightful! A highlight of our trip for sure! We went to the Payangan market, less crowded than the larger Ubud market, and still, everyone was friendly and welcoming during this educational component.We highly recommend - and cannot wait to try the recipes at home!

Experience the heart & soul of Bali via your tastebuds!. We were a tiny bit concerned before signing up for this because we both have sensitive stomachs and special dietary requirements. ...NO PROBLEM! It became apparent that we were in very experienced and capable hands - nothing to worry about, and we could actually relax and enjoy :DMade and Dewah took expert care of our group - they are both -MASTERS- of cultural exchange, group guidance and cullinary awesomeness. I am in awe of their abilities and wouldn't at all be surprised if they end up running their own international cooking school, or TV show or something. Superb!The tour of the *real* Bali markets was eye-opening and sensorily stimulating (and a little shocking, in some educational ways). The introduction to the family compound was very educational as well - you are welcomed into the family home, a true honour - the architexture is beautiful and Made's explanation of Balinese family tradition gives social and spiritual context to the 7-course meal you're about to prepare.The cooking class itself is a pleasure and a lot of fun - not to spoil any details but the dishes prepared are fun and have enough variety to suit all tastebuds and constituions -- they could even adapt for my gluten-intolerance, so no problems there. Very happy and grateful. I look forward to Lobong ADVANCED cooking classes so we have a reason to come back!

Loved every bit of this experience. My daughter and I would definitely recommend lobong cooking class to anyone..it is very well organised from the pick up,to the local market experience, to the cooking class and drop off..we felt very welcome to be in their home environment and the awesome cultural experience ....it's a very hands on class and the food we made taste amazing...we loved every minute of the day...thank you to Sang Made and his family.

Excellent Cooking Class Experience. I took half a dozen cooking classes in Bali during my stay. Each one was very different and LoBong added the cultural dimension. There were only 6 of us in this class. They accommodate vegetarians. The class was VERY WELL organized. I thoroughly enjoyed the market tour as we went to one outside of Ubud. The coconut oil-making process was a highlight. A little too much on traditions before the class, IMO. However, as long as you know this is more than a cooking class you will enjoy the cultural experience. Food was delicious and fresh and varied. Top notch.

Highlight of Ubud - Food, Culture, Fun!. One of our top highlights from our honeymoon in Ubud was taking a cooking class at Lobong Cooking School. For ~$40 USD per person, we were picked up at our hotel, taken to a local market outside of Ubud (no tourists there), learned about the variety of local ingredients, and then to the Lobong compound (where the family lives) to learn how to make 9 traditional Balinese dishes. Yum! The class size was small (maximum 12 people) and everyone spoke English well so we could get all our questions answered. This Asinan salad was both beautiful and delicious - I especially liked cooking with local fern tips. We not only learned how to make all these delicious dishes, but we learned about the Balinese culture, how the family compounds are built, the ritual offerings made daily, etc. - a great lesson in culture as well. And they have these nice small touches where you get water after your market tour and a cool refreshing towel, snacks throughout the class, etc. In our one week, we learned the most about the culture on this tour and had the most fun and one of the best meals. Bon appetite!

enak sekali !. definately recommend the lobong experienceafter visiting payongan market, which is a great non-touristy place to go and meet the locals, you are taken to a beautiful family compound to have a wonderful time chopping, pounding, cooking and of course eventually eating the delicious food that has been created. a wonderful day

Luscious lunch at Lobong. Congratulations to the family who run this cooking school, it is exemplary and we had a fabulous experience. Maximum class size is 12 people and there are 6 cooking stations, so a ratio of 2 to 1 wok, which worked well. Pick up time was 8am and we finished at 3pm. The cost is 375,000IDR + 10%, making a total of 412,000IDR.We were picked up promptly and driven to Payungan for a market tour with detailed explanations of ingredients that we would be using in our cooking given by the charismatic Sang De.The family compound is spotlessly clean, the family very welcoming and the whole day ran like a well oiled machine. Dewa our instructor/chef was clear in his cooking instructions and made sure that everyone in the group was fully included in all the activities. We cooked 10 dishes - exactly the menu on the website.After the cooking lunch was served up to us at a long table in an open-sided building and we all enjoyed the fruits of our labour. A small recipe book and bottle of freshly made coconut oil was presented to us before leaving.I can thoroughly recommend this cooking school - it was a fun, informative and professionally run day.

Wonderful hands-on cooking experience. We went to the class today and had an excellent day. Our pickup was on time in a very clean vehicle by a very pleasant man, Sang De who then took us to meet the rest of the group at the markets. It was a smaller market than Ubud and did not see any other tourists which was really good. We had an introduction to the vegetables, spices and herb being used today. Then on to the family compound where were greeted with refreshments and lots of information about Bali and customs. Well presented and fun. Cooking was hands on experience and with a group of only 11 cooking so not too crowded. It was in a very well set out kitchen, open on 3 sides so not too hot and a lovely view of the garden. Lobong chef is very good and a good instructor. With a price of about AUD40 for the 6 or 7 hour experience, I would say it was also excellent value. After the cooking is finished we then sit down and eat the results with a beer or soft drink if you want.

What a wonderful experience .. Let start by saying my partner and I absolutely love this place. We have done the cooking class twice now, but this trip decided to try there dining experience that they offer and were both blown away with what we had the pleasure of eating. It was honestly the most authentic Balinese experience we have ever had. To eat the nicest food we have tried in Bali in such a beautiful family compound surrounded by great company, we can not speak highly enough of our experience here .The smoked duck was the best I have ever tried . We enjoyed it so much we returned with a group of 10 family members (also in Bali with us for a wedding) two days later and let me tell you it was nothing short of a delicious Balinese feast. They welcomed our family into the compound like we were there own, every one thoroughly enjoyed it and are still raving about it. The best dinner I have ever experienced in Bali . Thank you guys you are always a highlight of trips to Bali and look forward to returning next year. Lots of love and thanks ,Adam and Michelle

must-do. The whole experience is perfect throughout. The staff are punctual and really friendly, the food is great, the whole program is very nicely organized. I don't think I can cook Indonesia food back home though mainly since I can't get the ingredients in U.S., but the whole experience is just awesome and I highly recommend it to anyone visits Ubud

Amazing Balinese Food and Culture Experience. We joined the cooking class with no expectations whatsoever, but came out enriched with knowledge not only about food but fantastic insights about Balinese culture. Such a warm and welcoming family with a beautiful family compound, an experience simply not to be missed. One of the main highlights of our trip and probably had one of our best meals in Bali here!

Fantastic Balinese Experience. The whole experience was professional, fun and inclusive from the start.Pickup from our villa was punctual and comfy aircon car - essential in Ubud.Visited a local fruit and veg market, no tourists there and our guide showed us all the interesting produce, what its used for and got to meet some locals. Once we returned to the family home we got to see how to make coconut oil as the rest of the family set about preparing our ingredients before chopping/slicing/frying/cooking and steaming rice!Cooking for 2 hours included preparation, teaching and everyone got a turn and chance to ask questions. The banquet was beautifully presented at the end of the day, the monsoon rains made it a true Balinese delight!Recommend 100%

Best and most hospitable experience. Thanks so much Sang De and family for the most amazing, personal and entertaining experience in Ubud. We have attended many cooking schools over the years and believe that your hospitality, generosity and enthusiasm made our stay more than memorable. We were lucky to have your class exclusively for our group of eight and besides your professionalism, our request for many, many cold Bintangs at the end of a challenging walk was indeed memorable.Good luck to you and the many generations of your family who shared our day.thanksDenise & Rodney

A wonderful day!. My new wife and I recently attended this class whilst on our honeymoon. Sang De and his family take you into their home and expose you to the traditions of Balinese cooking. It was an exceptionally well organised, professional day rounded off by a wonderful lunch!

Cooking and culture. My only regret is that I did not take a recording device..... Sang De imparts such insight into every aspect of Balinese cooking, from the prayers to the animals we are about to cook, to the growing of the vegetables and preparation to the people of Bali. My mind was filled with interesting facts and I hadn't even started cooking. The market used for the tour is off the beaten track allowing our hosts to really explain all the different foods. Onto the family compound where we learn more traditions and finally into the kitchen where we prepare 10 different dishes. Here there is no need to worry about remembering everything as the recipe covers that. Excellent experience.

A fantastic day. I had the pleasure of attending the Lobong cooking school with my daughter during our recent stay in Ubud. From the moment we were picked up in the morning until our drop off in the afternoon, everything was so professional and organised. The market tour was so interesting , not a tourist in sight (only us), the wonderful day at the family compound where the cooking was hands on, and Sang was so informative about Balinese culture and spirituality. The feast at the completion of our cooking class was delicious. We have learned so any new techniques ad can't wait to get back home and cook some authentic Balinese food. Don't hesitate, do this cooking class, it's the best in Ubud.
Not just cooking. Good opportunity to learn not only Balinese cooking techniques but also about family life and culture firsthand.

There is a reason this is one of the top attractions in Ubud.. This family- run business takes you right into the heart of traditional Balinese living. For over 5 hours Sang De, our host and market guide, and Dewa, our chef and food guide, stepped me and four other 'cooks' (they take up to 10) across the threshold into their home and lives. Their brother-in-law Gunk De arrived to collect me at 7:45. He had a smile so wide it could have lighted up the universe. We collected another couple attending the course and then went straight on to their local market where we met up with the knowledgable and delightful Sang De and took a stroll thru the narrow alleys and piles of fresh food to learn about Balinese ingredients and culture. Then it was on to their beautiful family compound to rest and have a drink, eat some yummy banana fritters, learn more about Balinese culture and have a lesson in making coconut milk and coconut oil. Next, Dewa's cooking lessons were gentle and encouraging. When it came time to eat the 10 dishes we'd prepared they were presented beautifully, restaurant-style. The menu itself was superb and I loved that everything was fresh -including the coconut oil made that morning. Gunk De told me on the way back that everyone in the family has a background in tourism or hotel management and it shows. Cool towels to soothe one from the heat, snacks and drinks just when you need them, fine food, super clean everything (including western toilets) and the famous Balinese happiness and love that seems to seep into very aspect of this heavenly day. And on top of all that a gift bag to take home! A wonderful experience that I'd recommend.

An excellent day. This was just the best experience. They have really thought it out. They have small groups, you go to the markets and they walk through explaining different foods and items and how they are used. Then you go to the school which is in their family compound. You are then told about local customs and have the family compound explained. The school steps you through the preparation and cooking steps and then you eat it. They are well organised from the pick up through the whole cooking process. They employ local staff and family and were just fantastic.

Book Lobong, You won't regret it!. If you are looking for a life experience that you will remember forever & possibly be the highlight of your holiday, then take this class.I used trip advisor to choose a cooking class to take while staying in Ubud. I chose Lobong because they seemed more personalised. I made the right choice! Lobong's classes never have more then 10 participants at a time. I was one of 5.After my day at Lobong I was on a natural high. It was a wonderful Balinese experience that will stay in my memory for ever.In the morning Sang Made guides you through his local fresh produce market. This alone was an amazing experience.You are then welcomed to the family compound to learn about how the family lives. This was a great insight into Balinese tradition.From here you head to the kitchen where you will prepare food for a few hours.Once all the cooking is done you will be served the most delicious Balinese cuisine you have eaten (your own creation). I would be happy to pay the cost of the class just for the food alone. Everything else is a bonus!I recommended two other travellers to take the class the next day. They too were beaming with enjoyment & raving about how great their day was.Book Lobong, You won't regret it!

Far exceeded expectations. Wow! What a fantastic day. A very professional operation Deiwa and Sang De are running. We were picked up at 8am and taken to a local food market, where we were shown a range of local foods and given explanations of their uses by the very knowledgable Sang De. On to the beautiful family compound where we were given either ginger tea or Balinese coffee. Sang De explained the buildings and the set out of their compound according to their traditional culture and beliefs. The gardens were beautiful and buildings so well maintained, it was a privilege to be there. On to the cooking part. After a demonstration of how to make coconut milk and coconut oil, we spent a few hours chopping and preparing our 10 dishes with the skillful and knowledgable Deiwa. The rest of the family ran around us clearing dishes, cleaning our slops and bringing out the next step. Deiwa was very kind to those of us who aren't experts with the chopping board, and encouraged all of us to have a go at every part of the process. Just before we sat down to enjoy the efforts, we followed Sang De's Mum in placing offerings in the family temple to give thanks for the food. The food was amazing, we learnt an enormous amount and were given a little "package" to take home. Won't tell you what's in it because it is a great surprise at the end. The whole experienced far exceeded any expectations, is excellent value for money, and highly recommended.

A very humbling experience. A very rare oopportunity to be invited in to a family compound to learn the beautiful cooking concepts of Balinese food. Its not just an insight to the amazing food its also an insight in the Balinese culture and family structure. A visit to the markets for the locals in the morning is certainly an education and very different to the Parap Markets in Darwin which is why it just added to the overall experience of the day. You are picked up in the morning, taken to the markets then back to the family compound to have step by step cooking lessons where you get to cook it all as small groups. You then sit down as a group and are served the lunch you have prepared. It costs about $40 per person but for the time and the experience it is certainly worth it.

Best cooking class ever!. I wanted to write a really great review and encourage everyone to take this cooking class... but I think every other review on Trip Advisor is already doing this!!! I have been trying to cook Indonesian food for many months (since I fell in love with the country and the food on my past four visits!), but did not have much success in the process. My partner and I booked a trip to Bali and this time I wanted to attend a cooking class to find out what I was doing wrong. I spent months (literally), looking for a cooking class. I had very specific items I wanted to cook, how I wanted them to be cooked, how many people were to be in the class, the utensils used and the location of the class. In the end, it came down to Lobong and one other class. Right from the start of my research, I had a feeling that Lobong was the right class for me. Although other classes were teaching recipes that I also wanted to learn how to cook, I didn't have a connection with them (sounds crazy, I know). I sent Sang Made an email and he replied straight away, he answered all of my questions and was very polite. I decided to go with my gut feeling and booked Lobong! It was the best decision I've ever made. Right from the very start, the class was fantastic. We went on the traditional market tour, then learnt about the Balinese way of life (very interesting!), and then we started to cook!!! The chef, Dewa, was a great teacher and very funny too! Finally, we were served our food in such a lovely way. It was the best day I've had in Bali. Thank you Sang Made and the family for such a great experience. I will be sure to recommend your class to all!!!!

Highlight of our trip!!. This was definately the highlight of our trip! Not only is it a cooking class, but a great insight into Bali customs and traditions. You are welcomed into Sang Made's home and spend many hours preparing and learning traditional meals, and then sit down to a beautiful lunch with the food you have prepared.We got a taxi up to Ubud on the morning of our class, and unfortunately our taxi driver did not know his way and got us lost, driving round in circles for hours. This meant we missed the market tour in the morning which was really disappointing. However Sang Made actually came to our Villa the next day and took myself and my partner to the market for the tour to make up for it - even though it wasn't his fault in any way we had missed!! You don't get this sort of service often anymore!!!! This experience is a must do when you are in Bali.
Enak sekali (delicious!). Highly recommended cooking class including informative trip to local market. A great culinary and cultural experience

Yummm. From the local market to the welcome you receive in the family home to the amazing food you help create !!It is never to be forgotten experience. We loved it and we loved eating the Delicious food we helped make. The insight this cooking class offers into Balinese culture is one not to be missed . The class size is small and very hands on. I would not hesitate to recommend this. Thank you Sang Made

Wonderful experience. This is the second time I have attended a cooking class in Ubud, and this was by far the best. I loved that we got to do most of the cooking, and the meal at the end was superb. My daughter and I learnt some new techniques and the hosts were knowledgeable, warm and very helpful. Highly recommended.

Great day for the whole family. I feel there is not a lot I can say that hasn't been said already, other than to agree with all of the fantastic reviews for Sang-De and his wonderful hospitable family. I wasn't sure how the day would work for our family of 5, including 3 kids the youngest of whom is 8, but they were all fully involved, busy chopping and stirring along with the adults. From the early morning tour of the local market, through the mid-morning coffee and welcome to the family compound to the very informative cooking process and feast that was our lunch, we were kept busy and well cared for. Sang-de and his whole family had a role to play in the day and they worked hard and professionally behind the scenes - nice touches were the cold towels after the market tour and the icy cold water during cooking, which is a hot process in Bali! I can't recommend this day enough. It was a real highlight of our trip and so lovely that every member of our family was able to participate. We are now back home with our coconut oil and recipe book, ready to try to reproduce some of the delicious dishes...

Amazing Cooking School. We were greeted by Sung De at our hotel, who had arrived early to collect us. We were told that our group (6 people) were getting our own class. However, I believe they have minimum number of 12? Sung De's local knowledge was outstanding, and I think I learned more about Bali than I did about cooking! His English was fantastic. The cooking class itself was great, with the meal served to you a la cart at the end (rather than buffet style I have experienced in other cooking schools). My only criticism was when we mentioned we had been to other Bali cooking classes in the past, some staff members went out of their way to "slag" them off. ie. They have too many students or They don't give you a hands on experience like we do. But I guess I'm just not a fan of businesses putting down others for their own gain. Overall, a truely amazing experience which I will be sure to do again when I next visit Bali.

A beautiful Insight into Bali. We were taken to the local market where we didn't see another tourist at all, then welcomed into their family comound with open arms. The three hour hands on cooking was amazing and very informative, revealing all the nifty secrets of Balinese cooking! Lovely people, great experience and value for money - a must do!

An experience the whole family enjoyed.. 7:30 am sharp we were picked up from our villa which was a good 25 minute drive out of central Ubud, and taken directly to the local marketplace to learn about the ingredients we were to use. The market was really interesting and we were able to try different fruits and produce as we walked around. San De was clearly very well know and much liked by the locals. Getting back to the villa compound was like arriving at a zen retreat. It was a very calm and beautiful place. Immaculately clean, it was very well set up for this group activity. The whole family get involved, from San De's mother to his cousins and brothers and even the in laws. We were provided with cold drinks and water, snacks and tastes of our cooking throughout the day. Once the meal had been cooked, we accompanied San De's mother to the family temple to watch her make an offering before we sat down to eat. Once at the table, the food we had cooked was absolutely delicious. Our 16 and 14 year olds were very open to eating all the dishes in front of them because they had invested time and effort into creating them. (Note to self!). My daughter is vegan and they catered to her needs with specific dishes she prepared as an alternative the meat dishes. I was really impressed. Armed with our recipe book and our coconut oil gift, we returned to the villa at around 3pm. This day was real value for money and enjoyed by all of us! Thank you!

Organised, informative and yum!. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Sang Made and Chef. The morning visit to the local market was fun and informative. The cooking class was well organised and professional. We could not fault it. Highly recommended. Thank you to the Lobong Team for enriching our stay in Ubud!

Excellent Authentic Balinese Experience - More than just cooking!. I'm not much of a cook at all, but this was terrific! I went with my 9 year-old daughter and the experience was terrific for both. The whole experience was top-notch. They picked us up from our home and took us directly to the meeting place where we went together to the market. The market was very educational - a tour of the structure, the different vegetables, spices, meats, and other ingredients. My daughter was even captivated by it all! Sang 'de was super, and his English is as good as any you'll hear in Indonesia. The home compound where we come back to do the preparations and cooking is gorgeous. Extremely neat and clean and super organized for a group. The groups are not huge - max of about 10 or 12 I think. So you get good instruction and service. The staff are super, and Dewa, the main cook is awesome. His English is also excellent. His skill as a chef is obvious he is very patient and friendly! And he makes sure you learn technique and don't have to memorize recipes - they give you a recipe book and bottle of genuine coconut oil to take home. You then get to eat, and it is incredible! The ingredients are obviously fresh, and you have ground the spices right there! They even let my daughter participate and take pictures. Of course, the Balinese love children, so she was right at home. I can't say enough about all the staff and the experience. And to top it off, the price is very reasonable for over a half-day genuine Balinese experience. in talking with others in the same class, they had checked around more than I and found this was either the most reasonable or close to. And based on the fullness of the experience, I know for a fact that you wouldn't get a better value for this kind of experience. Thanks again Dewa, Sang Ade, and staff!

Best Bali experience ever!!. My friend and I have been going to Bali for 20+ years and both agreed that this was the most rewarding of all our Bali ventures. From pick-up to drop off at our Ubud hotel we chatted to Sunday (Sand De) like a best mate about many Balinese customs and traditions. This is not just a cooking class in Bali, this class is a cultural experience from the local market to the family compound. Thank you for welcoming us into your world and sharing your beautiful food & knowledge on how to best prepare & serve it. To all my friends who visit Bali on a regular basis I will be encouraging them to visit and experience your hospitality and love of cooking. Congratulations on an amazing business and we will definitely be back on our next visit to Ubud Oh and the food we prepared and subsequently ate, Yummo!!

Great experience. Overall introduction of Balinese culture, way of living and cooking.Passed a great moment. Good explication at market of the different products used in the Blaine kitchen. Arrived at the cooking place, explanation of the way houses are organized, where temples are placed, the house of the parents,... Good cooking instruction

A wonderful insight into Balinese cuisine. It’s very difficult to add anything new to the countless superlatives that have already been used to describe the 6 hours that you get to spend with Sang and his family at Lobong Culinary Experience. I read countless reviews before booking in with them and can only say that the praise they continue to receive for their cooking class is richly deserved. It’s great value for money and the food at the end was delicious. I’m only sorry that we didn’t have time to attend the compound dinner which they offer in the evening, so we’ll definitely book ourselves in for that next time we’re in Ubud. Sang and his family do a truly wonderful job at enabling you to better appreciate the secrets of Balinese cooking and we are looking forward to tasting their wonderful food again. Many thanks from Sean and Jacky in Manila.

Lobong cooking class- an experience not to be missed. Just back from Bali last weekend, on our last day in Ubud my brother had arranged for his mum, my sister, my husband and I to attend the Lobong cooking class. Have to say it was the absolute highlight of our trip. Dewa thank you for showing us all that cooking is easy and not difficult :) The whole journey from the local markets to being welcomed into the family compound to learning how to prepare and cook local dishes was a fantastic experience but even more rewarding was learning the local culture and how a family compound works. Thank you Sang Dewa and to your family for sharing your home and talents.It's why a lot of people return to Bali time and time again, we love how happy, relaxed and hospitable you are not to mention hard working. We will definately come back, this time maybe to visit your restaurant also.

Interesting, tasty, great people and awesome experience. Well what a great experience. The booking was easy with quick reply and payment on the day. We were picked up on time (in fact early) on the morning by a nice bloke. Good quality vehicle drove us to the market where we met the rest of the people. We were then guided around the market meeting local vendors, with great explanation by our guide and a warm welcome by the people there. Saw sights and smelt smells only found in boring dried up form normal in jars at the supermarket (if you can even find them!). After the markets, where we tasted and smelled all we would work with later, we travelled to the main house but not before we were welcomed at the cars with a cold flannel and water... they think of everything.The experience there was warm and welcoming. Smiles everywhere within the venue's complex (it is their home at the end of the day) before we met the lady of the house. Here we saw the fresh coconut oil process and then to the open air kitchen area.The head chief was brilliant, great English and SO knowledgeable. Not your average "head chef" with smiles and laughter followed by a great explanation of the process ahead. All hands on, every dish, which was easy to follow and very tasty. After several hours of absorbing as much knowledge as we could we finally got to eat out wares. Delicious, fresh and honest food. Yum.To say we had a great time would be only the tip of the iceberg - the people were great, the food was great, the setting was great... All in all, it was alright ;-) PS if you don't get my humour, it was well worth it!

Wonderful Conclusion to Holiday in Bali. I read all the reviews on Tripadvisor and this Cooking class lived up to all the reviews. Communication is prompt, positive and reliable. You are picked up and transported to the Cooking class in above average style. The local market experience, the actual Cooking Class and the family experience were very memorable. If you go to Bali don't miss this opportunity.

Lobong Cooking school in Ubud - Fantastic. This is a must do if you are in Ubud and really want an authentic Balinese cooking experience. Firstly you are taken to an authentic marketplace where there are no other tourists and our guide Sang talks in depth about all the ingredients used in the days cooking. You are then taken to his family home which is breathtaking and immersed in a fun and interactive cooking class where you make up to 10 traditional Balinese dishes including yummy peanut sauce.I cannot recommend this experience enough and it really is great value for money. Sangs mother even shows you how she makes coconut oil (You get some as a gift as well).

Incredible experience and class. Hands down one of my favorite experiences in Bali. Not only is this a cooking class but such a cultural experience as well!I was picked up promptly at my hotel and taken to the traditional market. It was such a wonderful experience going the day prior to the Gangulan festival and seeing the business of the market as everyone was preparing for the holiday. The market experience was informative and very comprehensive. We ended with being handed cold towels and bottled water to help cool off for the ride back to the family compound.Upon arriving at the compound we were given a tour and taught about family life and how the compound is set up and then enjoyed Bali coffee or tea prior to starting the cooking class. During the cooking portion, the other participants and I made a nine course traditional Balinese meal. We did all the work and it was very hands on. It was incredibly thorough and very informative. At the conclusion, we were shown the Balinese offering that is done before meals and were able to go to the family temple and watch the offering. Such a wonderful experience to understand the offering and witness. Following the offering, we all were seated at a table in the gardens and served our meal, which was delicious. Prior to even coming to Bali, the email communication was prompt and it was very easy to book and even during the class and afterwards the service and professionalism was superb.The food was amazing, the education style was hands-on and came complete with our recipe book to take home. It was so well taught that I am confident that I could recreate some of the dishes! Overall what made this experience memorable was the immersion into the Balinese culture by the host family. A wonderful experience and highly recommended to anyone interested in understanding more about Balinese cooking or culture!

A highlight of our holiday!. The day started with a fascinating tour through a local produce market (we were the only tourists in the market!) before moving on to the Sang family compound where we learnt to cook 10 different Balinese dishes. The Sang family are incredibly friendly, knowledgable and welcoming and we learnt as much about Balinese culture as we did about the Balinese cuisine. We'd recommend this activity for anyone interested in learning more about Balinese cooking or culture. A great day!

Excellent experience.
