A great teacher who loves his job. The food was DELICIOUS! Some of the best food we have had in all of Asia. They did not skimp on ingredients either, we ate like Kings and Queens. The whole experience was very special, you are welcomed into their family compound and taught about Balinese traditions, lifestyle and culture. I would also not hesitate to bring along any male companions as my partner who is not a cook loved it, you couldn't not. Every details was well thought out, even down to the special gift and book of recipes that you get to take home with you. This  is the best way to experience a place and a culture.

Great Balinese cooking experience!. My friends and I loved spending time with Sang Made, his family and the rest of the Lobong Cooking team. We learned so much from our time at the market to touring the family compound and cooking many great Balinese dishes. They make sure that everyone plays a part in preparing the meal, so the entire experience is very hands-on. Highly recommended for those who want a mix of culture, cooking, and a good time with friends/family!

Best meal in Bali, great hosts, perfect presentation. We had the best time at Lobong cooking class. After looking at numerous reviews for various cooking classes, we realized that several factors are important: size of the class, location (home vs. cafe), and cost. Lobong limits its class size to 10, and we had a class of 6. There were plenty of things for each of us to do (though we weren't each making an individual meal- if that's what you expect). The chef was amazing and gave us instructions that were easy to understand- and more importantly- remember. The location also couldn't have been beat. The host family has a wonderful house, and the explanations of Balinese culture, the housing complex, etc. really contributed to our appreciation of the culture. Other cooking classes, many for a cheaper price, are located in warungs, or small restaurants, which I think would detract from the experience.The cost is roughly $40 USD, which we were hesitant about at first (other classes run as low as $20) but we think is more than worth it for what you get out of it. What it comes down to is- most anyone can run a cooking class. All you need is a kitchen and a recipe. Lobong manages to surpass all expectations with the presentation, the explanations, and the food. (the cook used to be a su chef and cooked for many celebrities.) If you are going to do a cooking class, you may as well do it right. Couldnt think of higher praises. Would highly recommend to any of my friends, and am going to send my parents when they come visit Bali.

Top-class cooking course. Sang De made us very welcome, took us thru the markets, then we went to his home compound to meet family, talk about his family unit and the reasons for the layout of the buildings and temple, had a lovely morning tea, then on to preparing the food. Dewa was a great teacher, but I would like to see more control over the participants. We had one person who kept butting in with suggestions, tips. Very annoying. But overall, a terrific course. Even our 25 yr old non-cooking son enjoyed it. Thank you from Bapa Cooch and family, Sang De.

Highly recommended!. We can't rate this experience highly enough. From the fascinating tour of the local market, to the wonderful hospitality of the Lobong family (especially Sang De), to the fun hands-on cooking, finishing with the amazing food for lunch. And great value for money. Book it now. You won't be disappointed.

Best cooking class in Bali!. Wonderful way to experience Balinese culture:Educational market tourWelcome into family compoundAmazing English speaking guide: 'Sunday'Hands on preparation of Balinese feast with 'Dewa' the world class chefComplementary recipe book and a special surpriseWould highly recommend to young and old!

What an Amazing Opportunity. There are numerous places in Ubud offering traditional Indonesian cooking classes. This is one of the top-rated options and now I see why. There is an opportunity to see real Balinese life as its being lived. The information at the market and then at the family compound was amazing. I appreciated the chance to slow down and learn about a different culture and how they live their lives. Everything about this experience was authentic, from the market with all it's interesting foods to the smells (not always pleasant but real) to the family compound and daily life. Nothing is glossed over or hidden, this is the way the Balinese have lived for many years. Yes the table is beautiful and the modern toilet is appreciated but you still see the simple kitchen, the delicious, fresh foods used for cooking, the pigs in the pen and the chickens walking through the yard. As a chef I was impressed by the quality of the meal from a simple stove, including the wood stove used to cook the rice and the matron of the house making fresh coconut milk and oil for cooking. I received a great education on the food, the lifestyle, the spirituality and the home of a Balinese family. What a great bargain for the price and a fabulous meal and parting gifts as well.

Not only had the best insight into Bali life, but cooked and ate the best food of our stay!. From start to finish the family puts on a welcoming, interesting, interactive and hugely insightful morning. Foodies and cooking beginners can both get a LOT out of this, there were no kids on our course but I am sure it would be good for them too. 100% recommended, the highlight of our stay in ubud.

Professional, fun, informative and hands on. We haven't done any other cooking classes here but here are the reasons we would recommend this one:1/ Morning market visit. This was a real clincher for us choosing this one in the first place, we love markets and seeing what people are selling and getting more information about the products than we could just walking around gawking.2/ not just a cooking class but a cultural class as well. Lots of information on lots of aspects of Balinese culture. Being in the family compound you are embedded in it from the offerings made after cooking to watching a priest conduct a ceremony 'cleansing" one of the family members who recently became a mother. This is the real clincher for why we don't think this class could be beaten.3/ Good facilities, good food, small groups (we only had 6 in total).4/ A professional chef who is a good communicator and helpful about things from knife skills to different techniques of cooking.5/ Professional handling all the way from booking to arriving back at our accommodation.6/ Friendly and knowledgeable hosts at all points of the tour.Thoroughly enjoyed it - thanks!

The best experience I had in Bali. Our host and the rest of the family were so kind and friendly, they made their best to make it a fantastic morning for us. I was staying in Ubud, and they picked me up from my hotel just on time. Then, we meet with the rest of our group (5 people in total) and our host Sang Made took us to the local market. It was a very nice tour explaining the different plants, vegetables, fruits used in the Balinese cooking. After we got home, we started cooking. It was an all-in-all class that we learned a lot about food, Balinese culture and family life, and of course the food we prepared at the end was amazing. I'd definitely recommend this cooking class to everyone.

Much more than just a cooking class. I honestly could not recommend this cooking class highly enough, not only was this an amazing cooking class but also a fantastic cultural insight. After promptly being picked up from my hotel, we were all taken to the local fresh produce markets and guided through the stalls and the produce that was for sale. After this Sang Made welcomed us into his family compound and explained the structure of his home. We then met our chef and it was full steam ahead from there!! Everyone was included in the process of cooking, with praise and encouragement being offered the whole way through. After all the cooking was complete we were taken into the family temple and Sang Made's mother made an offering for everyone in the class, Finally our creations were plated up for us in a three course meal and it was without a doubt the BEST food I have eaten in Bali!!

Ubud FAVOURITE!. So much more then a cooking class. Picked up at 8am from our villa, collected another couple and off we went to the local market. What an eye opener, im not going to go into too much detail as words cant really describe it! We were so welcomed and enjoyed every minute of our experience with Lobong Cooking, We cant wait to try their new class next time we are in Ubud! Thank you for welcoming us into your home. We have already made the peanut sauce at home :) YUM!!

Family fun. Efficient pick up and delivery from our villa was followed by a visit to the local markets, eye opening, before we were invited into the family compound for a n education on not only Balinese cuisine but also Balinese life. We took the kids and they too enjoyed the half day experience. The food is great and the friendly family atmosphere is a great taste of Bali life

Experience of a lifetime. My partner and I (avid food lovers and home chef's) went to the morning class. The markets were an assault on the senses. Amazing produce and an experience of the friendly locals of Ubud.The cooking class itself was informative on the traditional ways in preparing delicious Balinese food. I loved sitting down with the class to feast on the banquet we had all contributed to making. We both would highly recommend this experience. For about $35 AUD its amazing value for money.  J + T Qld, AUS

Best food in Bali!. My husband and I were lucky to get a private cooking class experience with them. So we had a lot of hands on experience and cooked all dishes ourselves.The food tasted amazing! Everything was so fresh (they killed the chicken the same morning) and tasted delicious. We stayed at the Four Seasons but the food at Lobong Cooking Class tasted much better than at the 5* hotel!

Fantastic Experience. An absolute "Must Do" - this family run cooking school held in their own compound is just fantastic. The tour of the market was really interesting particularly as it was not a tourist market so it showed real-life activity. Being part of the family and being able to ask questions about their life and customs was very rewarding and the actual cooking class was easy to understand and extremely well presented. The food was so delicious and we came away feeling we could replicate the meal at home. We learnt so much and were made to feel so welcome. It was a highlight of our time in Bali.

A sure thing!. This was recommended to us by the person who rented the villa we stayed at in Ubud, all of her recommendations as a local were excellent, but the Lobong Cooking Class was by far the best.It is a family business, and each member a different role. The friendly host picked us up at our accommodation. He was a very well educated man with excellent communication skills. He ensures you understand everything about local food, religion and traditions. We felt this was more than a cooking class, it was also about learning their way of life.The class was excellent. After the market, the host took us to his family compound where the class was held. Everything is done fresh, so before we arrived they have been preparing all the ingredients since 5AM. The Chef has 20 years of experience, cooking locally and overseas. He is focus in teaching techniques and open to give you tips on all type of cooking. We enjoy the 5 set menu we prepared and learned a lot.The experience was excellent, it was a morning very well spent. I highly recommend it.

Amazing!. As all the reviews illustrate, Lobong Culinary is a great way to spend a morning in Ubud whether you are an aspiring chef or just enjoy learning more about Balinese life and culture. Highly recommended, I'll be back, especially when they open a restaurant on the family compound!

A must do for everyone visiting Bali. I cannot recommend this enough. I was looking forward to this class before leaving Australia but it exceeded my expectations. We were surprised they still ran the class for just my friend and I on the day and the one on one attention was fantastic. Sang Made our host was very informative and pleased to answer any of our questions from the minute we were picked up from the hotel. All the staff were so welcoming and friendly and to visit the family compound was an amazing experience. The food was divine and awesome to see it made from scratch. There was so much quantity we could not eat it all and would of been good if Chef or Host got to sit down and share with us. Was THE highlight of my trip to Bali and Ubud is an amazing place to visit.

Ubud Highlight. A morning spent at the Lobong cooking class is an amazing authentic Balinese experience, highly recommended to anyone who can spend a day in Ubud. Starting with a trip to the Ubud food markets to see how the local ingredients are bought, the small class is then welcomed into the Lobong family home; a typical Balinese compound, where family life and spiritual tradition are explained. Under Chef Dewa's clear instruction the class then prepares and cooks 9 dishes, each one more delicious than the last. The family at Lobong are so friendly, speak fantastic english and offer an educational Balinese experience not to be missed.

Best experience I have had on Bali.. My 12 year old son, my mother inlay spent a fabulous day with the staff of Lobong Cooking (also see Facebook page). We had a great tour of a local market and then went to the family compound for a cooking experience of a life time. We were treated like honoured guests and felt honoured to be welcomed into their home. We were treated to a thorough explanation of family life in the compound before beginning our cooking experience. The 9 course meal was carefully explained and we really enjoyed the hands on approach to the cooking. My son was treated as a mini "Masterchef" and really enjoyed the attention from the staff. It was great to learn all about the traditional way to prepare an authentic Balinese meal and actually make a lot of the meal ourselves. While the meal was being plated up we were invited to the family temple, wearing sarong and learning how and why offerings are made. We the sat to eat our meal which was glorious and were were so proud of ourselves for making such great food. We were farewelled with a gift (will keep this a surprise for you). We had a really wonderful day and can not say enough of how professional and extremely well set up and hygienic the Labong Cooking is. I would highly recommend this to everyone. A bonus for us was that we were the only three at the class that day. I would also recommend doing the morning class so that you get to go to the market.

This is much more than a cooking class!!!. I went with my 24 yr old daughter and her guy friend. We loved it. It has been the highlight of our Bali trip. The trip to the market was so interesting and authentic. Wow. Sang, our amazing host showed us all the things that are commonly used in authentic Balinese cooking. We touched and smelled so many ingredients.Then we were off to the family compound which was beautiful. Sang told us all about how the extended family lives. It is really like a living museum experience with a warm and inviting host. We learned so much and we were comfortable to ask questions. The cooking portion was so fun and informative. It is very interactive and we had a good group which made it fun.A very special part of the day was when we all put on sarongs and watched as Sang's beautiful mother made the offering at the family temple. It was very beautiful and moving. Then we got to eat the meal that we had prepared. Yum. We really loved that we got to have a cold Bintang with it.When we left there were many hugs and pictures. Sang told us that we were now part of the family and we really felt that way. I would return in a second the next time I came to Bali. It would be a great experience even for someone who doesn't really cook. Just to attend the whole thing would be so enjoyable and informative. When we left we were given all the recipes we made and a bottle of coconut oil that Sang's mother makes daily. It was presented in a very nice presentation. I can't say enough good things about this day.

The best thing you'll do in Ubud. I always send my houseguests over to Lobong Cooking Class and they always come back raving about it. Today I went with them, and was reminded why. Made picked us up at 8 this morning and we headed to the traditional market -- a real one, just outside of Ubud -- where we had a wonderful tour of all the ingredients and regular market life (it's where things happen!). Back at the family compound over coffee and fresh-made snacks, you learn about how an extended family compound is designed and operates. Mother shows you how to make fresh coconut oil, and then Chef Dewa gets down to business. I was surprised the menu was so extensive, but it covers all of the basic types of preparation and sauces & sambals, and we did them all without trouble -- including cooking rice over a traditional wood stove! They have added a clean, spacious facility that lets everyone particiate and dine in comfort, and with a maximum of 12 participants you still feel like part of the family. We had two kids in our group aged 10 and 13, and they were easily included in all the activities. While the capable assistants finished up the last bits, we learned about making offerings, tied on our sarongs, and helped mother place the daily offerings around the family temple. Then we all sat down to a 5-star meal, the best Balinese food I've had in 20 years of living here. Even the picky kids cleaned their plates! Made delivered us home between 2:30 and 3:00 with our recipe booklet, a little bottle of fresh coconut oil, and an invitation to come say hi anytime we're back in town. A memorable day.

A must do in Bali if you want to learn about Bali's culture and people. This is way more than a cooking class. The day begins at the local market, where we did not see even one non-resident of the island. That alone gave us a unique perspective on the island. The variety of items available for sale is truly mind-boggling. If you keep your eyes and heart open, you will learn much here. Our guide spoke great English and there was no problem at all in communication.We were then driven to the family compound, where we were warmly greeted and seated in an open pavilion. While we ate banana fritters and drank coffee, we were told about the layout of the Balinese family compound. Since it was just my son and I at this class, we were able to ask anything we wanted. Our hosts were very generous and patient in explaining life in Bali.Our culture lesson continued while we cooked. Since it was just two of us, we got to be very hands on with the entire meal. Each step was thoroughly explained, with our hosts consistently making sure we understood. They told us things which we could use as substitutes for those ingredients which are not easy to find in the US. We also got the chance to see coconut oil being made by the elder woman of the compound in the traditional way.Time passed quickly, and soon, all the dishes were prepared. Before we could eat them, however, we got the very special treat of being allowed to participate in a blessing ceremony in the family temple. We donned traditional garb for this event. Every step in this process was carefully explained, with the reasons and beliefs behind it.Finally, we ate all the delicious food we had prepared. It was one of the best meals I ate in all of Bali. Very, very good!!!When you leave, you receive a recipe book for everything you've made, and given a gift of coconut oil made by the family matriarch. All in all, an incredible day out in Bali. I highly recommend it to everyone. You will not be sorry. As one final side note, the compound has very clean, western style restrooms. The area for food preparation, and dining is scrupulously clean. No worries about "bali belly" here!

The best day of our Bali holiday.
A cultural and culinary experience par excellence!. This is far more than a cooking class. Sang De (pronounced "Sunday") our guide took us into his family's home for this incredible experience. We learned about the real life of a Bali family ...food, weddings, Hindu religion and the interplay between family and community. This was the background for the fabulous cooking lesson which started in the local community markets and continued in his family home. Sang De's brother-in-law, Dewa, a qualified chef, took the actual cooking class. He was amiable and enjoyed a laugh as he involved us in each of the steps as we prepared the degustation lunch. The only suggestion would be that the experience would have been even further enhanced had Dewa sat down with us to enjoy the lunch we had prepared. Nevertheless, this was the highlight of our Bali trip. I'd strongly recommend this class. Oh, and it was the best meal we ate in Bali!!

Excellent cooking class!. Me and my girlfriend did the lobong cooking class in Ubud after finding it here on tripadvisor. Pickup up from our hotel was free and we were first taken to a local market. Here, we were shown many local herbs, spices, vegetables, fruit and meat by a guide with very good English. We then went to the Lobong house to begin our cooking class. We chopped spices but the meat was already prepared. Each person (7 in total) took turns cooking the 9 dishes. Drinks were free the whole class. At its completion, we were shown an offering at a local temple before eating our creations. A parting gift of home made coconut oil and cook book with their recipes was provided. Overall, a very positive experience with just the right amount of involvement. Definitely recommend doing it.

Must Do for Foodies and Partners Alike. I love to cook and my husband is not at all interested in cooking, but we both loved this day equally! We were unsure about travelling from Sanur to Ubud for a cooking class but so glad we did.All the other reviews describe the experience brilliantly. There is a great mix of cooking and culture, and the setting in the family compound is beautiful. The market visit was amazing, we got to see how the Balinese buy and sell in an authentic setting. You could opt in and out of the cooking process as you wanted, or just stand back and watch. The meal is served to you once all the dishes are prepared, and the coconut oil presented as a gift at the end is a really nice touch. Really highly recommended!

Our best day in Bali. This was by far the most interesting and rewarding day we had on our Bali trip. The market experience was fascinating, we felt like we were getting to see some authentic culture away from all the touristy places. The family compound we were taken to was beautiful and the meal we cooked was the most incredible meal we had on our holiday! My boyfriend is a chef and he still learnt some Balinese cooking techniques (as well as having a bit of a cook off with the family)! I found it just as fulfilling with my basic cooking skills. All the participation tasks are nothing too complex, so it was all achievable and very enjoyable. I have seen some complaints that there was not enough actual hands on activity time, but that isn't the purpose of the day, it is as much a cultural experience. The family then serve you the meal you've helped prepared, by this time you have got to know the group (there were only 9 when we were there), so the mood is very festive and relaxing, with some beers available to order. Considering the very reasonable price of this experience to top off the great day, this would be the first activity I would recommend to anyone going to Bali! Thank your for making our trip so special!

Fantastic way to experience Balinese culture!. We booked on to the morning cooking class and were met by a friendly driver, Agur, who took us to the Ubud food market. We were met by Sung De who showed us around the market and let us try fruits that we were inquisitive about. It was a great way to see the market and interact with the local people.We were then taken to the family compound which was a great insight into traditional Balinese life. We sat and chatted over a coffee and banana fritters (very tasty) and we learnt lots about the day-to-day life of a family.The cooking lesson was well explained, varied and interesting - all of the recipes that were given were totally do-able back at home. During the lesson we had a pit-stop near the bbq where we were served drinks and 'mangosteens' (picked fresh from their back garden as we had previously mentioned how much we enjoyed them).The food was incredible and we are looking forward to trying out the recipes back at home. This will be made a bit easier thanks to the little gift they gave us at the end of the lesson.I highly recommend this experience as a more authentic cooking lesson compared to the ones that are offered in a restaurant. It is also a great way to learn and experience traditional Balinese life - thank you for a lovely day!

Not-to-be-missed Tour. I learned about Lobong cooking class via tripadvisor. Email was answered quickly and accurately. Morning market at Payangan was a great way to introduce Indonesian cuisine so I suggest you get the morning slot. They only accept 6pax so better book early. As we enter the Lobong compound, we were seated first in their hall for culture briefing. Good info and Sundey was very fluent in English so we easily understood whatever he's explaining. We were given drinks and Nasi Goreng (fried banana fritters), it was delish! It was an easy cooking class session, but also we were lucky to have good companion. Gained friends also (skyping til now). Chef Dewa and staff were helpful during our session. I also like the oleh-oleh (souvenir) :) Good job Sang Made family! Bali vacation won't be complete without this experience.

Fantastic day, would reccomend to anyone. Had an awesome day at Lobong, not only did I learn alot about cooking the Bali way, I also learnt alot about their culture and way of life. Super friendly family and would reccomend it to anyone. Thanks!

Excellent - not to be missed. This class is much more than cooking.. We signed up for this class a few months before we arrived in Bali - and were glad we did. Our hired driver picked us up at 7:00 am at our hotel in Seminyak and took us to meet up with the class at an Ubud Market at 8:15am. We had a total of seven in the class. We toured the local market and learned about fresh ingredients used in daily Balinese cooking. We also sampled a few items. Once the market tour ended we were driven to the cooking class location and greeted with a drink of either coffee or tea and fried plantains. While enjoying our drinks, we were told about the layout of their home/garden, daily customs and other interesting facts of daily life in the Balinese home. The chef, who has worked in hotels in Bali, shared techniques of chopping, stir frying, grinding, and how rice is cooked. Everyone participated in the cooking and preparation process - and learned about all the ingredients. We cooked at least eight dishes in total - and after everything was done, we were served. It was excellent, and seriously some of the best food we had in Bali. I still don't know how they provide this class and make a profit. It's well organized, about five hours long, and very clean, and very professional. This is a class/day not to be missed. Very educational, fun and great food.

YUM. We undertook the Lobong Culinary Adventure along with our 11 year old granddaughter.The whole experience was wonderful.This is so much more than a cooking class. The knowledge we gained of Balinese culture was great, the visit to the local market was eye opening and the warm welcome we received into the family compound was very special.Dewa and Sang De should be very proud of what they are creating and the plan of a Culinary Walk sounds great.If you want to do a little cooking, share great food and learn the background to some of the food and customs of Bali, then take the time to join the family at Lobong.A highlight of our trip, especially the chicken!!

Absolutely fantastic!. Not only did we cook some amazing meals using the freshest of ingredients, but we visited a local non-tourist free food market and were taught about the essence of family life in Bali. This was one of the best tours we have ever done in over 30 years of travelling in Asia. Cheap and cheerful!!! Level of hygiene and health and safety was outstanding. A credit to all the family members who contribute to this venture.

Our best experience in Bali!. Lobong cooking class has been our best experience in Bali! We were so lucky to have a private course my husband and I, first going to the local market (very different from the overly touristic art market in Ubud!), then cooking and learning an incredible amount of details on the balinese culture, traditions and religion and finally being served the food we had cooked (so delicious!), we felt liked kings! The environment and the compound were lovely and really peaceful, and we were so warmly welcomed by the whole family, definitely an unforgettable day!

brilliant combination of cooking lesson and balinese lifestyle presentation. ...I planned to do this cooking lesson months before we arrived to Bali. all I can say in a nutshell it was really worth to wait for it!!! I got much more then I expected!!!go with your camera and fresh brain to remember every delicious moment!first we went to the local food-market together with the Family Host (not the busy-turisty Ubud one:) and get detailed explanation about fruits, vegetables, spices, offerings, everything "unknown" interesting stuff.after the market we went in to a real Balinese home and get welcome tea and pisang goreng.we also get really detailed explanation from our Family Host about how balinese homes are built, how generations are living together.he could just tell about these things for hours and hours...it was really interesting and inspiring to listen!than we got aprons and the cooking lesson started.we made a whole menu with a lots of help and explanation from the chef.we were cooking our rice in wood-fire also:)while this process is going on you can smell everything, ask about the ingredients and also take pics if you feel so.before we eat what we cook, we gave offerings (also detailed explanation why they are doing it before every meal) with the help of an oldest women in the house.we got wrapped in sarong and went together in to the temple of the house.they were nice moments.finally we ate the menu we cooked before.everything was really delicious!!!absolutely recommended for everyone wondering about balinese lifestyle, how they make those wonderful easy foods, how a balinese home is looking:)...and you will never feel yourself just a tourist...i really like this.thank you very much for the staff to share these wonderful things with us!!!Ibolya

Very good, learned about Bali food and Bali living.. The person give a lot information about living of Bali, the food was really good and I had really good experiences about the technic of making Bali food. Excellent cooking class.

Great food. Fascinating cultural experience. Great cooking class and an opportunity to understand more about Bali culture. The class takes place in the Balinese family compound so you do not only learn about cooking Balinese food but get a chance to see how people live and learn about tradition and culture. The dishes prepared during the class are elaborate and you really do learn about cooking. The entire thing is superbly organized, the setting is beautiful, and the food phenomenal. Definitely highly recommended.

Much more than merely a cooking class. As an introduction into Balinese cooking and food preparation for the average person-on-the-street, this class delivers.However, the REAL value is in the insight into the workings of Balinese society and religion, and how these relate to their food.Sang was a very well spoken guy, who took on the duty of explaining the social structures and family life, as well as BBQ duty.We felt priveleged to be welcomed into the Lobong home, and the presentation of their compound and the class itself was extremely professional.I am very pleased that we attended the Lobong cooking class. It has really helped us to start to understand and appreciate the traditional Balinese way of life.Also, the lunch (that we helped to prepare) was magnificent.Very highly recommended.
Great culinary and cultural experience. Very hospitable, informative and well organized. Excellent Balinese food too... A must in Ubud!

an absolute must. 6 adults and one child joined this class on the 50th birthday of one of us. It is one of the best experiences I have had: not only did we go to the market and cook all the food, we were really welcomed in the compound and learnt more about Balinese life than I have ever learnt before. We were allowed to join in the prayers and then my friend was presented with an enormous birthday cake, which was arranged by the class. All our dietary needs (vegetarian) were considered and they were wonderful with the 5 year old child.

Our favorite activity in Bali!. This was so worth it. For 35,000 rupias, we toured a local market, cooked a complete Balinese meal and learned about local life and offerings. This was the real deal. All of our ingredients came from the local market and the family farm. I felt like we really got a taste of how the Balinese live and eat. The family made sure we were safe and explained everything in great detail with warmth and pride. If you are going to do one thing in Bali, this is the one.

Cultural highlight. This is much more than a Balinese cooking class, although the 8 course lunch we helped prepare was wonderful. It's a look into local culture and family life through the window of an extended family just outside Ubud. The host, Seng De, is an articulate and charming man. The class is conducted inside the family compound and everyone we met, including his mother, was gracious and helpful. We visited a local market which was a bit challenging but with no tourists, so you saw how a real community buys, sells and prepares food. It was a highlight of our week in Bali.

one of the highlights of my trip. not only did we learn all about and how to cook a traditional Balinese feast -- we also learned so much about the Balinese culture! i loved this class... the people were so friendly & so accommodating! we had two vegetarians in our group and they adjusted their meals for them with no problem. touring the market was so fascinating and i feel like some of the techniques i learned in the cooking portion of the class are things i will forever use in my cooking.a must if you have an extra day in ubud.

not just cooking - experience the real Bali. I loved this half day course which is a tour de force from a family who really love what they are doing. You will see a local market in action and then cook what might be the most delicious food that you eat during your stay in Bali having been given the opportunity to actively assist in its preparation. All the family members involved care about what they are doing and are keen to show how life in a traditional family compound works. Several of them have also worked in the hospitality industry so they both speak excellent English and understand the needs and interests of visitors to Bali. If you only do one thing while staying in or near Ubud do this!

Easy, fun & great food. We started off with a trip to the local market which was informative and interesting. As we returned to the car we were given beautifully scented cold towels and cold bottle of water. Very nice touch. The class was loads of fun and the food fantastic, all managed by a knowledgeable and trained chef. The best bit was eating everything! We learnt a lot, not only about food, but about Bali traditions and way of life. Highly recommend Lobong cooking class. One of the highlights of our trip.
a great day. Loved the food, people and cultural insights. Highly recommended.

SUPERB!!! GREAT EXPERIENCE!!!. This is my first time cooking (oops) and I'm glad it is done here at Lobong. First, the hosts - they were very friendly and speak very clear and good English. They introduced their living space and some Balinese culture of living. We were served some very nice deep fried bananas and tea before we continued to our culinary experience. Everything went great, step by step we got to chop, grind, fry, braise, bbq, etc etc. The chef was great and explained every detail to us. The best part is, of course, the food!!!! That has to be one of the greatest meals I've had in my life. Thanks Lobong! I will introduce this to all my friends.

If you do one thing in Ubud make it this!. My daughter and I took the early morning class. We were picked up from our hotel and from the word go we were amazed at Sang De's knowledge, enthusiasm, professionalism and attention to detail. When we went to his family's home we were genuinely welcomed by his family and team. The cooking was fun and interesting and the food was fantastic. The experience far exceeded our expectations and was the best thing we did in Ubud.

So Amazing-- a definite MUST in Ubud!. Loved this experience. Not only did I learn the art of Balinese cooking, but I also got to experience a traditional Balinese market too! The transportation from my hotel was wonderful, I loved the market, and the cooking class was spectacular. The other participants and I made a nine course traditional Balinese meal, and then got to enjoy it in the most beautiful garden atmosphere. This is a family owned and operated business, so when you take the class you get to meet all the family too-- such a treat.The food was beyond amazing, the education style was hands-on, and I really enjoyed my time with this class. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone and EVERYONE visiting Bali.

Amazing food and hospitality. I really enjoyed this day. I was picked up at 8am and we first went to visit a market and looked at all the produce. This market is only open until about 11.30am so only the morning class gets to go so try to do this one.We then drove to the family compound where we got some info on Balinese food and then started cooking. In total we made 9 dishes and every single one was delicious.At the end we were given a bottle of coconut oil and a recipe book.

Great friendly atmosphere to learn Bali culture and cooking! Fresh ingredients and fun!. We so very much enjoyed our time at Lobong. We took the 4pm class which was perfect. We got to enjoy dinner with new friends and cooked as a team. It was hands-on where one or two volunteers worked on different tasks while others watched/listened. We learned a lot and thought the price was reasonable (375,0000r) for the small group, instruction, number of helpers in the kitchen, and door-to-door service. We were also really lucky because there were 8 of us and we all got along really well.

Great experience. From booking by email with quick responses, through to the very end - it was all very enjoyable. Sang Made was very hospitable, transfers were effortless and included and the whole family who participated were so helpful. We enjoyed participating and I have to say, the food we made and ate, was actually the tastiest, freshest meal we had on our whole trip. My husband is an absolute non cook and even he enjoyed it as they give information on the way of life, structure of family etc. You can see they are very genuine as at the end, they insisted that we cook the meals and if we have any issues, questions, queries to just email and they will discuss how to help and email back. The bottle of home made coconut oil and recipe booklet were a nice touch. Strongly recommended.

Great Experience. The Longong cooking class was a great experience, we learnt to cook 8 dishes and then we had to eat them all. It wasn't just about the cooking, it gives you great knowledge into Balinese culture and how they live.

Fantastic friendly ultimate cooking experience. I booked this cooking experience after reading reviews on Trip Advisor earlier in 2011.My two adult daughters and three friends (all in their 20's) and I (Mum) were staying in Kuta. A driver picked us up as arranged for a nominal fee and returned us to the hotel in late afternoon. The day starts with a trip to a local food market (not a tourist one) then on to the family compound for banana fritters and tea/coffee. Then it is straight into the cooking - all hands on- with so much fun and laughter. The total group of 12 people all mingled and we learnt so much about Balinese food culture and family. Finally, when we were all so starving after preparing so much lovely food, we sat down to a beautiful lunch- all prepared in some way by ourselves. Washed down with a freezing cold Bintang or water it was food to die for!!Thanks Sang Made for a wonderful life experience.

Best meal we had in Bali. This class is authentic, informative and delicious! What a great way to learn about Balinese culture, try your hand at their food and spend a morning. While I've seen my share of markets, it's always nice to be introduced to the basics and names of the common foods where you're traveling. Sang Made was a great host and courteous guide with excellent English. The chef is top notch and while he and his assistants help with some of the details in cooking each dish, the class ultimately prepares most of the food. An appreciation for Balinese (Hindu) traditions is learned as we patiently gave offerings of our food to the gods before eating it ourselves. A great experience.

Amazing food, people and hospitality. My wife, Rachael, organised the Lobong Cooking Class for me as a surprise. Being foodies and having a love of cooking, I cannot praise the experience enough. The day began with a visit to a traditional Balinese market where the first stall we went to had a fresh roast sucking pig on the table which set my mouth watering - for 10,000 rupia (just over AU$1) I bought a good sized parcel to share with Rachael. From here we walked through the market with our guide, Made, explaining the different foods and fruits along the way. This market doesn't usually have non Balinese visitors and I think the stall holders admired us with the same curiosity we did them, a lot of smiles were exchanged! From the markets we went to the Lobong Traditional Family Compound where we drank Bali Coffee, ate banana fritter and talked with each other and our hosts before the cooking experience began.We were given an explanation of the compound and a tour and along the way introduced to our guide's mother who was making coconut oil. The cooking class was fabulous, with each of us given a chance to participate in the preparation techniques from chopping, frying, steaming rice to grinding fresh ingredients for the curry and satay. We were kept engaged throughout the lesson with questions, smells and flavours.Once the food had been prepared and cooked we dressed in sarongs to enter the family temple to make an offering before we ate.We enjoyed the meal sat around a large table within one of the compound buildings and while we ate it started to pour with rain - it was amazing! When the rain began to encroach on the area we sat at, the family moved us under a larger building.The family at Lobong cooking were so friendly and explained the cooking steps along the way. We took away complimentary bottles of coconut oil made by our host's mother, together with a cook book of the recipes we made that day. Since returning to Australia we have made the chicken curry twice and had the satay tonight. Lobong have remained in touch with us through Facebook and have provided their email contact details should we ever have any questions - as they do with all of their guests.We'll definitely go back on our next visit to Bali - the experience goes well beyond cooking alone and remains long after returning home!

Culture and yummy food!. Wodnerful experience with Lobong cooking school. Punctual pick-up and return, market tour (of a market not visited by tourists), wonderful food and a chance to visit a Balinese family living and working in their tradtional home. I have nothing more to add to what the other reviewers have said, other than to do it!

Cooking, Learning, Fun, and a UNIQUE Experience. Think National Geographic captured during the market before the actual cooking class. This class allows you to learn about their culture and customs and makes you have a greater appreciation for Bali. The best way to learn about one's culture is sometimes through their food. Take the morning class to really experience the full monty.

Loved it. To anyone considering this, Just do it! We were picked up from our hotel in Seminyak and had a fantastic day out. Hospitality of Sang De and his family was special and more than we could have hoped for. A real Balinese cultural and cooking experience that we are so glad we did. We were even given a little gift pack to take home of coconut oil and a recipe book to ensure we can try to replicate the amazing dishes we helped to make on the day. Loved it, loved it, loved it. Melanie and Roberta

Amazing! Start your trip with this class!!. We took this class last week whilst in Ubud and the service is amazing. The family have this tour down to a fine art. They are professional and friendly and the lessons they teach you are priceless. During the market tour (morning class) you learn about local market histories and traditions. You mingle with the locals and learn all about their food and culture. On arrival the family home you are given a lesson on traditional family compound whilst you snack on deliscious deep fried bananas and locally grown coffee... all before you even start cooking.The menu is DELISH! and seeing the traditional cooking practices including bbq and cocnut oil productions are just a few of the highlights. You must start your visit with this tour so you are aware of the culture as you continue through Ubud. Thank you to the family of Lobong we had a very memorable time, Yum!

Brilliant!. This is truely one of the best things that we did in Bali. Admittedly it is a really early start (we were picked up at 7.30) but it was sooo worth it.Sang De is an amazing host and so very knowledgable, from start to finish he explained everything to us and why it was being done. We felt so at home in the family compound :)The food that we cooked was amazing, cant wait to try it out now that we are home!

Cooking & Culture. The day began with a punctual pickup from our hotel, and to a colorful local produce market, where we joined the other 7 in our class and our host, young Sang Made, who guided us through the produce on sale, explaining unfamiliar items and their uses eg betel nuts, live eels, various chillies, different types of rice and the local favourite, pork, (a 'suckling pig' definitely too big to have been suckling!) cooked and served to the locals as 'fast food'. We were given the warmest of welcomes by all the family at the Lobong home, the geriatrics amongst us given special consideration, being past sitting cross-legged on a cushion! After refreshments and an introduction to their beautiful home, and some of the customs and rituals they observe, it was 'roll up the sleeves', aprons on, and we were into it - learning how to make coconut oil, preparing rice by traditional methods, chopping, frying, tasting, asking and answering questions under the expert tutelage of an expert chef, with many years of commercial experience. Our group included 3 from Canada, 2 from the UK, and 4 Australians, all of whom participated and cooperated well as a team. Cousins and aunts, brothers and nephews, all gave attentive assistance throughout the process and withIn a couple of hours, 8 different dishes were prepared for a fabulous lunch. This would have to be one of the best ways to experience Bali if your interest extends beyond sightseeing and shopping.Sang De and his family deserve top marks for the presentation of their culinary experience. It would rate as one of our most memorable memories. We are so grateful to them for sharing their culture and opening their beautiful home to us.

A wonderful experience. The cooking course was an incredible day out. We were picked up by our hotel early in the morning to visit a local market. They explained a lot of things about the Balinese culture, about the market and about the products for sale there. It was amazing to see all the colours of fruits and vegetables and to see chickens in baskets…after the tour we were given a bottle of water and were brought to the compound, where the family who organizes these tours live. They life in a beautiful home, were we were served tea and a sweet snack while we learned about life in a Balinese compound. The chef was a nice and funny man, who has worked in a 5 star hotel before. He learned us to make 9 different dishes – all delicious. We also learned some chopping techniques and tips about onions and garlic, which is helpful for Western cooking back home as well! It was fun to learn how to make these dishes and to see how the others got on – there were about 8 other people there. We all had our part in making the wonderful meal we would be eating later. In the mean time everything was thought of – there was room to leave your bags, they took moment for you to take pictures and we were constantly provided by water. Very well taken care off. The meal was incredible! Pork satay and baby chicken barbequed and cooked in the nicest sauce ever, and a lovely and healthy salad. At the end of the day we were given a small bottle of coconut oil and a recipe book so we can try to make satay at home. All in all a well good day out, highly recommended.

Do not go to Ubud without booking here.. The Lobong Cooking Class was one of the highlights of our trip. It combined three elements of a good holiday activity: (1) a cultural experience; (2) it was enjoyable and (3) it had great food! The morning trip to the market was a great experience. Sang De provided very clear explanations and with a good sense of humour. Back at the family compound we took part in an interesting cooking class. The instructor (Sang De's brother) catered for all abilities, and made a lot of sense. His tips for 'substitute' items back home were helpful. Finally, once of the best meals of our trip was served up. It was very pleasant. I will (and have) recommend Lobong Cooking Class to anyone I know that travels to Bali. ps: I should add - the pick up and drop off-service back to the hotel made the whole outing a very easy.

One of my highlights. Cannot recommend this cooking class enough. I went with my sister, we were picked up on time at our hotel (slightly out of ubud, in the rice fields, this was a small additional cost which we were happy to pay), we then picked up another two girls and went straight to the local markets where we met our host Sang De. Sang De speaks great english, and provided us with much insight into the balinese culture. We walked through the markets and were explained all the different types of fruit and vegetables, grains, and traditions. We then went back to the family compound for some refreshments, which was a great opportunity to chat with the other members of the class and get to know them.We then met with the Chef who also spoke great english and he took us through the processes of making the balinese food. After we made all of the food we were able to do an offering at the family compound and were told about the traditional bali family life, it was all very interesting. We then ate our food, which was AMAZING and had more time to chat to the other members of the cooking class.Over all, it was definitely a highlight of my trip. The staff/family were all very friendly and helpful, and professional. Everything was done perfectly. My sister and I both agree it was worth every cent.To all at Lobong Cooking - thank you for such a memorable day.

Absolutely amazing!. Highly recommend doing this class! It was such a treat to go to the market and have the food, spices and customs explained. Cooking the food was fun and so tasty. I can't think of another meal that I've had that tasted better!! The people were really friendly and happy to answer any questions. Totally worth doing.
Interesting. I thought it was a fun day. About 2 hours too long. A little overpriced. They only accept cash.

A culinary and cultural treat. We organised our cooking class after reading about it on the net. We were picked up bang on time from our hotel and driven to the venue via another couple's hotel. We selected the morning class (8 am pick up) and were driven to the local markets where we met the other members of the cooking class who had been picked up by other drivers. We were met by our host Sang Dae who escorted us through the markets explaining the produce as well as how the markets are organised for the locals. From there, we were driven to his family home where he gave us the religious and cultural background of how a Balinese home is built and lived in. It was a good insight for a newcomer to Bali. Then on to cooking guided by one of his brothers, an experienced chef. Everyone had a go at helping make the dishes which we later enjoyed for lunch, which happened after an educational tour of their family temple. We were momentarily interrupted by a moderate earthquake and Sang Dae took great care to ensure we got into open space. Overall, it was a very nice half-day spent with very hospitable hosts. Would recommend it highly to anyone who has not been to Bali as an educational experience.

Great experience, even for "non cooks".. This was one of the highlights of our 10 day visit to Bali. we selected it due to great reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Market visit gave a great insight to local life. After the market we were transported to the familly compound. Coffee and sweets were served whilst we were welcomed to the familly and familly life and history was explained to us. Our host spoke excellent english and answered all questions. Cooking involved everyone and all that we ate later was prepared by the group, even the rice was cooked by the group! (No electric rice cookers here!!)Techniques and reasons for ingedients were shared by the chef and there was always a little humour involved.When cooking was completed we were dressed in sarongs and we all visited the familly temple and the history was explained.We finally sat down to a meal to die for washed down with bintang that was available at extra cost.The day started at 9.00 and finished at 2.00 and the cost was $37.50 pp. This included a cookbook given at the end of the session.My wife is a chef and so found it of great interest. However I am a non cook and still had a great day. Great value and I would recommend it as a must if visiting Bali.

Wonderful. Just got back from the culinary experience. It was a really great day. It is set in a beautiful family compound, with a very gracious and calm atmosphere. Starts with a pick up at my hotel, and a fantastic early morning visit to a market in the hillside near the family compound. No other tourists (except for our group) and no people trying to sell something, just a really interesting walk through the market, highlighting the produce we would use in the lesson. On arriving we had coffee and sweet banana (deep fried with caramel sauce). They shared a lot of information about family compounds, the way the houses are structured, the small details like how offerings are made to signify particular things within the compound. I felt quite privileged to be in their space. Cooking is part demonstration and part hands on, but very clear and easy to understand. the chef talks through alternative ingredient that you can use if the ones used are not available in your home country. I was more than satisfied with the level of cooking, even though you do not do everything yourself from start to finish, and I guess the cooking skills are not different, its more about understanding how to chop and mix the spices, how to cook them in particular order etc. after the class finished, we made offerings to the family temple, and then sat and had an a la carte service of the meals plus some to finish. the meal was divine. the whole day was completely fantastic. its low key, perfectly routined and i really enjoyed the understated yet polished delivery.

Wonderful experience!. Thank you Sang Made n Dewa for such an amazing experience into the Balinese culture, way of living n most of all - the great food! I will definitely recommend this to everyone I know.

Brilliant experience, offered so much to our group.. From beginning to end, nearly 6 hours of informative presentation, great cooking demonstration, and wonderful Balinese food. We learned so much in this time, and enjoyed the beautiful garden setting of the family compound. The markets were fascinating, esp. the spice section, and Sang De and his family shared their home and their knowledge so generously. A wonderful experience for everyone in our group.

An absolutely brilliant day!. I visited Lobong Cooking School whilst on holiday in Ubud with my Mum. She was being dragged along as she isn't exactly an Asian food enthusiast like myself, but even she raved about the cultural experience we had at Lobong. The staff in particular were amazing. They spoke excellent English and were very gracious with sharing their lives and culture with us. The class is held in the families compound and the open air kitchen is a beautiful place to take a cooking class. And the food... well! Yum yum yum. From the food we cooked on the BBQ to the steamed rice cooked over the fire- it was the perfect balance of salad and meat, sweet and spicy.It was so interesting to cook with the ingredients we had just seen at the local market. We shared the class with only another group of two, so four in total. This was a stark difference to a cooking class I had taken in Chiang Mai where we shared the class with 23 other people and felt lost and confused the whole time! A must if you are in Ubud, not just for the cooking experience but to learn about the Balinese culture, religion and family ties. A really wonderful day,

excellent! cooking, culture and eating all in one, in a family home setting. A very enjoyable and valuable learning experience, over six hours. Visiting a local market, our guide explained all the ingredients we would use. Then, in the family compound, we learned technique for basic peanut sauce and Bali spice paste, and then how to use them in various dishes. Also learned how to cook rice properly. To conclude, we ate what we had cooked - a true Balinese feast! We learned about the offerings and the family shrines, the daily routine and obligation for offering, and about how the family compound was laid out - who lived where and why, and what other buildings were used for. We asked many questions and our hosts were very generous in sharing information with us about their lives and customs.Not for babies or children, or those who can't stand for long periods - you need to watch the proceedings, listen and take part to get the most out of it.Our guide spoke very good English, and his brother the chef, had cooked for 20 years in hotels - all in all, very knowledgable people and excellent value for money. It was, without doubt, the highlight of my trip.

Excellent cultural travel experience!. We just happened to sign up for this class when one of the better known restaurant classes was full. Lucky us!The other reviewers are right on track with their comments. It is not a 'how to cook' class. It is more of a cultural experience. Thus it is fun for anyone with any level of cooking ability, although a basic knowledge of cooking techniques will certainly help. There is not much pressure and since everyone receives a cookbook at the end, one is not distracted by having to take notes during the class. The family is charming, welcoming and very eager to share their way of life with visitors. The food was interesting and very tasty. One of our classmates was vegetarian and was easily accommodated. I would take this class again.Be sure to bring your camera as there are lots of photo opportunities at both the market and the family compound. This is exactly the type of tourism business that should be encouraged all over the world. Small scale, environmentally aware family business with the money generated staying in the local community. I wish them every success.

If you do only one activity/tour.... So much more than a cooking lesson! Balinese home/family life, social structures, impact of development in the past 15 years, religion - fascinating. Oh - and the food you make will be the best meal you eat in Bali.

Agree with all the other reviews with one side note. Absolutely agree with all the other reviews but do feel that I should add that if you are after a cooking class with a lot of hands on cooking experience then this may not be right for you. I really loved the whole experience however was expecting a more hands on learning experience which isn't really what this is. Don't get me wrong, you do get to share in the cooking however I would have preferred it if I made the whole dish myself from start to finish with help from the teacher. Other than that a very enjoyable day.

Fab experience and a must for any foodie!!. We opted for the morning session as we wanted to experience the morning markets, this is a really great idea as the guide really interacts with the locals and teaches you all about the spices, fruit and vegtables that you will cook with later in the day.On arrival to the compound (the Balinese name used for 'home') we were offered fresh banana fritters. We were then shown the menu of what we would be cooking and introduced to the Chef. What's great about this particular cookery lesson is that everyone gets involved in preparing the food. As a group, you then sit down to eat the nine dishes that you have all prepared. The food was simply delicious.At the end of your day you were then presented with a lovely token reminder.

Masterchef Ubud. We loved it !As some others have indicated it is more a culture lesson rather than cooking.I know some were wishing more cooking time but for us the cooking really became secondary as we could have just sat there all day (and probably the following day and the day after that) learning about life in that part of the world.I enjoyed the trip to the market (AM tour) to see the locals doing their thing but I guess for some the sight of how some of the animals are contained may be a bit disturbing.(The truth is probably not much different in our own countries and I rather see things as they are than dressed up in a way that is false.)Do take cash as they cant take card payments at the moment.Keep up the good work guys and long may guests pass through your lovely family home !

Great fun & a highlight. Not to be missed. Lobong culinary experience is an amazing experience and was an (unexpected) highlight of our trip. Lobong is extremely professionally run and the whole family team ensure the experience is unforgettable. Sang De was our host for the day and throughout provided great insights into Bali life and culture The tour starts with a tour of a local Market with an opportunity to watch daily life and better understand the full range of local produce available. Very informative and great photo ops... The tour continues to the family compound which is beautiful where further insights are provided on Balinese customs and culture. Then the cooking ! As a non cook I was slightly apprehensive of the challenge but unnecessarily so - the whole experience is fun with Dewa , the chef coordinating our efforts superbly whilst providing great practical tips. The end result was fantastic providing huge personal satisfaction as we eat one of our best meals to date!

Tasting Bali through Balinese eyes!!. If you want to taste Bali let Sung De and his family show you their way of cooking. The team open their home (compound) for you to experience and learn the way they live, celebrate and cook a balinese FEAST!!We explored a village market examining fruit and spices as we went. Every vendor called out and smiled to the rarely seen (in this market) westerns. At the compound we were warmly welcomed and taught of how the Balinese build the family homes and temples. Fed fresh banana fritters we were ready to dive in.The 'white' kitchen was huge, beautifully equipped and a pleasure in which to play Chef. Taught to slice, dice and pumile the assortment of spices we were soon covered in concentrating smiles.Giving the 'offering' for the food (and learning an insight into the Balinese traditions) completed the preparation and the taste testing began. The feast was a delight, the best food we had eaten in Bali.Leaving with our recipe books was such a pleasure as was the generosity given by this entrepreneurial Balinese family. Love.

A truely amazing expierence. Highly recommend the morning class. A wonderful cultural experience to mingle with the locals at the markets & check out all the fresh produce. The classes are small so a great hands on experience where everyone gets a chance to participate & get a great understanding of the culture & religion. The food is amazing & complete feast. You'll leave full & happy along with a recipe book with everything you've learnt to cook so you can make it at home. A must do.

A REAL PRIVILEGE - A MUST DO. This was a highlight of our trip to Bali. I won't go into too much detail about the day as previous reviews capture it so well. it was a fabulous experience, learning about all the food in the Market. It was a real privilege to be invited into Sunday's compound when Dewa gave us the expert tuition on the food we were to prepare. Great fun- all 11 of us involved in the prep and cooking .. We met lovely people from Australia, Hong Kong and the USA - who all appreciated this fabulous day. The climax was to witness the offerings suitably dressed in sarongs before we sat down to eat the food we had prepared and cooked under the guidance of Dewa. The tastes, smells and the Whole experience will be with us for a long time. YOU MUST DO THIS or you will leave Bali incomplete. Thanks for a great day - you deserve this success and we wish you all the best for your lovely families in the future. Mick & Wendy x

yummy, yummy, yum, yum! A must do in Ubud. Decided to do the evening session, which misses out on the market tour but I'm sure equally as good as the morning session looking at other photos. The food was divine and I can't wait to have a go at cooking it in my kitchen.We loved the very informative talk about Balinese culture, which then helped us on other tours and gives you an insight into a totally different way of life than we are used to. It certainly puts things into perspective. The whole Lobong family are delightful and are on a winner with this business. We wish them every success and would thoroughly recommend.We had a thoroughly enjoyable time apart from the psycho, completely selfish, total nutcase of a 22 year old Malaysian girl who we had the misfortune to be sharing with in the small group of four. The Lobong family were hugely embarrassed that she had spoilt the evening for (which it didn't really, just gave us something else to remember!). Her behaviour suddenly changed after the food appeared, which incidentally she had been longing and hurrying everyone along for because she was hungry, only to turn it away demanding cigarettes and more alcohol. I might add, the Lobong family went out of their way to accommodate her wishes by going to several places to purchase cigarettes and without even a thank you. Her mood and tirade escalated after I politely asked her to stop blowing smoke across the table in my face as I am a non-smoker and used to Australian smoking rules, particularly whilst eating! She went off like a firecracker. We had to depart the table to get away from her and jointed the Lobong family for a few laughs to finish on a high. As mentioned, we did have a wonderful learning experience. LOL, if her travelling partner (poor thing!) has any sense, he will lose her as quick as he might have found her!!!

A Great Expierence. Not only a cooking class but a cultrual expirence as well, the markets are very interesting, the family compound where you do the class is so beautiful and so interesting to share their culture with us. It was so much fun and hands on. would definetly can recommend this to everybody.

mmmmmazing Balinese cooking experience. we highly recommend the Lobong cooking class. Traditional Balinese dishes and culture are taught in great English and in a friendly demenour. Max of 12 people per class; highly interactive and intimate. The Lobong family made our stay in Ubud all the more enjoyable. Great for groups, couples and singles.

Fun, Fun, Fun. This was a day we were looking forward to and we were not disapointed.The visit of the market in the morning is good fun that should put you out of your comfort zone. Then the cooking class is fun and they provide you with tons of information on the culture as well as the recipes and techniques they use. Most importantly, the meal you cook is delicious.

Fantastic all-round balinese experience. I would highly recommend this cookery class. It's so much more than just cooking! It starts off with a tour of the local markets which gives a great insight in to how the locals go about their daily market routines. There is so much to see and learn here and the guide is excellent at explaining what all the dfferent herbs, veggies etc are.Then it's back to the Lobong family compound where they are so welcoming. We had some lovely ginger tea or bali coffee along with gorgoeus banana fritters while we were given a talk on the customs and cultures of the hindu religion and balinese culture. Then it's over to the kitchen where we donned our aprons and got down to cooking! The chef is excellent and will answer any question you have. You learn to cook lots of different things all of which you get to eat at the end! But just before we ate, our guide explained about the hindu offerings. We all put on a sarong and went in to the temple where thr talk continued and tge offering took place.I would highly recommend this cooking course. It's such a balinese experience! Well worth it!

Incredible Hospitality - Beyond Our Expectations!. We were visiting Ubud from San Francisco in July, and booked the Lobong Cooking class in advance for a Saturday. We were picked up at our hotel (The Samaya Ubud) exactly on time and taken to the market at 8am for shopping before the class. The entire experience with Dewa and his brother-in-law was simply exceptional. If we ever go back to Ubud, my wife and I would certainly do this again! There are plenty of other reviews here so I won't bother with the details - I'll simple say, FOR SURE sign up for this wonderful experience! I recommend it far above any other recreational or cooking activity in Ubud. Enjoy!!!

Great experience, fantastic food and interesting info on Bali culture. Really enjoyed this experience - going to the market and learning about the different foods, visiting the family compound and hearing about Balinese life, cooking in the garden and then eating the fantastic food - look forward to trying to reproduce it now we are home.

Excellent Cooking Class with Balinese Culture Information. The team at the Lobong Culinary Experience are truly exceptional. The day began with an 8:00 pick up at our hotel, Tegal Sari, and then a tour of the small village market near the cooking school. The market tour was valuable, as our guide, Sundae (spelled incorrectly, my apologies!) speaks very good english and was open to answering our many questions on what the different and exotic food items were, were used for, cost in the market and clarifications on comparable items we might be able to find at home. He took extra time to allow us to taste and smell many different fruits and veggies. The Balinese culture portion of the day actually began at the market and continued to the family temple at the cooking compound. This view of Balinese family life was incredibly detailed and once again, no question went unanswered. Very well done! The brother in law, Dewa (once again, I am unsure of the exact spelling) is a trained chef with years of experience, and it showed. There was lots of hands on work, chopping, cooking, stirring and finally presenting the banquet...this is no "sit back and watch the magic" kind of experience, you are intimately involved in making the meal. There is a demonstration of how coconut oil is made and the detailed demonstration in the art of cooking traditional rice is fascinating. At the end, sarongs are donned and you witness the afternoon offering at the family temple with the matriarch of the clan. It's very moving. Everyone sits down to the meal and has a chance to visit and ask any further questions. We were each given a bottle of the homemade coconut oil and a recipe book to take home and we look forward to trying out the new recipes. We would highly recommend this culinary experience and felt it was well worth the cost.

Top quality from booking to drop off back at hotel. 6 out of 5. It is good to see a home grown Balinese venture do such a good job. This has to be our best experience in Bali in a long time. Our key hosts, Sang Made and Dewa were organised, informative and helpful and achieved their goal of giving us much more than a cooking class, supported by many other family and staff at their family compound. Our group was small, but diverse with the 5 couples each coming from different countries. The menu was varied to take into account vegetarian and 'no pork' preferences in the group. The groups are intentionally kept small so that everyone gets a hands on experience a few times through the class. Morning class includes a market visit, which is informative, but Dewa has the key raw ingredients at home to show you anyway. Great experience and great value for money. Subsequently, with Sang Made's guidance, we bought a Balinese mortar and pestle (fantastic!) and rice steamer (3 parts) to bring home. My first two days back at home were spent shopping and cooking. Australian Quarantine did seize my woven Balinese rice steamer mats, (infested with borers) so we had to have rice cooker rice, but family and friends have been very impressed by what we were able to make following the class using the recipes provided. The flavours are fantastic. We could not match Dewa's plating up though! Beers are offered with meals at modest cost. Must be one of your best and most memorable meals in Bali if you go. First class.

A fabulous cooking and cultural experience. The Lobong Cooking Class is everything you could ask for in a Balinese cooking class. My wife and I did the morning class. We arrived at the Lobong family compound (which is 5-10 minutes outside of downtown Ubud) just before 8am. That's when we met Sundae who runs the class with his brother-in-law, the chef. I'm not sure about the name spelling, but he said to think of an ice cream sundae - his English is really good. Sundae led us and a few other couples that joined on a tour of the market where all of our cooking ingredients were sourced. This was an authentic Balinese market. We were the only tourists there. We learned how the real Balinese markets work.After learning about the fruit, spices, rice, and meat in the market, we went back to the Lobong family compound to start cooking. Sundae's brother-in-law is the family chef and led us through each of the courses we created step-by-step. Each of the participants in our class helped cook one of the dishes or dish components. We learned about all of the ingredients and how to time the preparation - timing in Balinese cooking is really important. Before eating, Sundae led us on a tour of the family compound's temple. We made an offering, including small portions of what we had just created, before we ate. Then we sat down to eat all the food we had cooked. It was a great reward after a long morning of cooking.This is a family operation and you can tell. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The tour of the market and the tour of the family compound made me feel like my wife and I got a very authentic Balinese experience. Oh, and the food was fabulous!

Fantastic day, great food, great people. We had a great day at the Lobong cooking compound. A wonderfull family and a great chef. Do yourself a favour and put this on your list of "To Do's" We really appreciate Balinese cooking much more and are looking forward to getting home to practice!

Culture Trip. Much more than cooking only ... It was a truly cultural trip into the Balinese life ... Worth every minute ... from visiting the foodmarket to the joint lunch prepared by our class ... Highly recommended !!

The BEST balinese experience :). The Lobong culinary experience is not just a cooking lesson but a wonderfully warm experience of Balinese culture very professionally executed byt the family in a genuine,generous manner...highly recommended and I cant wait to go again next time.

Amazing experience. Highly recommend the Lobong Cooking School. It was a great experience in both Bali/Hindu culture and great food. You start with a tour at a local market, where Song Day walks you through and introduces you to new fruits, veggies and other food and then end in their family compound where his brother, who was a chef at a local resort for 20 years, helps you prepare a delicious meal made with all fresh, local ingredients. It was an awesome experience to go to a very local market, and then into a family compound to make a delicious meal. Highly, highly recommend.Lindsay

My favourite Balinese experience. We recently spent a month in Bali and visited many many great tourist attractions. This was the BEST experience my girls (ages 6,9,12) and I had the whole month. It was a fun and educational way to be able to experience traditional Balinese culture and learn how to cook some fabulous food at the same time. Chef Dewa involved the children in the cooking according to their ability, and made sure there was plenty of fun stuff for each of us to do. We were amazed at how delicious the dishes were, but of course we had help. Thank you to Sang Made and the whole family, we were honoured to be welcomed into your home. My advice for anyone thinking of doing a cooking class - do Lobong Cooking Class, it is simply the best. Fiona

More than just a cooking class. This is not your average cooking class where you go to a restaurant and learn to cook. Lobong combines traditional cooking techniques at a traditional family compound along with some insight into day to day Balinese life.Our day started with a drive out to the family home where the classes are held, past the scenic rice terraces of outer Ubud. From here our guide took the group to a traditional Balinese produce market where we learnt about some of the more unique Balinese fruits and vegetables as well as getting to see where the food we'd be cooking came from.Back at the family home our guide told us about Balinese life and culture.
