We found out about the daily offerings, Balinese calendar, family temples, and various aspects of life right from birth.After the markets we started our cooking class led by a Balinese chef who had worked at some international hotels. We made several dishes including red bean and papaya soup, tempe manis (fried soy bean cake), grilled marinated chicken, skewered marinated pork, a salad, sweet potato rice, sambal, and a rice porridge for dessert. All cooking was done using more or less traditional equipment and techniques such as stone pestle and mortar, woven flax steamer's for the rice and an open fire for grilling.The best part came at the end of course when we got to eat everything we made, tasty food and a cold Bintang.The only thing I didn't like about the course was the fact that we shared cooking duties as opposed to everyone doing their own thing however this did make the experience more social. Other than that we found the guides and chefs to be very knowledgeable and helpful and everyone spoke good English....a great way to learn about the 'real' Bali that most visitors don't get to see.

A great experience that starts with a banana fritter!!. This is the second cooking class we'd done in Ubud & was definitely the better of the two.. from the moment we got there they encouraged us to get involved. It began with a market tour and tasting some strange looking, but tasting fruit. Then we got driven back to the family compound and had morning tea!! Coffee and banana fritters - an excellent start to any day!!During the course of the day, we had Balinese family traditions and rituals explained as well as taking part in the daily offering. We made so much food, but they had us chopping and stirring in between the many photos and questions.. It was a great day and to sit down to our magnificent feast that we had contributed to was quite rewarding!We look forward to returning for one of their dinner classes when they commence in the future!

An absolute must for any first timer in Bali. The cooking part is good but what sets Lobong cooking school apart is the learning about the culture. It starts at 8:30 am in the food market and keeps on at the school which is located in a family compound. By the time the cooking (and eating) is over (by 1:30 pm), you will have learned a lot about the life, religion and culture of Balinese people. Highly recommended... ...even if you don't like cooking!

Absolute must do for everybody who travels to Ubud. This cooking class was one of the BEST things I did on my trip. We were put together with a small group of 10 people. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to a market (not the tourist one, but the market where the locals shop) and given a great tour trying some of the food on the way. We then went into the family compound and were welcomed with tea and fried bananas. We were taught about the Balinese culture and customs by an excellent english speaking host. Then onto the cooking! It was very hands on. Everyone had a try and the food was so delicious. I can't reocmmend this highly enough. The family were so friendly and welcoming, so informative and so much fun! We even recieved a little gift bag at the end :)The morning class is recommended, as the trip to the market isn't included in the afternoon session.http://lobongcooking.com/

A memorable experience. My husband and I attended this programme with our daughter on 15 August 2011. We learnt more about Balinese culture and traditons in one day than we would have in a whole week on our own. The programme was very compact and they made us feel very much at home. Also it is a rare chance to interact with people from different parts of the globe at a homely surrounding. We suggest this programme to anyone visiting Ubud.

Unbelievable experience. One of the best days we have ever had in Bali.Sang Made speaks excellent English and we learnt so much about the Balinese people and their way of life.The cooking class was a culinary experience and we felt part of Made's family as they took us through the steps that culminated in a five star meal that we cooked ourselves!!I highly recommend this to everyone that loves food, loves cooking and loves the Balinese culture and it's people.Carl and Barbara - Adelaide Australia

a great cooking and cultural experience. The day started with a trip to the local market before returning to the family compound where we cooked 9 delicious meals and experienced balinese culture. A fun and informative day. Would highly recommend this cooking class.

Sensational, eye-opening and truly an amazing experience!. Where to start. My girlfriend gave this to me as a birthday present during our trip through Indonesia and we loved it. The guide speaks the best English we heared in three weeks Indonesia and the contents of the cooking course are sublime; really nice to see Bali's true culture when it comes to its cousine.First, we set off to a local market no normal tourists would ever visit. Face the numerous stalls that sell their herbs, spices, clothes and animals. You will see Bali's true local people here. Find the freshly harvested food here that you will normally buy at your local supermarket. Always wanted to find out where it came from and how it made its way to the shelf? Here is your answer.After the guide on the market we arrived at a compound of a pretty rich Balinese family, I guess. Explanations about food, culture and habits are easily to follow because of, again, the good English of the guide. For the Dutch readers, this person cooperated with the Dutch tv-serie op zoek naar geluk from the Tros and worked together with Danny the Munk and other Dutch celebs (as so to say).Anyway, after some introductory talk we started preparing the food. We made our own peanut sauce, sambal ulek, tempe manis, marinade for the chicken and many other dishes. Everything is prepared with coconut oil (of which you will get a bottle of 100 ml after the course, sealed and good for hand luggage) and they even show you how they get the coconut oil from the...coconut.After about three hours we were finished with preparing the food and before we could devour the tasty dishes the food is bleshed traditionally, like the Balinese do.If you are in Ubud then this is a must-do. It not only grants access to the Balinese kitchen and its delicious herbs and all but also makes you appreciate the food and especially the animals. Bali locals bless their food and thus also the animals they eat. It actually reminded me of the Avatar movie where they too, praise their animal for its meat.A given many a Western country has already long forgotten.

Wonderful Experience. We booked with Lobong after reading about it on TA, and we were happy we followed the advice of everyone here. It was a very well organized and structured day without feeling scripted. The market tour was very interesting, the explanation of the traditional compound was the best we heard, and the cooking portion was fun and well run. They packed a lot of information and many activities into a morning without us feeling rushed. We would definitely recommend this experience to others!

So much more than a cooking class - an insight into Balinese lifestyle and culture.. After looking through trip advisor and seeing the excellent feedback Lobong had recieved I had high expectations for the class - which were definately met. My two girlfriends and I were picked up from our hotel, taken to the local markets and welcomed into the family compound where we could candidly ask questions about life in Bali. The cooking itself was fantastic and definately some of the best food I ate in my two weeks in Bali - I can't wait to try out some of the dishes at home! Overall just a great day with wonderful people!

The best day of my Bali holiday. Dewa , one of the drivers from the Lobong family picked me up from my hotel right on time on Friday morning. We headed towards the market and picked up Sang Made along the way. I had a good time with these guys, they told me a lot about Balinese amusements and about the cooking class we were gonna have.We arrived at the market, which was highly amusing itself, and Sanga Made took us (with other class participants) around the stalls and related everything he knew about the market to us. So much interesting stuff i learned that morning!After the market tour we went to the compound where we were welcomed by snacks. While we were sipping on our tea/coffee Sang Made once again shared his vast knowledge of Balinese culture with us and gave us a full illustration of the layout of his compound.Dewa, the master chef, welcomed us to the kitchen, introduced our menu and began our exquisite journey to a scrumptious meal. It was a very informative and detailed cooking lesson, fortunately, Dewa gave us a recipe book in the end so that we can remember everything we did. We also had a bottle of homemade coconut oil to take home :)This was not only a cooking class, it was also an interesting session of Balinese culture education. Sang Made was eager to answer all the questions we had related to Bali. Our chef was also well prepared and good in his expertise. And the driver was very cool and patient.. This is something I would definitely do again when i come to Bali.My palate and my mind were generously stimulated!Anyone who wants a hands-on experience and entertainment while in Bali should definitely go for this class!

fantastic experience. if there is one thing u should do and u love cooking this is it. So informative. the market was fun! And the food we cooked was awsome. Learnt so much about Balinese life, rituals and cooking

Just do it! Wonderful. After reading all the TA reviews.....could this day be so perfect? Yes it is...Sang Made picked us (3 girlfriends) right on time from our villa...and our adventure started straight away! SM spent 8 years at the CHEDI hotel ...great training ground, excellent English so many of our questions on Bali life were immediately answered. This is an educational day out...not just about cooking but about how Balinese families life. Food was delicious....great balanced menu, by far the best course I have done in Bali. Market visit was near the compound so much more interesting that Ubud's market. No wonder this has such a high rating....could not fault it....just do it! You will be very pleased, I'm sure ....thanks Sang Made all your team for such a memorable experience.

Fabulous cooking 'experience'. We recently completed a month-long tour of Indonesia and this cooking experience was one of the top memories of the trip. The organization of the class was fantastic, with the market tour (for the AM group), trip to the family's compound, and hours cooking & eating some wonderful Balinese cuisine. The food was wonderful, too--one of the best meals we had the entire trip, despite our significant efforts to top it. Thanks to TripAdvisor for helping us find this. Given it's newness, we easily could have missed it as it's too new for the guidebooks we were referencing. If you're in or near Ubud, definitely consider adding this to your itinerary.

FANTASTIC. Highly recommend this cooking class. We had a fantastic time. Everyone was so friendly from Dewa who picked us up, Sang Made whose English was fantastic to the chef also called Dewa (i think). We went on the morning class which was great to see the markets and then we went back to the family compound. We found it really interesting to listen to Sang talk about their culture and family and it was great to take part in the Blessing before we ate the food. The outdoor kitchen was great, very hands on and very enjoyable. and the food .... our best meal in Bali. I actually made the chicken, pork and vegetables this past weekend at home and surpisingly it turned out nearly as well as at the cooking class. What we loved about this was not only was it a fantastic cooking class and introduction into Balinese culture but you were made to feel so welcome and part of the family. Get in early though as Sang said that they were fully booked out in December.

way more than I expected; excellent for novice & advanced cooks. Where can I start? First, cooking lessons are something I like to do in most countries I visit. This is by far the best setup I have been to. This is also an excellent buy for your money. My friends and I were picked up in a comfortable, fairly new SUV. Our driver was very friendly and told us about various areas we passed by. We were let off at the market in Ubud and our guide there was very knowledgeable and a great teacher as well (and easy on the eyes). He was extremely charismatic and made us all very comfortable and welcome right away. He purchased items for us to sample and helped us when we wanted to buy fruits to take back. Once we arrived at the family facility we were completely blown away at the beauty of the layout! We started off with a snack and coffee that was prepared for us. The hospitality was just phenomenal. I am a very experienced cook. I was very pleased with the dishes we were taught to make. It didn't seem as though it would be too overwhelming for someone who is not so experienced, so I feel this is the perfect balance for all levels. The chef, who is the patriarch of the family, has worked in some wonderful restaurants around the world. He is very knowledgeable and explained everything we were doing so you knew why that step was important.We learned so much about the overall culture of the Balinese during our time there. That was such an added perk. It was very interesting and helped us to understand many things we saw during the duration of our trip. When the eating was done, all I wanted to do was figure out how I could spend a month living on their property and learning how to cook more food! They gave us a lovely going away present that absolutely made my trip! I won't say what it was so as not to spoil it, but they probably thought I was crazy the way I was gushing over it lol. All in all, this was an experience that I will always remember, and I truly mean that. I think if I ever go to Bali again I will do this all over just to go back to their home and learn a new dish. I cannot recommend this any higher....it is the best, I'm sure of it. If you choose them, you will not be disappointed. You can't even begin to imagine the experience you will have with them! Thank you, Lobong!!

What a fantastic experience - lovely family, great food. Thankyou to Lobong culinary experience for giving me the opportunity to learn more about Bali other than just the cooking!! Sang went above and beyond to make this cooking class one to remember. His perfect English added to my ability to absorb all the information he gave us about the Balinese culture, rice paddies, local market (no other westerners!) and his family.The food was fantastic too.What a wonderful family business - thankyou all so much for being willing to let me enjoy your family compound, culture and warm welcome.

Amazing cooking/cultural experience!. This is the first review I’ve ever written...on anything. I was so impressed with the experience that I feel compelled to share. The setting is a beautiful family compound, and is a family run business. This is more than just a cooking class. It really gives you insight into the way of life of Balinese people...outside of catering to tourists. The food is amazing, and nutritious! You actually have active participation in the cooking and preparation of the meal. And they even send you away with a goody bag. This is a definite must when in Bali!

A Fantastic cultural & culinary experience !!!!!!!. During our few days stay in Ubud my partner & I decided we would like to do a cooking course and decided Lobong was the compny to go with. A wise decision. We had a fantastic time for the whole 7 hours. From the early morning market visit, to see the produce we would be using over the next few hours, to eating the meal we prepared. Not only is it a culinary experience but a great insight into the traditional local village Balinese way of life. Avery rewarding way to spend your time.

Best activity in Bali. This cooking class is informative, fun and the food delicious! The family is so generous in the way they share their lives and the market trip is fascinating.I would strongly recommend Lobong to anyone going to Bali.
Best thing we did in Bali. You must go to this. Amazing day with friendly people showing not only incredible food but their way of life.Great day. 100% must go to this!

Felt like part of the family. Yes..this is what Bali is all about. I truly felt like I was part of the family. From the warm welcome into their family compound to the wonderful cooking class. Sang Made is an exceptional host - he shared his home and knowledge of Balinese culture - I cannot recommend this experience highly enough!! A must for all visitors to Bali - my only disappointment was that my family was not there to share this experience with me.

A taste of Bali. We attended the evening cooking class with Sang Made. They arranged for free pick-up from our hotel to Made's house for the class.Guests are welcomed with a cup of Balinese coffee and then showed around the house. Then, the cooking lesson started by showing us how coconut milk is made. We were then shown the menu and the ingredients used (including explaining any alternatives we can use back home).We cooked about 5 dishes plus rice. The only setback of this cooking class is the lack of hands-on cooking. There is only two woks and we take turns to do the cooking. (In our previous cooking class experience in a Bangkok, each student has his/her own stove and wok).The menu does not change much as the cooking concentrates on Balinese food, which does not have much variety. After cooking, we were introduced the traditional Balinese prayers led by Sang Made's mum at their family temple (yes, each Balinese house has a temple within their compound).After the prayers, we eat!

Your reviews were so true; one of our best experiences in Bali.. Was intrigued with all your excellent reviews for this cooking class. I rang once in Bali, and spoke to the very charming Sunday, who is the son who organises this cooking class at his family home. Sunday speaks impeccable english; he organised for driver to pick us up in Seminyak, drive to Ubud to see the produce market and then take us to his family home, to prepare and then eat a lovely lunch that we all had a hand in preparing. Even my grand-daughters, aged 5, 7 & 9 years were cutting, tossing, pounding herbs and were intrigued to see the making of offerings by Sundays' mother, and prior to eating we wnt to the family temple to place these offerings to the Gods.The combination of cooking, learning Balinese customs & understanding local produce made it a wonderful day. Lunch was superb. The cost of this day was very reasonable, considering the quality of information & experiences.
Awesome experience!. We had a great day doing this cooking class. All staff were So friendly and more than accommodating . Great cultural and culinary experience. Would highly recommend !

Best tour we have ever done. From the moment we were picked up and taken to the markets to the moment we left after a scrumptious meal, we were treated liked favored family. As others have said, this is not just a cooking class, but a comprehensive introduction to Balinese culture and family life. To top things off, we were invited back to a ceremony at the local temple the next night and were again treated like welcome family by Sang Made. Cannot recommend highly enough!!!

A must do Ubud experience. This was a highlight of our recent holiday in Ubud. What set it apart was the combining of the food/cooking experience with understanding of the culture. The cooking included visiting a market so we could see the range of foods and how local people shop and then seeing the varus food being grown in the family compound: a paddy to plate experience. The cooking class was very hands on and Dewar is a great teacher. He respected the varying levels in the group and adapted the class to take account of everyone's taste buds. Sang Made was a welcoming and informative host who made us feel at home. Nothing was too much trouble and he filled in many of the gaps we had about Balinese life and culture. All five of our group highly recommend this class even if you are not that interested in cooking because its such an opportunity to join a local Balinese family for the day and eat great Balinese food that you've prepared. For foodies like us it was a great way to cook some authentic Balinese dishes.

Ceade mile failte!. We were welcomed into this families home with a hundred thousand welcomes!This is more than just a cooking class! The family give you a complete cultural and educational lesson on all things sacred to the Balinese. We thoroughly enjoyed the passion with which this was communicated, in perfect English. Absolutely fantastic.Initially we had reservations doing the course, as we had done a cooking course in Chiang Mai Thailand at a much cheaper price (and Thai food favours our palate more). However, we thoroughly enjoyed our evening - in fact we had an awesome time!!! Highly recommended!!! Lobong cutely mixes up the main host and the chef, which keeps the interaction fresh. The host principally teaches you about the Bali culture (a former Bali tour guide) while the chef teaches you cooking skill sets (a former hotel chef who also worked in Perth). The food was fantastic - the peanut sauce, marinated chicken and pork skewers were standouts! The desert was slightly disappointing - I have tasted better black rice pudding in Bali.The only advice I would give Lobong is that we were asked if we would like a Bintang with our dinner. Everyone in the group assumed it was complimentary, as it seemed to be in the nature of the offer. It wasn't. We were all given large Bintangs, which most of the females didn't finish. It's a small matter which can be easily rectified with better communication. I would have been embarrassed if I had only the correct money with me for the course. Rectify this guys, give a small Bintang complimentary. The class is priced sufficiently.Overall, keep up the enthusiasm, keep educating us simple souls, and enjoy the rewards. Your tour has been the highlight of our trip to Bali so far (even better than the many massages, and that says it all).

A cultural and culinary delight!. This is one of the newest cooking schools in Bali and as a result, staff are very eager to please and make your experience as enjoyable as possible. I was incredibly impressed from start to finish. An educational trip to one of the village markets is followed by a trip to the family compound where the cooking takes place in the open air. Our menu consisted of a mix of 9 authentic local dishes with the most sumptuous of spices and flavours all chopped and ground by your own fair hands. It all ends with a banquet lunch or dinner (you can do an 8am or 3pm start) laid out in style in the family compound. They don't Market the fact that a % of profits goes back into the local community making this something of a social enterprise! Lobong deserves all the great reviews and is bound to go from strength to strength. Treat yourself. You won't regret it

An exceptional and wonderful experience!!!. We were welcomed at the family compound as it was our own home. The family host told us everything about living in the family compound and the Balinese way of living.Aftter this warm welcome we started cooking and the chef explained all the ingredients and techniques to use. We did a lot of chopping and frying and had a lot of fun. We now know more about the reason why Indonesian food is so good! Before dinner we also learned more about offering, a great experience as well. The dinner was delicious. Before saying goodbye we received the recipe book and a bottle of coconut oil made by the familiy. The cooking class in the familiy compound was more than only cooking for us. It was a very special and fantastic experience!

Simply a must if you're travelling to Bali!. As the title suggests..my friends and I had an absolutely fantastic time. We were fortunate enough to be the only ones in the class and thoroughly enjoyed the hands on cooking experience in Balinese cuisine! Sang Made was the friendliest most informative host, teaching us about not only the diiferent ingredients we were using but also about the Balinese culture. He also allowed us to buy and bring back some durian in the car (for those that don't know what it is..it is a spiky fruit that smells a tad pungent to some but tastes heavenly!) Chef Dewa was a very patient and friendly teacher, especially with my slow cutting skills! The dishes we made were delicious and easy enough to recreate in the home. We were also given a goody bag with coconut oil freshly made by Sang Made's mum and a booklet containing the recipes. The whole experience was brilliant and I recommend everyone to give it a go. You'll feel like a masterchef by the end of it!!

A fantastic culinary and cultural experience!. We chose this cooking class because it was locally based and involved visiting a Balinese family compound. We (five) were picked up early by our charming host and first visited a local produce market to learn about the ingredients we would be using. We were then welcomed at the family compound with a drink and a snack before meeting the chef. He then supported us as we cooked nine different courses of authentic Balinese food! It was very 'hands on' and we chopped, ground, stirred and fried all of the dishes. This was fantastic as we learnt the techniques not just the recipes which gave us confidence that we can reproduce them at home. We finally sat down and enjoyed the fabulous lunch we had produced - after participating in the family's blessings and thanks for the food. Seriously the best peanut sauce and tomato sambal ever!While the food and cooking experience was great, what really made this a memorable day was the extensive understanding we gained about Balinese cultural life from our generous host as we were shown around the compound, family temples and gardens. We did this class early in our 10 day holiday in Ubud and it meant we had a better understanding and appreciation of the culture and people for the rest of our stay. A very rich cultural and culinary experience - do it!

Best cooking class in Ubud!. We have attended the Lobong Cooking Class on June 10th 2011. We took the morning class - starting at 08:00 - and went to the local market where we got introduced to a variety of fruits and vegetables. I thought that I'd seen all, but as it turned out, Bali has many culinary secrets that lie hidden in the local market! After the visit to the local market we went to the family compound. I was afraid that it would be another day of endless cultural introductions to temples and Balinese customs, but to my pleasant surprise, we were all expected to take part in the cooking class and stir, cut and bake the ingredients ourselves! The menu was finger lickin' good, and the explanations of our cheff could not have been better. It took us 3 hours to complete the menus. Then, we sat down to enjoy our lunches. Since Lobong only works with small groups, there is a lot of individual attention. Oh, and BTW: they pick you up from the hotel and drop you off after the work's done! I really recommend this experience!

Highlight of Ubud. The Lobong cooking class has been the highlight of our time in Ubud. We feel so privileged to be allowed to integrate into a Balinese community for a few hours, to learn something of the culture PLUS learn to cook this delicious food in such a fabulous setting. From the moment we were picked up at our accommodation til we were dropped off hours later, full and happy; we felt welcomed and comfortable. Loved everything about this experience,and don't need a 64 GB memory to be able to reproduce some of our favorites when we get back home.

Fantastic day- so glad we did this!. Travelling to Ubud with family to celebrate my 50th birthday, one of my gifts was a cooking class of my choosing. After careful consideration, I opted for the Lobong culinary experience, and the five of us who went all agree it was an awesome choice. We were collected on time from our accommodation by Sang Made, our host, who was a fount of information about Balinese customs and culture and cheerfully answered all our questions as we drove from one side of Ubud to the other to get to the wet market where we would be seeing all the foods we would be cooking with later in the day. Sang Made was a most solicitous host and quick to assist as I had injured my foot before arriving in Ubud and was having some trouble with steps. He also helped us to purchase fruit to take back to our accommodation later. Back in the car, we quickly drove to the Lobong family compound where we left the bustle and noise of the main street behind for a quiet, peaceful family home.Here Sang Made explained how Balinese families plan their living spaces and share with the extended family as we enjoyed a moring coffee and snack in a ceremonial pavilion. Then he passed us into the capable hands of Chef Dewa to start preparing our luncheon feast. One of the things we liked best was that, as we were a small group, we all got to have hands on experience preparing each dish rather than standing about watching one or two people cook. Sang Made later explained that his family's plan is to always keep group sizes small, to provide just such and experience. We learned how to make a base paste which was then used to flavour our other dishes, which were all surprisingly different. There included two kinds of satay (which we had made the peanut sauce for from scratch), a salad, a special rice, a Balinese chicken "curry" and a tomato sambal. The only dish we did not make ourselves was a black rice pudding for dessert. All the ingredients used were fresh and healthy with no commercial products used and as Chef Dewa has worked in Australia he is very knowledgeable about ingredients which can be substituted if the original is not available.Our lunch feast was served in the ceremonial pavilion after Sang Made's mother kindly showed us the Balinese custom of making an offering to the family gods of the food one is about to eat, and Sang Made explained the significance of the offering and the family shrines.After we were full to bursting with a delicious lunch, we were surprised and delighted to see Sang Made, Chef Dewi and other family members appear singing "Happy Birthday", complete with a gorgeous cake! On our departure we were each presented with a going away gift of the family's home-produced coconut oil and a recipe book containing the recipes of all the foods we had cooked.On the way back to our accommodation, again Sang Made was happy to answer questions and point out places and sights of interest and it was a most pelasant trip. The whole experience was a fantastic way to spend some time in Ubud and I would thoroughly recommend it most heartily to anyone who wishes to enjoy good food, good friends and sterling hospitality.

What a wonderful cultural experience it was!. Attended a cookery class at Sang Made and chef Dewa's family compound yesterday and had a truly lovely experience. Made speaks perfect English and he doesn't get tired of telling you all about Bali, Balinese culture and religious and spiritual beliefs. If you think this is just an ordinary cookery class you are soooo wrong! We've been in Ubud for 5 days and I've learnt much more about Balinese culture from Made in a few hours than in the last 5 days!! Dewa is a great chef, he showed us everything carefully and explained in detail the technique, told us all the alternative ingredients in case we couldn't find them at home and kept asking if we've had any questions.. He's a very passionate and genuine cook:) Made's mum made offerings and we were given sarongs to go to their family temple in the compound where we cooked the meals in the "clean kitchen". we were treated so well and got sit down and were served the food we had cooked. It was Enak(delicious)!! All in all this has been a truly Wonderful experience both culinary and culturally, the class of 6 people also meant that we all had the chance to participate in the prep and cooking of all the dishes..I couldn't recommend it enough!

Memories forever.. Cannot recommend this experience highly enough. Sang Made and Dewa Jana with their family have given my wife and I, a memory to remember for ever. Sang Made is the perfect host, with his knowledge and expertise he took us for a journey through local markets and sites in the Ubud area that were beautiful. He then introduced us into his family compound, were we met Dewa Jana and his Mum along with other family members. We were made so welcome. It was a great experience to learn Bali style cooking from these lovely people. If you want to do a Bali cooking class As I said at the start, I cannot recommend the Lobong cooking class highly enough.

Outstanding Cultural Experience. One of my favorite experiences during my week stay in Ubud. Sang and his family welcomed us into their home, walked us through the local market and shared their cultural, religious and family lives.

Lobong cooking class. The Lobong cooking class is a must do in Bali, my husband and I love to cook and we wanted a real Balinese experience. This cooking class did not disappoint. From the moment we were picked up from our accommodation Sang Made (our host) was so friendly and informative, we made a stop at the markets where Sang explained the history of the local markets, and the unusual vegetables, fruits and spices native to Bali.. We were then taken to Sang's home, where we were welcomed with coffee and beautiful banana fritters. Dwar the Chef (Sang's brother-in-law) was instantly welcoming and explained what we would be cooking and how the morning would progress. The compound was extremely professional, great facilities with an authentic twist. We chopped, fried, diced and made 8 unbelievable courses. Cool home made juice and bottled water were supplied as we cooked, there was absolutely nothing forgotten.We were shown how the family prepare traditional offerings, and then witnessed Sang's Mother give the offering to bless the food we had just cooked. We then sat like "Kings" in a lovely outdoor area, the food is incredible ( and we cooked it, with help of course ), Dwar explained what we could use in Australia if we couldn't get the exact ingredients , which willbe really helpful when we return home. Sang had prepared a small bottle of home made coconut oil and a great recipe booklet for us to take home. The whole experience was extremely reasonably priced and the highlight of our trip.One thing I would like to suggest to anyone who is thinking booking for this class .....Do Not have a big breakfast.....!..... Thanks to Sang, Dwar and their family for making the day special.....

Best experience in Ubud!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and wanted to experience first hand some local cooking and traditions! Sang Made, his family and the Master Chef at the Lobong cooking class made this experience the highlight of our trip to Ubud.Sang Made picked us up on time from our hotel and the first stop - visit to the local market - was informative and interesting! Upon arriving to his home and family compound we marvelled at this amazing sanctuary. So peaceful and beautiful. The cooking class itself exceeded our expectations. However the atmosphere and Sang Made's staff and family made it all the more special. The food was absoloutely delicious (we could not believe we had cooked all the dishes 'ourselves')... and what we ate was better than any other meal we had in Ubud during our entire stay.The recipes we cooked meant we learnt some basics to Balinese cooking and it was interesting to learn the customs, traditions and beliefs also. This whole experience was wonderful and also extremely reasonably priced.... I would recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Bali looking for a unique and delicious culinary experience and I wish Sang Made and his family all the very best. (I would even do this class again if I ever returned to Bali and will certainly be telling all my friends!)

Top notch! One of the best activities I have EVER done overseas!. This cooking class is truly amazing... I believe the groups are limited to 5 so the experience is very personal. The hosts teach you so many great things about Balinese culture and the food we learnt to cook was the best food we had during our 11 days in Bali, by far. Thanks Sang Made! - We wish you and your family the very best! : )

Experience authentic Balinese culture and cuisine. Hosts, Sang Made and chef Dewa provided us with an outstanding opportunity to personally create a beautiful Balinese meal of 6 dishes, entirely composed of fresh local ingredients. The experience was intensified by being conducted in Sang Made's family compound, ouside of Ubud. Sang Made provided full explanation of the compound structure and the daily traditions that have helped the Balinese culture remain so successfull. After helping at each stage of the cooking we were served the meal as guests to enjoy. A thoroughly enjoyable and satisfying experience that would be recommended to anyone wishing to discover the culture and cuisine of Bali.

A wonderful introduction to Balinese cuisine and tradition!. Sang Made, Dewa Jana and their family are very gracious hosts. This was a wonderful experience and we felt it was an honour to be invited into their family home. Not only did we learn about Balinese cuisine and had the chance to prepare dishes under the guidance of Chef Dewa, we learnt about Balinese traditions, culture and the importance of their religion. After the cooking was done, we enjoyed the food and the chance to sit, relax and talk to our hosts about our different countries and ways of life. We left with good wishes, an invitation to contact them if we wanted any further advice and a recipe book.This is a complete experience, from being collected at our villa, to going to the markets to buy some ingredients, to the preparation, cooking and eating of some lovely dishes. Well recommended.

a highlight of our time in Bali. this was truly an unexpected highlight of out trip to bali. Sang Made picked us up from our villa, took us to the local markets to learn about and select the produce and then we were taken to his family compaound to learn about balinese life and balinese food cooked in a very authentic environment. we particularly liked the fact that the course took place in a traditional balinese compound, and that we got to learn about not just the food but also the cultural and religious aspects of balinese family life.the course lasted from 9am till 1pm.

The highlight of my vacation!. Sang Made and his family were the highlight of my Bali vacation! The cooking class was more than I could have hoped for. The atmosphere was beautiful and welcoming. The food was better than any restaurant in Ubud. The recipes were easy to follow but complexed in flavor. The price was extremely reasonable.... The whole experience was perfect! I would recommend this cooking class to any level of cook.

Delicious, great class, and beautiful place.... ... Host Sang Made, Chef Dewa, and the rest of their Cooking Team put out quite the spread in a gorgeous family compound. Fantastic learning experience with easy to follow recipes, tips, awesome Satay, vegetable salad, and Pisang Goreng (banana fritters). Basically everything was delicious!The added bonus is learning how the real Balinese Family Compounds functions, explanation of Deities, Shrines, the coolest "rice storing barns" (in my opinion, easily converted to great hotel rooms!), and even learning how to make doilies out of banana leaves, not to mention a bowl and ladle/spoon to serve your dessert in. Very cool!The plus of the setting is that you are not stuck in a hotel kitchen or a restaurant. The home feeling is great and conducive to making you want to duplicate the experience at home for your friends. Easy, delicious, and you'll give them a real taste of Balinese Cuisine.HIGHLY recommended! One of the best experiences in Ubud.

Fabulous traditional painting workshop... just what I wanted!. I received a lovely warm welcome when I visited Five Art Studio and met with Wayan, his beautiful wife and pretty little daughter. I went to learn Keliki painting, the traditional style of this village. Thanks to Wayan's wonderful teaching skills and his patience I produced a beautiful souvenir of my trip to Bali. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would highly recommend it to anyone interested in art.

Awsome Batik Class in Bali Ubud. Wonderful memory! Feel like an artist! The Five Art Studio provides all batik equipments, guidance and delicious snacks. Great to spend a day doing creative batik art piece in traditional Balinese complex with relaxing atmosphere and pleasant music. Bring back my own unique batik scarf home with proud and joy.

Batik Instruction - Amazing day. The experience of taking a batik class with someone who is as knowledgeable and patient as Wayan can only provide great results. He is friendly, hospitable and a great teacher. I learnt so much whilst creating my piece, I am looking forward to practising some more once I return home. The experience was therapeutic and relaxing. I now have my own batik fabric which will provide me with memories of a really happy experience for a lifetime.

Whole family loved it. We went with my wife and daughters aged 7 and 5. We did the painted wooden egg class. Wayan was fantastic with us and very patient with our daughters. He teaches act classes to the local school children so is amazing with them. The classes are held in his family home just outside of Ubud. We all came away with an beautiful souvenir that we had made ourselves.Could not recommend enough. Thank you Wayan

Such a good time!. I love painting and have been looking forward to taking a course to expand my knowledge on new techniques! Wayan was such a patient teacher who is very enthusiastic about art! He was flexible with his class times and had all the materials ready to go! If you are in Ubud and are looking for an art class, this would be a great place to look!

T-shirt painting. A beautiful and pleasant drive,about 15 minutes from Ubud. I went with my 12 year old granddaughter to do t-shirt painting. What a wonderful experience, she had a one on one lesson. So much patience, knowledge, creativity and most of all so much fun. The end product was gorgeous and such a perfect souvenir for her to bring home. Next time I will definitely be booking myself in for an art class.

Amazing experience . Me and my wife came here on our honeymoon and was greeted by the warmest people. We were guided to making our art pieces which we still are in awe in the fact we made that. It was truly a pleasure, and highly recommend this studio.

Kind, Patient and Warm. I was looking for some help with improving my painting skills and I contacted Wayan and he was very accommodating. I wasn't initially interested in Keliki lessons, but when I saw his work, I was blown away. Unfortunately I had only one day to spend but if I had more time, that would definitely have been worked in to my itinerary. Keliki paintings can be quite beautiful - what could be better than taking home something you made yourself? As an instructor, Wayan is kind, patient and encouraging. He steps in to help un-intrusively when needed, still giving you all the space you need to learn. The lessons are at his home, and it was nice to spend time in a traditional Balinese house. His wife was warm and his little daughter is delightful. It was a well-utilized morning and is the highlight of my trip to Ubud.

Wood carving class. We had a great time learning to wood carve . Everyone was nice and attentive. It is definitely harder than I thought it would be. Great way to spend a few hours of the day. They also have many other art classes including batik and silversmith

Awesome Experience!. This art class was a great find. Not only was it a great experience learning to paint a traditional Keliki painting and trying my hand at batik, it was also great to find something not so commercial and crowded. What's even better is that the class is in a traditional village surrounded by paddy fields outside central ubud. A big thanks to Wayan, his wife and adorable daughter Jia for making this such a memorable experience.

Learn the ways of woodcarving!. WOW. We learned so much about this incredible Balinese craft in such a welcoming and patient environment! Not only was the atmosphere friendly and hospitable (we were fed tofu snacks!), but we now feel so appreciative of what it takes to create the outstanding woodwork that you see surrounding the villages of Bali. This is an experience not to be missed! Big thanks to Wayan and his beautiful family! :)
Wonderful day of woodcarving. . We had a great day of wood carving! Great program, lots of instruction and a fabulous product to take home. We'll be back for the batik!

Woodcarving Class. Was sooo worth it doing this Art Class in Five Art Gallery. The studio itself is easy to find (available in google map) bli Wayan and his wife (and the little girl Putu) greeted us warmly though we were late. He's very talented, kind and fun to be with. He is fast respond on Whatsapp and easy to communicate, I booked this class in advance. You might want to do that as well to make sure the seat are available.You can choose available design or any of your own design. We are making our own design and he taught us patiently from scratch, the wood material was not too hard to be crafted makes the carving process easier. It was a therapeutic experience doing this Art Class, I think I might try to enroll another art class if I am back to Bali.Thank you Bli Wayan! :)

A rich cultural experience... Get creative!. I arranged a batik workshop in the morning and was picked up at my hotel in Ubud that afternoon. It was a lovely ride to the artists art studio/home. J Wayan Suardana was a great teacher - very friendly, helpful, personable and patient. He is also a very talented artist. While waiting for the paint to set, I asked to see the family's pigs which was fun. It was a great experience to learn batik and I'm sure any workshop here would be well done. Thanks for a great day!
Batik workshop. I really enjoyed my batik workshop! Very nice and good teacher, Who could tell me and learn me a lot. I had a really good First Time experience with the Balinese Art. Thank you!

Ended up here based on trip advisor . So we were looking for places to scope some local art and we ended up here on a tour we made. The artist is extremely chill and has amazing art work!! We didn't take any classes but we were so welcomed we sat and talked for about an hour! His work is rather expensive but totally worth it as it is so detailed !!!!! We left with 2 pieces and probably would have kicked ourselves if we didn't buy them! He is an amazing artist and a very easy to talk to and just hang out with! Please buy from local artist ! You are supporting their craft and lively hood!! Hopefully we'll be back to take a class! But seeing and being there was definitely enough!

Learning. I was recomended this place by my cousin who lives in Bali. I did not know what to expect since it was all new to me so i picked few classes and headed down the studio which turned out to be the teacher's house. Wife mom and kid greet u with smiles into their court yard where u are received by Wayan the teacher who is eager to learn about u and ur country. He is very detailed in his teachings. I took Batik and egg painting with him and wood carving with his friend whom his english is not good but (knows almost every single heavy metal song by heart ) Wayan is there to translate. If it is something ud like to experience then it is the place for u. I also found out that he offers his home for free for the children of the village to come and learn english from expat that are willing to teach.U are offered tea or coffee and if ur ok with motorcycles then ul get a free ride to and from ur hotel

Awesome experience with wayan and his family. Signed up for this class cause this is my third time to Bali and I wanted to do something different. Intended to do keliki painting but when we found out there was batik painting - my sister and I asked wayan if we could work together on a huge piece (1.5 vs 1.5m vs the regular 0.3x 0.6 frame per pax). We proceeded to spend 7 hours with him learning how to make our very own unique batik that we intend to turn into a shirt for our dad or frame up at home! While waiting for the paint to dry, it was also great talking to wayan about his experiences. Definitely recommend a trip down if you have a day / afternoon to while immerse yourself in traditional Balinese art making. Thanks again wayan!

Beautiful experience . Booked into this with my dad and it exceeded expectations. Very humble family home studio and home out the back of a wood carving shop and spent 3+ hours carving with a local expert carver. Really peaceful family environment and lots of good conversation while carving a beautiful lotus in the wood. Would recommend and go back for sure!

Keliki Painting and Wood Carving Class. We truly enjoyed our art classes at the studio. Both instructors were very patient and did a good job of instructing and ensuring that the art pieces were a reflection of our efforts. I highly recommend this class - gave me a whole new appreciation for the keliki paintings we saw in the galleries and markets.

Fun and fruitful classes. We have fun time at Five Art Studio. There are many classes to choose from. Some are suitable for young kids. Wayan has a beautiful mission to the community by providing studio and lessons to the young Balinese to spend their time after school. He is concerned that more and more young Balinese are losing their artistic abilities to social media / electronic. Him and his assistances are knowledgable and pleasant teachers.

Great experience in Bali. My friend and I decided to find a place to take a class in batik, and we're lucky enough to find a brochure from Five Art Studio. They transported us to their location and gave us quality time and attention in teaching us the ancient art of creating batik art on fabric. They were so friendly and supportive, and did not ever make us feel like we should be rushed even though we were taking a while to get our initial designs created to batik with. They gave us great direction on what to do and what to watch out for, and my friend and I were both very pleased with our results, but even more so with the experience.

Lovely and relaxing drawing session at Wayan's. 5 out of 5 points! I had an amazing time working on my own project. Wayan spent somuch time with me. He brings along a lot of passion and patience ;) It was so interesting to learn about the Keliki drawing style and ink. And I am so happy about getting the option for a passepartout and frame for my finished art work. What a great memory to take home. Plus point is the pick-up, drop-off, snack and water. Thanks for the great day!

Painting lesson. Wayan provided a three hour class that produced a wonderful painting of two women carrying offerings. The class held in a clean, airy and traditional family compound .Very friendly atmosphere w birds, children and family members doing their offerings and working quietly as the classes took place in elevated art studio.All material ...paints, ink, paper provided as well as great instruction.Afterwards, Wayan framed painting and delivered to hotel in Ubud.Great experience and most highly recommend.

Woodworking. We had a wonderful time at Wayan's studio and home. While he helped a lady learn traditional painting we did woodworking with Pande. He was so wonderful and patient with us. He helped when we didn't quite get it right and showed us that wood glue was designed to fix the bigger mistakes. Lol. We learned that woodworking is tougher than it looks and maybe the carvings at the markets are actually worth more. The only negative I have is that we had to sit on the floor to carve and for a middle aged couple that was difficult. Wayan's has a wonderful family and the snacks were delicious, especially the pastry. Thanks!

Authentic experience. We had a lovely day at Five Art Studio. Our kids took classes in carving and painting. The wood carving class was the best, the kids had the right balance of direction and independance. The painting class needed more direction for young kids. The biggest problem was that the wood used for the carvings was infested and had issues in quarantine upon returning home. But the family was so lovely and we really enjoyed our day. They cooked us a simple nasi goreng and we got to see the whole family compound. They also gave us free transport in a nice vehicle. Get out of Ubud central and try this place.

Highlight of Ubud visit . Took a class in wood carving together with my sister and it was, suffice to say, a memorable experience. Instructors (Pande and Wayan) were very friendly and welcoming. The place was very quiet and tranquil, perfect for that getaway from the city. Came home with a whole new appreciation of the art and will definitely come back the next time I visit Ubud.
Painting class. Amazing experience to discover the detail of the teliki painting style and also the fact that as an inexperienced painter I was capable of doing it myself :) Wayan is a supertecher!

Fantastic artwork and great service. . Would recommend to anyone who is thinking about an art class in Ubud. Fantastic family style business. They do pick-up and drop-off. Fantastic for young and not so young
Wood Carving . I really learnt a lot from this place and Suardana. Really enjoyed coming here and creating some seriously awesome pieces.You have to go here. You won't regret it.

A great way to spend the day. A friend and I spent the morning working on a Keliki painting with Wayan's assistance. It was very peaceful at the studio and Wayan and his family were very welcoming. I wish we had more time as it would have been better to spend the day there. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys creating art.

Fantastic art lessons . Five Art Studio is a short 10-15 minute drive from Ubud (Wayan will pick you up and drop you back). Wayan is a really talented artist and a wonderful teacher: he has good English, is very patient and obviously loves teaching. He told us about the ways he has been encouraging younger Balinese in his village to have a go at painting. My friend and I opted to try the Keliki painting and we spent many relaxing hours sitting in his studio. I even came back several days later to finish my painting off. Wayan's wife Kadek also teaches batik and assembling of Balinese offerings. They were very welcoming and hospitable. It was a truly delightful experience. I would love to return some day and try the Balinese wood carving.

Batik class . We were 4 friends from different country. Each of us loved the class given by Wayan and Gusti. It was well guided, with a profound love for art & lots of patience as it was our first experience of batik painting.This a unique experience to live while visiting Bali. Moreover, you are getting your own souvenir as a reward. I do recommend it for anyone; children and adults.

Great day learning the art of wood carving. After being collected from our hotel we were welcomed into Wayan's home for a few hours of wood carving (well more than a few hours, as we were not put under a time frame, being given the time needed to finish our master pieces, as Wayan said, 'you are on holiday, I do not expect you to rush). His family were very welcoming and friendly, with his wife offering refreshments and his friend practicing his English while we all shared information about our cultures. My friend and myself really enjoyed learning to wood carve and were very impressed with our achievements under Wayan's direction and guidance. We highly recommend this course and are looking forward to returning to do the painting class which Wayan also offers.

Fabulous day - I learned so much, enjoyed it so much.... I visited Ubud with my parents and brother in April 2016. Since I love to draw and already consider myself a fairly talented artist (but with lots to learn), I jumped at the chance to visit the Five Art Studio when my mother suggested it. I was already enthralled by the culture of Bali and eager to pick up some new techniques that would help me to draw in the style of the Balinese artists that I admire so much. Wayan picked me up on his motorbike at 9:00 AM at our hotel, which made it very convenient to take his lesson--no problem with transportation. I found Wayan to be an immensely likable, warm, engaging and magnanimous person. He's an excellent artist as well. During my lesson, he taught me many new techniques and was especially helpful in instructing me about the use of color. He gave me some great tips about blending colors that will be very useful in the future. I was really pleased with the work I created under his expert eye and tutelage. It was an exciting experience for me to paint in a style that was new to me.Not only did I have a great art class with Wayan, I was delighted to meet his wife and small daughter (she was so cute) and to see how they lived in their rural home. I was really struck at how they live at one with Nature. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I'll definitely go back to see Wayan when my family returns to Bali next year.If you're looking for a memorable art experience in Ubud, be sure to try the Five Art Studio. I know you will have a fabulous day just like I did. Thank you, Wayan!

Enjoyable hands-on experience. We were fetched by Reka from our villa. He was friendly and briefed us about Bali and its culture. Once there, Wayan and his wife greeted us and explained the different arts (batik, kelitik, wood carving etc) that he is engaged in. He also took time to explain more about the Balinese houses. I took up Kelitik painting and his friend, Gusti, showed utmost patience and eye for detail as he supported me in my learning process. Both Gusti and Wayan are young, talented artists who showed sincere appreciation for the arts in Bali and talked about why it is important to uphold this culture. I have respect for the work that these men have contributed towards the their society. Enjoy your day (you wlil be served coffee and fruit juice!), immersed in art and engaged in good natured and playful banter with Wayan and his friends. As you bring your artpiece home, it will definitely remind you of the wonderful time you spend with new found friends.

Fantastic experience - first time Batik lesson. It was one of my most precious memories of our recent trip to Bali, engaging in a batik lesson with Wayan. The whole process was at my own pace, not rushed and I got to make my own design from start to finish - through the drawing, wax and colouring. My family and friends were so impressed with the end result. I gained the knowledge of the batik process and learnt things about the Balinese lifestyle from Wayan who is a talented artist and teacher.

A Wonderful Afternoon of Art. Spending the afternoon with Wayan at his house/studio was one of the highlights of my six week trip to Thailand and Bali. With his guidance I created a lovely Keliki style painting and picked up some techniques that I will be able to try at home. He has a lovely kind and generous personality and was very patient, not rushing me to finish in a set time. Working at his house was very peaceful.

Great experience even for non artists!. We spent a Saturday morning at Wayan's house learning to make a batik style picture. He was patient, helpful and encouraging. We are some pleased with the pictures that we have to take back home and the lesson taught us a lot about the batik process. Not as simple as it looks when you see experts do it. There's a technique to it. A very enjoyable way to spend the morning even for my husband who is not in the least bit artistic. Wayan is a very talented artist, and his English is excellent.

Authentic Balinese Culture. I highly recommend a visit to Five Art Studio if you want to engage with Balinese culture and expand your artistic skills. Wayan is a very patient teacher and he will demonstrate the ancient traditional art techniques. The focus required was meditative and I gained a new level of competency in painting. Wayan welcomes visitors to his family compound and shares his precious talent. Thanks Wayan!

Amazing!. Five Art Studio is a beautiful place for a creative afternoon. Wayan (the artist and owner) is very kind and talented! We did a paintingclass there and loved it. He was very helpful and made us feel very welcome. He gave us all the time we needed for the painting. We are very happy with our results! A very nice souvenir to take home with us :)

Fühl dich wie zu Hause!. And yes, I did feel welcomed and cared for as I would feel at home... I spend two days at the studio, gaining my first experiences in woodcarving and learning how to prepare the small beautiful flower offerings. It was truly an adventure...Wayan picked me up by scooter, I got treated with balinese cakes and coffee, I laughed a lot and had so much fun! The classes were great, I learned a lot about the balinese culture and people...gosh, writing this review brings so many good memories to my mind. It makes me want to go back and meet Wayan and his friends again! 150% worth a visit!

Wonderful day!!. We had a great day at five-art studio learning to do traditional Indonesian Batik.Wayan is a great artist and taught my 10yr old daughter and I well. We loved that the class was taught at his home. His family was very welcoming and it was great to be taught within this personal environment. All of the tools and materials we used were very traditional and my daughter and I now really appreciate the time and effort it takes to create a beautiful batik.We recommend this to people of all ages.Thank you Wayan!

We loved it :). it was a really fun class and we all enjoyed our time with Wayan and his family:) he is very patient and helpful and he even dropped by my hotel the next day to drop a glue bottle i asked him for :) would definitely recommend as a fun day while in Ubud
Batik class. We had a wonderful time learnig & painting ! Amazing class & wayan was very helpful and generous ! Really enjoyed every moment

Traditional painting. We had a wonderful painting and drawing experience with Wayan. He is a very kind person, very patient and take time with each person to explain how to draw. He is very passionate about drawing and his passion is very contagious. He puts all his efforts to speak English and as he is really well motivated and strongly determined, I am sure he is going to speak fluently pretty soon. He is very open-minded and generous about his drawing approach. His place is absolutely gorgeous ! He works at home in a lovely balinese house.We come there with our three daughters. Everybody left with a beautiful drawing and was delighted for having shared these precious moments with Wayan and his family.Next trip to Bali, we will definitely stop by Wayan's house and will spend some time with him.Aurelia & Bertrand and their three daughters Alicia, Lou and Ellie.

Wonderful experience with beautiful Balinese from Keliki. My mother and I did a Batik painting class with Wayan and his family. The day was truly special and Wayan was very kind and showed us the steps along the way how to create simple Batik as we made our own masterpiece. Now I've done Batik myself I'm truly in awe of the fabrics I see around as you must be really talented to do so, first time around was very difficult and you'll need a steady hand. I was happy with the outcome. We really enjoyed a day out at Keliki out of the main Ubud town. It's always nice to support families who are a little out of the reach of the main tourist attractions in Ubud. Keliki is beautiful and traditional. Wayan and his family also support local school kids art and teach them art too. You can buy some of the kids art and the earnings go to them. I would highly recommend a day at Five Art studio with Wayan! Thanks

Keliki painting class. One of the more meaningful activities to do in Ubud. The ride to Keliki village is an experience in itself (you escape from the hustle and bustle of Ubud central and get a glimpse of a rice fields and village life in Ubud). I enjoyed the painting class with Wayan who patiently guided me through the intricacies of the painting process. He also provided an insight into the history behind the Keliki style and the art scene in Ubud.
A great experience!. Wayan spent the entire day with us, one on one. He adapts his instruction based on your skill set. I have never done acrylic paint, he helped me through it.

We had a great time at five art studio for Batik class with Wayan and Family. five art studio is the right choice to study art in Ubud . a quiet place and a cool atmosphere . bali traditional house with cultural atmosphere of Bali . you can booking the class by email, phone or come direct to five art Studio. It is at Keliki village closed from Ubud center, very quiet area on the way to studio we passing beutifull rice field. It is amazing. I am very recomend this studio for traveler who come to Ubud who want know the real traditional art of Keliki and Ubud.

Highlight on Bali, creative and deep day with Wayan. I went about a month ago to a class with Wayan and it was an amazing experience. Luckily that day I was the only one and ended up staying the whole day at Wayans and his families residence. We spoke for hours about the world we live in, while I worked on my piece. As I am an artist myself, the work itself was smooth, giving us more time to let our conversation influence what I painted. We added critical details to the traditional painting, reflecting our worlds situation. It was incredible, a kind of collaboration between him and me. His wife and mother offered us balinese coffee and cookies and his daughter was the cutest. I enjoyed my day so much with Wayan and his family and will keep contact and definetly go back whenever I am in Bali. Highlight, You have to go!!Thanks Wayan!
painting in ubud with wayan. We had a great afternoon with wayan teaching us painting we both enjoyed he is a very good teacher he is very patient and helpful thank you wayan from george and sandra

Wonderful Day at Five Art Studio with Wayan. I can only highly recommand you to visit Five Art Studio. I spent an amazing day in Tengallalang and was warmly welcomed by Wayan and his family in their beautiful home (typical balinese). Wayan is a great teacher and a great artist. I was able to take the Keliki painting Class and the wood carving Class on the same day. you can take this class no mater how good you are because Wayan walks you through every steps and helps you. I'll definitely come back again. Thank you Wayan !

Great art class for kids. We enjoyed the art class at Five Art Studio so much that we have been back 3 times! My kids look forward to each visit. Wayan is great with children and he has a great balance between directing the kids through the art making activity and allowing them to explore the materials on their own. Many of the paintings and activities are extremely intricate - clearly designed for older children and adults - but Wayan has adjusted the activities so my kids are able to enjoy it and feel proud of their final product. Highly recommend this place for an artistic activity in Ubud. It is also a great opportunity to visit a family compound and look at the wonderful paintings that are there..

Great experience!. Wayan is a great painter and it's really worth a visit. Some 10-15 minutes drive north of Ubud in Keliki/Tengallalang (Wayan can arange a pickup-service from Ubud) a small traditional Bali artist village you will find his "Five Art Studio". You could go there for painting classes and to find nice paintings. Also Wayan is happy to talk with you and make paintings as you order.

Beautiful experience. Myself and my adult daughter had a lovely time doing our pieces of artwork. Wayan is very patient and encouraging, and helped us when we needed it. He helped me produce a piece I was really proud of. The setting is absolutely beautiful, and we were given water, home-grown and roasted coffee, and cake. A very peaceful and relaxing experience. Well worth doing.

Great way to spend a few hours or even a day at Five Art Studio. We were picked up by Wayan and staff the lovely owner of the Five Art Studio and taken out to the workshop. We were given coffee and balinese snacks. and learnt more than I thought in the class. Wayan is a great Teacher we take a traditional Keliki painting class, we start from making sketch , after 4 hour we back to hotel with our beautiful art work, it is Great value for money. I hope to do another course when we return. I recommend this activity for the tourist when you are in Ubud.
Design Drawing. That amezing, just small Village we can find the good artist at Kliki Village. Thanks my friend for doing that.

Beautiful Balinese Works of Art. I was very impressed with the beautiful works of art seen in this Studio. This is a must visit for lovers of painting. Terima kasih Wayan for showing us your wonderful work.

Amazing Art Class. This is more than just an art lesson! It's a history and culture lesson too. Wayan provides free transport to his beautiful art gallery, located in his housing complex from Ubud town. It is a chance to get away from the typical tourist trail and truly experience REAL Balinese culture! You will get to drink authentic Balinese coffee, grown in the backyard and cooked in the house kitchen and you will get the chance to meet some truly wonderful locals. Do yourself a favor and take one of the classes here. It will be one of your favorite memories from your trip. No doubt! Thanks again !-Shannon

Wonderful!. Wonderful peaceful moment with Wayan. He is really nice and a very good teacher as he is patient and gives you confidence. You leave with the feeling of a great accomplishement and a very beautiful artwork.

Great for art lovers of almost all ages; learn Balinese technique!. This art studio is in the Keliki Village just outside of Ubud; a beautiful quick ride through the rice fields. It is in a beautiful setting.I have taken my daughters, one of whom is very interested in art; they were both excited to learn the technique that is typical in this type of Balinese art. The instructor is very knowledgeable and quite an accomplished artist.We chose paintings that we liked, and the artist, Wayan, taught my daughters step-by-step how to create their own keliki painting. I was amazed at the beauty they created by the end of their three-hour class! Wayan showed them how to draw, create their own detail and how to use the paint and brush effectively to make effects in shadow and light. Wayan is an excellent teacher. He is very accommodating with time and group vs. individual lessons. I would highly recommend this activity for children and adults who want to learn a real technique. My daughters like it so much they've already gone to Wayan twice and want to go to him again!

Great experience. I have never paint from in junior high school, but I could complete the work. He taught me the technique of traditional painting kindly carefully. Beautiful nature, quiet space, and kind people. It's so nice.絵を描くのは高校以来でしたが、丁寧に教えてくれるのでそれっぽい絵が描けました！本来3時間のところを多分6時間くらい付きっきりで教えてくれました。少し遠い場所にありますが、バリの田舎の暮らしにも触れられるし、帰りはタララガンの棚田を見て帰れるので良い。何より人が素敵。価格はディスカウント前で400,000ルピー。

Fabulous traditional painting workshop... just what I wanted!. I received a lovely warm welcome when I visited Five Art Studio and met with Wayan, his beautiful wife and pretty little daughter. I went to learn Keliki painting, the traditional style of this village. Thanks to Wayan's wonderful teaching skills and his patience I produced a beautiful souvenir of my trip to Bali. I thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would highly recommend it to anyone interested in art.

Awsome Batik Class in Bali Ubud. Wonderful memory! Feel like an artist! The Five Art Studio provides all batik equipments, guidance and delicious snacks. Great to spend a day doing creative batik art piece in traditional Balinese complex with relaxing atmosphere and pleasant music. Bring back my own unique batik scarf home with proud and joy.

Batik Instruction - Amazing day. The experience of taking a batik class with someone who is as knowledgeable and patient as Wayan can only provide great results. He is friendly, hospitable and a great teacher. I learnt so much whilst creating my piece, I am looking forward to practising some more once I return home. The experience was therapeutic and relaxing. I now have my own batik fabric which will provide me with memories of a really happy experience for a lifetime.

Whole family loved it. We went with my wife and daughters aged 7 and 5. We did the painted wooden egg class. Wayan was fantastic with us and very patient with our daughters. He teaches act classes to the local school children so is amazing with them. The classes are held in his family home just outside of Ubud. We all came away with an beautiful souvenir that we had made ourselves.Could not recommend enough. Thank you Wayan

Such a good time!. I love painting and have been looking forward to taking a course to expand my knowledge on new techniques! Wayan was such a patient teacher who is very enthusiastic about art! He was flexible with his class times and had all the materials ready to go! If you are in Ubud and are looking for an art class, this would be a great place to look!

T-shirt painting. A beautiful and pleasant drive,about 15 minutes from Ubud. I went with my 12 year old granddaughter to do t-shirt painting. What a wonderful experience, she had a one on one lesson. So much patience, knowledge, creativity and most of all so much fun. The end product was gorgeous and such a perfect souvenir for her to bring home. Next time I will definitely be booking myself in for an art class.

Amazing experience . Me and my wife came here on our honeymoon and was greeted by the warmest people. We were guided to making our art pieces which we still are in awe in the fact we made that. It was truly a pleasure, and highly recommend this studio.

Kind, Patient and Warm. I was looking for some help with improving my painting skills and I contacted Wayan and he was very accommodating. I wasn't initially interested in Keliki lessons, but when I saw his work, I was blown away. Unfortunately I had only one day to spend but if I had more time, that would definitely have been worked in to my itinerary. Keliki paintings can be quite beautiful - what could be better than taking home something you made yourself? As an instructor, Wayan is kind, patient and encouraging. He steps in to help un-intrusively when needed, still giving you all the space you need to learn. The lessons are at his home, and it was nice to spend time in a traditional Balinese house. His wife was warm and his little daughter is delightful. It was a well-utilized morning and is the highlight of my trip to Ubud.

Wood carving class. We had a great time learning to wood carve . Everyone was nice and attentive. It is definitely harder than I thought it would be. Great way to spend a few hours of the day. They also have many other art classes including batik and silversmith

Awesome Experience!. This art class was a great find. Not only was it a great experience learning to paint a traditional Keliki painting and trying my hand at batik, it was also great to find something not so commercial and crowded. What's even better is that the class is in a traditional village surrounded by paddy fields outside central ubud. A big thanks to Wayan, his wife and adorable daughter Jia for making this such a memorable experience.

Learn the ways of woodcarving!. WOW. We learned so much about this incredible Balinese craft in such a welcoming and patient environment! Not only was the atmosphere friendly and hospitable (we were fed tofu snacks!), but we now feel so appreciative of what it takes to create the outstanding woodwork that you see surrounding the villages of Bali. This is an experience not to be missed! Big thanks to Wayan and his beautiful family! :)
Wonderful day of woodcarving. . We had a great day of wood carving! Great program, lots of instruction and a fabulous product to take home. We'll be back for the batik!

Woodcarving Class. Was sooo worth it doing this Art Class in Five Art Gallery. The studio itself is easy to find (available in google map) bli Wayan and his wife (and the little girl Putu) greeted us warmly though we were late. He's very talented, kind and fun to be with. He is fast respond on Whatsapp and easy to communicate, I booked this class in advance. You might want to do that as well to make sure the seat are available.You can choose available design or any of your own design. We are making our own design and he taught us patiently from scratch, the wood material was not too hard to be crafted makes the carving process easier. It was a therapeutic experience doing this Art Class, I think I might try to enroll another art class if I am back to Bali.Thank you Bli Wayan! :)

A rich cultural experience... Get creative!. I arranged a batik workshop in the morning and was picked up at my hotel in Ubud that afternoon. It was a lovely ride to the artists art studio/home. J Wayan Suardana was a great teacher - very friendly, helpful, personable and patient. He is also a very talented artist. While waiting for the paint to set, I asked to see the family's pigs which was fun. It was a great experience to learn batik and I'm sure any workshop here would be well done. Thanks for a great day!
Batik workshop. I really enjoyed my batik workshop! Very nice and good teacher, Who could tell me and learn me a lot. I had a really good First Time experience with the Balinese Art. Thank you!

Ended up here based on trip advisor . So we were looking for places to scope some local art and we ended up here on a tour we made. The artist is extremely chill and has amazing art work!! We didn't take any classes but we were so welcomed we sat and talked for about an hour! His work is rather expensive but totally worth it as it is so detailed !!!!! We left with 2 pieces and probably would have kicked ourselves if we didn't buy them! He is an amazing artist and a very easy to talk to and just hang out with! Please buy from local artist ! You are supporting their craft and lively hood!! Hopefully we'll be back to take a class! But seeing and being there was definitely enough!

Learning. I was recomended this place by my cousin who lives in Bali. I did not know what to expect since it was all new to me so i picked few classes and headed down the studio which turned out to be the teacher's house. Wife mom and kid greet u with smiles into their court yard where u are received by Wayan the teacher who is eager to learn about u and ur country. He is very detailed in his teachings. I took Batik and egg painting with him and wood carving with his friend whom his english is not good but (knows almost every single heavy metal song by heart ) Wayan is there to translate. If it is something ud like to experience then it is the place for u.
