I also found out that he offers his home for free for the children of the village to come and learn english from expat that are willing to teach.U are offered tea or coffee and if ur ok with motorcycles then ul get a free ride to and from ur hotel

Awesome experience with wayan and his family. Signed up for this class cause this is my third time to Bali and I wanted to do something different. Intended to do keliki painting but when we found out there was batik painting - my sister and I asked wayan if we could work together on a huge piece (1.5 vs 1.5m vs the regular 0.3x 0.6 frame per pax). We proceeded to spend 7 hours with him learning how to make our very own unique batik that we intend to turn into a shirt for our dad or frame up at home! While waiting for the paint to dry, it was also great talking to wayan about his experiences. Definitely recommend a trip down if you have a day / afternoon to while immerse yourself in traditional Balinese art making. Thanks again wayan!

Beautiful experience . Booked into this with my dad and it exceeded expectations. Very humble family home studio and home out the back of a wood carving shop and spent 3+ hours carving with a local expert carver. Really peaceful family environment and lots of good conversation while carving a beautiful lotus in the wood. Would recommend and go back for sure!

Keliki Painting and Wood Carving Class. We truly enjoyed our art classes at the studio. Both instructors were very patient and did a good job of instructing and ensuring that the art pieces were a reflection of our efforts. I highly recommend this class - gave me a whole new appreciation for the keliki paintings we saw in the galleries and markets.

Fun and fruitful classes. We have fun time at Five Art Studio. There are many classes to choose from. Some are suitable for young kids. Wayan has a beautiful mission to the community by providing studio and lessons to the young Balinese to spend their time after school. He is concerned that more and more young Balinese are losing their artistic abilities to social media / electronic. Him and his assistances are knowledgable and pleasant teachers.

Great experience in Bali. My friend and I decided to find a place to take a class in batik, and we're lucky enough to find a brochure from Five Art Studio. They transported us to their location and gave us quality time and attention in teaching us the ancient art of creating batik art on fabric. They were so friendly and supportive, and did not ever make us feel like we should be rushed even though we were taking a while to get our initial designs created to batik with. They gave us great direction on what to do and what to watch out for, and my friend and I were both very pleased with our results, but even more so with the experience.

Lovely and relaxing drawing session at Wayan's. 5 out of 5 points! I had an amazing time working on my own project. Wayan spent somuch time with me. He brings along a lot of passion and patience ;) It was so interesting to learn about the Keliki drawing style and ink. And I am so happy about getting the option for a passepartout and frame for my finished art work. What a great memory to take home. Plus point is the pick-up, drop-off, snack and water. Thanks for the great day!

Painting lesson. Wayan provided a three hour class that produced a wonderful painting of two women carrying offerings. The class held in a clean, airy and traditional family compound .Very friendly atmosphere w birds, children and family members doing their offerings and working quietly as the classes took place in elevated art studio.All material ...paints, ink, paper provided as well as great instruction.Afterwards, Wayan framed painting and delivered to hotel in Ubud.Great experience and most highly recommend.

Woodworking. We had a wonderful time at Wayan's studio and home. While he helped a lady learn traditional painting we did woodworking with Pande. He was so wonderful and patient with us. He helped when we didn't quite get it right and showed us that wood glue was designed to fix the bigger mistakes. Lol. We learned that woodworking is tougher than it looks and maybe the carvings at the markets are actually worth more. The only negative I have is that we had to sit on the floor to carve and for a middle aged couple that was difficult. Wayan's has a wonderful family and the snacks were delicious, especially the pastry. Thanks!

Authentic experience. We had a lovely day at Five Art Studio. Our kids took classes in carving and painting. The wood carving class was the best, the kids had the right balance of direction and independance. The painting class needed more direction for young kids. The biggest problem was that the wood used for the carvings was infested and had issues in quarantine upon returning home. But the family was so lovely and we really enjoyed our day. They cooked us a simple nasi goreng and we got to see the whole family compound. They also gave us free transport in a nice vehicle. Get out of Ubud central and try this place.

Highlight of Ubud visit . Took a class in wood carving together with my sister and it was, suffice to say, a memorable experience. Instructors (Pande and Wayan) were very friendly and welcoming. The place was very quiet and tranquil, perfect for that getaway from the city. Came home with a whole new appreciation of the art and will definitely come back the next time I visit Ubud.
Painting class. Amazing experience to discover the detail of the teliki painting style and also the fact that as an inexperienced painter I was capable of doing it myself :) Wayan is a supertecher!

Fantastic artwork and great service. . Would recommend to anyone who is thinking about an art class in Ubud. Fantastic family style business. They do pick-up and drop-off. Fantastic for young and not so young
Wood Carving . I really learnt a lot from this place and Suardana. Really enjoyed coming here and creating some seriously awesome pieces.You have to go here. You won't regret it.

A great way to spend the day. A friend and I spent the morning working on a Keliki painting with Wayan's assistance. It was very peaceful at the studio and Wayan and his family were very welcoming. I wish we had more time as it would have been better to spend the day there. I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys creating art.

Fantastic art lessons . Five Art Studio is a short 10-15 minute drive from Ubud (Wayan will pick you up and drop you back). Wayan is a really talented artist and a wonderful teacher: he has good English, is very patient and obviously loves teaching. He told us about the ways he has been encouraging younger Balinese in his village to have a go at painting. My friend and I opted to try the Keliki painting and we spent many relaxing hours sitting in his studio. I even came back several days later to finish my painting off. Wayan's wife Kadek also teaches batik and assembling of Balinese offerings. They were very welcoming and hospitable. It was a truly delightful experience. I would love to return some day and try the Balinese wood carving.

Batik class . We were 4 friends from different country. Each of us loved the class given by Wayan and Gusti. It was well guided, with a profound love for art & lots of patience as it was our first experience of batik painting.This a unique experience to live while visiting Bali. Moreover, you are getting your own souvenir as a reward. I do recommend it for anyone; children and adults.

Great day learning the art of wood carving. After being collected from our hotel we were welcomed into Wayan's home for a few hours of wood carving (well more than a few hours, as we were not put under a time frame, being given the time needed to finish our master pieces, as Wayan said, 'you are on holiday, I do not expect you to rush). His family were very welcoming and friendly, with his wife offering refreshments and his friend practicing his English while we all shared information about our cultures. My friend and myself really enjoyed learning to wood carve and were very impressed with our achievements under Wayan's direction and guidance. We highly recommend this course and are looking forward to returning to do the painting class which Wayan also offers.

Fabulous day - I learned so much, enjoyed it so much.... I visited Ubud with my parents and brother in April 2016. Since I love to draw and already consider myself a fairly talented artist (but with lots to learn), I jumped at the chance to visit the Five Art Studio when my mother suggested it. I was already enthralled by the culture of Bali and eager to pick up some new techniques that would help me to draw in the style of the Balinese artists that I admire so much. Wayan picked me up on his motorbike at 9:00 AM at our hotel, which made it very convenient to take his lesson--no problem with transportation. I found Wayan to be an immensely likable, warm, engaging and magnanimous person. He's an excellent artist as well. During my lesson, he taught me many new techniques and was especially helpful in instructing me about the use of color. He gave me some great tips about blending colors that will be very useful in the future. I was really pleased with the work I created under his expert eye and tutelage. It was an exciting experience for me to paint in a style that was new to me.Not only did I have a great art class with Wayan, I was delighted to meet his wife and small daughter (she was so cute) and to see how they lived in their rural home. I was really struck at how they live at one with Nature. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I'll definitely go back to see Wayan when my family returns to Bali next year.If you're looking for a memorable art experience in Ubud, be sure to try the Five Art Studio. I know you will have a fabulous day just like I did. Thank you, Wayan!

Enjoyable hands-on experience. We were fetched by Reka from our villa. He was friendly and briefed us about Bali and its culture. Once there, Wayan and his wife greeted us and explained the different arts (batik, kelitik, wood carving etc) that he is engaged in. He also took time to explain more about the Balinese houses. I took up Kelitik painting and his friend, Gusti, showed utmost patience and eye for detail as he supported me in my learning process. Both Gusti and Wayan are young, talented artists who showed sincere appreciation for the arts in Bali and talked about why it is important to uphold this culture. I have respect for the work that these men have contributed towards the their society. Enjoy your day (you wlil be served coffee and fruit juice!), immersed in art and engaged in good natured and playful banter with Wayan and his friends. As you bring your artpiece home, it will definitely remind you of the wonderful time you spend with new found friends.

Fantastic experience - first time Batik lesson. It was one of my most precious memories of our recent trip to Bali, engaging in a batik lesson with Wayan. The whole process was at my own pace, not rushed and I got to make my own design from start to finish - through the drawing, wax and colouring. My family and friends were so impressed with the end result. I gained the knowledge of the batik process and learnt things about the Balinese lifestyle from Wayan who is a talented artist and teacher.

A Wonderful Afternoon of Art. Spending the afternoon with Wayan at his house/studio was one of the highlights of my six week trip to Thailand and Bali. With his guidance I created a lovely Keliki style painting and picked up some techniques that I will be able to try at home. He has a lovely kind and generous personality and was very patient, not rushing me to finish in a set time. Working at his house was very peaceful.

Great experience even for non artists!. We spent a Saturday morning at Wayan's house learning to make a batik style picture. He was patient, helpful and encouraging. We are some pleased with the pictures that we have to take back home and the lesson taught us a lot about the batik process. Not as simple as it looks when you see experts do it. There's a technique to it. A very enjoyable way to spend the morning even for my husband who is not in the least bit artistic. Wayan is a very talented artist, and his English is excellent.

Authentic Balinese Culture. I highly recommend a visit to Five Art Studio if you want to engage with Balinese culture and expand your artistic skills. Wayan is a very patient teacher and he will demonstrate the ancient traditional art techniques. The focus required was meditative and I gained a new level of competency in painting. Wayan welcomes visitors to his family compound and shares his precious talent. Thanks Wayan!

Amazing!. Five Art Studio is a beautiful place for a creative afternoon. Wayan (the artist and owner) is very kind and talented! We did a paintingclass there and loved it. He was very helpful and made us feel very welcome. He gave us all the time we needed for the painting. We are very happy with our results! A very nice souvenir to take home with us :)

Fühl dich wie zu Hause!. And yes, I did feel welcomed and cared for as I would feel at home... I spend two days at the studio, gaining my first experiences in woodcarving and learning how to prepare the small beautiful flower offerings. It was truly an adventure...Wayan picked me up by scooter, I got treated with balinese cakes and coffee, I laughed a lot and had so much fun! The classes were great, I learned a lot about the balinese culture and people...gosh, writing this review brings so many good memories to my mind. It makes me want to go back and meet Wayan and his friends again! 150% worth a visit!

Wonderful day!!. We had a great day at five-art studio learning to do traditional Indonesian Batik.Wayan is a great artist and taught my 10yr old daughter and I well. We loved that the class was taught at his home. His family was very welcoming and it was great to be taught within this personal environment. All of the tools and materials we used were very traditional and my daughter and I now really appreciate the time and effort it takes to create a beautiful batik.We recommend this to people of all ages.Thank you Wayan!

We loved it :). it was a really fun class and we all enjoyed our time with Wayan and his family:) he is very patient and helpful and he even dropped by my hotel the next day to drop a glue bottle i asked him for :) would definitely recommend as a fun day while in Ubud
Batik class. We had a wonderful time learnig & painting ! Amazing class & wayan was very helpful and generous ! Really enjoyed every moment

Traditional painting. We had a wonderful painting and drawing experience with Wayan. He is a very kind person, very patient and take time with each person to explain how to draw. He is very passionate about drawing and his passion is very contagious. He puts all his efforts to speak English and as he is really well motivated and strongly determined, I am sure he is going to speak fluently pretty soon. He is very open-minded and generous about his drawing approach. His place is absolutely gorgeous ! He works at home in a lovely balinese house.We come there with our three daughters. Everybody left with a beautiful drawing and was delighted for having shared these precious moments with Wayan and his family.Next trip to Bali, we will definitely stop by Wayan's house and will spend some time with him.Aurelia & Bertrand and their three daughters Alicia, Lou and Ellie.

Wonderful experience with beautiful Balinese from Keliki. My mother and I did a Batik painting class with Wayan and his family. The day was truly special and Wayan was very kind and showed us the steps along the way how to create simple Batik as we made our own masterpiece. Now I've done Batik myself I'm truly in awe of the fabrics I see around as you must be really talented to do so, first time around was very difficult and you'll need a steady hand. I was happy with the outcome. We really enjoyed a day out at Keliki out of the main Ubud town. It's always nice to support families who are a little out of the reach of the main tourist attractions in Ubud. Keliki is beautiful and traditional. Wayan and his family also support local school kids art and teach them art too. You can buy some of the kids art and the earnings go to them. I would highly recommend a day at Five Art studio with Wayan! Thanks

Keliki painting class. One of the more meaningful activities to do in Ubud. The ride to Keliki village is an experience in itself (you escape from the hustle and bustle of Ubud central and get a glimpse of a rice fields and village life in Ubud). I enjoyed the painting class with Wayan who patiently guided me through the intricacies of the painting process. He also provided an insight into the history behind the Keliki style and the art scene in Ubud.
A great experience!. Wayan spent the entire day with us, one on one. He adapts his instruction based on your skill set. I have never done acrylic paint, he helped me through it.

We had a great time at five art studio for Batik class with Wayan and Family. five art studio is the right choice to study art in Ubud . a quiet place and a cool atmosphere . bali traditional house with cultural atmosphere of Bali . you can booking the class by email, phone or come direct to five art Studio. It is at Keliki village closed from Ubud center, very quiet area on the way to studio we passing beutifull rice field. It is amazing. I am very recomend this studio for traveler who come to Ubud who want know the real traditional art of Keliki and Ubud.

Highlight on Bali, creative and deep day with Wayan. I went about a month ago to a class with Wayan and it was an amazing experience. Luckily that day I was the only one and ended up staying the whole day at Wayans and his families residence. We spoke for hours about the world we live in, while I worked on my piece. As I am an artist myself, the work itself was smooth, giving us more time to let our conversation influence what I painted. We added critical details to the traditional painting, reflecting our worlds situation. It was incredible, a kind of collaboration between him and me. His wife and mother offered us balinese coffee and cookies and his daughter was the cutest. I enjoyed my day so much with Wayan and his family and will keep contact and definetly go back whenever I am in Bali. Highlight, You have to go!!Thanks Wayan!
painting in ubud with wayan. We had a great afternoon with wayan teaching us painting we both enjoyed he is a very good teacher he is very patient and helpful thank you wayan from george and sandra

Wonderful Day at Five Art Studio with Wayan. I can only highly recommand you to visit Five Art Studio. I spent an amazing day in Tengallalang and was warmly welcomed by Wayan and his family in their beautiful home (typical balinese). Wayan is a great teacher and a great artist. I was able to take the Keliki painting Class and the wood carving Class on the same day. you can take this class no mater how good you are because Wayan walks you through every steps and helps you. I'll definitely come back again. Thank you Wayan !

Great art class for kids. We enjoyed the art class at Five Art Studio so much that we have been back 3 times! My kids look forward to each visit. Wayan is great with children and he has a great balance between directing the kids through the art making activity and allowing them to explore the materials on their own. Many of the paintings and activities are extremely intricate - clearly designed for older children and adults - but Wayan has adjusted the activities so my kids are able to enjoy it and feel proud of their final product. Highly recommend this place for an artistic activity in Ubud. It is also a great opportunity to visit a family compound and look at the wonderful paintings that are there..

Great experience!. Wayan is a great painter and it's really worth a visit. Some 10-15 minutes drive north of Ubud in Keliki/Tengallalang (Wayan can arange a pickup-service from Ubud) a small traditional Bali artist village you will find his "Five Art Studio". You could go there for painting classes and to find nice paintings. Also Wayan is happy to talk with you and make paintings as you order.

Beautiful experience. Myself and my adult daughter had a lovely time doing our pieces of artwork. Wayan is very patient and encouraging, and helped us when we needed it. He helped me produce a piece I was really proud of. The setting is absolutely beautiful, and we were given water, home-grown and roasted coffee, and cake. A very peaceful and relaxing experience. Well worth doing.

Great way to spend a few hours or even a day at Five Art Studio. We were picked up by Wayan and staff the lovely owner of the Five Art Studio and taken out to the workshop. We were given coffee and balinese snacks. and learnt more than I thought in the class. Wayan is a great Teacher we take a traditional Keliki painting class, we start from making sketch , after 4 hour we back to hotel with our beautiful art work, it is Great value for money. I hope to do another course when we return. I recommend this activity for the tourist when you are in Ubud.
Design Drawing. That amezing, just small Village we can find the good artist at Kliki Village. Thanks my friend for doing that.

Beautiful Balinese Works of Art. I was very impressed with the beautiful works of art seen in this Studio. This is a must visit for lovers of painting. Terima kasih Wayan for showing us your wonderful work.

Amazing Art Class. This is more than just an art lesson! It's a history and culture lesson too. Wayan provides free transport to his beautiful art gallery, located in his housing complex from Ubud town. It is a chance to get away from the typical tourist trail and truly experience REAL Balinese culture! You will get to drink authentic Balinese coffee, grown in the backyard and cooked in the house kitchen and you will get the chance to meet some truly wonderful locals. Do yourself a favor and take one of the classes here. It will be one of your favorite memories from your trip. No doubt! Thanks again !-Shannon

Wonderful!. Wonderful peaceful moment with Wayan. He is really nice and a very good teacher as he is patient and gives you confidence. You leave with the feeling of a great accomplishement and a very beautiful artwork.

Great for art lovers of almost all ages; learn Balinese technique!. This art studio is in the Keliki Village just outside of Ubud; a beautiful quick ride through the rice fields. It is in a beautiful setting.I have taken my daughters, one of whom is very interested in art; they were both excited to learn the technique that is typical in this type of Balinese art. The instructor is very knowledgeable and quite an accomplished artist.We chose paintings that we liked, and the artist, Wayan, taught my daughters step-by-step how to create their own keliki painting. I was amazed at the beauty they created by the end of their three-hour class! Wayan showed them how to draw, create their own detail and how to use the paint and brush effectively to make effects in shadow and light. Wayan is an excellent teacher. He is very accommodating with time and group vs. individual lessons. I would highly recommend this activity for children and adults who want to learn a real technique. My daughters like it so much they've already gone to Wayan twice and want to go to him again!

Great experience. I have never paint from in junior high school, but I could complete the work. He taught me the technique of traditional painting kindly carefully. Beautiful nature, quiet space, and kind people. It's so nice.絵を描くのは高校以来でしたが、丁寧に教えてくれるのでそれっぽい絵が描けました！本来3時間のところを多分6時間くらい付きっきりで教えてくれました。少し遠い場所にありますが、バリの田舎の暮らしにも触れられるし、帰りはタララガンの棚田を見て帰れるので良い。何より人が素敵。価格はディスカウント前で400,000ルピー。

Think Traditional. It was lovely to visit the shop and create things with my own hands. The entire class is done very well, with expert advise and some of the scents like LOTIS to put in your products is to die for. If you're into natural products, this is an interesting class. I definitely enjoyed it. No complaints at all whatsoever..PS. The shampoo product did not work as a normal western shampoo, as it was more water and I trusted that it actually cleansed my hair. It looked pretty good afterwards and smelled better.

Learned so many things.. very interesting!. It was a very interesting afternoon where we learned so much.. I attended the session with my mom and we were the only ones in class. We had a blast making and trying out the products.. from facial scrubs to shampoo to sunscreen.. and all the ingredients are so natural and easy to find.. Definitely recommending this activity and will do it again when we head back to Bali to learn more..

Must do.... Had the opportunity to visit this amazing interactive with Travel Noire. Dewi and her team were phenomenal. We took an amazing walk through there community checking out plants and herbs. Had fresh coconut water on our rest stop and then headed back past amazing rice fields. Once we returned to her space we took time learning to use the Bali blender, creating our own botanical based products (face scrub, shampoo, sunscreen and even tiger balm). A fantastic lunch that she woke early to prepare and an all around pleasant experience! Would highly recommend this as a stop in Ubud. Also ask her how the interactive started with the support of her village and how she works with the local farmers. Brilliant! Also, take a few rupiah to get pure oils and teas.

Back to earth. We did the botanical course with my husband. It was very interesting. We made the products and then they put it in bottles to take home. Beautiful class. Thanks Dewi for your knowledge and patience. Our two little girls were spoilt with hot chocolate and balinese cakes. Very relaxed and enjoyable. All natural ingredients. Thanks for your kindness!!!
Super nice!. Super friendly! Only natural products. Good explanations and you got the recipes. A lot of fun- highly recommended!

Wonderfull experience with very kind people. I had a great time at Ubud Botny interactive. We made suncream, bodyscrub, boreh and a shampoo. Dewi and her team were really kind and answered all my questions. I woud definitely recommend this to anyone who is interested in natural kosmetics.

Fun experience for the girls. My sister and I took our two daughters aged 10-14 to the beauty products making class with Dewi. The girls in particular, loved making up all the 'potions', and spent the rest of the afternoon recreating a day spa experience back at our villa, applying the scrub etc they had made. The natural ingredients were laid out beautifully and it was interesting to see what flowers and plants could be used to create the products. The girls said it was the highlight of their Ubud trip - thanks Dewi!

Wonderfully educational, lovely tour guides. Myself and 2 x friends had heard great reviews on the Botanical tour of the Rice Fields and surrounding area, so when we were in Ubud we booked.Our tour guide was absolutely lovely and his knowledge of the different flora was amazing. He was able to teach us exactly about different plant life and even allowed us to interact during the walk. Being Balinese, he also answered any and many questions we had on the area and their way of life.We finished the day at the UBI shop where Dewi instructed a class in which together, we made various products such as sun cream, body scrub and shampoo from locally sourced natural products.I cannot recommend this tour enough and wish to thank Dewi and her crew for their kindness, warmth and willingness to educate.
Botany Interactive. Went as a group where we made various face creams, shampoos. From there we took a tour of rice paddy fields which were just beautiful!

Amazing!. I came with a group of about 13 and they were extremely accommodating. We took the natural beauty course where we made our own shampoo, body scrubs, etc. After lunch, we took a tour and was able to see the rice patties from the eyes of a local. Dewi and everyone involved was absolutely amazing and hilarious! This is definitely a must do when you visit Ubud. Mawaliiiiii!

A wonderful & fun experience and empowering skills for self sufficiency: Beauty product class. The 2 ladies running the class were lovely and the botany instructor was extremely informative. We easily made shampoo (which I like more than any other shampoo I ever bought), face & body scrub, sunscreen (which is awesome on the skin) and tiger balm. My friend and I had so much fun in the class, loved the finished results and also loved the products in the shop. We were given herbal tea and Balinese donuts as refreshments, lots of individual attention and also had the opportunity to ask about how to make other natural products such as mosquito repellant and ask questions about which natural ingredients are useful to treat any skin, hair or nail condition. Dewi is amazing in her knowledge and presents everything so simply we could learn but also relax & enjoy. I loved it and now can't wait to buy a book from UBI to learn more. Highly recommended purely for enjoyment or if you'd like to make your own products to be healthier and more self sufficient. Thanks Dewi & UBI!

Fun beauty product class (and also good to know we are supporting the local community). My partner and I did the beauty product class. It was just the 2 of us so had great undivided attention from our 2 instructors. It was a fun class using only natural ingredients.Dewi (the owner) told us that they are supporters of fair trade and they source their produce from local farmers.

Beauty products class. I attended beauty products class and loved it! I was lucky to have an individual lesson, made all products from scratch and took them home. Very informative, relaxing atmosphere, time well spent! Recommended if you're a fan of natural cosmetics and want to learn some tips!

Coconut oil making class. What a wonderful experience we had with Dewi. Set among the rice fields and seeing how these farmers work so hard to make a living. Dewi has already managed to make a remarkable difference in these farmers lives while educating them along the way. Keep up the good work Dewi and thank you Dhika for driving us so carefully!

Fabulous. The coconut oil class was a fantastic experience in the middle of the fields in a peacefull and funny atmosphere. The beauty class shows you how to make natural cosmetics by yourself..very interesting too !!! Thank you Dewi and Dhika for this wonderful day togeither. And thank you to be so friendly and available and to share all those things about your culture.

Great Botany Class in Bali. If you're a lover of nature and enjoy making your own products this is a must! Had an amazing time and wish I could even remember a lot of the recipes for the products we made.

The highlight of my trip. The botanical walk with Ubud Botany Interactive (Ubi) was by far the highlight of my trip. The guides running this walk astounded me with their incredible knowledge of local plant life, there was no question I asked that they had any trouble answering. While learning about the local plant life I was also taught about each plants use and place within Balinese culture. At the end of the walk we got to try some of Dewi’s Healing tea which was delicious. On top of how fun and informative this walk was I feel it is also important to point out how kind and friendly Dewi and her staff are, truly some of the nicest people you will ever meet. This walk is a must do for anyone interested in plants and/or the local Balinese culture.

Relax and make your own beauty product. 호텔에서 급예약하고 찾아갔는데 혼자 수업받았습니다. 11시부터 12시반 정도까지 진행되었고, 인스트럭터인 뽀뚜가 한류팬이라 한국을 굉장히 좋아해서 더 재미있었습니다.100%자연재료, 에션셜 오일로 샴푸, 타이거밤, 스크럽, 선크림을 만듭니다. 호텔로 돌아올 때 친절한 뽀뚜가 오토바이로 샌딩까지 해주었습니다^^ -from unni moon

Memorable classes and a local nature walk!. My wife went to two classes at the Ubud Botany Interactive (UBI) over two days (a Beauty Products and Cake class), and she and my daughter and I also enjoyed one of their engaging and unique local walks through local rice fields and farms. The entire team, led by Dewi, is charming, knowledgable and very hospitable. The experience was one of the highlights of our trip to Bali, and a great way to learn about local culture and folk remedies and recipes. Highly, highly recommended!! Thanks, Dewi, Putu, Dika and Wagyu!!

Coconut Oil Cooking Class and learning about Balinese culture. The time we spent with the people from ubi was one of the best experiences we had in Bali. Not only did we learn how to traditionally make coconut oil but we also learnt a lot about the way of life in Bali/Indonesia and the life of the farmers living around Ubud. The class was held in the middle of the rice fields in an area where there is nothing touristic. Dewi and her colleagues explain everything very carefully and are very motivated to give you the best experience. Which we then also had thanks to them.We totally recommend this beautiful experience!

Engaging teacher and amazing products. I had the pleasure of doing both the Botany walk and the Beauty Product course. Dewi, who operates the business, is a very passionate and intelligent woman. She spoke about the ingredients and where they were sourced from with a great deal of knowledge. At the end of the course I had 4 amazing products that I made myself and knew exactly what had gone into them.

Awesome coconut oil making class. We were fortunate to have a private class on how to make coconut oil. This involved visiting Dewis fathers farm where he showed us how to make coconut milk, oil and cream, the taste was incredible. Along the way, we learnt about all the different plants of Bali and their uses. Dewi is a very talented and educated individual whom cares a lot about giving the farmers a fair share of her earnings.

Make your own shampoo, insect repellent, and more in Ubud!. We are a family of five with three young teens. We visited Ubud Botany Interactive near Starbucks in Ubud, spent a few hours making natural botanical products.The owner/instructor Dewi is a young entrepreneur who is passionate about educating people on environment and Balinese culture. She told us stories about her family, Balinese culture, and her passion--botany. It was the most inspiring and educational experience in our vacation in Bali.Next time you visit Ubud, we highly recommend spending a few hours with Dewi. The knowledge you acquire from her is rewarding, and improve your understanding of Bali that guidebooks do not mention.

Fun, informative & interactive. We met up at the shop at 9am & headed out for a morning walk with our guide Wahyu. Learned about the various herbs & uses along the way, seeing/smelling the difference between citronella & lemon grass and many other local practices & cultures.We also took the beauty products class, held at a rest stop next to a rice field. Fantastic ambiance. Our lovely guide, Putu made it humorous & enjoyable. I'm sure i'll be taking home this good knowledge to make some of these when i'm back in Singapore.Thanks Dewi & team for making this a highlight of our trip in Bali :)I'll be back for the other classes the next time i'm in Ubud.

Heart & Soul Nurturing! One of my favorite days in Bali!. I actually did 3 activities with Ubud Botany Interactive! The Health & Beauty Class, Short Walking Tour, and Coconut Oil Cooking Class. I really enjoyed all of them. The walking tour is through some beautiful rice paddies with lots of plant identification along the way, and a refreshing coconut to sip along the way. In the Health & Beauty Class, I used all sorts of fresh Balinese ingredients to create shampoo, body scrub, healing balm, and sunscreen. My favorite day was the coconut oil cooking class, out in the countryside where Dewi grew up. I think it depends on what you are looking for when you take these classes. I saw one review that mentioned the price seemed to high, and they could easily have looked these beauty recipes up on Pinterest and made them at home. My purpose for taking these classes was not simply to learn "how to" information for myself, but rather to have some connection to and interest in the local culture. I decided the best way to do that, is look at my personal interests, and then find local people with the same interests! The classes are a great interface to connect myself with the heart & soul of Bali. I think that is also a big part of Dewi's mission! Thus the name, "Ubud Botany Interactive". She is a lovely woman who established this like minded team and these activities for the mutual benefit of people in her own community as well as those visiting. She has a Bachelors degree in Botany and Agriculture from Udayana University in Denpasar, as well as a Master of Science in Biology specialising in plant biodiversity. Her heart is big, and she cares deeply about her traditional farming roots, her community and helping them, and care & harmony of people and nature! The coconut oil class was out in the rice fields where she grew up. Her dad is incredibly sweet, and will prepare some simple, traditional snacks, cut fresh coconut for you to drink, sugar cane to chew, and show you how to make coconut oil completely from scratch. Even all the tools for the process are very natural. He made his cooking stove from the earth. He fashioned many bamboo tools for the process you will use. He even made the coconut grater (which takes a day to make a grater). The whole day really touched my heart, and the coconut oil smells better than any organic, extra virgin coconut oil that I have ever bought. I could see that it was very precious to him. Not just the oil, but the traditional process of making it! You get to take your coconut oil home. The fields surrounding the scene included rice, corn fields, flower fields for devotional offerings, and smaller plots of cooking vegetables. I grew up on a farm, so being out in the countryside felt lovely, and reminded me of my childhood. My next favorite class was the Beauty products class! I hope this helps with decisions for interacting with
Botanical Product-Making class. Great class, very interesting and great to know that you can use common plants to make the products. The tiger balm was the best.

Would definitely come back !. I loved learning how to make natural beauty products from garden ingredients ! Dewi is very knowledgeable and very welcoming and friendly (as well as her friend !!). I'm already thinking about my next workshop there as to learn more !If you are looking for alternative activities to do in Ubud, it worths it !!

Lovely botanical product-making class. This is for another offering of Dewi's at Ubud Botany Interactive: the class where you make botanical products. I got the whole class to myself and got to make 4 products: shampoo, a scrub, a moisturizer, and a Balinese version of tiger balm. It was fun and I was very impressed with how friendly and knowledgeable Dewi and her team were. They chatted with me the whole time and were very kind. Very reasonable price, too, especially since you get to take home all 4 products you made in pretty generous amounts!

Very informative. Dewi is very proud of her newly established business, and so she should be. The walk was delightful, her knowledge of all plants is amazing, and the whole experience was memorable. Demi also makes some amazing teas, body lotions etc. Would love to return one day and do some of her classes. The price of the tour is extremely reasonable, it does not include transport to and from your home.

Best activity in Ubud!. Dewi has so much knowledge and passion for her people and country. She is really patient and will answer all your questions.I went for a walk to the rice paddies and local area, made beauty products and visited the Holy Water Temple.You really feel like you are contributing to the Balinese community by taking Dewi's tours. She only sources her ingredients from local Balinese farmers and she employs young students so that they can practice their English.I can't recommend highly enough :)Thanks Dewi!

Don't miss it !. Had an amazing morning with Dewi, making a few natural beauty products after a beautiful walk.Dewi was very welcoming, knowledgeable and passionate about supporting local organic farming, and conserving Ubud's botanic diversity & landscape: something about which everyone visiting Bali should get a clearer understanding.We had a great chat and shared a lovely meal from the next door warung.Will definitely come back for the cooking class, the essential oils & native rice.Brilliant !

Lovely walk in Dewi's fathers farm. Was a lovely very short walk in Dewi's father's farm I chose to make cake so we walked in and made cake. Dewi is lovely and very knowledgeable. Her father is very sweet and was there to help cook a traditional cake. I was expecting more of a nature walk taking longer. The distance was right though for a hot day. I would suggest being westerner as we have weak stomachs to wash the things used for preparing including knives in hot water. The food was cooked though so that was fine. It was a lovely morning. Dewi's father cut the coconut like I've never seen before making it very easy to drink made a spout. Nice way to learn about the local farming and hot locals cook.

botanical products class. We had a very good time during the Botanical Products Class in Bali, Ubud.Dewi and Dhika welcomed us with an open heart, hospitality and passion.In less than two hours we made shampoo, face mask, sunscreen and balinese tiger balm and we added a good chapter about Bali life and plants.

Highly recommended . I did the ceremony class and really enjoyed myself. I got a great insight in the Balinese culture and learned how to do an offering myself. Afterwards I went to the water temple and did the traditional ritual. Very interesting experience. Dewi is extremely helpful and kind....

Botanic natural product class and cultural temple visit. First of all: Thank you Dewi and Dhika for this amazing experience.We started with the Natural Product Class and learnt how to make shampoo, sun lotion, body scrub, boreh medicine...It went so great that we decided to book the offering making class followed by the visit to the temple with tradition water purification and prayer dressed in full tradition Balinese clothing. Amazing experience. Dewi and Dhika have built a great project and have a real passion of sharing experience and culture. Not just a tour business but we did make friend! We definitely recommend the tours. May their efforts and smiles be rewarded! Caroline (who loved Durian fruit) and Cedric

Learn to create Balinese products in the heart of Ubud. We learnt how to make beauty products from fresh, local ingredients. The workshop was very informative and we had fun creating shampoo, hair conditioner, body healing scrub, face mask and skin conditioner. All without harmful chemicals or preservatives. Next day I used the healing Balinese paste on my friend who had fever with great results...Dewi, is very patient and explains a lot of things about Balinese herbs, spices and how real Balinese people live... She is committed to the environment and improving conditions for her local rice farming community. Highly recommended!

Brilliant.. Definite highlight of my holiday in Ubud. Dewi Rusty is passionate about sharing traditional Balinese culture and committed to helping her community. Her passion shines through. She is generous, helpful and eager to assist in her classes. Loved this, HIGHLY recommend.

AWESOME authentic Bali experience.. My husband and I recently booked the Botany Walk . From the first onset Dewi and Dhika's are so very passionate about Ubud-Bali, the culture and paying it forward. Dewi’s botany knowledge and her passion for ensuring everyone that has a connection to this wonderful home grown business benefits. The tour was formal and informal, we shared our stories, walked through the local area. Spent real time with local farmers sitting at the foot of their farm lot enjoying a fresh coconuts. We rate this tour and business 5++Stars. A definite MUST DO when in UBUD. The shop is nicely arranged with soaps, medicinal teas and oils all prepared by Dewi with the upmost perfection for purity.We’re going back and this time definitely going to the offering tour.

A glimpse of the real Bali. If you're looking for an authentic Balinese experience, check out some of Dewi and Dhika's delightful offerings. My friend and I took her Balinese cake class, where we made traditional coconut cakes in a traditional shelter in the middle of a rice field near her home village. We were amazed at how delicious freshly grated coconut and rice flout could be! We loved watching Dewi use a bamboo tube to fan the cooking fire. The end result was delicious and we are eager to try it at home. We also did the ceremony class where we made an offering basket and participated in a water purification ceremony at a temple. Dewi guided us through each stage of the ceremony, and provided appropriate clothing. It was a moving experience that neither of us will forget. Dewi and her boyfriend Dhika have a lovely shop where they sell wonderful natural skincare products they make themselves (the coconut face cream and hair mask are amazing!). They also sell wooden products people in her village make. Dewi and Dhika are a hard-working and entrepreneurial couple who are passionate about showing visitors the real Bali. Our time with them was a highlight of the trip.

My best experience in Bali. What a fantastic day.First i had a ceremony class with Dewi so i learned a lot about balinese culture and traditions then with her i could create my own traditional offering basket then we had a trip to the Holy Spring Temple at Tampaksiring for purification.Later we had a restaurant-picnic and then i ate my first Snake-fruit and my first Durian (my delight). A lot of fun !I highly recommand you to do that so exceptionnel class and trip with Dewi and Dihka at Ubud- Bali

Great day in the nature. Me and my husband have recently took part in the Botany Walk and the Workshop. Both were great and pretty informative. Dewi showed us a lot of local plants and told some interesting facts about local culture. We also had lunch with a freshly cut coconut among the rice fields. Shame we didn't know about the option of the Long Walk, it lasts longer and spreads till Dewi's village where she grows more plants. Make sure you mention this when booking as she didn't warn us about such possibility. The Workshop was fun! We made a shampoo, body lotion, real Tiger Balm and scrub while drinking tea made by Dewi. It took place at Ubi Botany nice small shop where you can buy essential oils, herbs, body stuff all prepared by Dewi and hand-crafted goods from wood and coconut shells. Totally recommended, don't miss it.

All of a sudden, the rice terraces made so much sense!. We took Dewi's Botany Walk and then followed up with her Botanical Products class. I found the descriptions of the community management of the rice terraces to be excellent, along with seeing native plants (cocoa, cloves, lemongrass, citronella) to be great. Pam made sunscreen, lotion, hair cream and liniment from the products we found. The liniment took away the a headache quickly, very neat.The store is located on Kajeng street, very quiet, completely away from the hustle and bustle on the main road. You'll enjoy this tour if you have any interest in learning about the Balinese community organization or in natural, organic products and remedies.

Fun time, but just okay. If you're tight on time, no need to prioritize this.. I really liked Dewi and her boyfriend who run this, so I feel unfortunate to give it an average review. But I would've given this a 2 star review had it not been for the fact that I do respect the local people trying to make a good living and the cause is great, of course. I also want to preface this review with that this is based on very high standards, but you might very much love this class.I did the natural product class with them. We made a shampoo, two scrubs and a sunscreen.What I liked: the scrubs were great and I also bought a frangipani lotion from their store that I liked.What I thought wasn't so great: I didn't think we learned all that much in this class even though that was the aim. We were basically given the ingredients and mixed them and that's it. That is really fun of course. It would be great for kids, I think but for adults who want hands on active learning, this falls quite short. I asked questions like what is the active ingredient, what is this ingredient for. Had I not asked those questions, I would've learned even less. But I think that should be basic information in a natural product class, what is the active ingredient, what are substitute options, what are the benefits of each ingredient and how they might be used in other ways, how do the ingredients work together, even how to pick fresh good ingredients. Secondly, we made primarily scrubs. Scrubs are the easiest thing to make, you can take almost any healthy ingredient and mix it with a textured ingredient like rice or oatmeal or salt and you have a great scrub, you literally cannot go wrong. So have half the class on that is really really basic. I think a good class should show a variety of methods of making natural products and a greater variety of products. Making the scrub and the sunscreen was basically the same process, which is mix in a stone grinder bowl. So that's 75% of the class. It's something you could've done at home looking up a recipe on Pinterest for 2 seconds. Making the shampoo was the most interesting part for me because I hadn't made a liquid before, but even the the shampoo we made still had residues in there because the process of removing the soaked ingredients left them. I think a true professional would not let there be so many residue in a product, after all, you wouldn't sell it that way, so why allow your clients to take home such a product.I still wished for something more complex, different processes, etc. I asked if they taught how to make lotion in the class, and she said no because it takes a few days to make lotion, but I still think it could've been done like you see on cooking shows where they show you how to make something and that it needs some time to sit in the fridge, so they take out another one that's been made before and is ready to go. Lastly, I just don't think it's great for the value. It's 300k for 90 minutes. Compared to other things in Ubud for the same value, it kind of falls short. 120k for a 90 min massage. 350k for a cooking class making 8 dishes. 450k to spend a whole day making really beautiful batik or silver jewelry. 300k to make such simple things for an hour and a half without a whole lot of education falls a little short.

Very informative!. I can only endorse the previous favourable reviews about Dewi and her mission to educate visitors about local flora and village customs, as well as to support the local community especially farmers, which is her family background. I'm only sorry that I didn't ask her a lot more questions.

Best experience. . Best people and experience in Ubud! Dewi and Agus are so kind, knowledge and wonderful to spend time with! We loved learning about the life of the farmers, the medicinal plants and how they are used for beauty, food and medicine.

WE LEARNT SO MUCH!. Dewi is one of those truly passionate and knowledgable tour guides that you will ever meet. We are so glad that we booked in for her tour to the Istana Tampak Siring visit. The inside knowledge that you gain is enormous! Our guide was the beautiful Dewi, who also runs Ubud Botany walks and classes. She brought along traditional Balinese costumes for us to be able to gain entry to the very centre of the Holy Temple and the source of the sacred springs. We would highly recommend that you do this!

My best experience in Bali. This experience was so informative and helpful. For years, I've been looking for a natural shampoo that actually works. We made a shampoo in class, and it not only feels and smells amazing, but it actually does the job and is full of wonderful ingredients. We also made a cacao face mask/ scrub that made my skin baby soft. Lastly, we made a balm for pain relief that was very effective. I cannot recommend this class highly enough!! Dewi is extremely knowledgable and helpful. I will come again next time I come to Bali!

Fun and informative morning. Thank you Dewi for sharing your wealth of knowledge on how to make natural, chemical free beauty products with just a few plants. I had a wonderful time and highly recommend this class to anyone who is interested in learning how to reduce the amount of chemicals absorbed through their skin and have fun in the process! In the class you get to make shampoo, sunscreen, face scrub and healing tiger balm (and keep what you make).

So worth it. My friend and I had a fantastic time with Dewi taking the botanical beauty course.Very informative.Very fun.Make sure you take some extra money to buy some of the great products she makes.And make sure you try the tea!!! The best tea I've ever had.So far this was the highlight of my trip.Ten out of ten!!!!
Brilliant experience!. Thank you Dewi and team for a delightful day. I did the botany walk and class, learnt so much and all with a smile as everyone is v friendly. Highly recommended :)

Informative and enjoyable!. I enjoyed a lovely walk and then a product making class with Dewi in her cute little shop in Ubud. Dewi is very knowledgeable about local plants and all their uses, and happy to share insights into the lives of the local farmers who supply her ingredients. She keeps you hydrated with her delicious own-recipe lemongrass tea throughout the class and you can buy some of this to take home too (I did, amongst other things!)A very nice way to spend a couple of hours and her products make for lovely presents to take home.

This is as good as the Tripadvisor reviews suggest!. Lives up to the high expectations set by the previous Tripadvisor reviews. My wife and I did a short walk with Dewi and then the hair/body products class. Both were very interesting and great fun. Aside from Dewi's great insight into the world of botany she also shares a vast amount about Balinese culture, which was one of the highlights of my walk and class. Dewi has started up this business from scratch and her story of growing the business in an ethical and sustainable way is fascinating. Bring some extra cash with you - there are some excellent and very reasonably priced products you will be tempted to buy - all handmade and hand-tested by Dewi!

Botanical classes with Dewi. I enjoyed a lovely morning with Dewi, making natural botanical products: hair conditioner, sun protection, body scrub and healing cream. Dewi is supporting local farmers helping them get a fair deal and uses all sustainable native plants. Its a relaxing and fun way to spend a few hours. All products are wrapped up in banana leaves to take away with you. My favourite product we made was the body scrub which is so easy to make and something I can easily make at home (in cold London I will struggle to find some of the more exotic local ingredients used). The sun protection was also great, I used it the following day and despite being outside all day my fair skin didn't burn at all - fabulous! Just wish I had more time to do some of the other classes with Dewi. See you next time :)

Wonderful experience making all-natural beauty product. . My 12 year old daughter & I had a wonderful time at the beauty product class with Dewi. We learned to make all-natural shampoo, body scrub, traditional Balinese 'Boreh', healing balm and all natural sunscreen. Dewi guided us every step of the way. She is very knowledgeable, warm & a welcoming person. She also has an array of great products which you can purchase on site. The essential oils are amazing. Everything we made smelled wonderful. Truly an enjoyable experience and will come back, thank you Dewi!

Ceremony class - learn how to make a traditional offering. Dewi is an intelligent, thoughtful and welcoming person. My daughter and I took the Ceremony class to learn how to make a traditional offering. It is the best way to appreciate the Balinese culture by understanding the meaning behind a traditional offering. Dewi had everything prepared for our class and allowed us to ask any question about the process of making the offerings as well as any questions we may have on Balinese culture. I highly recommend taking any of her classes. I wish we had time to take more!

Fun and relaxing . I went to Ubud Botany with my mother and sister. We made our own natural shampoo, scrub, sunscreen and healing balm. It was a great experience. It was fun and we learnt a lot at the same time. Our teacher was so nice and passionate about what she's doing, it was great. They also have a great range of 100% natural products for sale at reasonable prices.

Great beauty making products class. Very central, but tucked away from the noisy streets of Ubud, this is a great class to do. I made completely natural shampoo, face mask and body scrub, healing balm and sunscreen lotion. The passion for eco friendly products and giving farmers a fair price for their products is fantastic. The class is around is around £!7/ $25 and you can also buy ready made masks at the shop as well. Would highly reccomend!

Ubud Botany Walk. We took a botany walk around the rice paddies of Ubud which lasted about 1.5 hours. We were shown all different kinds of plants and trees to get educated where cocoa, mangosteen, cloves, lemongrass and other fruits and spices come from. She also explained how irrigation of the rice paddies and the local rural communities work in Bali. We had a really nice time there and we were kindly offered cake and tea by Dewi which was delicious. In the store/office of the cooperative you can buy organic foods and cosmetics which are produced by the cooperating farmers.

Wonderful experience. We visited dewis ceremony Workshop and it was a Wonderful experience, she is Really Nice and explains a lot. Also the Food was good and i Love all her organic Products she sells, the homemade coconut oil smells sooo good. I highly recommend her.

Water Temple Tour. Hi there!The temple tour was really exciting. Dewi explained the whole ceremony to us - and a lot more!I learnt a lot of the religious traditions, the school system, the agriculture und had an ecxellent lunch (made by Dewis Mum!) at the end of the tour.It was a unbelieveable and very interesting day with her, she is a very kind and loveable person :-)If you like personal tours with small groups and want to know more about Bali - besides your lonely planet or whatever - I can really recommend this tour!Nici

A chance to see into the true heart of Bali". Imagine the joy of joining a young, hard working, well educated Balinese daughter on a journey from the Ubud city streets to the countryside of her farming village on the outskirts of town. A young woman whose love of people, family, and mother earth cannot be contained. Imagine passing through rice fields and farm trails to stop at the edge of a newly harvested field only to learn about plants you pass, the land in transition and the fruit ripening on the trees. Where the farmers telephone is a carved bamboo pole that has a drumstick to tap a rhythm on. Each beat having a special meaning to the workers in the fields. Imagine that every curious question you have about Balinese life, land, religion and customs is answered with an open and honest heart. Imagine the great fun of grinding down coconut and being taught to make oil out over the a field fire in a grass hut like a true Balinese. That was just a part of our glorious, informative and heartfelt adventure with Dewi! Do not miss this amazing young woman and this unique experience!

Feeling the heart & soul of Bali nature. Meeting Dewi, a delightful and generous girl with a big heart and the purest love for nature I have ever seen, was a mere coincidence which changed my stay in Bali completely. I came across her small shop in Kajeng street, Ubud, as she was watering her plants and instantly felt she is different than most of other shop owners in overcrowded but nonetheless magical Ubud. She invited me in, offered me some organic hot chocolate and coffee and started talking to me as if we have been friends for ever. When she explained her dreams and efforts to make the world a better place, to keep nature as it used to be and to help small Ubud farmers, who are more and more feeling the negative aspects of globalization, she deeply touched my heart. In her beautiful shop she organizes several workshops which you can attend even if you are alone - there is no timetable or minimum number of participants, which makes it a very personal experience. I attended a workshop in which we made natural hair conditioner, body healing scrub, face mask and skin conditioner with locally-sourced plants and fruit. She packed the products in small packages made of palm leaves so I could enjoy my "self-made spa treatment" in my bungalow. The next day she took me for a two-hours walk through the rice fields around Ubud and explained (in perfect English) Balinese culture and ceremonies, the everyday life of a farmer including the troubles farmers are facing due to globalization and her childhood memories. She grew up in the rice fields and her love for nature lead her to study biology. She explained the rice field irrigation system, showed me a variety of plants and how they use them in everyday life (the flowers they use to color textile, the bamboo they use for building houses and another type of bamboo they use exclusively for building temples etc.), we saw the avocado tree, clove tree, different types of rice, papaya, ginger, lemon grass and much much more. It was fun, educational, very interesting and really worth the money.Dewi is a lovely person and if you are a nature lover and want to see Ubud through the eyes of a local you should definitely visit her. She is like a ray of sunshine, with an open heart and big dreams, she helps the local farmers with selling their products (coffee, cocoa, oils ...) in a "fair food" manner and she is kind to everyone. She helped me in various ways and I knew I could come to her for advice or just a chat over a nice cup of delicious cocoa. I stopped to say hello every time I passed by her shop (my bungalow was in the same street), I met her cousins and her boyfriend, her mother made me delicious snacks wrapped in palm leaves and they truly made me feel as if I have an Ubud family far away from home. I will surely go back to visit Bali one day and Ubud Botany Interactive will definitely be the first stop on my list.

Unexpected gem. My hotel helped me find this tour and I wasn't expecting it to be so much about medicinal plants and agriculture in Bali but what a great surprise ! Made is extremely knowledgeable and was kind to answer each and every possible question I had be it about nature or Bali's customs. I wish I had known about this tour earlier as I would surely have booked for more activities with them.

Ubud Botany - Discover by walking and talking. I was curious about how the rice fields work, and what Balinese people grew in their gardens and what Ceremony was all about. From the Ubud Botany office/workshop a short walk led to a number of rice paddies where Dewi explained how the farmers worked the rice paddies, and what life is like for a farmer. Along the way a number of trees and vines etc were identified and we said hello to a few of the locals. It was not a long or taxing walk, and as part of my time with Dewi was to create and understand the ideas behind the offering basket for Ceremony I purchased a sarong in one of small shops along the rice paddy path (that fits with the idea of understanding and appreciating the culture). The walk & talk, then the ceremony basket workshop was about two and half to three hours altogether. I learned Dewi offered a day trip to her village, which included a hands on Balinese cooking lesson and another day option is the Ceremony Basket and visit to the Water Temple. I did not have the time for that this trip, but will come back and do those day trips next time. Think of questions you want to ask about Balinese culture - Dewi is practical, very knowledgeable and determined to help the farmers.

i was so glad i found them. when so much of Bali is drowning amidst the commercialism these folks offer us a glimpse of what is almost lost. their walks are eye opening and mind expanding. Knowing they have a unique relationship with a local farming family is heart warming. especially knowing they are preserving their own families farms in their own Subak (the new word I learnt for their a Balinese irrigation co-op ) and the skincare recipes I will use this summer :) thanxxx

Not your tourist tour. Dewi taught us how to make ceremony baskets that followed to a visit and water blessing at a temple. The volcanic spring water was incredibly clean and refreshing. We made our traction all offerings before going into the water. We went to each pipe to ask for blessing and thank for receiving blessings. Then we changed out if our wet clothes and put on traditional appropriate Balinese wear that Dewi brought, and entered an area only those asking for prayer could go in. We got blessing from priest and had lunch from Dewis parents farm and a local warang, which we would never experience on our own. Drove pass the terraced rice paddies. Today we go to zdewis family farm to make our own coconut oil and have lunch.

A most inspiring experience!. This is one extraordinary young lady! After two hours with Dewi, I was amazed at what she does: She takes you on a walk through the rice fields and every couple of meters she shows you a plant, a flower, a spice… that alone would be worth the tour. But Dewi is a lot more: a daughter of traditional farmers with an university degree in agriculture, Dewi does not only know everything about growing rice, but has a vision of bringing modern tourism and traditional farming together in harmony. Listening to her, I was amazed at how she approaches Bali’s future in a creative, comprehensive manner: This young lady has a lot of scientific knowledge, and she combines it with a great respect for tradition, a search for harmony and sustainability and a humble attitude towards life. Dewi understands that Bali’s tourism cannot exist without Bali’s farmers, and she has a vision of how both can coexist. I do believe that people like Dewi are Bali’s future – if you can, meet her, support her, and let her share with you.

Going natural - Health and Beauty class and discovering the secret of Coconut Oil making.. I spent two lovely afternoons with Dewi and her Family learning loads about how easy healthy living can be by making your own natural and organic beauty and health producs, food and teas. The knowledge about coconut oil making is priceless as I use a lot of it at home :)Ubi - Ubud Botany Interactive is also a great place to meet like-minded people and share tips and experiences.Thank you Dewi and Agus

The Best Way to Experience Genuine Bali Agriculture!. This was an amazing and touching experience that I will never forget.We were brought to the farm and home of Dewi where we learned about the farming and the plants of Bali. I was amazed of how many things you can do with plants, other then eating them. My girlfriend got a little cut on her finger, and they used plants to clean and stop the bleeding (it worked :) )We made organic coconut oil in traditional Balinese way, on a fire and without electricity. We tasted delicious fruits and food. When we were finished making the oil, we took one bottle with us home.One of the greatest moments was in meeting Dewi's family. They greeted us with smiles, hugs and open arms. You could feel their hospitality and genuine care for us. I felt that I learned more about the authentic Balinese culture from this trip, then from our trip combined to Bali.You encounter a part of Bali that has not been affected by tourism and modern society. One of the elderly farmers cried of happiness, when we were the first people to ever take a picture of him.This is an experience of a lifetime!

Botany walk & Botanical Product Class - best experience in Ubud!. We are so happy we did this Botany walk and the Botanical Class! When we came to Ubud, we wanted to learn something that could teach us about the authentic Balinese people, culture and traditions. Dewi is such a inspiring teacher, and a beautiful human being. I would highly recommend this experience if you are going to Ubud!

Interesting learning experiance. First we went on a very interesting walk. We learned a lot of unexpected things about the beautiful surroundings of Ubud.
The workshop was very nice as well. The atmosphere is easy and friendly. You can take home the products you just learned to make, and the recipes you wrote down. Now I can try to make them at home!
Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. Great walk. Very informative. Tour starts and ends with snacks!!! The guide was very informative and genuine. A+

Really interesting and informative!. My friend and I had been very interested in all the ceremonial offerings that were left everywhere around ubud so we decided to take Dewi's ceremony class. She started out with her back story, how life is for farmers here in Bali, and how she got to where she is today. We got free Balinese drinks and a banana cake. She taught us how to make the offering baskets and gave a ton of information on every part of it. It's definitely worth going to take one of her classes. I only wish we had had time to tKe more than one!
Ceremony class. 100% would recommend for an activity in Ubud! Dewi was an excellent host! My friend and I had a great time and learnt lots :)

workshop Balinese offering. My friend and I wanted to know how to make a Balinese offering, which flowers to use in which colors and why. We learned everything we wanted to know by Rusti Dewi. Not only the offering, also about kaja & kelod, home temples, herbal information etcetera. Rusti Dewi is a very helpful & patient teacher.

So happy to have met Medicine Woman Dewi =). As a Cert. Herbalist from America, I found Dewi's knowledge of the traditional cosmetic and medicinal use of local plant life very informative. She also sells a fabulous stock of well made herbal products ... she is truly interconnected into the plant kingdom and the real deal for those seeking a local Herbalist/Medicine Woman. I will visit her shop again when I return to Bali. <3

Best experience in Ubud! . We stumbled upon this place as we were walking to the rice fields. We made an appointment for the same week and had the best experience in Ubud. With the help and great knowledge of the owner Dewi we made our own sunscreen, face mask, conditoner/shampoo and boreh. She thought us a lot about the Balinese lifestyle, (agri)culture and a lot of natural products. She is a very smart woman who built this place by staying true and faithfull to herself and others. She built everything from scratch. We have a lot of respect for her and she's a big inspiration. We really recommend a visit to this place so you can get inspired as well!

Please support this tour!. We are so happy we did this tour. We were looking for a tour in Ubud which was less scripted, something that could teach us about life, beliefs, and ingenuity of Balinese people. We learned so much from Dewi. She is an amazing person who can be inspirational to anyone in the world. We learned about the farming situation in Bali, and also how it's done. We learned about fruits, herbs, and plants that can be found growing anywhere on the island. We also learned how those plants are used, and after the informative, calming, peaceful walk, we got to make all natural products such as tigerbalm, sunscreen, shampoo, and others. The knowledge and insight Dewi has is wonderful to be exposed to. Please feel free to get to know her and her goals to improve the lives of Balinese. We will visit again and hope to help in the future.

Best experience we had in Ubud!. Dewi and Agus are fantastic educators and guides. We learned so much about agriculture and plants in Ubud. It was particularly enlightening learning about the plight of Ubud's farmers and great that Dewi and Agus support them. Not to mention all the lovely little snacks and drinks we were greeted with. A must do if you're in Ubud!Sam and April

Very interesting workshop, making a daily Hindu offering.. Dewi welcomed us with a cold and spicy tea. We learned how to make a daily offering and afterwards we made a sort of tigerbalm. No matter what you are doing at Ubi, it's pure joy. You got a lot of information from here and she was still willing to answer all the questions we had. She learned us a lot of the offerings and the Hindu traditions. In the afternoon you can book a trip to Tirta Empul to take the offering and go into the Holy water. We did not because we just went there the day before. It was quite an experience and highly recommended for everyone who wands to learn more about Bali and Hinduism. I wish Dewi al the best and hope she succeed in what she is up to. Tnx Dewi
An informative walk. I really enjoyed the walk through the rice-fields with Dewi. It was very informative and she's teaching you a lot about Bali. I highly recommend it!

unique & fun! learn to make natural beauty products. really enjoyed our time at Ubud Botany class. we learned to make our own natural beauty products! sunscreen, face mask, and others using fresh herbs and coconut oil. Dewi is a fantastic host/teacher and will inspire you by her incredible sense of community- all of her profits go straight to the local farmers that provide the stuff you get to work with. must do if you're in ubud!

Interesting and educational. I thoroughly enjoyed my few hours spent learning about herbs and making natural products with Dewi. She is a sweet and humble young lady with true aspirations to help the local people of Bali. Her ethical business practices are a breath of fresh air and I hope she exceeds in her plans.It was easy to contact and book the class - I just did the natural product making bit - and I was welcomed with a natural hot cocoa drink and balinese sweet.Her shop has many natural products of which I purchased a few and use back in the UK.I loved the hair conditioner and body srcub!Hope to see this business flourish for Dewi and her family.

Amazing Family you must visit Dewi 32 Kajeng Street, a unique Balinese experience. We met Dewi when she was running a botanical class at her shop, please go see her, she does Health and Beauty Classes, Ceremony classes, Balinese Cake Cooking Classes, various walks and tours, she is such a lovely young lady and very informative. Prices are very reasonable, she started Ubud Botany Interactive to share her knowledge of native plants and how they are used in Balinese culture, she has a bachelor degree in botany and agriculture and a master of science specialising in plant biodiversity.you will not be disappointed and will learn lots, highly recommend. Thanks Dewi so nice to meet you.

A must do!. I did the both the workshop and the walk with Dewi and Agus and loved it. Dewi and Agus want to create a business that pays farmers better for their hard work while educating visitors about traditional balinese farming. Coming from a farmers family they are a very knowledgeable source regarding plants, herbs, the Balinese culture as well as organic farming. It was a wonderful experience learning about all the herbs and medicinal plants, being able to recognize them and learning how to use them. The fact that Dewi is also a real Balinese biologist with real knowledge on plants and nature enriches the experience even more. And they are very generous with their time and more than happy to answer any questions you may have! I stayed in Ubud for 2 months and was always welcome at their little shop for some company and hot chocolate. Which is the best organic chocolate I ever had! U don't want to miss this experience or meeting with Dewi and Agus. Two lovely souls who have become my friends and are both very committed to the environment and to improving conditions for the local farming community. Definitely a must do in Ubud. Authentic and very informative. This is of one of those experiences that will stay with you long after you've returned home.

Botanical Product Class was one of our best experiences in Bali!!!. Me and my wife joined the Botanical Product Class and we met Dewi at her shop. Dewi taught us how to make shampoo/conditioner, face mask, sun screen/moisturizer and body healing scrub from 100% organic, sustainable and natural ingredients. We were given some traditional tools to cut, grind and mix the ingredients and were taught the authentic traditional way of making these products, which we enjoyed very much. According to my wife, the face mask works really well on her skin since she's quite sensitive to chemicals. The shampoo/conditioner is also wonderful as it leaves a pleasant flowery scent and we could really feel the difference on our hair.Dewi was passionate, sweet, patient, knowledgeable and she taught us many secrets of nature and how we should embrace it. We were so touched by her philosophy of caring for the environment and her belief in fair trade to help local farmers instead of making profits for herself. She's an inspiration and her cause is truly noble.We'd recommend anyone to try her fun classes and organic products.

Special tour with Enthusiastic tour guide. It's a small shop owned by two people, which they insist to bring private tour with small group.We two people ,follow a male guide who really familiar with all kinds of plants, he did share lots of plants knowledge to us.He is funny and kind that we chatted happily. He told us they cooperated with the local farmers that hopefully can help them earn more $$. Introducing fair trade to farmers also can help the organic farms to survive Another owner taught us to make shampoo , body scrub sun block and coco mask, it's so interesting and organic.all things come from natural products .At last, they even bought take away food and dinner with us ,we chat like friends . Really wonderful and meaningful tour! You can meet locals, learn local cultural , and more importantly, we agree with their views, really appreciate their effort and support them to protect the nature .

Best experience in Ubud!. If you are in Ubud, we highly recommend that you visit Agus and Dewi at Ubi! We took the Nature Walk with Agus and learned all about the local agriculture, healing herbs and traditions. The walk could not have been more informative and interesting! After the nature walk, Ashira did the Natural Beauty Course with Dewi where she learned how to make Balinese Beauty Products from farm fresh and all natural ingredients. After the class we shared a local, farm fresh lunch with them and enjoyed a lively conversation. After meeting Agus and Dewi, we continued to visit them regularly and drink cocoa and coffee with them. They quickly become our best friends in Ubud.

THE most enjoyable 'learning' I've ever experienced.. The first time I saw Dewi's cute little shop I wanted to know who was behind it. The use of recycled materials is truly creative so it's no surprise the workshop was top quality.
