Dewi's is unlike any other person I've met, she is genuine in her care of others, the environment and passionate about sharing her wealth of knowledge. I was lucky enough to have spent my last day in her company, absorbing her knowledge and creating the most unique botanical Beauty products. If you're thinking about doing this, don't hesitate. You're time could not be better spent. If I was there any longer I would have done all 3 workshops. I'm now looking forward to creating these gifts at home for friends. Can't wait to go back and catch up with Dewi again and support this lovely genuine girl in her future plans. She's a true gem.

Real Bali. While staying at Villa Kalisat I was taken to meet Dewi and Agus of Ubi Botany Interactive. Agus took us on a gentle walk through a rice paddy which was very informative and gave an insight into the life of the farmers who work so hard for so little. There were many plants along the way that Agus identified like Tumeric, Cacao and Ylang-ylang. Then we returned to the workshop where we were treated to some natural hot chocolate and Dewi taught us how to make a Traditional Offering after which we had a Balinese lunch. Dewi and her brother Agus had so much knowledge and enthusiasm I shall return again to enjoy some more of their workshops.

Informative, authentic experience. I've read many trip advisor reviews but this is the first I've wrote. I really can't recommend visiting Dewi enough. I did the botanical products workshop this morning and she was able to accommodate me at short notice. A lovely, sweet girl who taught me a lot not only about the products but about Balinease life. By doing one of Dewis activities you are helping support a great initiative as she is working with local farmers. I can't wait to have a pamper using the products I've made! I wish Dewi the best of luck with her business and I'm sure I will see her again soon!

Ubud Botanical Class -very interesting and great experience in Ubud with Dewi. By chance we saw Dewis Shop as we walked trough Ubuds streets. We decided to book the botany walk through the rice fields and countryside. That was such a good experience that we wanted to do the botanical class as well. So 2 days after we sat together with Dewi in her beautiful shop and learned a lot about doing products just with natural ingredients. It was a lot of fun as well as we got some helpful hints from Dewi. We went home with a big smile and we wish Dewi all the best for her business and a lot of curious and content customers. We can recommend both the botanical walk and the botanical class a lot.

Real Bali experience. It was a very lucky day, when I first met Dewi and Agus on Kajeng street. They invited me in their nice little place and while we talked, I realised that I have found what I had wished for. Lovely local people, who like to share the beauty and knowledge of their homeland with the visitors. On my second visit in Ubud I joined the Health and Beauty Products class which I enjoyed very much and I hope next time I come for more, especially the Botanic walk :)Thank you Dewi and Agus and I am looking forward to see you again.

Uniques walking tour experience. Lovely morning spent with Dewi & Agus learning about Bali agriculture. Very knowledgeable and passionate about botany and sustainability which provided a fascinating insight into the local culture and life of the farmers. They were both very generous with their time & were more than happy to answer any questions we had. Highly recommend if you have an interest in agriculture and looking for something different.

Wonderful idea - everyone can support. Great idea to show and tell People about balinese culture and worklife of a Farmer. Wonderfully explained, you can ask all questions you may have. Everyone can Support a Little by doing this Tour- the Farmers will get half of the Tour Price you pay. Wishing Dewi and her Brother all the best with their Project and lots of Love.

Brilliant experience. I had an amazing 1 to 1 class with Dewi, who was a great teacher and host. We had some delicious locally sourced refreshments together and then began the class. We made four products, all of which looked and smelled amazing. I felt like I learned a lot about botany and Balinese culture. I would definitely recommend the class and would do it again.

Amazing Walks and Guides. I work at a botanical garden and was looking for more than just a rice paddy walk. I certainly found that and more with Ubi. Dewi and Agus were enthusiastic, knowledgeable and most importantly friendly and caring guides. It's clear they have a strong love and connection to the plants and landscape of their home and an authentic desire to share it with visitors.Their walks are designed for small groups to maximize personal attention and are easy for all abilities. They bring a unique perspective to they way the Balinese people weave local flora into their daily lives. I would certainly take another course with Ubi and wish them every success.

Inspired and Inspiring Local Insight. Ubi offered so many fantastic, interesting courses that I'd like to take one each day! We did a beautiful rice paddy walk and learned so much about plants and local culture. Dewi and Augus went above and beyond to create an engaging and interactive small-group experience. They were knowledgeable, creative, and beyond kind. I feel so fortunate to have discovered this opportunity in Bali and I highly recommend it. Cheryl WoodmanToronto, Canada

Anna Wild. What an inspiring morning I had with the lovely Dewi. I learnt so much about all the local plants and vegetation, inside knowledge from a botanical pro, Dewi also teaches you to make natural products for health and skin. It made a nice change to being in the busy streets of Ubud, instead a meditative morning in the beautiful padi fields. Thank you Dewi.

Fun and knowledgeable. Dewi will take you away from the busyness of Ubud centre into the farmlands and countryside that surround the area. We learnt a lot about plants that can be used to make natural products for sustainable living and had great fun doing it. She is very helpful and happy to share her knowledge.

Best activity in Ubud. A must do in Ubud. Authentic classes and very informative walk. Dewi opens your eyes (and soul) on the surroundings.The fact that she is a real Balinese biologist who actually holds the real knowledge on plants and nature enriches the experience. Fully recommendable to everyone who wants to acquire knowledge outside the mass travel guide.

Excellent sustainable tourisim!. If you are interested in what is involved in getting the 'nasi' from the field, into the 'nasi goreng' that is on your plate - do this tour! Dewi, a biology graduate who comes from a rice farming family, is passionate about sharing her traditional and scientific knowledge on Balinese rice farming and culture. The walk you take through the rice fields close to the Ubud town center is semi structured, Dewi will show you and talk about rice, coconuts and other important plants, how they are used as well as their significance. Ask as many questions as you like, as Dewi will gladly answer them, as well as focus the tour based on your interests. Following my walk, I did the botanical class and made a range of wonderful products to use on the body. The plant products used are ones that were identified and spoken about on the walk. The things you make are lovely, and are easy to make on your own. You can take home what you make in biodegradable/recyclable containers.Dewi is realising a dream by building this business, and she is sharing the benefits with her community. She lives by her principles of sustainability, and these principles are reflected in her business. It was a pleasure to meet her and participate in her tour and class.

Fantastic authentic experience of natural health and beauty products. I completed the botany class on my visit to ubud and thoroughly enjoyed it - worth every penny. It was out near the rice fields so convenient for the walk if you choose, but easy walking distance from anywhere in town. Dewi and the team were welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable chatting to us about the business, balinese life and culture. Dewi has studied biology and gives lots of details on the plants and spices used. We made tea, conditioner, face mask, healing scrub and sun lotion all from leaves, petals, ginger, rice etc. The class last about 1.5 hours and was relaxing and fun, will definitely recommend to friends and family!

Botany Class. My friend and I did the Botany class this morning with Dewi and made some hair conditioner, moisturiser, face scrub, face mask and some warming tea. It was a really fantastic experience. We learnt lots about the products and how we could make them at home and got to keep what we had made. Dewi even organised for us to get a local lunch that was very yummy and spent ages chatting to us about life in Bali which was incredibly interesting. Highly recommended.

BOTANICAL CLASS. Whilst staying at a nearby resort I watched Dewi's little shop develop and open with interest and after meeting Dewi and Agus outside one day and finding out what their concept was, I was hooked on taking up the class.It was a wonderful and eye opening experience. Dewi's knowledge of the natural products and their use was enlightening and after learning what they were and how they were used I was pleased to be able to produce the creams and lotions myself for use back at the hotel.Well worth the time and money - highly recommend you try it and learn how to use back home instead of forking out lots of money for shop bought products.Take the class and throw in a little extra donation to help them thrive.Great job Dewi - thank youPat - Australia

Wonderful , beautiful, informative and fun walk through local rice fields. I spent a wonderful morning with Dewi walking through the local Ubud rice fields. Her educational tour about anything Balinese you would like to know was great. She is passionate about helping the rice farmers create a sustainable and fair price for their back breaking work we all take for granted when we buy cheap rice from the supermarket. She is inspiring to hear about her desire to create a business on freshly made natural, organic products using local rice. She wants to buy local rice for a fair price to use in her products. She grew up the daughter of a rice farmer in a neighboring village and was fortunate enough to get a scholarship and complete a botany degree. She was very informative about local plants and after the tour she taught me about local remedies used in Bali and we had fun making some of these with natural, local products. I especially loved her biodegradable bamboo take away containers for your products. A big thank you to her mother who made us a delicious local treat to eat on our walk. Thanks Dewi!
More than just a walk. Dewi’s walking tour through the rice paddies was a excellent insight into the local farming practices and culture.

a walk through Balinese culture, language and botany. You could do this cruisy stroll through the rice fields by yourself in an hour or so and be impressed by the landscape and scenery of Ubud but if you walk with Dewi you'll get a whole lot more. In the 3 hours that I spent on this walk I learnt more about Balinese culture, language and botany than I have in 5 or so trips to Bali. What I like most is that she's committed to the environment and to improving conditions for the local rice farming community. I highly recommend taking a walk with Dewi. It's one of those experiences that will stay with you long after you've returned home.

Great insight into Bali Life & Culture. We enjoyed a 2 hour nature walk amongst rice fields and learnt a good amount about the Balinese traditions and way of life. Dewi was our guide, and she comes across as a deeply strong and passionate woman who supports her local farming community, knowing first hand being the daughter to a rice farming family. She has a natural calm presence which allows the tour to be a great and comfortable experience. I highly recommend taking an early morning or afternoon tour with Dewi before you go anywhere else. Namaste

A cool stroll through the green rice fields. What a fascinating insight into the lives of local Balinese farmers. Dewi was a great teacher. She shared her vast knowledge of local plants and their uses as well as the customs and culture that surrounds the faming community. We learnt so much about the local plants and what they are used for and got to taste milk straight from a freshly picked coconut. How amazing to see the farmer scamper up the tree with such ease and fetch us down a fresh coconut. I highly recommend this tour to anyone looking for a real insight into the lives of the locals and to support this very enterprising young farmer's daughter.

Unique, interesting and authentic. This is because of Dewi's unique view of nature, culture and enterpreneuring. She is a Biology student at the University of Denpasar and therefore she knows a lot about local plants and their usage. I did the botanical walk and class. Not only did I learn about local plants and trees; Dewi also told me a lot about Balinese culture, language and living. During the botanical class I made 5 kinds of natural care products like a hair conditioner, a moisturizer and a detox drink. It worked like a charm because my hair and skin were really soft. Conclusion: a must do if you want to have an authentic Bali experience.

Growing Rice is Difficult. Make Sure You always FINISH Your Rice :D. Thank you Dewi for organizing a simple sightseeing tour in Ubud :)During the trip, Dewi told me about how the farmers have been treated unfairly in the community. Farmers have been working so hard under the sun from morning to night. However, they receive very little when they sell their rice, corn, or other fruits and vegetables...During the trip, it was after harvesting season and during Galungan celebration as well. That's why, I cannot observe the farmers in action :DMoreover, Dewi will share to you about her small project to help the farmers community.I wish you all the best, Dewi :)May you and your loved ones always be well and happy :)

talk a walk on the rice side. We stumbled over Dewi coincidentially when she already made a tour with a couple from Australia. We were allowed to join and have experienced a very interesting and informative walk through the ricefields. The afternoon teached us a lot about agriculture and tradition,about plants and their cure,about coconuts and star of Bethlehem, Frangipani and ylang-ylang, about the Balinese and ...foremost about harmony with nature and the spirits. Thanks Dewi for your enthusiasm and passion. We highly recommend the tour to broaden your own horizon and support this bright young woman.Daniela&Christoph

A Great Way To Experience Bali!. Dewi posseses a great knowledge about Balinese plants and culture and provided a wonderful introduction to agricultural life in Bali. Her tour was fun and insightful. I highly recommend it!

Support a great socially responsible local business. Like the other reviews said, Dewi is a great tour guide but more importantly, she is trying to build a socially responsible business that can preserve the traditional Balinese agricultural culture in a growing commercialized tourist area. The tour itself is about 2 hours long and is usually held in the morning when it is much cooler. Dewi was kind enough to take us on a tour after lunch since our schedule was tight. Her knowledge about local botany is impressive and her explanations about Balinese culture is fascinating. On the tour, we met a local coconut farmer who let us sample his home made coconut oil and gave an impromptu lesson on how to climb a coconut tree. It was quite an experience and one of the most culturally rewarding ones. This tour is great for anyone of all ages as Dewi will adjust the length of the walk accordingly.

Walking in the farmlands. I stayed in Bali for 2 months and spent 1 week in Ubud. I heard about the irrigation system for rice and everything in Bali and I was wondering how it worked. Dewi showed me everything regarding rice farming: agriculture together with culture and traditions. She described every step from a seed to nasi goreng. Moreover during the walk in the farms she was telling me curious facts about every single plant in our way. I knew what is lemongrass and ylang-ylang only tea or cosmetics, and couldn't even imagine how the plant really looked like. The walk with Dewi was supplemented with awesome homemade traditional Balinese cakes. Yummi! :)Absolutely great experience in the early morning. I do recommend it for everyone interested in nature and organic food.

Ricefields around Ubud. If you want to see ricefields you find them right behind the door - if you stay in Ubud. And it is worth to find a guide, there are so many things you will not see until somebody explains them. At least this was our experience.We were lucky to get in contact with Devi, who is an excellent guide, very sympatic and professional. Raised in a farmer family she knows everything about ricegrowing and the situation of these hard working people. She showed us the beautiful nature of her homeland as well as the problems they have to deal with. A walk with Devi is a every worthful experience!

Walk with Devi. We had a wonderful time with Devi and her sister and learnt so much about agriculture, plants and Balinese culture, it is a pity that this was our last day on the Island. The walk is easy to go even when it gets hot, we would recommend it to anyone who stays in Ubud for a couple of days. Devi is a very intelligent and sensitive person who can explain agriculture as well as the Balinese spirituality integrated in daily life.

Herbal walk. Wonderful, interesting walk! Dewi, named after the goddess of rice bij her farmer parents talks passionate about plants and herbs. She combines her practical knowledge and the knowledge of her studies which makes it an educational and cultural walk. Thx Dewi!

Serene and informative walk with an authentic insight to Balinese culture. This walk was one of our best experiences in Ubud. Conveniently located just off one of the main street, you are quickly able to escape into nature and get this local's amazing insight on traditional Balinese uses of plants, whether for food, medicine, religion, or even cosmetics (have you ever made conditioner from hibiscus leaves...!? You'll be amazed!!) The walk also take you through the rice 'subak' where Dewi, the daughter or rice farmers, will explain everything you need to know about these community run systems. The best part for me was the underpinning insight gained about Balinese culture and religion, most importantly the concepts of respect and balance. Dewi is fantastic!! If you are looking for an authentic experience - this is the place to start!!

Relaxed, enjoyable and informative nature walk with a local expert. This walk is a leisurely two-hour stroll along the scenic paths of an extensive area of rice fields just north of central Ubud with Dewi from a local farm family in a neighboring village. In addition to her practical knowledge of Bali agriculture from growing up on the farm, she has studied botany at university and biodiversity at graduate school, so she can speak about many aspects of Bali agriculture and botany from cultural, societal, health and scientific perspectives. In her promotional materials, Dewi says that she can tailor the walk to your own interests, and that is what we found. There is something for everyone. You might want to simply take a walk through the fields with someone who can explain what you are looking at. Dewi showed us many plants used in health and beauty remedies and explained how they are used (complete with recipes), demonstrating, for example, how to create your own hair conditioner in a matter of seconds – one of the “wow” factors for my eleven year old daughter. She also explained how various fruit, flowers, spices and vegetables can be identified, classified, and used for a range of ailments (with recipes too), including a hilarious story from her childhood about the care needed in balancing the special properties of guava and papaya (if you know what I mean).If you are interested in the social or cultural sides of Bali agriculture, then Dewi has something to say about that too. For example, she had already explained how the subak irrigation system works but as she pointed out the sole building standing when she began giving tours, she shared with my daughter and I how the society deals with members who sell or otherwise divert their land for hotels or other non-agricultural uses. She also shared her own ideas about how rice farmers might diversify their use of the land in a value-added yet sustainable way.Bali Agriculture and Botany Walk is more than just a walk in the beautiful countryside or a demonstration of plants used in health and beauty remedies, though it surely includes that. Imagine a conversation with a local Balinese as you stroll the rice fields of Ubud. If that is what you are looking for, then I highly recommend this tour.

Wonderful walk. This walk throught the ricefields from ubud was a wonderful experience for my friend an me. Dewi gave us so many informations about the plants and trees and told us, how to use them for your health. You can ask her everything about the culture and traditions in Bali. She was so open and friedly and full of respect for the environment. It was a very great day and ich would recommend this trip to everybody, who is interested in the culture and nature from Bali.Thank you for this wonderful trip, Dewi!!!Best regards from Germany...Christina

Very informative tour!. We found the flyer for Dewi's tour by pure chance and decided immediately to book for the next morning. A good choice! Dewi explained us in detail how rice cultivation is done and what the different plants, flowers and fruits can be used for. We really enjoyed it, she is doing an excellent job and her approach is quite different from the usual balinese tourist tours. I can only recommend this experience!

A great and very interesting experience. While walking through the rice fields Dewi explained how farmers plant and harvest rice and how paddy fields are irrigated; she showed us various plants and talked about how they are used in daily life. The homemade cake she brought was delicious. Then a balinese guy climbed on a coconut palm and took one coconut for each person and we drank the fresh coconut water!I'm very happy to have made this experience and recommend this tour to everyone who spends some time in Ubud and is interested in nature and Balinese tradition!

Interesting and informative, with a very welcoming hostess. Really enjoyed the tour, I had been wondering about the rice paddies, native farming and indiginous plant uses since I started travelling through Indonesia and this was the perfect tour to answer all my questions. Dewi is very friendly and knowledgeable, and there is a strong relationship between the tour and the local farmers, which results in a very positive feeling for you as a tourist.

A pleasant change from the streets. Dewi took us on a journey through the fields near ubud, and described how each and every plant in the landscape has a use for which most of us will be unaware. She has a solid agricultural background and will describe not only the names and uses of what we see; but also how these things fit with social fabric of bali. My only wish is that I could have spent the whole day talking!

Beautiful morning with Dewi. We walk across paddy field, she explain farming, how to use plant wich are growing around, how water is used in the field, she can talk about lot of balinese tradition. I spend great time with her, she became a friend. and after 3 years, we still keep in touch, and each time I back in Bali I visit her and her family. Hope little duwi is find.... thks a lot dewi.
Great excursion!. Dewi did a great job. She was sweet, dedicated and very knowledgeable about plants and agriculture. Hope to come back sometime:-)

Beautiful, educating walks. We took this tour about three years ago and really loved it. The tour guide Dewi knows so much about her culture, agriculture, medicinal plants etc. And she does her very best to make you feel at home in her country.We highly recommend booking a tour with her! :-)

See the beauty of Ubud's nature - and people!. Our walk with Dewi was truely amazing!Ubud center can be quite hectic at times. This is one of the reasons why a walk with Dewi is so refreshing. We stood up with the morning sun and Dewi led us through the backstreets directly into nature and the beautiful, calm rice fields. It felt really good and the little break during which we got to drink a fresh coconut (with an explanation of how to drink it correctly) was amazing! Dewi, our guide, is an impressive young woman. Coming from a family of farmers (while studying botany/agriculture at the university) means she really knows her stuff. You can feel that she grew up with all of this and with the nature that surrounds her. I believe exactly that makes it so incredibly charming and interesting to listen to her. Whether she explains how she makes her own hair shampoo out of a leaf, talks about Balinese Culture or tells anekdotes of the Every Day Life in the Community - all of it fascinated us and it is definitely a privilege that she shared her knowledge with us. Aside all the attractions in and around Ubud - lots of them with a far more touristic feel - a walk with Dewi is what we were really looking for and what we always look for when coming to Ubud. A real taste of Ubud Life. And the best thing about it - you are doing good at the same time. What you pay for the walk goes directly into funding Dewis studies and helping her family. Definitely a Win-Win! Thank you Dewi - it was great!

Nice getaway from the crowdy Ubud.. This herbal walk was an optional activity of our 4-day visit to Bali. Dewi is a very smart and passionate girl that tells about the herbs, the plants and the way people work at the rice-fields. You will learn about flowers that can be used as a hair-conditioner, and how the farmers grow the rice-plants. In the middle of the walk there is a short stop to drink from a coconut and eat some local fruits. As a photographer I was able to shoot some nice rice-fields and insects. Very nice activity for families and/or nature people.

This walk is an added value at your visit to Bali. I was very glad that I could experience this lovely walk with Dewi as guide. Dewi explains the use of plants and fruits in such an interesting way that it makes the visit in bali even more worthwhile. It is a step closer to nature, realising we are one with nature.

Great way to learn about Bali. This walk was very informative and educational. Dewi is lovely and very knowledgeable. She explained about the use of various plants and flowers to produce hair treatments, health cures, etc. It was fascinating to see rows upon rows of rice fields. This is definitely a great way to learn about Bali and the Balinese.

Discovering Bali's beauty. My nature walk with Dewi, a local girl who grew up on a farm and studied botany at university, was most interesting and educational. The walk is informal and tailor-made and can last from 2 to 3 hours. I learnt about rice varieties, flowers and their uses in natural bodycare and haircare, herbs and various other plants. I would definitely recommend this walk as you get to see Bali from a different perspective.

Fantastic great activity! . One of my favourite experiences in Ubud. I'll be taking this memory (and my very own handmade accessory) home for life.The 3 instructors were all very kind, patient and obviously professionals. You can draft the design you have in mind and they'll advise you how best to go about it. The way they help to finish off your work shows the dedication and that professional pride they have in silversmithing.It was a really enjoyable way to spend the morning, and incredibly satisfying to see your very own piece take shape. Some of the people in class really did some fabulous work that looked store bought. The only area for improvement was that at the point of making the jewelry, you're not entirely sure if your piece is within the 10g silver quota or not that is included in the course fees. Only at the end does the lady boss look at your piece to estimate if you need to pay more for the additional silver used. Other than that, it was a great experience!
Absolutely delightful . Had an amazing Beef Wellington with a lovely bottle of wine. Great pairing of a chilly London night!

Fantastic value, something different.. My wife was really looking forward to making a piece of jewelry and she wasn't disappointed. These guys are lovely people and really helpful. Several other tourists we met there had been back 3 or 4 times. We spent about 3 hours making the ring.Cold bottled water on arrival and a very relaxed atmosphere. Be careful you don't go to there retail shop instead of the silver smith class. They are a good 20 minute walk apart which is a pain in 90% humidity and 33°temperature.

The best silver jewellry making class in Ubud. The lovely people who run the classes are highly knowledgeable in their craft and more importantly very accommodating and helpful. I had an idea in my head that was unmakeable in the end due to the technique not the class, so I was lost for an idea, they were most helpful in helping me decide, no matter how long I took, they then guided me through the steps to making my own engraved ring. Only suggestion is if you wish to include a gemstone in your setting, purchase it before coming to class. There is a place in Ubud on the main street Batu-Batu, it's not particularly cheap for Bali (there are places around Kuta that are way cheaper). Also research some ideas for silver jewelry the use flat not curved edges. You can also purchase for a very reasonable price extra silver if your wanting to make a more solid piece, such as by friend who made a silver bangle.It was great fun and children would enjoy it as well.

Quality . Best value souvenir and experience I could ever have done. I'm already planning my next trip to come back and make more! It's a very casual laid back class, and you will do the majority of the work. Make sure to go to the right address, we went first to the shop front but it's quite a hike from here.

Wonderful experience! . We had an amazing afternoon making jewellery at Chez Monique! Wayan and his staff are incredibly helpful, and show you every step along the way. We left not only with souvenirs, but a piece of art and wonderful memories!

What a great experience getting creative in Ubud!. I attended a class with my mother, mother in-law and son (11yrs) we all walked away amazed at our wonderful creations that looked like we had brought them from a shop. I can highly recommend you give this class a go the staff were so friendly and helpful. Wish I had more to to do another course.

Not to be missed experience !. I have been doing a jewellery class every time I stay in Ubud and have to say that chez mobile with the super helpful , caring staff is the best place you can find. The attention to the "students" is unreal. Helping everyone, even in bigger groups, to achievexactly what you would like to create is stunning. I had to "fix up" a few times some mistakes and nothing is to much to ask. ( unlike in other places where it is a hassle) I can't recommend this place enough and will return many more times over the next few years. Make sure you book ahead as I think this will be one of the places where it could become more difficult to get in : ) The attitude that nothing is a hassle and most things can be done is my absolute plus !!! Thank you very much for this amazing day

What an amazing and empowering experience. Could not have enjoyed my afternoon more. The staff were extraordinarily kind and welcoming and provided excellent instruction. I have no artistic ability but I created a one of a kind silver medallion based on the design I drew. It is a very hands on experience from cutting and shaping the silver yourself to giving the final polish. The piece turned out way better than I could have hoped. Master silversmith Wayan is incredibly kind and talented. Thanks for the afternoon, we will never forget it!!! Ryan and Seren

Two times. We visited Chez Minique silver class two times with my husband on our honeymoon. We made some beAutiful pieces of jewellery. We needed to come back twice because it's so fantastic! You need to try! Thank you for the fantastic two days! Ps: If you want to make something with stones you can buy from Batu Batu store!

We had such a great time...we went back two days later!!. A definite must do on a Bali holiday. I love the atmosphere of sitting at the outdoor tables in the village experiencing the balinese way of life....so relaxing! Wayan, Mogey and the team are really helpful, talented and most of all patient. It is also a fab way to reconnect with teenage daughters!! This was my third visit and I will definitely be back again.

unique and lovely experience. Visiting Wayan in his family compound for this silversmith class was amazing. It was an afternoon well spent with souvenirs we will keep and remember forever.I was highly recommended this class by my friends Joy & Corey who took the class multiple times and made their wedding bands there and I am so glad I listened to them. There are so many amazing things to do in Ubud and this is definitely on the top of the list. You will definitely want to come back after taking this class and seeing the beautiful jewelry that comes out. There are no limitations on what you can create and the teachers help you make your vision come to life.

very enjoyable afternoon. We did a silver class in September. Wayan and his team were very competent, helpful and caring. They gave us a warm welcome, water to drink and we (mother and 19year old daughter) made a very nice souvenir, a ring and a bracelet. We wear it with proud, Kerima Kasi Wayan and team for this unforgettable afternoon.
Must do in ubud . Fantastic!!! So much fun. Highly recommend to anyone. Very friendly and helpful. Would do again!

Most interesting thing we did in Ubud. If you are at all interested in creating your own jewelry at least just to see how it is all done, then this is a "must do". We spent about 2 hours designing and creating with a lot of help from the talented staff. Nice peaceful neighborhood atmosphere as well.
Fab. I've had a lovely taster of working with silver. Something I've wanted to do for years. The staff are so helpful guiding you through and doing the boys that need experience. Loved it

Get creative - fun afternoon of jewellery making!. Highly recommend this jewellery making class - a really fun way to spend a few hours in Ubud. The staff are all very helpful and give good guidance on your design (checking if it is realistically possible!) before you start making your piece. We were all really happy with our final pieces and very proud of our work!

Awesome!! Unique! Must do!!. We spent about 3 hours designing and making two pendants. Called ahead with reservation, but they are so low key you can probably drop in most times. We loved it! Using hand tools to fabricate jewelry, burning, grinding, polishing. The 3 master silversmiths want you to go away with a nice piece, so they help to correct errors and clean up the piece when you are done. We had a great time, and two large pendants cost less than $100USD. Not sure if we'll ever find another place to do this, so glad we took the opportunity when in Ubud. Loved it. Was this helpful?

I'd travel back to Bali to take this class again!. Love, love, LOVE this class! Found on here for things to do. I had wanted to buy some silver jewelry from Bali anyway, and thought this could have a story behind it. You sketch your design and they help you cut it out and shape it. The only thing I didn't do was weld the band to the design. It didn't take long and I had a great time! Would definitely do this class again :)

Best Silver Smith Class in Ubud!. My wife and I have done a few different silver smithing classes in Ubud.This one is by far the best. You get a little or as much help as you want. They are all very talented people here.I made a large ring for myself. It cost extra due to the size and weight. Wayan was very honest and upfront, letting me know if I wanted to proceed with my design it would cost more.I appreciated his honesty. To be frank, this class even with extra's is more than a bargain. You can find cheaper classes, but you aren't going to get the same quality or care that you get here from Wayan and his crew.I loved this class so much, Im going to try and book in again before I leave Ubud.

Will be back. My husband and I went here on the morning our our wedding anniversary. We emailed the night before at 9.30pm and still got us in.
We made matching rings, was a great morning.
Recommend to all, you will want to go back and make more.

Professional quality creations. I've been to Ubud a number of times and never heard about this class. Now that I've done it once, I have a feeling I'll be going back - probably in the next few days...Our little group created four gorgeous pieces that will be the best keepsakes of our time here. My daughter made a pendant. She did all the cutting out and the silver smiths simply soldered loops onto it, helped her add a chain and polish the item.Another 11yo girl travelling with us made a solid silver ring which she stamped with her name and engraved with a tree of life. It is stunning.My friend made gorgeous drop earrings with the tiniest bit of help... while I created a bezel setting for a pre-purchased crystal (from Batu in Ubud). I needed quite a lot of help because my piece required a lot of soldering but I still got to create the bezel and twist the silver for the setting.The staff were incredibly welcoming, friendly and supportive. Everyone at Chez Monique's was having a great time and every person there left with a beautiful piece of jewelry. Such a great half day activity that made us all feel very accomplished!

Making jewellery with my bestie . What a magnificent class. Helpful and patient teachers. Gave me such an appreciation for how silver jewellery is made and you get to leave with a gorgeous handmade item. Highly recommend to all.

Fantastic experience. What an amazing way to spend an afternoon. Wayan and his staff were super helpful and patient as I spent an hour figuring out my design. Then they helped me make it and I LOVE my new ring. Coming back to make a wedding gift for my friend.

Take home a unique souvenir. My husband and I enjoyed our morning in the sliver workshop. I brought in photos of a very simple ring design that I wanted to make. The rings turned out perfectly and it was fun being able to do many of the steps ourselves.

Very happy. What a relaxed little joint! It's within a traditional compound, with family members milling around. What a great cultural experience. The staff were readily available to help- it's more like a studio than a class. You choose what you want to make it and they help you turn it into a reality. We really enjoyed ourselves here.

Fantastic class!. I had a great time at this class, as did my boyfriend. We designed our own pendants, and everyone was really friendly, helpful and willing to answer any and all questions that we had. We were shown great hospitality, and were given water and fruit on arrival. It was really easy to book and communicate with Wayan, and he came to say hello even though he was ill! All in all, it was a great experience that I'm already itching to do again. The end products we made are lovely, and with the help of the guys at the workshop, look pretty professional (even if I do say so myself). Everything was quality, and I'd recommend this to everyone going to Ubud!

Fantastic staff. My wife and I decided to make rings to commemorate our anniversary and the entire process was simply fantastic! We tried to show up to an earlier class than I had reserved but he was full. Wayan offered us cold water and called up a friend who drove us on an impromptu tour of Ubud (for a small fee) until it was time for our class. All together we paid about $80 for 2 rings and my ring is fairly heavy. I loved it. The entire process was amazing and the staff was always nearby to help but let us work independently.

Chez Monique jewelry class . This is a fantastic place to make your own professional jewelry. Staff are happy and helpful and nothing is too much bother. I will definately go back next time in Bali. I was very pleased with what I made.

GREAT SILVER CLASS!. The end products was 100x better than expected. They looked after us with tea and bananas and gave us a warm welcome and farewell. I learnt a lot and would say this is totally worth the value for money.

Great class, great jewellery!. Organising my class with Wayan (Frankie) was very easy. I arrived and didn't have much idea what earring design I wanted to go with. I was given all the tools and materials required to design and then cut all of the pieces to size. The silver smiths on site then helped me through the stages to make a stunning pair of earrings!This was a relaxed, friendly, supportive and professional environment. Overall, I had a great time. Thanks so much for a great experience and a pair of beautiful earrings made by me in Ubud. What a treasure!Highly recommend.

Ms. Absolutely loved the class. I ended up making a beautiful pendant with an opal I had brought from Australia. Everyone there was so helpful and knowledgable - but they also let you work your piece by yourself. It felt like YOU were the one who made something. It's a good idea to know what you want to make before going to the class.I would definitely recommend this class :)

Joy. Had a great day. Made a ring for myself and a bracelet as a gift for a friend. Picked up @ hotel in Seminyak by Wayan's brother Made. Friendly and knowledgeable about local area. Good English. Cold bottle of water on arrival, beautiful coffee and fresh fruit. Wayan's team are wonderful. Very patient and easygoing. They easily fixed my mistakes and I left with two lovely pieces of jewellery. Wayan happily worked with a young boy to help him make a dinosaur pendant. The price does not include the silver. It is weighed and they will give you a price on top of the quoted price. Still good value for a day of learning, creativity and fun. I spent $250 Aus. More than expected, but what price can you put on such a great experience. I'll definitely bring my daughter and granddaughters when next in Bali.

So. Much. Fun!. During our recent trip to Bali, my daughter, who is very creative & has some experience with jewelry-making, was excited to attend a class with Wayan & his assistants at Chez Monique. I, who totally lack the creative gene, tagged along. We both had a terrific time and left happy with our silver bracelets. Even if you think working with silver is beyond your capabilities-I sure did-take the leap & give it a try. You won't be sorry!PS-It's a little tricky to find, but persevere!

Must-do!. Had an absolutely lovely time in the workshop. The guys are amazingly patient and helpful. A wonderful experience with a beautiful and unique souvenir to take away from Bali. Get out of the bustle and head over for an hour or so!

An amazing experience . We came to Bali knowing we wanted to try this class and it did not disappoint! We made beautiful rings, with the expert guidance and help of Wayan and the guys at Chez Monique. It was literally one of the best things we've done - so much so that were going back to make some more top quality jewellery in a couple of days! Unique souvenirs. The guys there are so helpful and want you to walk away with amazing jewellery. Everyone there was so happy, it was such a lovely experience. Make sure you go with a clear idea/design already in your head. It'll help as deciding what to make was the hardest part! Can't wait to go back.
Fantastic experience. Leaves you with an amazing souvenir of your holiday. Friendly!! Helpful!! Just make sure to go to workshop not the gallery.

A wonderful workshop. We really enjoyed this workshop. The owner greeted us as though we were long-lost friends and made us feel very welcome. We were guided through each part of the process of making our jewellery, encouraged with kindness and humour and learnt several simple skills quite quickly. It gave us an appreciation for the craft and the joy of having made a unique piece of jewellery by ourselves. I highly recommend this course.

I loved this class . We spent a really enjoyable morning attending the silver making class. We were greeted by very warm and friendly staff who were on hand to help if you needed them. I will treasure the ring my partner made for me.

Very fun experience!. If you're looking for a fun way to spend a couple hours or a unique souvenir to bring home, this is a great option! Everyone was very helpful, friendly, and patient. There is a good teacher to student ratio so you never have to wait very long to get help with your project. When I first arrived, I was a little confused because I wasn't really told what to do and it seemed like people were in all different stages of their projects (I thought maybe I had the start time wrong!). I soon realized there were still people from the morning class finishing up and others had just arrived early. However, don't let this dissuade you at all or make you think things are disorganized. It really just has more of a feel of dropping into a studio than attending a class. Soon after that, Wayan (who is so nice!) came by and introduced himself and made sure I was comfortable. While I was a bit confused at first, the casual set up is actually really nice because you can really take your time and go at your own pace. There's no pressure to keep up with the phase of the project that other students are in, so you can just relax and enjoy! Don't be shy about asking questions either!My ring came out great, and I felt like everyone there was really focused on ensuring my piece looked as good as possible. I really appreciated their attention to detail and patience. Would definitely recommend!

An eye-opening experience!. What a beautiful atmosphere with a family full of happy, knowledgable silversmith teachers! Thank you so much Wayan for this eye-opening experience of what goes into crafting silver. We left feeling creative and enlightened on the jewelry making process, and we can't wait to come back to make our next pieces!
Great morning!. Such a friendly, relaxed class and really good value. Thank you. Loved making the jewellery and I'm going to buy some tools for hold!
Best thing in bali. Had a great time!!! they are true master silversmiths such a great sense of accomplishment designing your own jewlery.

Extraordinary Experience for a Teen ! Great jewerlry result !. Discovering how to make a jewelry was a great and completely new experience to our Teen (16). People being very nice, helpful and providing lot of advice. Result is amazing after a 3 hours class. Price extremely reasonable !

Brilliant!. We took our 2 boys (6 and 8) to this class- we were a bit unsure whether they would be able to make anything or how involved they would be but the team here were so attention and helpful. The. It's designed and made their own silver brackets (with as much support as they wanted or needed) and although we weren't the only people there it felt as if we had booked for a one on one session for them as they were so well looked after.It also meant that we could focus on creating and making our own designs so we were all able to have a beautiful piece of jewellery to remember our trip by.The boys were so proud of their football shirt and dog brackets (and we were equally chuffed with ours)! Would highly recommend this as a family activity we will be back next time we are in Ubud - thank you.Louise, Paul, George and Ollie

Great experience. We are a family of 7 people with 2 small kids. This workshop was the best time we had in Bali. All of us were very happy and proud of our work. Wayan and his crew were really nice and helpful. We had a great time and will certainly come back. Sandrine, Frederic, Zoe, Raph, Tya, Kiku and Ivy.
Great experience!. Very happy we booked this last minute. The wife and I made each other rings. It was such a fun experience!

highlight of ubud!. absolutely LOVED the silversmith workshop at chez monique! made two items and am going back today to make some more. beautiful people and beautiful surroundings! will recommend to everyone i know going to ubud! amazing :)

The most special souvenir from a vacation ever. Someone staying at the same resort as my teen sister and I recommended this workshop and it was the best tip we got this vacation. Everyone who joined the class had their design as good -or better- as they had hoped for and I wear my anklet with joy everyday. Absolutely worth a try. Very suited for children and teens as well as adults.

Very Enjoyable!. We had a great day making necklaces! It was nice to sit down for a while and do something different. I enjoyed the class and love the necklace I made. Would of been nice to have a heads up before making my design that I would be charged extra because my pendant was bigger than allowed.

we are super happy with our rings!. the silver class was a great experience! we didnt have any idea of what we want to make and how its working, but in the workshop we got so much help and support. thank you so much! within theese ten grams of silver that are included in the prize you can really make much and have heaps of opportunities. most important: dont give up, each pice will look great after you pollished it ;) Dont expect do be able to do each step, for your own saftey they wont give you the heater for example. we strongly recommend this class, you will enjoy it!!!

My personal highlight in Ubud!. I very much enjoyed creating a silver bracelet with the help of the silversmith Wayan and his team. He is very welcoming, friendly, helpful and his happiness and enthusiasm are simply contagious! I also very much appreciated that Wayan and his team are locking for quality and don't hesitate to give advise if anything can be done better. I highly recommend his silversmith class! What a great memory!

Highly Recommend!. Wayan and everyone there were so welcoming extremely helpful, hospitable and happy. I highly recommend everyone to go here as you will not regret it one bit! I sure will be coming back :)

Super peaceful morning and with great keepsakes made. This was a really nice experience and a bit different to the painting or cooking which is quite the usual in Bali. The people helping (the silversmiths I guess!), were a delight and had patience and humour in good measure. You really get to do most of the making of whatever you like and there is no rush or feeling that you are clueless (even though we were!). Just make sure you check how much things are for the size, so that you don't pick something you really like before knowing how much it will be to make. Overall such a chilled and enjoyable experience with something to treasure at the end!

Great way to spend a few hours!. Chez Monique was a great experience. Myself, my mom and my sister all went along for the morning. It is such a lovely place, and the guys that work there are super patient and friendly, their expertise was incredible.Wayan was great, from speaking to him on the phone to book to meeting him and hearing all about his life as a silver smith, what a lovely man he is. I would fully recommend going here and spending some time, just wish I had of had longer in Ubud as I would have definitely returned! One day hopefully.Thank you to Wayan and the guys for everything

Great experience, really helpful staff . Took my 9 year old daughter to chez Monique and she made her own necklace. It turned out so professionally I was really impressed. The staff allow you to do any part of the process you are capable of - i.e. My daughter did not do any of the welding although some other adults did. It is set up so you can do all parts of production safely and with good support. The owner was there - beautiful man! My only suggestion to improve it would that any extra charges are advised about before the process. My daughter used extra silver and it cost an extra $10aud but we were not told until ready to pay ... A small suggestion to make a great experience even better.

Favourite thing to do in Bali. We went twice!. Me and my girlfriend came across this class looking through trip advisor and as lovers of silver jewellery jumped at the chance to make one-off pieces of jewellery for ourselves.We booked a place with Wayan, who was quick to respond to emails, even after we changed our minds about the date/time twice. On arrival at his workshop we were greeted by Wayan with a smile, a hug and a drink, before being sat down to look through his books for ideas about what to make. We already had ideas of our own, so after letting Wayan know what we wanted to make, we got to work. We had a go at every aspect of the process; cutting, filing, polishing and soldering the silver from the beginning to the end, while having Wayans three attentative staff helping along the way (doing the trickier bits and making sure everything was finished to a high standard).We loved this class so much, we drove back to Ubud from Seminyak to do the class one more time before flying home. It was our favourite thing to do in Bali. Wayan clearly loves what he does and after showing us the things he and his staff are capable of making, will definitely be keeping in contact to purchase from him in the future.Loved it, thankyou!

Brilliant Silver Class -We Went twice!. Loved this class so much the first time round we came back again! After prompt responses to emails we were booked in to do a silver class. We are big fans on silver and decided to make our own silver rings. We were given a warm welcome by Wayan himself who is a very humble man who loves his craft. He gave us books to look through for inspiration and asked if we knew what we would like to create. Once we had an idea we were given the ring net after finding out our size. There were three very attentive helpers who helped us create our rings along the way. The experience was hands on and we were able to cut silver, file, heat, mould and polish the rings ourselves. We left for Seminyak and decide to bike back to Ubud to do the silver class one more time before flying home. Again, the class was brilliant and Wayan remembered us. This was my favourite thing to do in Ubud and totally recommend this class. We will keep in touch with Wayan and continue to create and purchase his beautiful silver.

Great afternoon. We took advice from Trip Advisor to visit this place and it was well worth it. the location is a little off the beaten track and deceptively uphill so if its hot perhaps grab a taxi.We met the owner who is a really amiable freindly guy, and worked to create two rings that are a brilliant reminder of a great holiday.A couple before us created their own wedding rings, something really special if you're soon to get married!It's pretty cheap and the guys are on hand to help you create whatever you want, though be aware it's a lot harder than you think!

Brilliant experience . I was really excited about this class and the chance to make something totally unique for myself. I was not disappointed. Warmly welcomed all the staff were very friendly and helpful; we were shown books of designs we could chose or you can make your own design; which is what I did. I made a ring, I measured approx size of my finger and told them the thickness I wanted the ring I was then handed a flat piece of silver, my drawn design was stuck onto the silver and I cut out the cat face using a tiny hacksaw blade, I then filed it, I also used hammer and chisels to engrave letters on the ring and used stamps inside. Once I was done the ring was soldered together by the staff and oxidisation where I wanted it. It was then polished, staff started it off and let me finish the polishing and buffing. It was then complete. I was there 1hr 45min in total, total cost for lesson and my finished jewellery was Rp. 450.000 which I found reasonable and I tipped also. Staff were very patient; I did not think the end result would look so good but I'm really happy with it for a first attempt. I would recommend this for anyone wanting a unique experience, and for any level of skill as the staff will help as much as you require. I will definitely be returning next time I'm in Bali.

Course. This class was amazing, they have few guys expert in the field to help u out. U are offered coffee or tea and a bottle of water when u come in. U are given free reins to do ur own design and they help u do it. The course is at a good price but be advised u pay for the silver u use which is not mentioned before u start. Check the price of silver on google before u pay.

Uncommon activity. I think everything has already been told in the other comments.It was a really nice experience, people were friendly and helpful, they guided us step by step.It is also a good context to chit-chat with other tourists you're sharing this experience with.Were it a little less expensive, I would most certainly come back.

MUST DO! . I had an amazing time yesterday at my silver class. The staff were so attentive and friendly that I didn't mind at all being on my own. I was overjoyed with my final product, and the fact that they let you do almost everything means that you can be really proud of what you produce. A definite must do in Ubud!

Great for kids and adults alike. Had a fantastic time. Had to return for a second class. A peaceful setting for a workshop, wonderful meeting Wayan, his wife and his staff. The kids were able to freehand their designs and make them into professional looking jewelry featuring original artwork. Even the day that Wayan was not there, the other silversmiths were wonderful, easy to communicate with, and knew exactly what we were aiming for. Other than soldering, they pretty much let you do as much as you want to - so you really get a piece that is not only gorgeous but for which you can take the credit. Even the pendant designed by my 8 year old came out looking beautiful. Great place to make a souvenir for yourself or a gift for someone you love. We spent 3-4 hours each time - depends on the complexity of your piece and how much you want to work on it. They let you take your time until you achieve what you are satisfied with. Two tips: 1. See other posts on location - google the silversmith class, as the store of the same name is in a different location. 2. It's helpful but not necessary to spend a little time before you get there thinking about what you might want to make and sketching some designs. You will be drawing the design on paper yourself, though, of course, they will help you if needed. We really loved the kids' original work rendered in silver. Thank you Wayan, Monique, and the rest of the staff. We hope to return someday.
Very personalised and such kind hosts. Made some gorgeous rings with my friends!Wayan and the other jewellery-makers were very hospitable - a fantastic experience for anyone in Bali!

Fantastic Experience!!. A wonderful thing to do in Ubud!! Not too difficult to find. A lovely typical Balinese walled family compound with a pretty garden, caged birds singing, and a lovely peaceful atmosphere. The owner is very friendly and helpful, and either gives you lots of help or very little depending on what you wish. I made a frog pendant and a ring, and did about 98% of each myself. The only thing guests can't do (understandably) is soldering. Otherwise, from designing, to drawing, to cutting, to polishing, you can do it all yourself. The jewellery is all Balinese silver - there are no stones or gems available, however, if you bring your own, the owner will help you set them if you wish (or do it for you). I spent most of the day here, with repeated free coffee topups. water, and a cool electric fan. The total cost for both of my pieces was around $70, which I consider a very small price to pay for the satisfaction of producing these items myself. I wear the ring every day, even now, almost a year later. In the afternoon, the owner even gave me a complimentary lift back into Ubud centre on his scooter. I would absolutely return to make more pieces - I am already thinking of my next design!

A 'must do' when in Ubud!. Amazing couple of hours spent learning to - and making silver jewellery! Whether it be something bespoke you have in mind, or something you choose from the many catalogues on hand. Staff are extremely welcoming, friendly and patient! Very happy with the final result and well worth the money spent.

Amazing experience !! . We have passed a very good moment in this place to make a ring and a pendant for each other. It was such a good idea to realise our own jewellery. you are free to draw what you want and the result is awesome. So good!!! We have spend there for few hours..you really can take your Time and the team is very helpfull and kind. We recommand to go there for a unique experience. You Will not regret it at all !!

Must Stop in Ubud!. Had the most amazing experience here. The owner and staff members are extremely friendly and helpful. I ended up with a ring that I love and it was one of my favorite days here in Bali.

Best thing I did in bali. I did a class with my sister and loved it so much I came back again the next day. I was worried the quality of our handmade jewelry would be dodgy but everything turned out beautiful!!! Very welcoming, homely, chilled out class environment. I hope to go back one day :)

Great Couple's Activity. We LOVED this experience! We gave them a call and set up coming in the next day. They are VERY laid back and helpful. There are books and books of ideas for you to look through, you can also come in with your own ideas or do a combo of the two. The owner is so friendly and immediately hugs you and helps you out. Once you pick your design you are off to work on your jewelry. We chose to make rings for each other as a fun couple's activity. They really let you do a lot and it's so fun! We were very focused and nervous about messing up! But in the end we loved what we made for each other.

Pretty good. Great for personalised gifts etc. Really helpful and friendly crew, but like many of the other reviews, don't expect to do much of it yourself/ come away with expert skills. Also have an idea in mind of what you want and maybe bring an image as the ones provided to choose from are lacklustre. But all in all a really good experience. Would definitely recommend.

Spur of the moment . We decided on the spur of the moment to book a class here, one of the best decision we've made, we would highly recommend this. Brilliant value for money, very rewarding and you come away with something unique. We'll be coming back again. The staff were extremely helpful and informative. The cost, even including the hire of a private transport Guide still totally value for money and rewarding.

A must-do when in Ubud. Monique, Wayan & the team here are supportive, patient & give you enough time to get things done in your own time & way.This sometimes means that you do things in less time than you'd bargained for - my gorgeous Bali honeymoon ring took less than 2 hours. I will be going back for another class next time we're in Bali.All materials, tools, scenery, & smiling warm welcomes are included in the class price. The work areas are clean & spacious, the bathroom is pristine & there's street parking out the front. Highly recommended!

Unique experience. We attended the silver class in July with my boyfriend just couple days before our wedding ceremony in Bali. We made our wedding rings by ourselves and it was very memorable and unique experience. The host, Wayan, is very welcoming, helpful and friendly, atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable. I would definitely recommend to try this class if you are in Bali!

Unique experience . My boyfriend got me this as a birthday present. I loved it, it was a really unique experience and interesting seeing how jewellery like this gets made. The class was very relaxed and not run as an organised tour event which was good. The silversmiths assisting are very helpful and I was impressed with the quality of jewellery we made. The price is great considering you keep what you make! They even glued my broken earring back together which I really appreciated. We would definitely go back again if we go back to Ubud.

Simply the best silver making class around. The people at Monique's are brilliant artisans and they will do anything to help you realise your own project. Thanks to them, I managed to make my own design of ring even though wearing silver isn't usually what they do. They made It happen nevertheless! Count 2-3h to make your own piece of jewelry for approximately 450.000 IDR (I guess it varies, depends on the quantity of silver you use!). The best in the area as It is the only place where the people offered to help me make my own design as It was deemed too complexant other silver making classes. Highly recommended.

An afternoon well spent!. Just loved our time at Chez Monique. We celebrated our silver anniversary (25 years) while in Ubud. We decided to celebrate by making jewelry for each other. It was the perfect mixture of getting to do it ourselves and having help. I designed my own bracelet for my husband and they were very helpful in making that design become a reality. I chose earrings from a binder and my husband made those for me. We think our time here was one of the highlights of our time in Ubud.
Silver Class was awesome . Es war absolut super und ich habe den Kurs genossen, thanks and keep going it was wonderful and I wanna do it again :) my Ring is fantasic

service with a smile and a huge hug. What a charming man Wayan, the owner of Chez Monique is! And what a lovely experience. Choose from any number of fabulous designs or bring your own. The helpful staff will guide you and allow you to do as much or as little as you ike in the production of your stunning silver keepsake. Well priced given the ridiculous prices in the local jewellery stores and you can say you made it yourself! Thank you, hope to visit one day again.

Great fun. It's definitely worth having a look at if you have a couple of hours in Ubud. The staff are great and you'll be surprised how good your product ends up. Just make sure you follow the map on their website - Google Maps takes you to the wrong place about a 15-20 minute walk away.
Well worth the visit . Decided to do this a couple of days ago on our holiday was a bit of trek from nusa dua but worth it as you come away with something unique because you get to be hands on

Enjoy and learn about jewellery making. Went to Ubud to enjoy jewellery class today. I would recommend you have an idea about what you would like to make before you go.You get expert advice and help and are encouraged throughout the whole experience.I was very happy with my piece and you pay according to the weight. What a great experience to do something different on a holiday -thankyou Chez Monique!!

Thoroughly enjoyable!!. What a fantastic way to spend a few hours, and make a special, unique item to keep forever. Wayan is so welcoming, and he and the other craftsmen are extremely patient and talented. I absolutely recommend going to this class, and I'll definitely return on my next visit.

Wonderful experience. Very helpful staff.. I have no prior jewellery making experience before this class. When i arrived we were given drinks and a few books to look at for inspiration. I already had an idea of what i wanted to make. I drew my design and was then shown step by step how to create my piece. The staff were amazing and would demonstarate then encourage me to have a go. It was great as they didnt take over. They worked with me until i was 100% happy with my piece. This calss inspired me and i will definitely be back for more. Thank you wayan and all of the staff for your patience, encouragement and dedication.

Learning and fun rolled into one!. So yesterday my husband and I became silversmiths!I had researched this before coming to Ubud and it was definitely on my to do list. I was not disappointed - the wonderful Wayan has the patience of a saint and exudes a welcoming warmth. We designed and created ( with a little help here and there) two beautiful silver pendants that I will wear proudly.Thank you to Wayan and his boys - we loved learning and laughing with you.I would highly recommend anyone to give Chez Monique a go while visiting beautiful Ubud.

Never fails to impress. We love Wayan and his silver making class. Every trip we make to Bali we make sure to include a couple of visits to Wayan and his class. All his men are professional and caring when understanding your requests about your jewellery and your vision. They give guidance and advice when you could make some modifications to improve your piece. Wayan himself is one of the most friendly and warmest Balinese people we have had the pleasure of meeting. He never fails to greet you with a brilliant smile and can do attitude to whatever design you bring to him. The necklaces we made last year we have worn daily since and this trip we made some rings, animal tags and have ordered some custom pieces to be made for us. Well worth the time to do this class and very cheap considering you would pay more for a piece at home and wouldn't be unique to yourself made by yourself.

The best. . We would rate this as one of the best things we did in Bali. We each came home with a unique ring made by ourselves and were very pleased with our new skills. The staff were great. So helpful and patient. Would highly recommend.
Great opportunity. Great opportunity to have tuition in silversmithing by a super friendly expert in his own family compound, a 'real Bali' experience not just a tourist thing.
Best afternoon! . I had such a lovely afternoon at chez monique. The staff were so helpful and friendly! I love the ring that I made and will treasure it forever. Definitely recommend!

Chez Magnifique!. We came back it was so good. Four more fantastic pieces of jewelry we will treasure forever. It is you chance to learn from artisans how jewelry is made. Can you get that chance easily where you are from? I doubt it so take the opportunity here to make yourself a real souvenir. My youngest is 8 and even his piece is fantastic so you have no excuse that you cannot do it.

Amazing! . Very relaxed and nice people who will help you. First you make your design and then step by step they will show you what to do and then you can finish that step. I really loved it and im very happy with my rings!!! Thank you

Customized jewelry made by Master Silversmith Wayan Sunarta. I will definitely take this class when I am back in Bali, but am writing to recommend the class instructor--Master Silversmith Wayan Sunarta! I had purchased a unique silver and wooden bracelet in Bali several years ago, but had been unable to wear it as it actually proved to be too large for my arm. I had taken it to numerous jewelers in the United States, but none had a solution of how to make it smaller to fit my arm. I decided to bring it with me to Bali when returning there this summer, with the hope of finding someone to help me with a solution. Alas, none of the many silversmiths in Bali that I spoke with had a solution either--saying that the unique silver/wooden composition of the piece presented an unsurmountable challenge for modification. That is, until I found Wayan Sunarta two days before I was to leave back for the States! Wayan met with me multiple times in that two day period to ensure that we came up with a solution to the problem--then literally took hours inbetween his busy classes to craft a GOREGOUS etched silver addition to my bracelet which makes it fit perfectly--all the while, maintaining the beautiful artistry of the piece and making it even more lovely than the original!!! He did this all for an extremely reasonable price, and with such a warmth that I truly can call him a friend even after such a brief time of knowing him. He was determined to find a solution that would work, and is a true artist in his skill and craftsmanship. I finally been able to wear my bracelet upon returning home, and people literally catch their breath upon seeing it. My only regret is that I did not know about Wayan and Chez Monique upon travelling to Bali (I stumbled upon the shop on Jalan Hanoman by good fortune!!), so did not have the time to take his class--but will definitely plan to do so on my next trip, as I am sure it is wonderful! I also will be pondering on what custom jewelry I might ask Wayan to design for me, as he is amazing!! Thank you, Thank you!!

Fantastic afternoon. What a great time our group of 5 had, right from the time we walked in the door, we were treated with such exuberance, and that set the tone.We were given books to peruse to get our creativity flowing, and wow, we were supported and praised and guided, these people know their craft and customer service is fantastic!Thank so much for the experience

Love love loved it!. After reading reviews of silver making classes in Ubud, I decided to head to Chez Monique and I'm so glad I did. I picked up 3 stones to set in Ubud (studio perak in hannoman- they do classes too but reviews weren't as good) prior to my class and also went with photographs of the rings I wanted to make. Even with this preparation I was still worried that I might end up making rings I would never wear again... Well what can I say! I am ecstatic with the results. The super friendly Wayan and his team of highly talented and patient teachers guide you every step of the way and teach you many of the techniques required including design (if you need it), cutting, soldering, polishing, setting etc. Thank you Wayan and previous trip advisor peeps who steered me in this direction with their helpful posts :)NB: I payed 1500000 but my rings very very solid and heavy- most pay about one third of that to make one item :)

Great time. We had a great time here and would recommend Chez Monique to anyone. Wayan and the staff are very welcoming, and they provide you with a quality hands-on experience. The finished products looked nice and were something we were proud to have made.Some notes:-CM has a catalog of artwork for inspiration, so you don't need to come here with an idea already in mind. Wayan helped with the planning process and gave us some good artistic feedback. -The normal amount of silver was more than adequate for what we made. Again, CM helps with the planning process and would let you know how much silver you need.-CM handles some of the more technical finishing work. This ensures the end product looks really good and probably helps with safety concerns too. You still get to do a lot of hands-on work too.-If using google maps to find the class, search "Chez Monique Silversmith Classes", which is located north of the palace. Do NOT search "Chez Monique Jewelry", which would lead you south.

Fantastic!. The Hubs and I attended and we both made products for me (him a bangle and me a bracelet). We had a blast and came away with unique products that will remind me of my trip every time I wear them.

Awesome workshop, lovely staff. My partner and I went to the silver workshop this morning and each made a ring. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and hope to return again next year. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Ubud/Bali with a few hours to spare and some creative flare

What an Amazing Experience for Our Fmaily. What an amazing experience for myself, my wife and my 10yo daughter. We were expecting it to be good but was really impressed with what we walked away with. Not only do you design your own piece of silver (e.g. ring, pendant etc) but you also get to create and keep it. You are not left to your own devices as Chez has a small team of silversmiths who are there to support you through the process. Chez is also very friendly and welcoming and his family's village is beautiful. Number one on my list of Must-Do's for Ubud.

An afternoon making rings. An absolutely fantastic way to spend the morning. We spent 3 hours choosing designs, cutting, knocking, shining our rings. It was super fun. Wayan and his guys are skilled and helpful.

Best In Bali. Great place to come and make some jewellery even if you aren't into jewellery. The team there are very friendly and have great banter. Make sure to book in advance as they limit numbers to maximise teacher to student time. They give as much or little help as you require. No experience needed but you will want to come back again.

Personal touch. We made our engagement ring at Chez Mounique, and Wayan went out of his way to make the experience special and memorable for us. The atmosphere is relaxed and easy going, while the craftsmanship and guidance is professional. The end result was of very high quality and exceeded our expectations. You can't go wrong as far as an authentic experience in Ubud goes.

Perfect Environment to Nurture Hands-on Creativity. From the busy coast, it may take you upwards of 2 hours for your driver to get to the family compound in Ubud. The class starts with a blank sheet of paper and your brain being relaxed into a creative mode where there are no distractions from your day of learning and creating using your hands. This class is a welcome break from the other wild Bali adventures during my trip.

Best thing we've done in Bali!. Wayan and his team are so skilled, patient and friendly. They make silver crafting look easy! My girlfriend and I attended the 9am workshop and absolutely loved it. With the teams help, we spent around 3 hours designing and making a ring each and we are so pleased with them! Worth every penny and would definitely go again!

Unforgettable. Best way to spend a morning or afternoon in Ubud! I made an 11am appointment and was there for over three hours designing and manufacturing my piece! Wayan and his staff are incredibly helpful and talented. Depending on the piece you design, you can make it entirely by yourself with guidance from the team. I sawed, hammered, and sanded my silver to make a beautiful ring. I am far from creative and if I can make a nice piece of jewelry anyone can! Thank you Wayan!!
Great class. I really enjoyed the opportunity to create my own piece of silver jewellery. Everyone was helpful and friendly. Highly recommended

Love our keepsakes!. Wayan was very obliging and made it possible for us to do this outside of their regular time slots. My daughter wanted to design her own pendant instead of choosing from their designs, and Wayan and his team helped her to transform her rough idea to something that was even better than she expected. The ring that I made was also an adaptation from the design I chose, as advised by Wayan, because my ring size was too small and the original design would not look good. We enjoyed the process and were both very happy with our new accessories!
