In all honesty, Wayan and his team do hold your hand quite a lot and do some of the trickier work like welding, but you do most of the basics yourself and it's super satisfying to help create something that turns out so beautifully! I made some long earrings that look a bit like leaves on a stem and my boyfriend made some smaller ones in an elegant, classic design. We were both very pleased with the end result and for the equivalent of about £20 each are taking home a lovely handmade gift for our mums. The other people at the class were lovely and all enjoyed it too. The creations were all great - you don't need to be particularly creative to make something that you would even consider buying in a shop. If you can spare a couple of hours while in Ubud, I would recommend this class. In fact I'd like to spend a future holiday just making jewellery all the time!

Wonderful, fascinating,amazing experience.Whole family LOVED it!. Stumbled across this on Trip advisor.Looked like the perfect family activity whilst in Ubud with our two daughters aged 15 & 11.Must add that this was very last minute and I was worried that I would not be able to arrange it,but the quick response(e-mails) from Wayan made it all very easy and possible.We walked up from Ubud town centre and were expecting to find a shop but to our pleasant surprise you actually enter the beautiful family compound and the "workshop" is an open air set up of groups of 4 desks-all very professional.Wayan is the most amazingly friendly host, greeted us all with hugs and immediately offered us all refreshing drinks whilst we browsed the extensive range of photo catalogues of examples of what you can make.There was so much choice it took the 4 of us some time to decide but soon we were all "designing" our own pieces with the help of Wayan and his craftsmen.They transfer your finished design to your individual pieces of silver and you then cut,twist bend into shape with the perfect balance of letting you do it yourself and stepping in and helping a bit when needed.The whole process was fascinating,all the more so for the beautful relaxed setting.My design took me the best part of 2.5 hrs to complete whilst my eldest daughter was enjoying it so much she completed her piece and made two more in this time (even paid for the extra pieces with her own money-if you knew her you would you would know how much of a compliment this is!) When your piece is finished they "weld" it while you watch,using an amazing foot pump powered blow torch and then polish it up to a finish that I almost couldn't beleive when they placed it back down in front of me.WOW did I make that?Surely not, it looks ....just to proffesional! We were all so pleased with what we had made and we had such a good time doing it.I cannot reccomend this highly enough as an activity,as an experience,as a wonderful memory of Bali and the lovely people and as a unique (Literally!) Souveneir to be treasured forever.Thank you WayanWe will always remember our time with youPhilip,Estelle,Stephanie and Jennifer Walker

Relaxing way to spend a morning/afternoon.. My partner and I spent a few hours at Wayan's workshop and throroughly enjoyed it. When we arrived we were welcomed by Wayan, offered something to drink and given catalogues to look through for inspiration. We sketched out our pieces and went to work on them. We both made rings and were surprised by how well they turned out. It seems you can create almost anything you wish. It was very interesting to see how this silver jewellery is made. Besides all this we found it a very therapeutic way to spend a morning, in Wayan's, compound, under shelter and cooling fans. For the money we had a relaxing and enjoyable experience and an item of jewellery that would have cost us more to buy at home than the activity cost.

Fun, fun, fun. Spent a morning here with my daughter and we absolutely loved this experience. Wayan and his staff were always happy to help you and the piece you make and keep at the end is priceless. Great way to spend a couple of hours making something special.

My favourite day in Ubud!. When I got looked on Tripadvisor for things to do in Ubud, I came across Chez Monique. I knew I had to check this place out, because as well as wanting to try silversmithing for a long time now, my name is also Monique!Mum and I didn't have much idea of what we would be able to make in our class, but there are lots of folders with pictures of different designs to help you out with any creative block! Everyone has a very "can do" attitude, not matter the design you choose. I thought my choice may have been a little complicated but Wayan just smiled and said "Great choice! It's not too hard, we will help you."And help is given every step of the way! You get to do the more basic and safer parts of creating your piece, while Wayan and his team do all the soldering and filing - it's a lot less stressful when you don't have to deal with a blowtorch and grinder! Everyone is very patient and helpful with the parts you try yourself.The workshop is in Wayan's home, which is really cool because you get to see inside a Balinese family compound. It's nice and cool, and they provide you with icy cold water. I want to say thank you to Wayan and his team, particularly Echo (sp?) for the great afternoon that Mum and I had at Chez Monique. I highly recommend them if you are looking to do something a little different to the usual sightseeing and want to get creative! They really do make everyone feel like they can make something very special and nothing compares to being handed your brand new piece of jewellery after it's final polishing and being able to say you made it yourself!I can't wait to come back with lots more design ideas next time I am in Ubud.

Absolutely THE best Balinese experience . Visiting Wayan and the boys was truly one of my highlights. I was welcomed into their world for an hour or two and came out the other side with a truly memorable experience of making my own piece of jewellery. I would highly recommend Wayan's class to all who want a uniquely Bali experience.

Perfect way to spend a few hours... HIGHLY recommend!. I don't see how anyone couldn't enjoy this class. Wayan is the nicest, most caring person and his staff is so helpful and knowledgeable. My husband and I spent about three hours at his home making a ring and a bracelet for ourselves and they turned out AMAZING! We started out by looking through books of pieces that other people had created to get ideas, and ended up drawing our own. We were involved in every step of the process and everything was completely our choice. They do the dangerous welding, but I watched that being done the entire time, and we were able to polish our pieces on the wheel, ask questions, and do everything from the design to the cutting to the polishing process. Everything was go at your own pace and very laid back. You could be as involved as you wanted to and take as much time as you needed. My husbands ring was done in a little over two hours from start to finish, and mine was closer to three (I'm a bit too much of a perfectionist!)He warned us that we were using more silver than the class price allowed for, so we weren't shocked at the end. I made a very sturdy bracelet that cost 700.000 (about $65 USD and my husband made a ring for 500.000 ($45 or so USD) which included the cost of the silver as well as hours of entertainment and a new appreciation for silver jewelry. I usually end up buying myself a piece of jewelry as a souvenir anyway, so the fact that I got to actually make something, take some fun pictures, and personalize my souvenir was just perfect. You'll pay as much if not more just buying a piece of silver jewelry at any shop in Ubud, so why not make an experience out of it? I can't recommend this class enough!!

Great morning. We spent a couple of hours with the team and left very happy with our end products! It was easy to book via email with a swift reply. The team were very welcoming and so patient with us and our somewhat shaky jewellery making skills! I made a bracelet and my wife made some earrings both turned out better than our expectations! Great fun! Thank you all.

Great way to spend a few hours... I had a great time making my own ring,so happy with all the help from Wayan and his team. Very friendly and welcoming .Going back again to make myself some earrings CAN'T WAIT....Thank you so much Wayan.Michelle

Great experience in Ubud. We booked this class via mail when I saw the reviews on tripadvisor...We were very well took in charge by the nice team there, at a walking distance from ubud center in a nice part.They show you pictures of jewelry that can be done, but you can draw or explain your wish and they try to help you. Then, they let you start building your object and help you with the hard work or to give the last finish.Very patient, always in mind to make you happy, it is a nice experience to do when you are in ubud. Priceless too as you go out with your own ring made by yourself...Thanks to all the team again, see you on my next stay there...

Unique experience, more than memories to take away.. Wayan and his brother Made made this day amazing. My clumsy hands and almost complete lack of creativity didn't matter, the team helped my husband and I make beautiful jewellry. I strongly recommend this experience to people visiting Bali, you leave with the best kind of souvenir- a beautiful piece of jewellry that you created (with help of course!) and meeting two great examples of Balinese friendliness- Wayan and Made

Great morning, kids love their rings!. We booked this workshop already months ago, based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor.Stayed at Alam Indah, and got a free shuttle to this street, however the driver dropped us at the beginning of the street. We had no idea how long the walk was to Chez Monique, and it was quite long (at least 15 minutes), so we arrived a bit late.But we were welcomed with smiles and kisses, felt very welcome here, owner and staff were so friendly. Got free coffee and water (coffee was delicious according to my husband)Our girls chose rings from photos in a book, and they started the work, with the help our my husband and of course with help of the staff. They were so glad with the result!It took about 1,5 hours, I thought the whole workshop took longer, but it all depends on which items you want to make. Same for the price, it depends on how much silver you use, in our case it cost 800.000 inr. for both rings.We chatted with other guests, who also made beautiful things. Very nice morning, and later on we walked back along the street, had a drink at Jendela House, and had lunch at Dapur Bunda.Would recommend this workshop to everone!

Favourite experience in Ubud. We finished creating our silver jewellery about 10 minutes ago and couldn't wait to review. It's totally worth going. We spent about an hour and a half creating a ring and a pendant and it was under $90 AUD. Do it.
One of the most impressive experiances during the trip. Absolutely loved the class...and really proud of the ring i made! Plus they offer amazing homemade banana juice)

Lovely atmosphere with talented and patient teachers. I recently went to one of Wayan's jewellery workshops and it was one of my favourite things I've done whilst visiting Indonesia. The class takes part in Wayan's workshop which is about 10 minutes walk from the palace. It's a beautiful location and I was made to feel very welcome. Everyone who works there was friendly and all very talented at what they do. I was able to choose from a wide selection of designs or create my own. I decided to create my own and was then shown and assisted with each step of the way until my necklace was complete. They even fixed my necklace for me which was from the gili Islands! I am working on a new design and plan to go back before the end of my trip to enjoy a second class. Thank you again and see you soon!

Great fun with an excellent result. Did a class during my stay in Ubud and it was great. Wayan and his team were excellent, from the initial books offering options for things to make, to explaining the design process, to the actual making of the item. I picked a pendant and the final result exceeded my expectations.There were children making items whilst I was there and the staff were extremely patient and friendly. Cannot recommend this place highly enough.

"Great Fun and Great Family Bonding Time. My children and I had a wonderful time here. Wayan and his team were very patient and helpful in guiding us throughout. It was just amazing for the kids to watch how the skillful masters could craft something out of silver as easily as they would of play dough! My son is so proud of his pendent that he is now wearing it everyday. As the workshop is held at Wayang's house, it was also wonderful to get a glimpse into how the locals live.

Wayan Sunarta Silver Smith. I can only say just do it!Chez monique /Wayan what an amazing man I was researching for places to take women over 65 to do cooking , jewelry making and eat healthy food. Then I found The diamond in the crown this amazing friendly and accommodating gentle man Wayan Sunarta.. I made a beautiful Silver Ring.And the patients this man and staff have is 10-10. all amenities are clean and tidy!I'm going back with my laddies thank you Wayan. From Kathleen ..

Will go again. What an exceptional time we had here, I took my parents and 3 young children.There were plenty on designs to pick from and the staff were very helpful.If you are a little crafty or not this is a great couple of hours spent in a great spot with lovely people.

Great fun for a couple of hours. An excellent way to spend an afternoon. The whole set up is very laid back and the staff were friendly and welcoming. They set us up on each task with a good explanation and demonstration of what to do, this included designing, cutting, engraving and polishing a ring and a pair earrings. I liked the way they left us to get on with things. Any errors, from breaking a saw blade to engraving the wrong letter were artfully and discretely repaired by the experts without making you feel that you'd gone wrong! It was interesting to see the process from start to finish and we walked away with two pieces of jewelry that are not only wearable, but look professionally made. A super memento of a fantastic trip - why buy from a jeweler when you can make your own?

A fun place for making personalized silver pieces. I have always looked forward to getting some local yet different experiences in bali than just going to the beach and enjoying the sun and for sure this is the place! Although it took a little bit of walk from the monkey forest, it's totally worth it! I spent almost 4 hours getting my hands on designing, shaping, cutting and polishing the silver pieces that I have made and I was totally impressed about the quality. The final products looked exactly the same as what had been on my mind and I love them so much! Thank you Wayan and staff for the welcoming greetings and of course the silversmithing lesson! I had great fun! If you ever stop by ubud, please do get this on your itinerary! You will love it!

One of our highlights. We came here on our honeymoon in November 2013. Sorry it has taken so long to review. It was a little bit of a walk from the monkey forest in the center of town, which was fine for me, but my husband has trouble dealing with the heat so if you are the same, maybe take a taxi. But do not let anything deter you from doing this. This is a unique experience and it was one of the highlights of our trip. I made a bracelet - a hammered bracelet with an engraving in the side - and my husband made a keychain. We both wear our momentum all the time. It was really a wonderful learning and hands-on experience. Highly recommend - do not miss it.

Great with kids!. I took my two kids (ages 15 and 12) to make jewelry here--they had been looking forward to it, and the experience went beyond our expectations! They were so kind and helpful with my kids--and the jewelry that we were able to produce was stunning.

Our favorite activity in Ubud!. My husband, 5 kids (ages 6-16) and I were staying in Ubud for 10 weeks and decided to try out Chez Monique's Silver Smith Class the first week, after reading about it on TripAdvisor. We absolutely LOVED it! In fact, we had so much fun, we did 4 more classes during our stay! Wayan and the staff at Chez Monique are terrific and worked hard to ensure that each person's project came out successfully, each and every time. My daughter (age 13) made 6 rings over her 5 classes, each time taking on a more sophisticated design and more complicated processes. My sons (age 16 and 12) had fun making silver ice axes for pendants and gifts for their grandmothers. Even my twin 6 year-olds took a class one week and made pendants of their favorite stuffed animals. We also had 10 friends visit Ubud and had them come to a class as well. They all enjoyed it...men and women. I would HIGHLY recommend Chez Monique for everyone!!!! It is fun for kids, teens, men and women!

I went back for more!. Wayan has a smile and positive energy that lights up the entire compound. He and his team are artisans pleased to pass on their craft. Come with an idea of what you would like to make, and then peruse Wayan's pictures and samples to really get what you want. You are the artist here. Wayan's team will support you every step of the way, from drawing your design to the final touches, but this will be YOUR work of art - one you will love forever. The environment at the studio is warm and loving, and so much fun as everyone shouts for joy at their pieces. I had so much fun and loved my ring so much that I went back the next day to create another. Also, Wayan's silver shop has some of the most creative and original pieces that I saw in Ubud. If you are shopping for silver, make sure to go to Chez Monique.

Make this one on your list. I went along to meet Wayan and his lovely wife, Monique with my friend, who said it was something she was recommended to do. I am so glad we went. Not only were Wayan and his assistant, Eko, an absolute delight to meet, but were so relaxed and patient, encouraging and helping where needed. I surprised myself in the end at the quality and workmanship, and I did much of the hands on, from the free-hand template to cutting it out with the saw. My design was inspired by the incredibly large gheko (25cm long, no kidding) above my bed in my accommodation. Symbolizing, luck, love and fertility! Free coffee, tea and water were on hand and very clean facilities. Wow, what a fabulous experience! I highly recommend going and meeting Wayan and making something for yourself as a wonderful keep-sake from your adventures in Bali.

Fun day making jewelry!. My 9 year old daughter and I had a fun time making silver jewelry here! You can create *anything* you want, and they offer many design ideas. The staff was eager to help us with any hiccup. My daughter was dying to go back, but unfortunately, time didn't allow it. Highly recommend!

A unique bali experience. Firstly I am sorry for taking so long to write this review. We had a great afternoon with Wayan and his team at his compound in Ubud. When we arrived we were shown examples of jewellery that we could make. I had a couple of ideas of my own so I started to sketch them. Luckily I was told they were possible to make so we began the process of cutting out the designs in silver - I was not very good at this but the patient skilled staff were on hand to help me. Throughout the process we received help when we needed it but also had the freedom to do as much as we could by ourselves. It was a really fun afternoon, as the only couple in the class we enjoyed one to one supervision. At the end of the class we had two beautiful and unique pieces of jewellery. We went to the shop to buy a chain for my pendant, Wayan then offered to fix the chain to the pendant and delivered the complete necklace to our out of town accommodation the next day. Wayan was a lovely gentleman who happily shared his skills. We would love to visit again. Thank you for helping us create beautiful pieces that we are often asked about.

Fantastic hands on experience. I turned up to chez monique with an idea already in mind of what I wanted to make and the guys were great at helping me create a bracelet. They advised me on extra cost beforehand as it's just 10grams of silver included in price and my bracelet weight just a little more but nice to know at the beginning. Very warm and welcoming hosts and great help in creating your silver piece. Would love to go back and create more. Thank you Chez Monique!

A must to Do. My Daughter and I attended Wayan,s jewellery class this morning . It was fantastic. They make you feel so welcome and give you lots of encouragement . I would have to say that the last 10 years I have been coming to Bali this would be one of my biggest highlights. When I return to Bali next year I will be returning to make myself something else. If you have the time I highly recommend this to do.

Really cute. My girlfriend and i had never done anything like this and were unsure what to expect. The class was alot of fun, the guys were extremely helpful and good teachers. We were thrilled with our end product and coulsnt shut up about how much fun we had. I will most likely return

Excellent experience!. This class was a really interesting experience and we thoroughly enjoyed it - the perfect balance of letting us learn and try things for ourselves and helping. Overall it was a great way to spend some time!

Second visit. My first visit was 2012 & had to come back again! Wayan and staff are so patient & friendly. Came with family 2012 & brought a friend 2014. Both times made amazing pendants. A great experience and highly recommend to anyone.

Our favourite activity in Bali... not bad for someone as uncreative as me :-). My partner suggested this jewellery making class as he wanted a new ring for himself. I am the most uncreative person on earth and it wouldn't normally be my type of thing but I went along because I knew how much he wanted to do it. Turns out I had an absolute magical time and it was by far one of the best things I have ever done, especially in Bali. The staff are so friendly and will help you as much or as little as you need them to. I wanted a pendant with the tree of life. They encouraged me to first attempt to draw a tree myself which was very bad... haha... but then they helped me to tweak it and make it look like an awesome tree. I loved cutting it out and working with the nice man who helped us put it all together. We walked away each with a stunning and unique piece of jewellery and I will make sure we go back and do this class every time we visit Bali. Thank you to everyone at Chez Monique for a fun and rewarding experience... highly recommended and incredible value for money!!!

I love these people. November 2013 was first time I attended this class and again May this year. Will be going again November this year. All the staff are beautiful and patient. I am not arty by a long shot, but they are very encouraging. I was truly amazed at the work that goes into even the simplest of jewelry. Last year I made a beautiful pendant for my daughter (people ask her where they can get one - sorry, it's a one off :) ). Cost includes all materials and one on one instruction. You do everything from choosing your design, cutting it out to the hard work of polishing. If you are not into making your own stuff, please take time to visit their shop in Ubud as I have watched them making their pieces - it is all hand made, therefore each would be unique.Chezmoniquejewelry.com

An interesting and different experience.. Located in a quiet backstreet just away from the main hustle and bustle of Ubud, a visit to the silver studio is an ideal way to spend a few hours if you seek something a little different from the main tourist pulls of Ubud. The studio is very peaceful and all the team are very patient and happy to help you. Wayan was very kind and nobody hassles you into buying anything other than that which you are there to create (a pleasant change from the rest of Ubud). You can be as hands-on as you want, the team are there to guide (or to take over if you need them!). This was my first experience at doing something like this. I went on my own and felt very comfortable and was given as much or as little help as I needed. I definitely recommend this to anyone visiting the town, it actually has a very broad appeal as you do not have to be creatively gifted to take part. At the end of the visit I have a unique souvenir of my time in Ubud-which means more than something purchased and haggled over in a touristy shop.

Unique souvenir. Wayan was very nice welcoming us at his family compound. If you don't have an idea of what to do you can choose from many pictures. If you already have an idea in mind, Wayan is there to help you design your piece. We have made a ring and a pendant. Both are very simple since that is what we wanted. About 2h later everything was finish. Also, we were the only two attending the class so we had all the attention of Wayan and the teachers. We are very happy with our unique souvenir. We strongly recommend this activity. Thanks Wayan for this special experience.

Exciting workshop. It was amazing experience doing this jewellery workshop. I felt very welcomed by Wayan, his wife in their lovely , peaceful home & their apprentices who were very friendly & helpful .I have a lovely silver pendant that I completed & many people have commented on it. I would definitely recommended anyone who is visiting Bali to make the time to visit Ubud & complete the workshop.

Fun silver jewellry making class. My 9 year old daughter and I recently visited Chez Monique silversmith class. We had a great afternoon with Wayan and made 2 stunning pieces of silver jewelry. Everyone was very helpful, patient and friendly, especially helping my daughter who made an intricate piece. We would highly recommend if you are in Bali and will definitely go again if we come back to Bali.

Make your silver dreams come to life..... We loved, loved this silver class!!! I went to Chez Monique with my husband, our 8 year old daughter and her friend. Wow! Wayan and his staff are amazing....they so helpful, friendly and super attentive! You can either bring your own design, photo or look through several of their photo books for ideas or inspiration. Not to worry...somehow, they make everything you make look gorgeous! Depending upon your desires, you can take as much or as little help from their staff as you like. Our finished items were fabulous! They all look like we came from a beautiful silver shop! The best part was that we designed them ourselves and we now own one-of-a-kind silver creations! If you have any interest in crafts, design, silver or just an afternoon of fun, check them out! We will definitely go back!!

Enjoyable afternoon of hands on jewellery making. My 16yo daughter and I visited Chez Monique and really enjoyed it. We both chose pendants from the many photos available - designs to suit just about anyone's taste. Next step was to draw a template which was attached to the silver so what you draw is what you get. Can't draw? Don't panic, if it doesn't go well one of the guys will help so it looks like it should. We then were shown how to cut out the piece using a wire like blade - they started us off and only helped if we got stuck, broke a blade (and not just one!) or asked for assistance with the tricky bits. They did all of the soldering - they use foot pedal bellows to control the soldering flame, certainly beyond our expertise. We then filed and buffed with a very pleasing finished product.We were lucky to be the only 2 there at the start so got plenty of help but still felt we did as much as we were able - soldering and electric sanding really not ideal for total beginners. Wayan was lovely, took time to show some of his and his son's work.We were both really pleased with the finished items and would love to visit again given the chance.Probably the only criticism is cost was not mentioned until the end but we did not ask either - even so thought the whole experience and finished product (how many people can say they have a piece chosen and made by themselves?) was good value for money and would do it again

Fixed my ring. When I got to Bali the stone in my gold ring had come loose. It was my grandmother's and is my dearest possession. I saw Wayan's Silver Class sign on my hotel's road and went in to see him on my last day. I was very nervous to leave my ring or to have someone work on it that didn't really know what they were doing. Not only was Wayan incredibly knowledge, he was very sensitive to it being intensely sentimental. He fixed my ring in a few hours and went above and beyond what I was expecting by polishing the stone. My ring looks the most beautiful it's ever looked and the stone is securely locked in now. What a blessing to find him!

A fun and memorable experience. On our honeymoon, we thoroughly enjoyed our couple of hours making earrings for me and a replacement wedding band for my husband. After losing his ring on day 1(!!) he was able to make a stand-in from scratch with our wedding date and initials stamped on the inside. Wayan and his team were a pleasure to deal with. I'd recommend any visitors to Ubud to try this fun activity. Visiting Wayan's workshop and seeing his neighbour painting on his porch was an added bonus.

Get creative!. The silversmith class with Wayan made me create a unique piece of jewellery. Everybody was super friendly and I could amlost do everything to create my bracelet! It was so much fun making something with my own imagination and work on it!
Great experience. We had a great time making our jewelry. We were the only two in the class and Wayan gave us personal attention. We got more than we expected!

An afternoon of pure joy.. My afternoon was spent recapturing techniques last used many many years ago with the help and encouragement of Wyan and his skilled staff. Thanks so much for your enthusiasm with the project I had chosen. The recipiant (wife of 42 + years) was delighted and want's me to return to make more. Pretty sure that Chez Monique workshop will be regularly on the Ubud itinerary from now on. And the coffee was great!! Thanks againSteve R Melbourne Aus

Highlight of my time in Bali!. Every time I go to Bali I make a little something with Wayan. He is the nicest man and welcomes you into his home! Highly recommended!! I've been three times and going back in August and December.

Wonderful experience. What a wonderful experience. Wayan, his family and his staff do such a great job of looking after us and helping us create amazing silver pieces. We have been to do the class 5 times now and still love it every time we go. We will definitely do it again.

A real highlight of our time in Ubud.. Wayan and his team ensure everyone has a successful experience at his silver making class in his family compound in central Ubud. With patience, guidance and a good sense of humor you are taught the basics of silver design and production in just a few hours. Each 'student' works at their own pace, with their own vision of what they want to create. I took an image that was of special significance and was able to make a pendant for my daughter that she really loves. Nothing better than giving a hand made gift! I have shared your business cards with the hotel where I stayed and they are going to recommend it to future guests.

An amazing afternoon. My girlfriend and I had a genuinely fun afternoon with the amazing wayan and his silver smithing class. Our designs were a little different but it was no drama and were able to get really hands on during the day with a little grinding, melting and some buffing. My girlfriend loves the finished design.

Absolutely the highlight of Bali!!!. This place is incredible! !! Book now before it gets too popular and fills up :) A really fun day where you get to learn and make your own jewelrey. The workshop is in a family house and it is great to see how Balinese people live in such a happy community. I did the course with my boyfriend and we both had complicated designs in mind but Wayan was keen to help us + optimistic, and the results were spectacular! Also a big highlight for me was that it was such good value for money and so entertaining. Enjoy this place!!

Thank you Wayan! . I had arranged the class with Wayan via email and had to change my time all of which he accomodated perfectly! I was late arriving and had the whole workshop to myself. Wayan and his family took such good care of me helping me to make my design how I wanted it and showing me how to do and use everything. Was a truly lovely experience which I highly recommend, thank you Wayan for your hospitality and adding another great memory to my trip.

A personalised memory of Bali. Three weeks in Bali accumulating many wonderful memories (and too many dresses and sarongs), so I decided to buy something that would last: a fellow traveller suggest a jewellery class. I found Chez Monique on the web, then checked it out on TA. Wow what an experience.Wayan and his talented and friendly team are amazing; the studio is inspiring, the equipment well used (which is encouaging and inspiring in itself). Although there very photos of many designs and styles, I had my own idea of what I wanted plus I had a photo of something similar (I went to Wayan's shop first). Once I had sketched my design it only took 2hrs for it to become a silver reality. Thank you.

Great experience. This was a great way to spend the morning with my daughter and son in law. All three of us really enjoyed making a personal piece of jewellery that had meaning to each of us. All the staff members of staff were friendly, helpful and fun. Highly recommend a visit to this establishment

So much fun. Doing the jewellery making class was so much fun. Everyone was so helpful and professional and sitting in this lovely Balinese home was really a peaceful and enjoyable experience. Love that I could make something personal for my grandchild.

Original Handmade Silver Jewellery. A Big thankyou to Wayan and his awesome silversmithing staff. My partner and I had an amazing couple of days spent with Wayan designing and handmaking our own jewellery with rubies we supplied. We left silver and stones with him and hand drew many designs and pieces to be made by him while we did other things and then returned to pick them up and make our individual earrings and rings. Such fun and great teachers and now friends we will visit again when we return to Bali. Thoroughly recommend it to everyone! young and old :)

Momentos. Loved this experience. My wife and I had lots of fun I made a ring for her. She made a Pendant for me. The silversmiths were extremely helpful and patient. The coffee is awesome its a must try when u r making yr silver items. NJY the experience. A must do when u r n Ubud.

Amazing experience. This class was recommended to me via a friend. I'm so glad I took the advice. From the moment I arrived, I felt welcome in Wayan's studio! Greeted with a smile and a hug! Wayan gave me time to look over a few books with designs and then gave me advice on what I could create. I was surprised at how much I was doing to create my piece! I designed, cut, grinded, blow torched, and polished! Of course, I required help at times and there was always someone there on hand. I felt so much emotion whilst creating my piece. I teared a little as I left, it was a great day and something I'll never forget!

Highlight of my trip. This is the highlight of my trip! Had fun working on my ring with dedicated and skillful teachers. They allowed me to try working on my ring 90% of the time with guidance.Their sense of humour made the session v interesting. It's also quite an experience to have the session within a home compound. All family members are so friendly! :)
Wonderful morning. Delightful class, with helpful silversmiths and plenty of guidance and advice. Very pleased with my earrings!

Great class. My mum and I took a beautiful jewellery class at Chez Monique. Wayan was so welcoming with that beautiful smile. We had so much fun sitting in their gorgeous home enjoying mangosteens and making necklaces. Wayan and his family were so patient and the class was a one on one sit and have some fun. We are both so happy with what we made. We will definitely be back!

Top of my list in ubud. I've never felt compelled to take the time to write a review, but this class, Wayan, and Monik merit a huge nod. The class, which is held at Wayan's studio is in a lovely outdoor setting and is a computable creative environment. They go above and beyond encouraging and mentoring throughout the whole creation process, and are so kind. Come prepared, and with a design in mind is my suggestion! 5 stars hands down.

Fantastic Must Do in Ubud!. Chez Monique was mentioned to us by a French couple we met on a cycling trip while in Ubud. Thank heavens they did, it was an amazing experience. From an insignificant piece of silver we transformed it into something special and very memorable, with the very patient help of Wayan and his staff. The surroundings were peaceful and cool. A truly amazing activity to do, especially on the heat of the day!

So Amazing!!. This is a must do experience in Ubud! So generous and kind with their patience and time, it makes me wanna go back for more! A great way to explore your creative side all afternoon in beautiful Ubud.

A Must-Do in Ubud!. Having read wonderful reviews about this workshop and knowing it was only a few doors up the street from where we were renting a place, my daughter and mother-in-law enrolled in a class almost as soon as we got to Bali. They spent a fabulous morning working on their own silver piece. They learned how to use the proper tools and the different steps needed in order to make silver jewellery. The workshop is in a Balinese compound surrounded by nature. The whole experience was simply wonderful. It was a nice bonding moment between grand-mother & granddaughter, and the final pieces are spectacular.An absolute must-do in Ubud! A five-star recommendation!

Fabulous Experience - One of a Kind. It was a real personal experience to be able to work side by side with the silversmiths in Ubud. The shop is in the entry patio of Wayan and Monik's home which allows for a very personal experience. Plan to spend time so you are not pressured as you create your masterpiece.

Great experience . Had a great time with wayan and Eko, felt very welcome and thoroughly enjoyed the class. Worth every cent !I made a ring and my husband a silver bracelet pendant. Wayan and Eko are both so patient and helpful

Wonderful experience. This is my third visit to Wayan's home for silver class. It is always a happy time with so much care and help from Wayan, Eco & Mogi. I made a ring & charm today really thrilled with them. I did my design & drawings beforehand, it saves a lot of time if you have some idea what you want to make. Now must think about design for next time!
Well worth it . Amazing hospitality and friendly service, highly recommend if you want something special to take away with you from your holiday

Fantastic fun!. Had a great few hours creating a unique silver souvenir ring for myself. I'm quite indecisive and a perfectionist so not the easiest combination but Wayan and the other gentleman were extremely patient and helpful. Only wish that I had time to go back and make something else!

Unique experience. I wanted to make a gift for my wife and this seemed like the ideal opportunity. I'm not the most artistic person in the world but Wayan was on hand to help me through the process and, from a basic plaque of silver, I was able to create a unique present for my wife. Scored major brownie points!I highly recommend this as something different from the normal tourist attractions. Wayan will make sure you're well looked after.

Experience of a Lifetime. We made a last minute decision to take this class with Wayan and it turned out to be a great find. Wayan fitted us into his class, with no problems and gave us a great welcome to his home!! if you have an idea of a design in your head for a piece of jewellry bring it wit you because you will be accomadated by wayan and his staff but if you don't have any ideas don't worry about it because wayan will help you decide. it's a great way to see how the locals use their tools to create beautiful pieces which will always remind us of our trip to bali and to wayans workshop.. we will be back for another class on our next visit to bali

Amazing workshop!. Yesterday I went to have a silver class at chez Monique. It was such an amazing workshop.I had fun and learn how to make jewelries from silver. The amazing Wayang and his friends welcomed me with a huge and a smile.And the product came just as I pictured it!Highly recommend!!!

So Good I Went Twice. Spent two great mornings at Chez Monique making two great pendants which are great souvenirs of my time in Bali. First morning there was me and a few couples but we had all been scheduled with different start times so Wayan could get us started and ensure no bottleneck. Helped me fix my mistakes and took care of some of the tricky bits but I left with something I really felt I made. Loved it so much went back the next morning to make a second piece. Will recommend to friends and family. I'll make sure to visit again when next in Bali.

Fantastic!!!. We brought our three daughters (ages 5, 5, and 8) to Wayan and Monik's home to learn about how to make silver jewelry. We had a wonderful time. We learned a lot, received plenty of help when we needed it, and our pieces turns out great! It was the highlight of a trip that included many great activities.

Fantastic experience!. The silver smith class at Chez Monique is not to be missed! Wayan and his staff are very friendly and patient. They worked with everyone in our party, including a three year old that wanted to help, to design and create AMAZING silver jewelry! This class was the highlight of an outstanding trip to Bali. Book this class...you won't find a better experience. :)

Very Disappointing. After reading so many positive reviews I was so excited to do the Chez Monique class. I did the course yesterday and its been bothering me since. After a 1 hour taxi ride from Sanur to Ubud I sat down with Wayan (who is lovely) and really took my time choosing the best piece for me. Then it went downhill from there. The whole ‘making’ process only took about 20 minutes and it was done. I struggle to say that I made this piece because all I did was cut out the shape and later polish it, the rest I just watched being done for me. I sat there thinking that these parts must be the technical parts that they always do and soon ill get into it, and then my piece was finished! I chose quite a small piece because I wanted it to go on a bracelet that wasn’t so big, but I really wish I had been able to make something else with the left over silver because I’m sure there was quite a bit – I guess my fault for not asking.So all in all I don’t think I got what I was expecting out of it – a very tiny piece that I don’t feel like I can completely say ‘I made’.

Fantastic. This was an amazing experience. Wayan was fantastic and showed me so many new techniques truly amazing experience and I made an amazing piece. Thank you wayan for a fantastic experience recommend to everyone.

A lasting memento of my trip. What a fabulous way to spend a few hours. Wayan and Monik are the most lovely and welcoming people that I met in my 16 days in Bali! I was made so welcome and it was an honour to spend time in their home to make such a lovely piece of jewellery.I have had so many nice comments when I wear my necklace. I can't wait to get back and make another piece.Thank you so much Wayan for spending time with me and having the patience to teach me how to make this beautiful pendant.

Must do !!!. My husband Jason and I spent yesterday morning at Chez Monique. We were there 3 hours and the time flew by with everyone concentrating on making their own special piece of jewellery. Wayan and Monik are just gorgeous and really make you feel welcome In their home. The hardest part of the class is deciding what design you want to make there are 100's to choose from, if you plan ahead take your own design and wayan and his team will help you create your unique piece. Both my husbands and mine turned out amazing and we are so grateful that we had the chance to experience this class. We enjoyed it so much we will definitely be back to visit Wayan and Monik again !Kim

Excellent experience. This was one of my highlights for my first trip to Bali. With Wayan's help, I created my unique ring that has my life line on the surface of the ring and a cross hidden inside. I had hands-on experience carving and polishing my ring too.Highly recommended activity.

Jewellery Making. What a wonderful experience, not only a great day out with friends, you come away with a unique piece of hand crafted jewellery that you've made yourself. Wayan and team are professional and very helpful to ensure you have a quality piece. Made (Wayan's Brother) can pick you up from Kuta, Legian, Seminyak for $50/car/day and has intimate knowledge of the culture & surrounding area as you drive to Ubud. After lunch in the rice fields a trip to the markets can be arranged all before Made drives you back. Thanks Wayan & family a highlight of my trip to Bali

Fantastic morning. There were 4 in our group that travelled to Ubud for the morning to make some jewellery. Wayan's brother Made Suparna picked us up from Legian and drove us around for the day, his english and his knowledge was invaluable a great guide. Our morning spent making jewellery at Wayans was fantastic his hospitality and guidance through making our pieces was wonderful. We left with some high quality lovely pieces which will be a reminder of a great day. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend doing this to anyone who is visiting Bali for a holiday.

My favourite part of my holiday. Visiting Wayan and his beautiful and warm hearted family is definitely a wonderful experience. They help you with the whole process of creating your own piece and make it highly enjoyable for all publics. I've managed to convince my husband to come with me to make a ring and even though he doesn't like this type of activities he absolutely loved it.They are talented at teaching and also at creating. They make beautiful things and they love what they do.We will definitely be coming back and I look forward to it already.

Lasting souvenir of amazing Ubud. I decided to surprise my daughter to something a little different to the usual tourist outing in Bali.Shopping, massage braid your hair! NO ............... We spent a morning making an exquisite individualy designed (by us) 925 silver piece of jewellery. I went thinking this will be nice mother daughter time and we will come out with a cute lump of something resembling jewelry. Wrong! We arrived and were warmly welcomed and after consulting some photograph albums and a little googling we settled on our designs. I strongly suggest you arrive with your design ready to go to save time though as I will do next time. Although there was plenty of help and assistance we realy felt that we made our pendants ourselves, complete with name, date or inspirasional message engraved on the back. I can highly recommend this experience to all I can truly say it was the best experience of our holiday although we did also indulge in shopping and massage NO hair braiding :). Cost $40 but we used a little more silver so paid $50 very reasonable as we were there several hours and took home a high quality piece of art, if I may say so myself. Big thanks Chez Monique we will return.

Great Morning. A great way to spend a morning with a huge amount of things you can make yourself, or if your not that good with your hands they will let you have a go and help you along the way. My wife and I loved it and it really shows you how beautiful Bali and the people can be.

One of the Best things to do in Bali. Spending a morning or afternoon in Ubud with Wayan, in his family home, creating a piece of silver jewellery that is a permanent memento of your holiday in Bali, is one of the best things you can do. We have returned many times with family and friends and always leave with a lovely new piece of silver.

Loved it. Had a great time doing this made my own ring, was a lot of fun and the guys were all really lovely and helpful. Was a really cool experience which I'd do again but next time I'd go prepared with some design research, if your thinking about it definitely give this place a go

A must do!. I have travelled to bali several times and this is by far the best "hands on" class I've done. Wayang couldn't have been more friendly or helpful and I loved everyone's assistance in helping me fashion a stunning pendant. They also made little initial pendants on the spot that I asked for. Absolutely loved this class, and I encourage everyone to give it a go!!!
Creatively genius!. Had an awesome creative experience here! Created my own silver bracelet in a setting and ambiance that made one feel part of the family.

The magic of Ubud. Spent a magical afternoon realising my design with the help of Eco and Wayan. Thank you Eco for your good eye and hands - showing me the process of silversmithing. I learnt a lot. Just one of the many magical things to do in Ubud. Go with a drawing and an open mind.....

Silver making class. My daughter and I each made a pendant at the silver making class. I had so much fun creating my design. My daughter wasn't as thrilled as I was to take the class but she was very happy with her end product as they are so warm and friendly and helpful. When I go back to Bali, I will definitely take some more classes. You can be as creative as you desire. Love, love loved it!

Silver smithing!. I was dying to try out a bit of jewellery-making, and, being a massive fan of silver, I decided to try out Wayan's class.When I got there I had no idea what to make, in the end I figured my own doodle was something I'd like to bring to life.I had no idea how to go about it but with the help of Wayan, Eco & Moggie I created my most favourite and memorable piece of jewellery. I'd definitely recommend this, as when I look down at my ring on my finger I always think fondly of Ubud!

Creative and beautiful!. Just spent the morning at Chez Monique's and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Last year my wife and a friend made a few pieces here. This year I decided to join my wife and try to make a silver ring. Even though I don't consider myself artistic, with the help of Wayan I was able to design and make a silver ring. Enjoyed the whole process and appreciated the help of the craftsmen. Amazing how beautiful they all turned out!

Jewellery making experience. What a fabulous fun way to spend an afternoon in Ubud. Choose a design from their extensive catalogues or bring along your own design to make. Wayan along with his two other jewellers are very welcoming and encouraging to novices to 'have a go'. Don't be in a hurry, plan to spend at least 3 hours as there was about 8 of us in the class, all requiring various amounts of assistance. Clean amenities and refreshments provided.

Fantastic experience. Wayan was extremely friendly and helpful. I had come with two designs that I wanted to make and he and his staff assisted me to make these. I was able to choose what size silver to use and they assisted me using the different tools needed. It was a great experience, would definitely recommend to my friends.

One of a kind. I looked into a number of silversmithing studios in Ubud, and I got lucky in selecting Chez Monique first. I loved it so much I went back three more times. From the minute you arrive, you're welcomed by Wayan and his staff and family. Echo and Mogo work with Wayan, and they are just as committed to making your creation a stunning piece of art. I could not rave about my time at Chez Monique more!

Fantastic experience, love what we made. My husband and I looked forward to this experience and it did not disappoint! So glad we made it. We had full creative control and they gave advice throughout the process that made us feel really at ease about 'going for it' (we have not done something like this before). We did most of the work ourselves but were well supervised. They helped to tidy up small imperfections and everything came out brilliant. If we had more time in Ubud we would certainly have signed up for another class to make something different as souvenirs for our mums. Wayan and his team (family? This class was held in their family compound) were welcoming, friendly and just lovely to work with. We will definitely do this again on our next trip to Ubud.

Fantastic! A must do. We loved the Chez Monique silversmith class. It was a unique way to spend 3 or so hours in Ubud. We came with no idea what we would make and ended up making 2 pendants and some earrings. Neither of us are overly talented but the people there assisted us in the parts we could not do by ourselves. If you have no idea what you want to make, there are folders and folders worth of pictures to help. Coffee and water was provided, and a friendly chat. The pieces we made came out looking stunning - highly recommended attraction.

Great Day out. Wayan was extremely friendly and helpful and he welcome's you with open arms and big hugs, his workshop and facilities were very neat and clean in a residential setting. Although we came with some ideas of our own he was able to help us select something more compatible with the time we had available and we produced with his help two lovely pieces of jewelry to take away. Wayan and Echo ( I think thats his name) kept a watchful eye over us and advised about technique, and stepped in on some of the more difficult aspects. all in all a great day out including the trip back through Ubud which is picturesque and filled with interesting shops, (that we unfortunately didn't have time to explore).

Thank you. My mum and I had a lot of fun as a part of this class. We came with some ideas but there was also a lot of inspiration and advise given there. Wayan and team helped us to create a beautiful piece of jewellery each which we were proud to have made ourselves. It is good to feel as though we now have another budding skill. Thank you for an encouraging morning.

A Great Experience. This was great fun. We all chose a design from the many available choices, which could be modified how we wanted. There was lots of friendly and patient help to get us going and with the more skilled aspects of the process. We all walked away with a necklace we were proud to wear! Thanks Wayan!

Better than buy one in the store!!. Wonderful experience! Something to do if you have 40$ or more to do your creation! More silver you use, more you pay, but very good experience for me! In the tourist season its probably differente, but you have to do the stuff by yourself... Thats the idea and the guys will help for sure!!I did a ring, better than the store can offer me! Souvenir for a live!

Fantastic Morning at Chez Monique!. I visited Chez Monique in January, 2014. It was a really wet day in Bali and this was a perfect activity to enjoy in the rain.We were greeted with hugs by our teacher Wayan Sunarta and seated at a table with some paper, pencils, and 3 display books filled of inspiration. I am not very artistic, so I chose a simple design - an infinity ring. Others taking the lesson chose more complicated things like earrings, bracelets, pendants etc. You can do anything you like and there is plenty of help if you need it!Wayan and his staff will help you shape your jewellery if you need it, however they let you do it instead of taking over (unless you really need them to, which I did at one point!). I chose to engrave my ring using my twin sister, and my own initials. The staff are very approachable and will go out of there way to ensure you are comfortable and enjoying your experience. This is a great activity for the young, and young at heart. I am 27 and would recommend this for children as well as adults of all ages. No matter your level of skill you will leave with a beautiful piece of jewellery that you designed and made. What a great souvenir.Thank you so much to everyone at Chez Monique! We had a wonderful day.- Louise

Jewellery making class. Had a fabulous 2 hours with my daughter making a pendant each. Wayan Sunarta is a lovely man who made us feel very welcome. He and his staff guided us through the process, to produce a beautiful pendant to wear at home. We will love to come back in the future to make something else. It was definitely a highlight of our holiday. Thank you Wayan and your staff.

Patient and love class made my favorite ring ever!. I was too lucky to meet Wayan in their family wedding, I start talk to him because he looks friendliest that day in the crowd. There's more story after I met Wayan, in short, this man made my trip!Wayan's class is fabulous! I can't not believe that they give me the second change cause I made a mistake with my first ring. I choose a design that is very difficult to make. Total We spend 4+ hours to make it perfect! Wayan and the stuff are always smiling and full of patient to make your ring right! They care the details! And they only charged a very reasonable price depends how weight the silver you use on your ring! I wear my ring everyday now, there's a lot of memory and love in it! Don't miss it if you're in UBud!

Great for kids and adults. My wife and two kids did this. They each made a piece of their own. The artist is friendly and patient. A special activity with a nice souvenir at the end. Walkable from Ubud centre.

Fabulous!. I had an amazing afternoon creating and crafting my pendant under Wayun's watchful eye. The whole family is involved in making this a fabulous experience and after only a few short hours you walk away with an original piece of jewellery. Discreet classes. Plenty of assistance and a guaranteed result at the end. Highly recommended!

A lifetime memory. This was the highlight of our week's stay in Bali - Wayan is just so welcoming and his enthusiasm for his craft so inspiring. I managed to persuade my husband to come along (as everyone else had fallen sick!) and he ended up having the best time ever, boys with toys - hacksaws, hammers, grinders and shears!! This is a fantastic hands-on workshop, suitable even for children, they give you the basics, but then you can improvise and be as creative as you like, but always with help and guidance when needed. We will treasure our creations !

Beautiful result, something I'd wear. Chez Monique offered my teenaged daughters and myself an opportunity to create a nice piece of silver jewelry. We entered the compound and were greeted by a smiling group of silversmiths. We could either choose our piece of jewelry from a book or create our own design. I made a ring, my daughters each chose a pair of earrings and a necklace. While we did some of the work (the cutting, twisting and pounding) the silversmiths polished up the pieces and fused bits together. So, while we didn't do the whole process ourselves, we did get to see it all being done and we ended up with products that are very nice and we will wear proudly! The only reason I don't give this place a 5 star rating is because while we were there someone else in the home was burning something write next to our working place and the smell of smoke was strong throughout the afternoon.

Awesome afternoon activity. My husband and I decided to take the silver smith class on our last day in Ubud. We were promptly picked up at our hotel and driven to the site. Once there, we were graciously greeted by Wayan and offered cold drinks. We got to browse through several booklets to get an idea as to what we wanted to make. I chose to make a bracelet with an elephant pendant on it. You sketch a template then cut it on a sheet of silver, so you're actually creating your own artwork, not from a stencil. I thought that was very cool! I am not an artist, so my elephant didn't come out perfectly, BUT there are many people there to help you out. Any mistake you can think of, they can fix it. In the end, in were there for less than 2 hours and left with 2 new great pieces of jewelry. All for 900,000 rp. In my opinion, that is a more than fair price. What a great way to spend our afternoon!

Fantastic!!. My family and I went to chez Monique on the 4th of Jan 2014. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor I was looking forward to trying this. My hopes were not let down!! It was exciting to watch as our various projects begun to come to life. The tasks we were given, were challenging but not ridiculously hard and the staff were always there to give us a helping hand if we were having trouble! I really enjoyed the whole process!I thoroughly enjoyed my time at chez Monique and would recommend it to anyone. If I ever find myself in ubud again, I will definitely return!! 10 out of 10 from me!

Fantastic place. Chez Monique silver smith class was a very good class. The people there were nice and ready to help and also there was a very wide variety of possible things which you could make. All in all it is a great place to go when you are visiting Ubud and it will make a very good souvenir.

Fantastic activity. I visited with my 3 children (aged 13, 11 and 7) based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. Chez Monique was a fantastic place to visit - we all loved it. After choosing what to make from the many pictures available, we were all given just the right amount of help to finish our items. Three of us made pendants and my son made a bangle. All of them turned out incredibly well. We were given lots of personal attention, and were so impressed with Wayan his staff. They were very welcoming and it was also a great experience to visit a Balinese home. We were there about 2 hours and we ended up spending around Rp 500,000 each as we used more silver, particularly in the bangle. Given we all got to take home a great personal hand made souvenir I think this was pretty good value. I would highly recommend this activity, it was unique and fantastic.

you can just keep coming back. Great classes, flexible with times to suit whatever you are doing. So many choice of things you can make, rings, earrings, pendants and best of all you have a unique piece of quality jewellery to remind you of Bali

Great experience for children!. This was one of the activity my boys wanted to do in Bali and when we showed up without prior booking, Wayan graciously squeezed us in. We are so grateful and everyone there was so friendly. The staff there were very patient and helpful. My children are eight and they handled the tasks well. They did not do the polishing as the temperature was too high. It took us close to 2 hours to complete. The final products were beautiful and kids felt so proud. They wear their pendant all the time. Thanks so much for the wonderful experience Wayan and everyone there!

Very worthwhile. So much fun and such good value... From the moment you arrive you feel relaxed and welcome, sooo many designs to choose from...but for the first time the simpler the better.My husband made a beautiful ring with a fish design and was finished in 2 hours, I chose to make a cut-out design on a pendant.....4 hours later after a LOT of helpful hints and some finishing touches by Eko I ended up with a unique piece of jewelry I will cherish forever.Thank you Wayan and Eko for your patience this was one of the best experiences we had in Ubud!

Great way to spend a day.. Had a fantastic time. Wayan and his staff were friendly, patient and helpful. I was over the moon with the unique pieces of jewellery I made. Would definitely go again, & recommend to all my friends. Thanx Wayan!

So fun!. Wayan welcomed us with hugs and brought us into his home. He and his guys let us do most of it but they could tell when their help was needed. I went with no idea of what to make but after looking through pictures for ideas and sketching out ideas a bit, I ended up with the perfect design. My husband, (adult) daughter and had so much fun watching, helping and laughing with each other - what a great memory! Next time in Ubud, I'll definitely go again.

Don't miss this! . You don't just get a great experience at Chez Monique, you get to take home a special piece of jewelry designed and made by yourself.What surprises me the quality of the outcome. My turtle pendant looked just as good and if not better than what I see in shops. After class, I went straight to their shop to get a silver necklace for my pendant.A rewarding and authentic experience that you shouldn't miss in Ubud. I would come back again to make more pieces if only I have more than 3 days in Ubud.

Terrific fun. I spent a wonderful morning making a pendant with Mr Wayan at his home in Ubud. I have wanted to try my hand at making jewellery for some time and this gave me an idea of what it would be like. I loved it! I was very pleased the result. I would highly recommend Chez Monique Silver Smith Class to anyone wishing to bring home something extra special from beautiful Bali.

remarkable place to go. An amazing experience, i don ' t get in other places. With the remarkable individuals. Mr wayan the owners the workshop are those who are humble and very friendly. I and my husband chose to make a pair of wedding ring, and we are so amazed with the result that we are getting. With simple tools we get satisfactory results. the expert instructor guiding us for making the ring. Definitely an unforgettable experience

So much fun I booked twice!!. Seriously the best experience in Bali for me.. a must do for anyone crafty. I booked with Chez the day before and he stated that although he would not be there his colleagues would be - which was not a problem for me. The work shop is a 15 min walk from his shop near the soccer field in Ubud. Apparently Chez is the only locally owned silver smithing workshop in Ubud. Anyway I arrived very early as I really wasn't sure what I wanted to make as I have never done this kind of thing before and I wanted to look through the ideas books. As soon as I arrived I was given the books and I drew up some designs.. some of my own and some from the books. Then It was on to making!! On the first day I just cut out and engraved my designs but on the second day I was allowed to use the grinding and the polishing machine. I really loved the experience so much that I booked in for a second day. All up I made 3 sets of earrings and 5 pendants all of which I am very happy with. My friends and family have a unique gift that was handmade from me and I could not be happier with the result. I really did make a lot of jewelry and felt that the price was very very reasonable. When I come back to Bali I will definitely do this course again and I am already thinking of what I will make next time. Thank you to Chez, Moogy (a wonderful instructor) and Echo very talented artists!!

Excellent and Unique Bali Experience. Welcomed with a huge hug from Wayan, followed by a chat about what I wanted to design and make in the afternoon session. We proceed to make my design with friendly advise and assistance from the team, in a rustic Bali workshop, with little chicks running around your feet. Recommend it to anyone who wants to take away a unique piece of Bali Jewelry and also have a really enjoyable and authentic experience at the same time.

Make your own gifts and souvenirs!. Wayan, Echo, and Nyoman help you create a piece of silver jewelry (no previous knowledge required). My wife and I made matching rings for each other, and it was a lot of fun. This is a great experience and you get to work with expert craftsmen. You pick or create your design, then Wayan and company guide you through the steps and provide tools/materials. For difficult operations like soldering or fixing mistakes, don't worry, they've got you covered. Safe, friendly, and fun.
Fantastic. Really excellent. The staff was so friendly & very helpful & as my sister said if you can't do it they can. Will be going to do it again next time I'm in Bali

Fabulous morning!. Thank you for giving us such a fabulous morning! My husband was really reluctant and only went to humor me. When we left he was wanting to make another (and so was I). We both cut our chosen designs out of silver ourselves, but let the experts finish them off and make them look amazing, though they did offer to let us do it. I'm extremely happy with my piece and we can't wait to give our son the pendant my husband made for him. Our only criticism is that it was difficult for our driver to find, we came up from Umalas and out driver was not overly familiar with the area and we went past it because he was looking for the Chez Monique name, so maybe a more obvious sign?Thanks again, and we can't wait to come back!

Excellent experience. The idea of making my own jewelry was very enticing so I had to try this for myself. I travel by myself but the classes are given in a group which is nice. Wayan came and greeted each of us with a massive smile followed by a hug. A hug that felt very genuine in fact. The class was not strict and all the students went at their rate (some fast, some slower) and it was fine with Wayan to walk around and assist all who needed his help. His assistants were also very present and would help "fix" our mistakes over and over again. I happen to have snapped my ring a few times and felt embarrassed by it, but Wayan smiled and said he will fix it without any problem. The entire experience was very pleasant and of course, the end result being able to walk away with a unique hand crafted jewelry is just cherry on top. If you have free time and would like to create a souvenir like no other, than please consider this silver smith class.

Lots of fun.. I had come along to this class with an idea in mind of what I wanted, but since it involved setting too many stones, they said it wouldn't be ready that day. I decided then to just choose a design from one of their many books and go with that. (In the end I did get to set a stone and take it home that same day.)There are so many designs to choose from I don't think anyone would have a problem in finding something to suit. I chose a lotus - possibly a little on the complex side for a beginner.I have to admit I felt super clumsy as I have never done anything like this before, and I broke quite a few blades while cutting out my design, but the guys are so friendly and helpful, they just sorted it out for me. Apart from anything else, it's fascinating watching the guys work and seeing how silver jewellery is made.I went with a group of others and our designs ranged in complexity, but all of us had a great time and have great souvenirs to take home with us. :-)

Second visit will be back next time in Ubud.. I returned for a second class after an excellent experience last year. With help made 2 wonderful pieces of memorable jewelery that I will treasure forever. Warm and welcoming teacher,staff and family. Worth every cent.

Best Souvenir from Bali!. After reading various reviews on Trip advisor we decided to book this class as a couple. This class is located in a traditional Bailanese home near central ubud which gives a very nice cultural feel. Wayan was our instructor and he is very friendly & patient. The class fee includes 10 gm of Silver from which a ring or a locket can be made. We decided to make love bands for each other and after hours of brainstroming we came out with an idea. Now the real challenge was to make the ring from the raw silver strip which seemed like a difficult task but Wayan and his team helped us along the way. When we saw the finished product we were not able to believe that we had made the ring ourselves. It is one of the best personalised gifts which we have given to each other.Highly recommended if you want to give a personlized gift/Souvenir to your loved ones!

Great way to spend the day and make a special meaningful piece of Jewelry. Wayan invites you into his family compound and helps you create a piece of jewelry on the spot. Even though I am not artistic, he quickly understood what I was trying to create and corrected quite a few of my mistakes. The piece turned out great and it was very reasonably priced. I enjoyed myself thoroughly and HIGHLY recommend you spend a day creating your own special piece of jewelry.

Absolute highlight of Ubud holiday. If there is one thing you MUST do in Ubud it is a silversmithing class.  Wayan from Chez Monique greeted my daughter (9) and I with the warmest of welcomes and then after a cool drink we got straight into it! My daughter chose her piece from the many many designs available. I had a design in mind, so with a bit help from Wayan we came up with something that was going to work.Wayan's outdoor studio is situated at the rear of his family 's home. I have really been enjoying the experience of being invited into a traditional Balinese home.Wayan has a team of helpers that assist you with the soldering, grinding and buffing. I was particularly impressed with the attention, guidance and kindness offered to my daughter as she created her special piece.It was so rewarding to see your design come to life - from a dull piece of raw material to the most amazing shiny masterpiece.I highly recommend joining Wayan and his team for a silversmithing class.Chez Monique now sits firmly on the top of my 'must do' list every time we return to Bali!

Highlight of my ubud trip. Sliver class was the last programme of the day after a full morning of white water rafting and heavy lunch at naughty nuri. Was running super late for the class but Sunarta was so accomodating. They allowed us to start the class late and was patiently waiting for us. We took so long to come out with the design and kept changing it. But Sunarta and his team was always ready to assist and offer us their expert opinions. After the whole sliver making class, sliver making is really not very easy. It requires a lot of skill and patience. But with the assistance of Chew Monique team we were able to complete 6 sliver peices of our customised design. Thank you the team for the wonderful experience. I look forward to the next visit where I can challenge more complicated designs. Yumin From Singapore

extraordinary experience. Are you one of us that searches for something just a little different to make your holiday a life long memory? For my daughter and I Chez Monique silver class was just that. Not knowing what to expect we went ahead and pre booked our class. The reason for pre booking is that space is limited. By doing this Sunarta, Moniq, and their team can give you the most attention possible .When you arrive they welcome you into their home with hugs and smiles and then sit down with a beverage to discuss your idea or look through the catalog for something else. Don't worry because you think your plan wont work, if you can explain it or even draw a somewhat likeness of what you have in mind they will make it work. Once planning is done you sit at your station with the raw material and get to work. We chose rings of our own design, Sunarta shows you the tools and how to use them, then its up to you. You can do as little or as much of the work as you are comfortable with but please try to do it yourself. Sunarta and the team are so helpful and patient you cant make a mistake. The cutting, filing, hammering all add up to a one of a kind piece that will last a lifetime. Whenever we wear our rings we will think of Bali 2013, Sunarta, his beautiful wife Moniq and the fantastic experience we had at their home.

Excellent experience run by brilliant craftsmen. My husband and I visited the Chez Monique silver making class in September 2013. We have visited Bali numerous times and this was by far my favourite experience from all of our trips!While the compound can be a little difficult to find (make sure you take the address with you so you can ask for help) once you are there you are met by the lovely Sunarta who will assist you in the creation of a beautiful piece of jewellery. When I chose my design, I tried not to expect too much because I had no idea what the final product would turn out like. I couldn't wipe the smile off my face as the dull piece of silver I started with, slowly became a beautiful ring. We couldn't have been happier with the outcome and I would highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Bali.Thank you to Sunarta and your wonderful team!

Amazing for memories. My girlfriend and I designed our own bracelets last week at this wonderful shop. You can have as much input and hands on as you want. The atmosphere was great and the staff genuinely nice. We now have memories (in the form of our bracelets) to last a lifetime!

Amazing experience, so much fun!. Myself and My 2 children had a memorable time here at Chez Monique, we were able to design and create a peice in which would resemble our trip to Bali. I recommend everyone to do this as is creates a significant memory and is something you can take home with you. The staff hear and their is no problem they cant handle!

Very interesting class. I booked the silversmith course as one of the surprises for my wife on our honeymoon, and we both loved it.We arrived at 9:30am for our pre booked course. I had emailed Sunarta well in advance to arrange booking. Correspondence was great, just need to bear in mind the time difference, so email replies were exchanged over a few days.The team were ready for us and sat us down straight away to get some ideas of what we might like to make. We hadn't come with a plan, but there are books with literally hundreds of examples to inspire the imagination.We both decided on necklaces, and set about drawing up our ideas. The local team are as hands-on or hands-off as you want them to be, and will help with your design if needed, or suggest ideas if you are stuck!After redrawing our ideas in real size the silver was templates and we set about cutting, sawing, etching, bashing, filing, sanding and polishing our pieces.Sunarta and the team were happy to watch and offer assistance where needed, we never felt pushed to let them take over. However they would help with tricky bits if you asked. They even seemed happy enough when I snapped three saw blades cutting out my bit of silver!We were very pleased with our experience and the results, and would recommend the class highly. The Australian couple we shared our class with even booked to come back again to make some more.

A great experience. We arranged a visit to Chez Monique on the day and my wife had a great time making her piece of silver jewellery. You can make your own design or choose own from a huge catalogue. They let you make the jewellery whilst providing any help you need! It really is interesting to see the different stages of creating the jewellery! The staff are skilled and attentive, you don’t feel rushed at all. My wife was really pleased with the finished product and would definitely recommend a visit.

A new experience. I had a great time here but I think the key is to pick a piece that isn't too hard. I went with my mother and I made a fantastic ring.
