I was able to cut and file a pattern into the ring and it made a great birthday present for my boyfriend. Unfortunately, my mother picked a piece that involved a lot of twisting (we thought it would be easy but neither of us could make the simple-liking twists required) so the entire necklace was made by an assistant. It looks amazing but she personally feels the experience wasn't worth it for her. I would definitely recommend this, however stay away from twisting pieces! Lots of the harder looking pictures in the owner's books are actually much easier!

So much fun!. This class is such a great idea and well worth doing! The staff are so friendly and fun! The quality of what you can make in the class is much higher than expected and I now have a classy souvenir that will last me a life time! Thanks team

A lot of fun !. As previously mentioned here , went along with my wife for support and ended up making a ring for my daughter...she loves it as its so personal !The star of the show here is the owner Sunarta with his team of helpers , he was great and shared many stories of his village and his family...he is incredibly patient after my attempts at jewellry making and 8/9 hand saw blades later !My wife ended up making a fantastic pendant that she is very proud of.Yes if you want a more hands experience then ask , Sunarta's staff will walk you through every step of the process and are more than happy to help.It can be hard to find but pop into their shop on Dewi Sita Rd in Ubud and get the lovely Wayan to draw you a map , its a lovely stroll down hill afterwards back into Ubud.Thoroughly enjoyed our morning , ended up chatting to Sunarta long after we had finished , he cleaned some of my other jewellry for nothing.Will take my mother back next year and show Sunarta the all the fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor...he's a very humble host !

Wonderful class. We rocked up not sure what to expected - but really enjoyed the experience. The team were helpful & friendly and we both came away with a ring that we were both very happy with. they even shined and cleaned my other rings while we were there which was great!. Would do this again - something different to do on holiday & had a great time.

Great class, even for the uncreative. Came here to humour my wife who is much more creative than me. Husband and wife team owners were super friendly and enthusiastic, genuinely warm people. Staff were happy to help with my design, and very professional, but not over-bearing. Came away with a cool necklace and really enjoyed my morning - nice to really concentrate on a new skill and come away with something to show for it.House had plenty of parking for your scooter, but it was walking distance from town as well. Recommended.

Super, If you want more hands on though, just ask!. Visited at the beginning of September. The place is super and in a very lovely compound with the nicest people i met on the island. I made my own design based on ideas out of the book. I asked for something representative of Bali and was given some nice advice. i loved my time here and felt extremely comfortable. You are given the opportunity to either do the easy stuff and have the guys perfect it or, you can ask to be more involved. I think you do need to ask though as these guys are complete perfectionists and want you to leave extremely happy with your item of jewelry. It is however, a very difficult process and does require alot of help from the brilliant staff. The courses are very laid back and you get what you put in. Ask questions and they will answer and show, it is more of a relaxed unstructured few hours where you can do as little or as much as you like than a full blown course. I loved it and would highly recommend. The guy who owns it has an amazing story and he is local, it was important for me to support this as opposed to many foreigners whom have set up similar things in the area. Would highly recommend.

Room for improvement. Took the class largely due to positive reviews on TA.Found the whole experience to be underwhelming, I was expecting a more refined experience.I would say the class did not meet expectations.You enter the compound and after being greeted, you are give a whole bunch of folders of previous works so you can pick out or choose your own design, reminds me of the hairdresser.Next you pick your size (you are not given any information about pricing, about how many grams that is, about how many grams you're entitled to/is included etc.) and sketch your design onto paper.The teacher then starts hammering away at some silver, with no explanation and cuts your piece of silver to size. Next he starts cutting away one portion of the design then hands over to you, and not having done this before proceeded to brake 5 strings of the cutting saw, strings were replaced but was not given any help or guidance as to why you're breaking the string, what you're doing wrong etc.Anyway, after the cutting was finished, it was onto the other processes, where the staff kind of just took over tidied up mistakes and finished the piece (torching, cooling, buffing, etc.). It would be nice to also be involved in the other processes, but not even an explanation was given.We were happy with the finished product, it's very nice, but the experience was somewhat lacking. Pro'sChoose your own designMake (to a degree) your own souvenirFriendly staffHappy with finished product and proud to where something you helped makeCon'sHard to findLittle to no explanation of whats going on, processes, etc.Not hands on enough, only involved in sketching and cuttingPrice transparency

Fun activity!. We travelled from Seminyak to Ubud for this silver making class and it was worth the time and trip. We were greeted with warm hospitality and laughter in a relaxed environment - Wayan's courtyard! As complete novices, Wayan and team were very patient, creative and detailed from start to end. We are very pleased and proud with the silver pieces constructed and the fun educational process of it all. We will definitely be back! You will enjoy the experience, and bring home a momento that you could truly call one-of-a-kind.

Great for a souvenir. It's something worth spending a few hours making your own keepsake from ubud. The artisans were very helpful and encouraging. It is worthwhile spending some time before thinking of what design you would like to make especially if it is for some one special before heading there... There are many pictures for reference and it is pretty nice. The artisans will guide you along and help with the final touches. Highly recommended.

6 star. This is an amazing workshop to do in Ubud. I have done many activities in Bali and this has to be one of the best. You can take a picture with your own design or browse one of their many book and the delightful silversmiths will help you recreate whatever you choose. So friendly and welcoming...an experience not to be missed.

Great experience, highly recommended.. I decided to go to Chez Monique after looking at information on tripadviser before travelling to Bali and am so glad i did. The whole experience was so wonderful. Sunarta is a warm charming person adding to the great experience. I emailed Sunarta with designs for him to create which he did exactly as i wanted them. I can't thank Sunarta enough for my beautiful jewellery pieces. Sunarta allows you to participate as much or as little as you want in the jewellery making process. Entering his village was also a great experience. I would highly recommend this class to anyone looking for something special in Bali and can't wait to go back.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND - MUST DO!. we hired a driver to take us there, tucked away in small village neighborhood, don't be worried it's safe :). This was the best afternoon, we were there for about 3 1/2hrs. it's just him and an assistant so they work in small groups, but he was very busy, so it took awhile. We didn't mind, they were the nicest people! we got to pick through books of jewelry examples. but instead we designed our own. im not a good drawer, so know this if you want to have your own piece made, sketch it out and bring it with you (to scale) as they will use that drawing to make it. you truly cut, bend, file & form your own piece, it was awesome. Me and my husband got to make 2 beautiful one of a kind pieces that we will have to remember our honeymoon for a lifetime, it's the best souvenior there is! Great value! Don't miss it!

Great & Unique Experience in Bali! A lot of fun!. We found this workshop on Trip Adivser after we saw others' recommendation, so we booked the class via email with Master Silversmith Wayan directly, very easy, we just need to confirm number of people and the preferred session time. On the day we arrived about 9:30am, we were only group of class in the morning, so we were very luck to have Wayan and other two silversmith to help us aside. We started from picking the product & jewellery desgin we want to make,coz too many pretty stuff could not decide which one to pick, so eventually end up with the decision of making a ring & a matching pendent. Both of them are easy ones as no cutting technique involved, so roughly took me around two hours to finish. The final products were better than my expectation after they helped me finish polishing, very pretty & I was so excited about being able to make my own jewellery. I m not after a fine jewellery with perfect bits & parts, as this is my first time in making jewellery like this, I was enjoying the expirence & having fun. This is a unique and great expirenice and one of my best part in my Bali trip this time, and I've made something special as the souvernier. I was very happy and definitely recommend!!

Make the time to do this. Would would have ever thought I had artisitc ability? Set in the quiet traditional outskirts of uptown Ubud exisits this gem. I had a ball making two silver jewellery items that will always serve as a reminder of the wonderful experieince. The environment is welcoming and the people delightful. It was a magical experience that I would encourage everyone to try. It was a special day with much laughter and smiling.

You can just keep coming back!!. This is a great class. You get to make something special to always remind you of this beautiful island. Sunarta and his very helpful staff assist you to make whatever you choose and it is always hard to believe that you could of made the finished product. Very professional but warm and welcoming that is why I will keep coming back to Chez Monique!! Thanks again Sunarta for my helping me make a beautiful ring on my 25th wedding Anniversary Trip in March and my heart pendant last week- both gorgeous pieces even if i do say so myself!! See you next time!!

Good fun, and a souvenir at the end. I booked the Chez Monique class via email a couple of weeks prior to my trip, and was given a choice of three timeslots for the day, with each class taking about 1.5-2 hrs. Chez Monique silver studio is located about a kilometer up a gentle hill on Jalan Sriwedari, which is off the main road, not far from the Ubud market. (I got transport there, but as we approached Jalan Sriwedari, the driver suggested he drop me at the start of the road because it is too narrow to drive up. As it was raining, and I had no idea where I was going, I insisted. The road is fine for driving, so don't fall for this trick!). The class is situated in an undercover patio of the family compound of Sunarta, our welcoming and charming host. It was really nice to see how the locals live in a pleasant residential street. After a warm welcome, we were given time to browse the design books and sketch our intended piece. I drew a fairly simple medallion charm with a star design on one side and some stamped words on the other. We were a class of four, and we were taken to a workbench in turn, to start work. Depending on the complexity of your design, Sunarta and the other silversmith (whose name I didn't catch) provide different levels of assistance. For me, I cut out the design from the silver using a special hacksaw, and did the letter stamping, which didn't take long. But the welding, burnishing, finishing and polishing was done by the professionals! So there was a bit of waiting around, watching this all happen. But the reward for your patience is a lovely piece of jewellery to remember your trip to beautiful Ubud. Initially, Sunarta said that my design, with its double thickness would cost more than the standard 400k Rp fee. But in the end, he said it was a bit smaller than expected, so the standard fee would be enough. All in all, I would highly recommend a visit to Chez Monique for the class - it was very relaxing and rewarding.

Bring Home a Treasure. My husband and I went along a couple of weeks back and had a great morning here. My husband being quite artistic designed made a very cool hook necklace for himself and I surprised myself with coming up with my own design for some earrings - take a look at the photo's. Good idea to have a design in mind before you go - therefore you can get right into it on arrival. What an ideal location to do something like this - right in the heart of Bali's culture/silver centre.

Unique Experience and Special Souvenir!. What a fun way to spend an afternoon in Ubud and have something unique to take home with you! I received a prompt reply from Sunarta the evening before and arrived at his compound with two others already there making their pieces (it only took me about 1.5 hours though if the class is full it can take longer). You are free to create whatever you please given the amount of metal allotted to you and there are books for ideas. Sunarta gives you the metal piece with your design outlined which you then cut with a saw and add any texture via hammering. It is okay if you break the saw string! I did it twice unfortunately. Once you have cut out your shape Sunarta's team will then sand, solder, put together the item and then polish. While it would have been great to have a hand in the finishing stages, I can understand that there is a liability should you do something to your hang or another part of your body as those machines work fast and have lots of heat! Nonetheless Sunarta and his team's humor, friendliness and guidance only enhanced the experience. Sunarta was so welcoming that you feel like you have been friends for a long time. You won't regret this experience!!

Special souvenir of my time in Ubud. Over the years I have collected a lot of silver rings, which I no longer wear. I brought these with me to Bali to see if I could find a place to have them melted down and turned into something new. I found Chez Monique online and emailed them with my request, they were very happy to do this for me. So I signed up for their silver workshop and greatly enjoyed turning my old rings into a new silver necklace. It was interesting talking to Sunarta about his jewellery business, and I loved the opportunity to use the different tools to make my silver souvenir. Lots of fun!

You must try this. I tagged along with my wife like many dutiful husbands, intent on being a fly on the wall while she "created" something. It wasn't long before Sunarta had very subtly persuaded me to sketch something out. Within a short time of seeing my sketch his artists hands had redrawn the shaky wobbly curves into what I had intended but had no hope of achieving. Very soon I had a length of silver in front of me and I was hammering and cutting along with the rest of our friends. There is a remarkable sense of satisfaction and achievement in creating something from scratch. Sunarta and his staff were always there to assist and advise but were very careful to let you do everything that you possibly could. When we were finished I had created a beautiful object that I was very proud of that I could give to my wife. All in all it was a great way to spend a few hours and very good value for money.

Wonderful Experience. I stayed at Kuta so the trip to Ubud was quite costly (in Bali spending standards) but it was well worth the trip. Everyone there was very welcoming and helpful. Both my bf and I are very satisfied with what we made. If I had more time in Bali, I definitely would have gone back to make something more intricate. Note for google map users: I used google maps "Chez Monique" on my way there but turns out that is the address of the shop. You have to go to the workshop first to make the jewellery (which is about 10 mins away by car). Afterwards, you have to make a trip to the shop to make the payment. Unfortunately for us, our trip was : Shop-workshop-shop.

Great activity for the family. Thanks to Sunarta, the whole family enjoyed making a piece of jewellery to have as a reminder of Bali. Sunarta and the boys were very friendly and it was such a relaxing environment. My two kids 8 & 11 love their pieces. Highly recommend.

Loved it!. We really didn't know what to expect but as soon as we arrived at Sunarta's compound we felt so welcome- it was like visitng an old friend! All our concerns about our lack of creativity and skills were forgotten and we had an amazing morning. We had a large extended family group of 13 with ages ranging from 12 to 70. Sunarta suggested we come in two groups that over lapped slightly so we could all admire and chat about our creations. Nothing was too hard and all the Sunartas team were very encouraging and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. We all left with beautiful tokens to remind us of our Bali adventure and of course some really great memories of our visit to Chez Monique. Thanks Sunarta! :)

Great way to learn silver jewellery making. Five girlfriends and I spent a wonderful afternoon learning some liver jewellery making skills. Sunarta and his fellow jewellers patiently worked with each of us through the process of deciding on an item, drawing it and working with the silver. They were able to make our ideas come to life and we all left with a fabulous memento of our time in Ubud and Bali. I would recommend this class to everyone.

A really wonderful experience and great souvenir. We had a lovely morning at Chez Monique. We had booked for 9:30 and 2 members of our party got lost and were 40 minute late, however, this was not a problem, as the class was relaxed and individual to each participant rather than a large group.There are lots of books for design ideas, however, I would do some research before hand so that you make exactly what you want. Also, I am not a very good drawer, and you sketch your own design. If you want something more perfect, print off your design before hand, the exact size of what you want.The owner was really friendly (we even got a hug!) it was lovely to chat with him, and interesting to find out that his business was never intentional, it started through an individual request for a lesson grew through word of mouth. My only semi-criticism would be that the assistants do quite a lot of the process, soldering and such. I made sure that I kept asking to be involved but you have to be forth moving with this if you want to be involved in the entire process. On the other hand... It ensured that the finished products were professional looking and fixes the wonky sawing and hammering that I had done!Over all, a great experience... I'm thinking of going back before we leave Ubud!

Creative Fun. Just arrived back from a great trip to Bali with 5 girlfriends where we experienced many new tastes, smells and vistas. A highlight of our trip for all the girls was our afternoon spent with Sunartra at Chez Monique. From when we entered his wonderful home we felt welcomed and encouraged to create a special Bali memory. Each of us returned to our Villa with a very precious piece that had been created by ourselves with the encouragement and support of Sunartaand his talented team of artisans. A must do for anyone visiting Ubud.

Wonderful experience!. This was an amazing thing to do in Ubud. The team of men that work here are endlessly patient, helpful and great teachers. Perfect blend of helping you when necessary but not taking over. The did not bat an eyelid when I broke blade after blade on their saws (its tricky! watch the corners!). The workshop went for a few hours so I had plenty of time to finish an intricate design I had chosen. Everyone made a variety of beautiful things and the men had a wonderful attitude in helping us. A wonderful experience which leaves you with a souvenir to be proud of!

A wonderful experience!. My husband and I decided to go to Chez Monique to take the jewelry making class and we LOVED it! We were greeted by Sunarta and his lovely wife, and they graciously welcomed us to their home. We were lucky enough to have a private class and each had support from an expert silversmith. It was so interesting to learn how to use the tools provided to make beautiful jewelry and we were very happy with our results! We would highly recommend this class to anyone interested in jewelry making. It was a wonderful experience!

Nice, but found it a bit pricey. I went to Chez Monique with my two kids aged 7 and 12. Both got on real well and there was no stopping them once we had decided on a design. There are plenty to chose from in albums with sample fotos. My daughter, 12, actually made two pieces of jewellery in the 4 hours we stayed there. In the end I paid 110 USD for the silver and instruction for both. If this is within your budget, it´s great stuff. I wasn´t prepared for this price tag, as other classes in Ubud cost 20 USD including silver. The Pondok Pekak library would be the place to go for that, they are a community project and have a very good reputation for the quality of their classes ( we actually took a wood carving class there which was very good. ).

GREAT!!! ...just as good second time.. Came to Sunarta's class last year and am lucky enough to be visiting Ubud again with a group of female friends. All were very keen to try their hand at making their own unique memory of our holiday...no-one was disappointed! There were a few nerves before the class but Sunarta and his fellow jewellers gave us all confidence, patient assistance and support with a fabulous "masterpiece" that we could claim to have made. I would highly recommend this class to visitors of Ubud. You'll be made to feel welcome, learn some new skills as well as an appreciation for the art of silver jewellery-making not to forget the BLING at the end of the class.
Nice place to be here. i and my friend made our own rings, We spent about 3 hours in a nice workshop in Ubud - "Chez monique"very relax and excited at Cheznice place and friendly owner.

Worth the time and money. Wayan made us feel very welcome. From a sketched design they helped me make a pretty professional-looking piece of jewellery. Even my husband managed to make a nice piece of jewellery! Good value!

Goldish experience in Silver!!!. We spent 3 hours in a lovely workshop in the middle of Ubud, creating our own jewelry in silver. "Chez monique" team are simply adorable: warm welcome, nice atmosphere and great hospitality. We definetly recommend that activity to all couples and friends! An unforgetable experience!!! See you again "chez monique"

Wonderful experience. Our family of 5 ..2 adults and 3 teenagers had a great morning at Chez Monique, making a silver piece each which we gave as gifts to each other. Very friendly, reputable and helpful. Got to see and meet real friendly Balinese family.

Fantastic morning with great results. Our family (4 adults and 2 teenagers) really enjoyed our morning with Wayan, Monique and the other helpers at Chez Monique. Wayan makes sure that even the least artistic amongst us end up with a lovely souvenir of their visit to Ubud and his workshop. He is a really lovely guy - friendly, professional and great fun to spend time with. His lovely home compound is a pleasure to visit and his family really make you feel at home and welcome. Keep up the great work Wayan - hope to see you again soon.

What a cool experience!. I am so glad I did this. I had just taken the Kintamani to Ubud bicycling trip a few days past, and it being my favorite experience on my Bali trip so far, I wanted to commemmorate it. With the help and expertise of the Chez Monique team, I was able to create an (I think) adorable memento. FYI: The class is held in Wayan's own home compound, so you will get to see a lovely Balinese home. The staff was friendly, professional, and spoke English fluently.

Amazing experience and beautiful craftsmanship. Had a wonderful experience with Wayan and his team today. We decided last minute to try the silver class out nevertheless they were very accommodating for our group of 5. We each took our time deciding on designs, helped with catalogues of previous designs and then each had some time to discuss how our design would work and taught how to begin work. The day was very relaxing and the staff made it very easy to be as involved as you liked with your design. The pieces were all very reasonably priced and we spent some time with Wayan and his family in their house drinking tea and coffee and chatting away! Had a wonderful day and will treasure the beautifully finished and polished silver creations we each left with. Highly recommended(TIP- try to plan ahead what you would like to do or spend some time at his gallery shop first to get inspiration!)

Great Fun. Wanted something nice to do with my daughters on our 5 day stay in Ubud. A friend had recommended Sunarta at Chez Monique and we were not disappointed. For a complete novice like me it was interesting and fun. Sunarta and staff were very helpful and there are lots of designs to choose from if you dont have any of your own ideas. Most of the local drivers know where he is, but I suggest you book due to popularity. Would definitely go again next time we are in Bali.

Something different and a good experience. I went to the class after some friends recommended to me. I decided to make a simple circular necklace. There was just me to start with and 2 teachers.I Cut the silver, hammered, filed and stamped some letters on to the metal, but the necklace was taken away by one of the teachers and a loop put on (for the string to go through), the letters were oxidised and the metal was buffed and polished whilst I was sat waiting. As there were no other students, it would have been really nice to have been involved in those processes - even to watch whilst it was being explained to me. But other than that, the staff were really friendly and patient and I had a thoroughly enjoyable couple of hours. Definitely worth a visit if you would like to do something different whilst in Ubud.

Great experience - well worth a visit. I had seen details about this course on trip advisor and as it was my birthday while we were in Bali thought it might be a fun activity.My husband and I were not disappointed. When we arrived we were immediately offered some water or a cup of tea or coffee and given a large collection of books to look through so we could pick what to make. My husband decided to make a very intricate ring with a leaf design and I made a lotus flower pendant. The team were very helpful and showed us what to do from cutting out the silver pieces to filing. Use of any soldering was left to the professionals! They also helped fix one or two minor mistakes we made to ensure we had pieces we were happy with. We left with two lovely pieces of jewellery which I am very pleased with. A lovely way to spend a day! There are lots of designs for children and never more than 8 people in a class so I would also recommend this class to anyone who has kids aged 8 or above.

Great. Everything you read about the experience is spot-on. The home, where the classes are held, is a bit out of the way, but the experience was just great. We loved it, and I proudly show off the ring I designed and made in Bali!

Wonderful and unique experience!!!. My girlfriend and I went along with no expectations of what the class would entail or what we would make and we both had a fantastic time. Sunarta was a great teacher and super friendly and he gave us the confidence to make some reasonably complex designs (a ring and a pendent) taking inspiration from the hundreds of photos he had of other successful tourist's projects. We got to make as much of our designs ourselves as was possible with only the polishing and soldering being completed by one of the team of experts. The final results were fantastic and as my girlfriend said at the time, the only disappointing part of the experience was that out travel plans meant we couldn't go back the next day for another class! Highly recommended - unique, interesting and fun

A must do experience in Ubud. I created a beautiful hand made pendant that I had designed at home in this class. This was the first time I had attempted to make anything out of silver. The instruction and support was fantastic and within a couple of hours I had a unique piece to take home. I would highly recommend this class as an experience not to be missed in Ubud.

Enjoyable experience. Lovely experience with my 9 y/o daughter. Only us two in the class. Lots of help, attention and encouragement. Lovely piece to come home with. Recommended. Terima kasih I Wayan Sunarta. :)

Discover your creative side. Wayan was so welcoming and I had a fabulous time. I broke a ring that I adored several years ago and have never been able to find another like it. I drew the ring I remembered in my head and Wayan helped me to make the ring (new improved version).It was great to see everyone's project evolve over the morning into beautiful and individual keepsakes.Next time I'm in Bali, I would definitely go back here and I have started to look into silversmithing courses in my local area back home!Thank you Wayan! Sophie x

A Uniquely Creative Experience. Silversmithing with Sunarta and Monik at Chez Monique was a much more personal and satisfying experience than I could ever have imagined. Instead of working from preplaned designs and blanks, I was allowed, and helped, to create a unique necklace pendant using my own creativity, drawing and metal working skills. Their instruction and patience while I learned the rudiments of silversmithing was inspirational, and their attention to detail remarkable. Their studio is tucked away in one of the nicest of Ubud's neighborhoods and with other artists in the compound serves to set the stage for a truely creative experience. No matter your talent level they will have you leave with a professional looking memento of your visit to Ubud, Bali.

What a lovely way to spend a morning. We had a lovely time at Chez Monique making 2 pieces of jewellery. The assistance given by Wayan and his assistants was just enough to make you feel that you made it all yourself, but still had help when you needed it . . and I did!In a small group of 6 it was easy to have the help required. The time passed really quickly, and we came away with our lovely silver finished items which we have not taken off since!

Highlight of our time in Ubud. This was the highlight of our stay in Ubud! The owner was a wonderful teacher. He gave you good guidance but also space to try it on your own...and then fixed my mistakes. It is not the easiest to find or the cheapest activity but it's worth the little adventure to get there and every penny.

Better than expected. All i can sau is the owner makes the experience perfect. He gives you the freedom to create what you want and is extremely accomodating. My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed our time there. I made something simple but i wish i made something more elaborate. Their studio is in the vicinity of their home itself. Grear time spent with very friendly silver smiths. My friend waa wearing a silver bracelet and the owner told my friend to polish it with his machine. The worker ended up helping my friend and now, my friend's bracelet looks brand new. Totally elated with our experience,

Amazing experience. Made & his team of silversmiths were great. Was welcomed into Made's home where the classes are held. I got to design & make with some expert help a beautiful pendant. Had a very happy few hours. I would really recommend this class.

Fun time. I'm not the most creative or artistic person in the world, but I did have a good time with this class. My wife and I each made rings as keepsakes we could take home from our honeymoon. We had brought dumpy travel rings to wear while traveling, but it was cool to replace them with these (a little more sentimental I guess).It was tough to figure out how/when we could show up, but we met the guys the day before and went back the next morning (was good to make sure there weren't too many people in the class). Worth a morning if you want to stay close to downtown Ubud as it does take a couple hours.

Great way to spend a few hours. My self my partner & son enjoyed three hours at Chez Monique silver smith class. This was a really worth while & fun activity. Lots of help & support and we all are delighted with our piece. We ate already planning the piece we will Skye next time we go !

Fantastic. My wife enjoyed the workshop while I climbed volcanoes. She came away with a big smile on her face and a beautiful pendant she helped design. Listening to her talk about the process required and help given I could see she had a fantastic time; even talking about doing the workshop again next visit to Bali and make another individual piece as a keepsake from our trip to Bali and our 9 day stay in Ubud. The helpful staff and welcoming atmosphere at Chez Monique makes being a student so easy. Learning the techniques and watching the skilled teachers complete the more complicated (soldering the silver with blow torch etc) was amazing.
Highly Recommended. absolutely wonderful. the staff were so friendly and helpful. they helped us to create exactly what we were after. highly recomended

Warm and welcoming. I am a frequent visitor to Bali and recently heard of this wonderful class. The last day of my trip I decided to visit the class. After e-mailing the night before, I received a prompt response and was warmly welcomed into their lovely home. The atmosphere was inviting and relaxed and I immediately felt at home. The atmosphere is flexible and open, not at all like a structured cooking class, which I liked. After being assisted with the two designs, I began to work on my two pieces of jewelry. I was provided help along the way, just when I needed it, and left to practice on my own the perfect amount of time. Sunarta is exceptionally patient and guided me through my projects. His assistants were equally patient and helpful. For two pieces I paid $80 american dollars. I would highly recommend this activity and the recipients of my gifts were extremely pleased to receive hand-made silver jewelry personally made just for them! Thanks for the great experience! It was the perfect activity to do!

Great hands on silver making Workshop. I think it's a great experience to do a souvenir to bring it home. I spent about three hours to do a ring and earring. Though i'm not involve in the whole process, I only get to do shaping, designing of the products I still enjoyed myself.Each class has about 6-8 ppl so must call early to book. The team is very friendly and helpful. They will assist and guide you. Location is a bit hard to locate so must really asks the right person or make sure drivers is aware of the location.

bonding session. My wife and i spent 2hours where we jointly contributed to the process of making a tree of life pendant. The result was not a perfect copy of the original design , more like the autumn version. This however added to its authentic, personally hand made appearance which my wife now treasures. Wayan and his staff are to be commended for their advice and assistance. The time required will depend in how intricate or complicated the chosen design is.

What a fantastic and unique experience!. This was by far the highlight of my trip to Ubud. Such a unique experience and leaves you with the perfect souviner! Wayan is so kind, friendly and the perfect host. Greeted guests with a hug on arrival! I will be recommending this to every person I know coming to Bali. Worth the trip from Kuta/Legian/Seminyak!
Silver making class. The highlight of my trip. Very knowledgable craftsman. Had an absolute ball making a toe ring.Took 3-4hours. Would recommend this as a must do.You pay according to what you make.

A must do.. This a great experience, learning, doing, and watching beautiful jewellery being made from the basic material. There is no time limit but 1 to 3 hours would be a good average to choose your design and make the piece. You have expert help from the friendly owner who is a master silversmith.The wonderful aspect is that you leave with a piece of jewellery made by yourself, so it can be a memory of your holiday.It costs about 400,000R upwards depending on the weight of the silver. Bring cash.This a very relaxing and worthwhile experience for men and women.

great Experience. If you have a few spare hours head on up to Chez Monique Silver Smith class, You can make such beautiful pieces, We paid $40 US for the experience but it was well worth it, and we walked away with a beautiful unique piece of jewellery. IF you have bad knees take extra time as the stairs are really deep and there are no hand rails.

Class ok but steal your money!. Me and my friend went to the class. It was ok, didn't really get to do much, they sort of take over for you. Would have been enjoyable experience though had it not been for the payment part. We paid by credit card in their shop, and the store keeper processed 9.8million instead of 980,000. Some would say a simple mistake, however I adamantly pointed out the amount was wrong and she still continued and authorised the transaction despite my refusal to sign for the amount. This was at the beginning of April and now 2 months on, after submitting fraudulence claims against the company, they are still refusing to return the money, despite also taking the correct amount. So they have had their money plus 10x that. I'm starting to think its part of their plan- rip off tourists who won't be there to deal with it. Would not recommend this company!!

What a fantastic experience!. We both decided to make rings and had fun deciding and creating our masterpieces. The end results, polished and finished, made our efforts look superb. A fantastic and fun experience. The premises are a bit hard to find and a local taxi to the address is probably a good idea. Have a go, you won,t regret it.

Great experience, jewellery to treasure for a lifetime. I found this silver smith class through Trip Advisor and emailed Wayan before I travelled on honeymoon to Bali to book in for a class. Wayan responded to my email enquiry and confirmed by booking very promptly. I booked an afternoon class and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Wayan and staff are very welcoming and friendly. I was given time to look at the pictures of jewellery designs/pieces I could have made (or you can design your own).I chose to make a ring which was in one of Wayan's folders. I'm so pleased with the ring I made (with the help of Wayan and his staff) and will cherish it forever. I would recommend this class to anyone.

Great staff, wonderful experience.. We had a wonderful time at Chez Monique and made some beautiful jewelry... The staff were so lovely and welcoming! The only thing I might suggest is that they get a sign made up, as they were very difficult to find! Other then that I would recommend this class to anyone, I especially think kids would enjoy it.
Make your own jewellery. Great staff who help you select a piece and then make it (with their help). A great value and a lot of fun!

Silver Star. A good activity to do whilst visiting Ubud. Wayan & his staff were very helpful in allowing us to create our own originally designed rings, the only criticism would be that they gave a little too much help, and we probably would have preferred to have more of a part in actually making the pieces ourselves. All in all, a fun experience.

A great way to enjoy a morning in Ubud. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Ubud, the owner was so warm and welcoming, giving us a big hug when we arrive. On arrival we were offered bottled water and we browsed through many picture books to choose what we wanted to make. You get help along the way and if you make a mistake on anything they take it away and fix it for you so you can start again. You don't get to burn the silver, but you do get to smash the silver, hammer it and do the design work. We ended up with two gorgeous and unique rings that we will treasure always. Definately worth the money and the time!

great fun to create your own jewellery. It was great to find out how to make jewellery, You could also bring your bits and pieces of silver and create something of lasting memories. Highly recommended..!

Absolute must-do in Ubud. This was our second time trying our hand at silver making, under the gentle, guiding, helpful supervision of Sunarta and his lovely staff. Although we are not gifted designers (or executors, it would seem!) the jewellery made is stunning, and the morning was brilliant fun, spent in great company.

What a great way to spend the morning :). My Fiance and I just recently engaged live and work in Bali, for his birthday I planned a surprise trip to Ubud. I was trying to find something different for us to do on our trip and I found Chez Monique on tripadvisor, and was not disappointed.Wayan replied to all my emails within a couple of hours, booked us in and gave us great directions. When we arrived he was warm, friendly and very patient with our attempts to make our matching rings. It's not as easy as we thought it would be... :)All in all, it was a great morning. We love our rings, though they have started to blacken quite quickly so don't expect too high quality. Lovely way to spend the morning. I would and will definitely recommend to others.
Toe rings. This is a wonderful experience and all the staff are real master silversmiths. Incredibly patient and helpful. Have a design sketched out before you go to save time.

We'll be back and would definitely recommend it!. My partner, his mum and I went along after I saw how highly rated it was on Tripadvisor. It's certainly worth the time and was one of the most fun experiences that I had during my time in Bali. The professionals were very helpful and my somewhat ambitious turtle design turned out beautifully! I'd also recommend bringing cash to pay, you can pay via card but you'll have to travel back to the store in Ubud to do so. It's only a tiny inconvenience but we didn't realise and were running late to plans we had booked afterwards.

An experience. Wonderful morning today doing a jewellery class and walked away with an amazing unique necklace. Definitely worth the rating on trip advisor. Well done. We felt right at home and had a great morning. Thank you.

Good to do, Slightly overpriced. This was one of the day tour attractions, did not have any interest initially in purchasing any jewellery but once there was very intrigued by the huge options in the shop. Not sure why its so expensive for just silver but the real plus point was the staff are really helpful and they even customise things for size on the spot and altered an item for us. Also lot of showpiece items as well especially noticeable are framed fish depictions in Silver. Overall place was empty when we went but good to see especially if never been to this kind of place before.

Silversmith classes for my grandchildren and daughter in law. A superb experience for the whole family. My 7 grandchildren (1 boy 6 girls) and daughter- in- law created beautiful silver pendants and rings as a memento of our 18 member family trip - 4 children and spouses with children ages 9-15 - to Bali and Ubud. The silversmith class (maximum 7-8 people for 2 hours) was held in Sunarta and Monik's home complex and this added to our cultural experience. Sunarta and his silversmith colleagues were fantastic helping and showing the "budding" jewellers the skills necessary to turn 10Gm of silver into their special mementoes.Sunarta and his silversmiths were very friendly, nothing was a problem, one could bring own designs or choose a design from their many catalogues.Of course the "creations" were "perfect"

Excellent, unique activity whilst in Ubud.. After a bit of a challenge to find the house (map on website not quite acurate-we ended up finding the in shop instead) this turned into a fantastic experience for my children (9 and 12), my sister-in-law and myself.My 12 year old son enjoyed it so much he wants to do it again when we return to Ubud in January. My daughter was a couple of years too yung and ended up with the mst 'help' to complete her little silver bird. She enjoyed looking around the family's compound and just 'being in the moment'.Worth doing especially if you are looking for a different, artistic activity.

What a great experience!. I was in Ubud in January and saw all of the ratings on Tripadvisor and decided that this would be a great experience. I was there for a performing arts class, but on a day when we had some downtime I took a group of six of us. I booked in advance which was fast and easy. It is recommended that you book in advance because of the popularity of this. We decided to walk there from our hotel and by the time we got there we were exhausted, but were greeted with smiling faces and water! The class was great. Mr. Wayan is so sweet and helpful. The end results are also really beautiful and you get to take home your own handmade piece of art.

Brilliant. I had booked in to do a class based on other reviews I had read. At the last minute my husband also decided to come and we had a fabulous time. The jewellers who looked after us were both very patient and very friendly. I thought it would be easier than it was, however, saying that, we had so much support from the jewellers we ended up with 2 beautiful pieces. If you are not going with a guide, you need to ensure you walk all the way to the back of the complex to get to the workshop. Don't be concerned you are in a private home - you are, and this is one of the things that makes the entire experience so fabulous. One tip, if you haven't made jewellery before don't be over ambitious rather pick something you will love and be proud of and ask the jeweller before you start if it is easy, medium or hard. They will certainly provide advice if you ask for it.

What a great way to spend the morning. The folks are helpful and in the end, each of us was surprised by the items that we had made. Though much of the finishing and polishing is done by the staff, it is remarkable to see the initial lump of metal become something quite beautiful. This is an activity available to all ages and skill levels. Don't miss it. It is also a great way to meet other travelers.

Make something you are proud of. This really surprised me. I went with my wife expecting a jewellery shop. What we got was a metalwork shed and foundry. Its very hands-on, hammering, bending, cutting silver and making a piece of jewellery that I will always wear with the pride of having created it from scratch myself. Great experience and good for kids too. Very good value and run by possibly the nicest man in Bali!Not to be missed!

great,bit pricey. i agree with all positive reviewers however i found they were very pushy in getting me to write a review on here, i am a fan of TA... however it kind of leaves a bad taste when you get asked a few times and then use your details from the guest book to contact you within hours asking for a review... bit too ott... but otherwise great!

Truly educational and enjoyable experience. My partner wanted me to see how a silversmith with a limited area can make beautiful things. I have been using the excuse that I have no room. The experience I attained watching and participating in the making of a beautiful silver object was wonderful. Fortunately the jewellers did the soldering and the polishing (I am quite capable of doing this myself but I was unfamiliar with the bellows-run torch and wasn't insured to use the bench polisher). This cut the time down so I could concentrate on the piece I made. I would recommend anyone do this course. You won't be disappointed.

A Must Do In Sanur. While you’re in Bali, I would definitely recommend you check out Chez Monique Silversmith Classes. It was a great experience. I thought it would be difficult to make something out of silver, but with the help of the friendly,patient and skilful staff, I managed to make a beautiful treble clef out of some thin silver wire. The only downside was that I was hoping to do more, but the staff ended up taking my creation and working on it themselves.

great experience with a tangible memory. Even wiothout coming prepared with a design, the setting, the people and the ideas available in a folder set me right on track for making a jewellery piece that will always be special.

Great for Kids!. Our kids made pendants that they love for $40 each! The team here were patient with the kids, showing them how to file, cut and stamp. My son kept breaking the blade, but they did not mind. We went to the shop near Kizmet, but you need to go the studio. Taxi from shop to studio about A$5. The aunty at the shop actually called her son to take us to the studio which is also their home. Lovely people!Recommend you turn up early morning 10am as the classes are busy in the afternoon.

Best thing I did in Ubud. I love the silver pendant I made. I have a new appreciation for hand made silver jewellery. A 2 hour class, but the silversmiths take over to help you finish in time (I would have taken all day!) This was the best experience I had on holiday in Ubud.
DIY jewellery is precious. Wonderful experience for everyone, if you want your engagement ring to be unique and special, it's a great opportnity to do it yourself!Attentive staff, great teacher.

Great experience in a beautiful place with wonderful people. Although it is a little tricky to find, the silversmith 'class' was wonderful. There were only 5 of us there and the team at Chez Monique helped us make some beautiful jewellery which are fantastic mementoes of our time in Ubud. I feel proud every time I look at the pendant I made and the ring that was made for me is on my finger right now. This was a great way to learn more about Bali and a real delight. And no-one complained when I kept breaking the saw-blades! (Whoever described this as poor or terrible must have been in a very bad mood.)

Wonderful Experience !. I would recommend this to anyone . We had a fantastic hands on experience creating out own beautiful jewelry. The whole experience from start to finish was fun comfortable and everyone was welcoming and extremely helpful. From the minute we walked through into the workshop area we felt at home and relaxed. Please if you have time in Ubud make time to create your own special memory of creating your own piece of jewelry.
Great!. We loved this! Very peaceful and calm experience. The jewellery that you walk away with is store quality and a great memory of teh holiday.

A must do!. I was a bit apprehensive after I had booked this, however, I must say that I came away counting the days until I return to Bali to have another go. Wayan and his accomplished silver smiths were very attentive. They encouraged you and then were able to correct any mistakes you made. We came away with fantastic pieces. Thanks you soooo much for a truly unique experience. I will say that it is a bit tricky to find. We came all the way from Seminyak for the morning class and our driver who is very experienced and knows Bali very well had difficulty finding it. Make sure you have the address with you. Outstanding experience we will be back!

Great souvenir and memory. What a unique experience in Bali to make something personal and take it home with you! Wayan and his family were very welcoming and accommodating and it was really nice to see the process of making something from scratch. I now really appreciate handmade beautiful silver jewelry! Not only is this such a great souvenir, but would make an excellent gift. I hope to return and make more!

Lovely people and very cool experience. We saw this on trip advisor and booked in advance, it was everything we had hoped and more. Lovely people welcoming us into their home and the craftsmanship was amazing! We got to make our jewellery from wo to go and were amazed with the results. A great way to spend a morning or afternoon in ubud!

Make your own unique souvenir.. My partner and I have actually done silversmithing before but due to various excuses haven't had time/ space/ tools to do any in recent years, our trip to Ubud has been a time to reconnect with our creative selves and gain inspiration to continue work at home. The point of our visit here was to see what a studio was like in Bali, I had seen one years ago and marvelled at the beautiful things being created with just a few basic tools and one small bench. There goes two of our excuses right there! Within a short space of time I created a ring that I was extremely happy with. Yes you can flick through a book of existing designs, for those who had no art background while we were there seemed to find them very useful but it was not mandatory to choose from these. I went armed with my sketch book and made sure we left our class until the end of or holiday so that our piece of jewellery was reflective of our Ubud experience.My design was more complex than many others, combining several simple elements pieced together. With regard to not being able to solder the piece together ourselves, I was not phased or upset by this, I have done it before and with the equipment they use here I was happy not to play with fire this time! They use petrol and a bellows system! I had plenty of pieces to cut using a jewellery saw and actually learnt a new technique - the Balinese hold their saw the opposite way to how I was taught in perth at art school and it s actually easier. The fellow doing the polishing held the silver without gloves or safety equipment. Some people complained in their reviews that they didn't get to do these things themselves but I really wouldn't expect to jump onto those things too quickly in reality it takes more than one lesson to become proficient at silversmithing. It would be a fantastic introduction to the process and if you really enjoy it why not investigate a course at home. (However it would cost you a great deal more and in all likelihood you would end up with only one piece at the end of a several week course! ) I think it was an invaluable workshop with many of the people there with us gaining a new understanding and appreciation for the work artists do.We found Wayan to be so warm and welcoming. His studio was in the family compound so it was a lovely snippit of family life and how the real people live not just the inside of a hotel or restaurant.Would I recommend it absolutely, would I do it again definitely. As a lady with large fingers and particular tastes and a desire for the unique this was the perfect way for me to come home with a perfect piece of jeweller thar every time I wear it I will remember my trip fondly. There were a few couples there making rings for each other- sweet....especially the one who wrote "beast" in his ring his wife questioned him why he did that, he had meant to write "best" as in friend. We all had a good laugh. It was a lovely friendly atmosphere all round. As we arrived a family with a boy about 11 or 12 were just leaving. So this is something for couples, individuals ( Wayan is so lovely you wouldn't feel alone) and families.

A great holiday experience. We were excited about our side trip to Ubud, of course to visit the monkeys - that goes without saying, but to also enjoy testing our creativity. I had used Trip Advisor to check out the top things to do in Bali - this was our fourth trip and we try to do something different each time we visit.Stumbling across other comments for Chez Monique, we jumped at this opportunity - very glad we did, it was a highlight of our trip. Everything from the location – was amazing being welcomed into the family compound, Sunarta opening his home and his knowledge with us, to the expert guidance to help create a piece to be pleased and proud of. So many designs to choose from or the opportunity to design your own. From start to finish, Sunarta and his team’s helpful guidance, steering me away from disaster a couple of times, to be able to take away a lovely pair of earrings for me that I will quite happily tell anyone who admires them that they were made by me…and a little help perhaps, and a ring and pendant for mini me – who was very pleased with herself with the end product.

Creative output. Wayan is definitely a top notch master silversmith and a very good teacher as well. I've learned so much from the hands-on experience, and couldn't believe that the design from my imagination (point A) to the actual one of a kind silver ring that I'm wearing now (point B) was only a matter of just taking some time, a few hours of uninterrupted learning, that allows for unleashing the creativity within me. Surely this is both a productive and creative use of time in Bali. Browse through the catalog for inspiration, or better yet come up ready with what you would like to do beforehand. Wayan was very professional in giving suggestions to me, and other options to improve my design. I also appreciate that he discussed the total cost of the product even before I started making it. The workspaces are very organized and tools can be accessed easily. They offer water/drinks and make sure everyone is comfortable.Thanks so much for Wayan and his staff for a great experience!

I Made It "Myself". This was one of the top highlights of our trip. 2 Families enjoy a lovely morning making our own jewelry which we wear proudly the rest of the trip and beyond. We all made something distinct and different and every piece looked professional, not "hand made". Thanks so much to our host for making us feel at home and providing such a unique experience.

Just Do It. We booked a class before leaving home, but people just turned up without a booking and were accommodated in the workshop. Wayan Sunarta speaks excellent English and is one of the most positive people I have ever met. He has at least six picture catalog books to help you choose your project - rings, pendants, etc. He and his jolly helpers then guide you through each step of the way until you project is completed and polished, regardless of how long it takes you.we spent about 4 hours making our intricate pieces, but others making simple rings completed much quicker. The workshop is held in his family compound, which is such a serene place to work. The advertised price includes the workshop and the first 10 grams of silver. My wife and I each made fairly heavy double layer pendants, yet in total the cost was very, very reasonably priced. Once completed, Sunata put our unique pieces on a leather band and then in a gift pouch. You can further make your piece unique by stamping whatever you like on the back. I strongly recommend singles, couples or even whole families, regardless of age do this workshop. And at the end, you have a unique self made keepsake or special present to take home with you as a momento.

A creative oasis. Lovely few hours spent at Pak Wayan Sunarta's house and studio. We were made to feel genuinely very welcome. The class gave a great insight into silversmithing and with help we made some beautiful pieces. The other jewellers were also delightfully kind and helpful.

Behind the scenes. Last week myself and a friend had a truly engaging experience in a sliver making workshop run by Sunarta and his competent and experienced staff. I appreciated how you are able to design your own piece, gain inspiration from a range of options or a use a combination of both. The workshop gave a good idea of the process, effort and skill behind crafting and creating a piece of jewellery and I liked the hands on attempt to etch and carve out my own design. A creative and technical experience overall; the information provided and graciousness of the host and team made the workshop worthwhile doing. Something I would do again for sure.

Fantastic. Something we will remember forever! Staff was fabulous. So welcoming, warm and helpful. They take you right through the steps of drawing your design, laying out the silver. We made rings for each other right from a strip of silver. We cut each hole out of the silver with a fine saw and lots of sweat. You can choose to make anything from earrings, a pendant, anklet or belt buckle and they help you perfect it. prices charged by weight and time. We paid 950,000 rb for two big rings including a large bintang. Worth every penny. Would have paid hundreds of dollars in north America. A totally unique experience you can't pass on while in ubud. Will go back if ever in Bali again. Setting is beautiful. Only thing that would have made it better would be air conditioning lol.

Miss it, miss out. This was brilliant! Not something I would normally do but from start to finish, we had so much fun. Sanatra and his team were extremely welcoming, friendly and helpful. The end product (2 silver rings) are impressive as well. A memory we will cherish for sure. Do it! Great value for money.

Insight into silversmithing, Bali style. Myself and partner spent 2/3 hours on this silversmithing class in Ubud after reading great reviews on trip advisor. Set in the workshop which creates for Chez Monique jewellery shop on Dewa Sita, the surroundings are calm, cool and welcoming. The course can be made as difficult or simple as you feel happy with. We made a pendant and ring with help from the numerous catalogues and friendly staff, but others had brought their own complex designs which were coming out wonderfully.Much of the finishing work was done for us, possibly for health and safety reasons but you can photograph and ask questions. Our course was very busy, with a large group entering mid way through, so the tuition is not one to one, though the staff ensure you are on track, make suggestions and complete to high quality.We have been wearing and showing-off our pieces ever since, so a big thank you to the team.
Very good. Nice place to buy silvery jewellary and it is worth and money. Nice to see the silvery ear rings making live.

Love our jewellery. While our visit was a really quick one due to the designs we picked,which were simple, our experience was still awesome, extremely happy with our jewellery and the staff were more than helpful, truly a great experience... I love love love my jewellery :)

Fabulous experience!. Its great to do something a little out of the ordinary and then come home with a wonderful souvenir to remind you of a trip. Meeting wonderful Wayan and his family, and making a piece of jewellery. A fabulous experience. Highly highly recommended.

dissapointed. I booked this class in advance of the trip and had confirmation by email - I was very excited about it but the silversmith never showed up despite being telephoned by a shopkeeper next door. We sat out in the pouring rain wandering around for over an hour just in case. I'm sure this is probably wonderful but have your guesthouse call before you go to make sure there are no misunderstandings.

Wonderful experience for my 10 year old & me!. From the beginning to the end we felt very at home doing the Chez Monique jewellery course! It was a very hands on morning for us and an experience to be in a family compound. We love the 2 pieces that we made and wouldn't hesitate to go back and do it all again!

Interesting experience but a bit hard to find. Situated in a cluster of houses in the heart of Ubud, this gives you a taste of what being an artisan in Bali is like for a few hours. I gained much more appreciation of handmade jewelry after struggling to make my own; it was still good fun overall. We took at cab from Sanur (approx 40 mins) to the location but the frazzled cab driver got quite lost. Also, classes are kept small (around 6 persons) so reservations are recommended.

Fun to try and be creative. Staff very helpful and my husband and I made some pretty nice jewellery. You could hve your own disign or make something similar to what was in the store. Great price for about $35 each.

Chez Monique Silver Smith Class. A great experience.. highly recommend it to all. Not expensive.. $40 for a 2 1/2 hour lesson, pleasant company, a piece of jewellery not perfect but made by ME !!!
Wish I'd gone at the beginning of the holiday... I would've gone back for a second visit.

Chez Monique silver jewellery class, Ubud, Bali. Today I spent a lovely, relaxing afternoon making jewellery at Chez Monique jewellery class. The welcome was very warm and with the aid of the attentive staff and inspiration from pictures I created a pretty pendant and wonderful earrings - very much better than I had hoped for a first try!The setting is outside the family's house, so you get to see a bit of local life too and everyone was smiling and friendly.I would recommend this to anyone who wants to take home their own unique souvenir of Bali.Also, the owner was also kind enough to arrange a driver for the day as I am staying in Nusa Dua , rather a long drive but worth it.

Will Most Definitely Be Back!. I struggled to initially find the location of the workshop but I just didn't walk far enough up the road! Walk all the way up to the 90deg right hand bend in the road and you're there :)You are greeted by very friendly people who have patience to deal with the likes of me, I was on my own as was another two ladies and there were two other ladies that were holidaying together but everyone mingled like old friends.There are lots of 'design books' for you to look through or you can simply design your own, which I kinda did. You are talked through every step of the jewelry making process and every process (with the exception of blow torching) is completed by you with the guidance of the guys in the know :) As I mentioned they are very patient, I broke my hacksaw blade thingy several times whilst cutting out my ring and they were there right behind me to replace it each and every time. I found it very relaxing and had a massive sense of achievement when I finished it, and you could see the enthusiasm and love for what he does oozing out of Wayan.This is a fabulous value for money experience that I truly can't see a downside too.I thoroughly enjoyed this experienced and will ABSOLUTELY be making reservations to be going back the next time I'm over and have already passed the details on to several friends.THANK YOU

Awesome Experience!. The instructors are very nice and helpful, my hubby and i spent around 4 hours there (cos we have our own design, so it took more time than others). This is a unique experience that you ever had, you can have your own design, or from the sample provided by instructors~ the difficult level is depends on the design and they will assist you during the whole process~ We enjoy this class very much and so satisfy with our product for our anniversary, this is a very memorable! Recommend for those who like art, handcraft, or wanna have some unique experience with your love one!

Sentimental Souvenir. Overall it was a worthwhile experience. You pick out the design and make the marks on the silver. The staff does the soldering, buffing, etc. The best part is walking away with a unique experience and personalized momento of the time spend in Ubud! A heads-up, his website says 350,000 rupiah, but it was 400,000. Also, if you don't want to get charged extra for using more material, make sure you ask before starting to make your creation! We ended up spending about $10usd more than we were anticipating.

Artistic - not me - BUT. A great way to spend a few hours making something unique and personal to take home. Would highly recommend to everyone (even if you think you are not artistic) Plenty of assistance with choice of design.

Awesome Time. Wayan Sunarta, welcomed us into his home and offered us a great morning. We made Rings, earrings and necklaces. Sunarta and his staff were extremely helpful the whole time. Coffee was fantastic, awesome and spectacular!!!!!!!!! The product we "created" was professionally finished and of high quality. The experience was one we won't soon forget! And one we would be willing to repeat.Thanks Wayan for the great day:)Dan, Laurie, Cynthia and JohnnyBC, Canada

Such an awesome morning activity!. my husband and I had read about this class and considered taking it but weren't 100% sure. During an afternoon stroll through Ubud, we stumbled upon a jewelry shop that had several items in the window that caught my eye. We went in and began looking around. We started talking to the woman behind the counter and she mentioned a class. We were getting information when the owner came down to chime in. It just happened to be Chez Monique! After talking with him we knew we definitely wanted to take the class! We took a shuttle into the center of town the next am where he picked us up and drove us to his studio, which also happened to be his home. It was an amazing experience because we got to go into one of the villages and meet many people, including his wife & apprentice. It was such a cultural unique experience. We designed our own pieces and with his help finished them in only a few hours! We would definitely recommend this class to anyone coming to Ubud looking for a one of a kind experience!

Awesome experience!. Sunarta and his staff are really friendly, patient, and helpful. An awesome experience designing and making your own silver jewelry to keep. A fun way to spend an afternoon! You leave with a sense of appreciation for hand-made jewelry.
A great experience. A very neat experience to make your own jewelry. A cool keepsake from your trip.Most times you are able to walk in and book a time.
Great fun and learnt a lot. This was a great way to spend a morning. Very helpful owners, and my pendant turned out very nice despite making a few mistakes. I think I've found a new hobby.

Great Experience. This is a must if your in Ubud. The whole experience is well worth the very very reasonable price of the class and silver. Held in Sunarta's family compound, his family and staff are beautiful. Without a creative bone in my body, my girlfriends and i chose from templates or came up with our own designs, which we then created, with as much or as little help as you want. So pleased, we had more designs created by the masters themselves !! I would email & book before you go just to make sure you dont miss out. Thank you Sunarta, we loved it & your smiling face.

Excellent Day Out With Very Helpful People. For my wife's 60th we went to Chez Monique so that she could make her own silver pendant. Everything had been arranged with Sunarta in advance by email that included an excellent private taxi (Tours & Service rakadiver@yahoo.com) that I can also recommend. At Chez Monique, Sunarta and his team were excellent and very patient in their own traditional family compound. It was something different but well worth it which I can recommend.

Great experiance. just a great time, this was held in the silversmiths own traditional family compound, clean friendly, personal and genuinely a sharing experience resulting in making jewellery that would cost more than the class itself. A great father son bonding while the girls shopped. Everything supplied including templates and ideas and using the basic tools required to do silversmithing plus 3 artisans to help or rectify any stuff ups :)

A different fun experience!. This is rated number one for a reason!Had a fab time here making a ring and bracelet with my boyfriend - the staff are very helpful & patient & will help you bring your designs to life! Worth going if in ubud! Had a brill time & will be back if I come to bali again!! Thanks again! Alice & Lloyd PS the best coffee I've ever tasted!

You CAN make jewellery!. I would have to be one of the least creative people I know , with no practical skills but was blown away at the necklace I created. I got to pick a design from the large selection in the books and that was the only hard part of the day. The staff were great at guiding you to designs that were less challenging and had a good balance of showing you but at the same time stepping back to let you do the work. This was the highlight of our trip to Bali and would recommend it to anyone.

So great we came back again!. Really cool experience and a must-do if you are in Ubud! The staff is very friendly and willing to help you. They have loads of ideas if you don't already have your own and the greatest part is leaving at the end with a piece of jewelry that looks amazing and you made it! Awesome experience, so great we came back the next day and did it again!

Highly recommend!. This was such an incredible experience in Bali! Everyone working there and even the other guests were so nice. Staff was very helpful and it was amazing to leave with a piece of silver that you create! It takes some patience if you choose to do something complicated (I did a detailed tree pendant) but they are there to help. It was one of the highlights of my time in Ubud and something different to do!

great people, great souvenir. My wife and I took a silver making class with Chez Monique. As mentioned in other reviews, the class actually takes place in their home (not at their storefront.) It was great to actually be in their home and learn how to craft some pendants out of silver.We jumped right in and started just doing it. A bit daunting at first, but the man (not Wayan, who was at a village ogoh-ogoh meeting) helped guide us, despite the language barrier. I ended up breaking a few of the mini-hacksaw blades, which earned me a few laughs, but I finally got the hang of it and crafted something that I love and will get to enjoy as a souvenir for a long time.We finally did get to meet Wayan and loved chatting with him and Monique.This is a great activity and highly recommend it.

A Happy Birthday Silver Pendant!. i) YES!ii) Sunarta is prompt at responding to emails and making your reservations.iii) He is warm and very welcoming; he even serves a delicious coffee brew to get you started.iv) The process is informal and very hands-on. v) Watching the piece of silver wire take shape and slowly come to life as you work on it with your own hands was the most exhilarating experience.vi) This is the most precious piece of jewelry I have ever owned. My husband made it for me as a birthday present.vii) $40 for the two hours of sheer joy was well worth it. I recommend the Chez Monique experience strongly!

Absolutely fun and creative experience.. My friends, my husband and I were greeted with a smile and a big hug by Sunarta, the owner of Chez Monique. He made us all feel so welcomed (group of 4).This was lots of fun - designing and making my own jewellery with my friend and with lots of help and support from Sunarta and his skilled craftsmen. They gently guide us to create earrings, pendants, and rings. Excellent value and certainly well worth the visit.Bring your own design if you have something special you would like to create. However, they have many idea books if you don't arrive with your own design in mind.

Loved it, dont miss this opportunity. My wife and I joined for a half day Chez Monique's to design and build one ring and one pendant.It was not just a "class", it is also a cultural experience:as soon as you entered their house surrounded by locals with individual temples in the garden, you receive a warm welcome from the owner. They will help you to succeed to build a nice piece of jewelry based on your own creativity. Good for children, families, couples, ....great experience, we are so proud of our designs! If we got again in Bali, we will do it again.Thank you
fun!. fantastic way to exploring your piece of art and meet people with a common interest.. with good ambience around wayan's house..

A Highlight of Ubud. This is a great activity to spend a morning or afternoon in Ubud. The class usually begins at 9:30am or 1pm.To be honest, I was not at all excited, and a little sceptical about spending the day making making jewellery but agreed to go along with the super keen girlfriend. However, that quickly changed when I saw how genuine the class is, with the welcoming and professional Sunarta.The class was great from the start to the end. I first chose to do a ring that was very plain and simple, but decided to try challenge myself and go for a trickier double layered ring with a tree in it. I made numerous mistakes but every time, the staff took it and melted some silver into the mistake and brought it back for a second attempt. They are all extremely patient. You don't feel rushed and they are ready to answer any questions you may have or give you tips.I would suggest that if you like a design, choose that one to make. Don't worry if it appears too tricky because the staff is ready to help and will show you how to do each step then get out of your way and let you do it.The rings turned out better than I thought possible, with a very professional finish. Thank you Sunarta and staff!
Worth every $$. Great attraction, an opportunity to express your creativity, beautiful Balianese home, make sure to check your price of silver if you require more as you are doing something big.

Not as good as expected. After reading the many trip advisor reviews we gave this a try. Overall we were not that impressed by the experience. At 400,000 Rp or just over €30 we had hoped for a bit more. There was no doubt the guys there were firendly, but we felt that the expereince was lacking. Upon arrival we were give some books to take a look at or asked to sketch what we wanted to make. We chose a pendant for my wife to make, and I chose to make her some earrings. The pendant involved a lot of cutting with a small saw, and we were told that they would charge us extra as we would surely break many blades....ok we thought, but at 50,000Rp, an amount charged without counting the blades we broke, we thought they could have bought a lot more of these blades than we used. After cutting out the holes, the guys there took it and soldered a ring onto it, cleaned it, and attached a necklace...exerience over for my wife. It was pretty much the same case for me only quicker. I was given some silver wire to make the earings although I had chosen to make some with a flatter profile (too difficult perhaps), and after 10 minutes of bending the wire to the shape I wanted, it was taken by the guys and filled with solder, not at all the look that I was wanting. As with my wife, it was then taken and cleaned, ear pieces attached and handed back. The finsihed items of jewelry look decent enough (only up to our skill I suppose), but we learnt and experienced very little that could not have been done at home. We were not intimately involved as some reviews suggested, more like peripherally involved and paying for the privelage.

Not your average classroom!. My husband and I had discovered Wayan's sign on his house in the countryside outside of Ubud a few days earlier and had visited. With NO prior experience, but with a desire to do something creative in this artistic enclave, we booked and returned a few days later.
