Entering Wayan Sunarta's family compound, we passed the house of his uncle who was working on a detailled painting with one year of work already invested. Roosters crowed and laundry flapped, inscence burned and offerings littered the path as we passed the family temple before we arrived at Wayan’s lovely home at the back. Greeted warmly with hugs and drinks, we were guided through ideas for creating a first piece of jewelry and then we set out with pencil and paper. Satisfied with our “creations”, we were then guided with instruction and the odd held hand, until we had fashioned the crude pieces that were to become our "masterpieces" The polishing, a technique requiring thickly calloused hands since so much heat is produced from the friction, we relinquished to a teacher. Lastly, the welding required to attach rings, loops and pieces together, we again had watch since a first time class cannot begin to teach these skills. More polishing, and our 2 pieces were very proudly stowed away in bright organza bags... Two pieces of jewelry with meaning and memories.

Create Your Own Silver Treasure!. Sunarta, the owner of Chez Monique, and his skilled craftsmen gently guide you to create original silver jewelry. They have many idea books if you don't arrive with your own design in mind to get your creative juices flowing. You will be intimately involved in creating your own piece, and when it comes time to do the fine-tuning that requires their in-depth skills, they will appropriately step in and finalize your jewelry. You walk away with a beautiful piece of jewelry that you can be proud of because you designed and help make it. It's a unique experience in a Ubud family compound where you get a sense of day to day living in Bali. Sunarta has created a crafting experience that includes a generous helping of encouragement and support. Don't miss this opportunity...especially if you love silver jewelry!

Wonderful afternoon!. What a wonderful afternoon my husband and I had with these guys! Just the 2 of us sat learning about silvermaking and with their support being able to make a ring and pendant (me) and a pendant by my husband. Very friendly and helpful - they made it so very enjoyable.

Wonderful Experience. Absolutely wonderful experience. My partner and i were greeted with a huge smile and a big hug. Complimentary bottles of water were available too!We sat down and had a look through some books of what had been made before us. (Its good to have a bit of an idea of what you want to create before you go, pendant - ring - etc..) The staff were friendly, kind and patient, with well spoken english!We hope to go back again on our next visit.

Great Experience. An enjoyable way to spend some time in Ubud, we got to make some very nice jewellery that will always remind us of our time in Ubud. Excellent value and certainly well worth the visit. The host family literally open up there home to you and assist you all the way to the end product is made, memorable experience and well worth the visit...Thanks

Memorable Souvenir. We were welcomed not as customers but like family in a charming home-studio on the first day of Chinese New Year. With the help of the friendly staff, my family and I created beautifully crafted pieces of art from raw silver! Fun and a memorable experience for all - definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Bali.
must do for couple or family. it was all good, this guy is truly nice, it's lots of fun & the product is very good quality. really good value & fun for kids over 10 yr old up to 90yrs.

Lovely, fun experience. My sister and I did this course earlier this week and both loved it! Thanks to the help and advice of the staff we managed to produce between us a ring and pendant, which we were really pleased with. A really enjoyable and unforgettable experience- I would recommend to everyone! Thank you Chez Monique!
Great DIY souvenir. Perfect for couples on honeymoon or anniversary. You can work on something together, and you'll end up with a beautiful piece and a great story. We highly reccommend it!

Its a have to do!!!. On our second visit to Bali we finally found this place and we so glad we did. Fabulous time design ing and making our ring and pendant. Wayan is a delight and his staff are great. Great value and a pretty good looking reminder of a memorable time.

You have to do this..... Having no artistic skill and no idea of what to expect, I was quite nervous about taking this on.....but what a fantastic experience ! The Chez Monique team helped me pick a design (and made sure that I was going to be able to handle it) and gave me all the information I needed to start. I picked quite a basic design but my partner picked an intricate and delicate design and we were both astounded at how great they came out with help from the Chez Monique team. There was always someone on hand to help and give guidance where needed and we have both walked away with a beautiful keepsake from our trip. I would recommend this to everyone.

Make your own Treasure to take home!. What an awesome creative time I had in this class with some other very friendly tourists. Sunarta made us all feel so welcomed (group of 5). He is very friendly, kind & helpful along with 2 jewellery assistants.The class starts with you looking through books for ideas if you don't know what to make which is a great idea. Your bound to find something you like from pendant, earrings & ring's etc.Once picked, you draw your design on paper & your given a piece of silver to file, cut, bang, form into your desired shape.You are shown how to cut, file etc but you are left to work on your own piece.... But don't worry if you get stuck or break a saw blade (I did twice) Sunarta & his team are there to fix things / help you when requried.The only things you can't do is solder & polish your item. And fair enough too. These men are qualified in their craft & as an Amerture I was happy that is left to the professionals. You can certainly watch that process so you still feel part of the whole process. You do work outside but there is shade from a balcony & trees. You are also given plenty of water (sealed bottles). The workshop is on family compound & you'll enjoy the flowers, chickens, rosters & all the butterflies. It really was idyllic. I totally enjoyed this class and hope to go back one day to make more jewellery. At least for now I have a fun piece I love hanging around my neck. A fun reminder of my trip to Bali.

New appreciation for jewelry making.. Very fun couple of hours spent making a ring. Learned its not as easy as it looks. Really didn't matter that the cutout is not perfect - it's mine and I made it! Beautiful ring to cherish forever, including the memories. The craftsmen are extremely helpful and wildly encouraging.

Great results!. Went with my wife. I should start with that I am very much NOt an artist. Drawing stresses me out to be honest. The guys at chez Monique were very welcoming and helpful. It is a great intro into how the local silver is made. You get to choose design (or design your own) - I chose a pendant and you get to participate in the whole process (they take over when the fire comes out, or you make an error). The results were amazing!! I give full credit to the guys helping me though.

Great way to slow down after a week of outdoor activities. After a week of cycling, hiking, surfing, and canyoning, this was a perfect relaxing thing to do. I had something in mind to make and indeed I made it (yes, with hands-on help and guidance). I now have my next project in mind when I return to Bali. I would recommend for folks to have an actual size printout of what you want to make before you arrive, especially if you are not good with drawing free-hand. Great fun!

Such a great, genuine local experience. What a wonderful way to spend 3 hours on a Saturday afternoon. Such a friendly nature, and had so many great conversations about local Balinese culture and experiences. Was pretty cool being able to design and make a piece of jewellery of my own, they sure do know their trade well.I'd also recommend checking out their shop in Ubud town too, very nice pieces there.

silversmith. Had a great experience making jewellery in Ubud. Relaxed environment, great little side excursion to add to a holiday by the pool in sunny bali.... we used one of their drivers paid around $35(aus) for the day from seminyak to ubud, around ubud and back.

Lots of fun. This was lots of fun - designing and making my own jewellery with lots of help and support from the guys. They were not fussed about my lack of drawing talent and were only too happy to jump in and make this bit for me, and I ended up with a beautiful pair of gecko earrings. Definitely a worthwhile experience

Unique. A truly unique Bali experience where you are warmly welcomed into the silversmiths home to make what has become one of our favorite holiday souvenirs.Not only a great introduction to the art of silversmithing but also an insite into balianese life.A beautiful relaxed morning shared with my husband and two teenage boys.

Great fun!. First of all, you feel SO welcome going to chez monique. You get to choose what to make to a certain degree (nothing too fancy for beginners) or design a piece yourself. The silversmiths help you and weld the pendant/ring/what ever you're making and you walk away with a pieve of jewellery "you made". You get 8g of silver, the cost is 400 000rp and it takes about 2-4 hours. Money well spent!

This is a must-do activity while you are in Ubud.. My partner and I chose to do this after checking out Trip Advisor. It was an amazing and inspiring experience. From the moment we walked into this beautiful artists haven, we felt welcome. Wayan Sunarta was very helpful and hospitable. The power went out in Ubud before our rings could get polished. We walked around Ubud and Wayan Sunarta delivered our finished rings once the power was restored. This is the place where you can create (with as much or as little assistance as you need) highly personalised and wonderful quality souvenirs. We highly recommend this. Thank you to Wayan Sunarta and friends, we will be back.

Amazing way to spend your day. This class completely lived up to all of the Tripadvisor reviews. The owner and his wife were so friendly and it is at his there home, which allows you to get a feel for living in Bali. The staff let us do most of the cutting and engraving ourselves and only stepped in when we needed assistance. They were so helpful and knowledgeable and really allowed you to be creative. I am completely in love with the ring I made. It is one of the best souvenirs i brought home from my trip. I was a one of a kind experienceHowever, the $40 that it says it cost is more adjustable than the website makes it seem. Six of us went but only one made something small enough that it was only $40. The others ranges fom $45-50. But I thought it was totally worth it!

Absolutely lovely experience. We went because of Trip Advisor reviews and spent almost three hours making our pieces. Wayan Sunarta and his associates Harris and Mogi were extremely helpful throughout the process. You could design your own piece or see samples from many books. (I traced a design I loved.) You could do as much as you wanted on your piece or let them help you. The final pieces looked professionally crafted, and we were thrilled with them. The price of the class included 10 grams of silver for a piece, such as ring, pendant or earrings, with a charge for the cost of silver if more is used. The price of silver fluctuates on the market regardless of where you are in the world but we found the cost of the class, the generous amount of silver provided to create the pendants, access to professionals, as much help as we needed as novices, and their attention to detail well worth the cost of this experience. Clean restroom was also available. Thank you Wayan, Mogi and Harris for a wonderful experience in Ubud! We get to keep and treasure these pieces!

Fantastic experience with rewarding result.. Today I created a beautiful ring! I got enough help and was able to do almost all the cutting myself. The more difficult things are done by the staff. These are for example the soldering, polishing and measurement etc.A woderful experience with a very rewarding result, a unique, self-made and self-designed souvenir for a very acceptable price. (400.000)

I impressed myself with the beautiful piece of silver jewellry I made, but couldn't have done it without Wayan & his friendly st. It was so interesting to see a slab of silver ribbon turn into a shiney polished pendant - that I made! And it was just as interesting to be invited into Wayan & Monique's home. They are friendly & know how to make sure you learn a little about silversmithing. Even my 7 yr old son came away with a groovy silver pendant he made.

Fantastic fun. I chose to do a bangle which cost more due to the extra silver but because I chose to put a raised design on It I was able to use the other cut out to make a matching pendent. I was really happy with it and I was able to do most of it (the cutting out bit) myself. There were many others also doing the class and all made beautiful rings and pendants. I would go back again, give it a go its fun and a different keepsake from Bali.

I just love my ring i made!. We enjoyed our afternoon of our first ever sliver smith class. The guy who runs it is lovely and so his team. While it was mostly pick out a design and watch them make it (for us it was anyway!) i found i was still value for money. Our designs where twisting sliver lots of other peoples were cutting sliver, which looked like hard work. I really would go with the experts opinion if they say it will not work, it wont! We saw some terrible looking designs which people made up themselves such as dogs, dolphins etc. Each to their own i guess. For me i think less is more!

Fantastic experience. This is tucked out of the way in Ubud but was an absolutely fanastic experience. There were folders of designs we could choose from or we could design our own piece of silver jewellery from scratch. The staff were REALLY helpful and lovely and we came away from the day with two wonderful pieces of jewellery.

Well worth the price. As all the reviews mention this is one of the better things to do in bali, not just ubud. My wife and I read the reviews and being a bit sceptical booked in for an afternoon session that started at 11.30 and we didn't finish till well after 4! People come and go at their own pace (usually 2-3 hrs) but we had some tricky designs we wanted to attempt so I think we were by far the slowest. no matter to them though and we were provided with plenty of drinks and fruit if we needed. It pays to think of a rough design before you go but there is definitely plenty of ideas and designs to choose from if you haven't. Sunarto was very patient and being there for a long time gave appreciation to his professionalism at dealing with many different nationalities and somehow getting everyone to leave with a huge smile on their face. I saw so many saw blades being snapped multiple times by different people and each one was approached with a "no problem, I fix for you" attitude. Most of the rings we saw made sell in the chez monique shop for $25-$35 so if you think you are going there to buy silver at cost, use and often break his equipment for free then you are wrong. One girl while we were there was concerned that $40 was a lot of money for such a small ring, she reluctantly went ahead and within 30 minutes her attitude flipped around and she was so excited about what she made the money she paid for the experience was suddenly a bargain. We paid the $40 each and came away with a big ring, pendant and a matching charm for a bracelet. More than happy with the cost and the experience.

Not really worth the money. My partner and I went to the class. It was just the two of us, so we had a silver smith each. The owner was there a short time but then left.His two employees were really nice. BUT the class was basically choose a design and we'll do it for you. If you asked to do some of it they would let you. But basically it was watching them make it. There was no talk of the different methods you could use, history, background or anything.At the end my partner was charged extra, which was a complete con because there is no way his is over 10g. I think it might just be a standard way for him to make more money.For the money we paid we were very dissapointed. I don't normally write reviews but this attraction having no.1 spot is very deceiving.

a must do....lovely experience.. Did a silver class here in April and made a simple silver ring. The lovely owners made us feel right at home and I could have sat there all day hanging out...maybe next when I will make some bracelets to match the ring. My friend made a ring for her daughters 18th birthday..was a creative and special day.Even walking back ito main Ubud was a lovely experience. Please support these beautiful people and give it a go..you wont be disappointed.

Great experience!!!. Attended the class since it was #1 in Ubud attractions and it did not disappoint!!! So much fun and everyone is so friendly and helpful, even let us into his home when my phone ran out of battery. Well worth it and will definitely go again next time I'm in Ubud!

Fun,fun,fun. We decided to take the silver class after all positive reviews on TripAdvisor and what can I say, it was pure fun,fun and fun. Sunarto welcomed us like we were his relatives, even he saw us for the first time and taking in count that we did not book class in advance. However we were fortunate as one school bench was free so we took the class straight away. As we were beginners we decided to make some simple piece of jewellery. I made earings, and my wife made a nice ring. It was so fun making it from drawing the design till the final product. Have to mention that all time we had excellent support from Sunarto and his associates. All in all a great experience, a great memory of Bali and Ubud. When visiting Ubud or Bali in general this should be a must to visit as the experience and fun delivered through this class is priceless.

A bit over rated.. This is a pretty sweet thing to do. Very unique, very memorable. However you certainly pay through the nose for it. $40-50 for a silver ring, where you put in the labour is no bargain when we saw about 10 people go through this process in 2 hours10 grams of silver costs about $10. There is a lot of profit going around for a couple silversmiths. All this being said I'm still wearing my ring a month later:)

Blissful Afternoon. Following TripAdvisors lead I attended this silver smith class and was so glad I did. Sunarto and Monique are such warm welcoming people, the session didn't even feel like a formal class rather we spent a relaxing afternoon crafting on the veranda of a family's house. Furthermore I have a meaningful necklace to cherish from this wonderful afternoon.

The best souvenir you can get in Bali!. My boyfriend and I decided to do the class after seeing all of the rave reviews on TripAdvisor, and the class and your handmade piece of jewellery are worth every penny! We both made gifts for family and we're so stoked with ourselves and had a blast! You're able to design your piece yourself and you have have as much or a little help as you'd like. I'd recommend for guys and girls, young and old, including kids.

Wonderful activity for everyone!. Sunarta, the silversmith is simply charming and caring for his guests, as well as his wife Monique, who offered fruits and refreshments. You will be welcomed in a nice family environment, with loads of images to choose from, enough instruments for everyone and lots of help from Sunatra's assistants who will polish and assemble your work.The price of the class is well worth it since you might actually pay the same amount for an equivalent piece of jewellery.Wonderful experience overall, a good couple activity if your are planing on getting married;)Don't forget to stop by the Chez Monique shop in Ubud central!Trema kashi!

Interesting and fun. The kids (5 teens and 9 year old) and my sister in law did the class. Sunarto and his assistants were very patient and helpful. He does have display books of different designs but many of them are probably too complicated to duplicate. A simple design is best as you will have to draw your design onto paper to size before cutting your design with a small coping saw into the "raw" unpolished sterling silver metal. You will also file your piece before handing it over to Sunarto's assistants to grind and polish. The cutting and filing takes quite abit of effort so it is handy to know that at any time you can get assistance. They will also help you fix any mistakes you might make along the way. The finished product is a gleaming mirror like pendant or ring. You will be amazed that you were part of creating this piece of professional looking jewelry. You can also stamp your initials or something else onto the back of your piece to personalize it! Highly recommend this activity. Sunarto, his wife and his staff are wonderful. But be aware that if you are paying for this by credit card you will néed to go to his shop after. This is abit tricky to find and if you go on a hot day like when we were there - you might want to consider bringing cash so that you don't have to worry about this after all your hard work!

Fantastic Family fun. what a great day we had with they guys out at Chez Monique, i would recommend this to all, the kids loved making their own jewellery, all staff and family members where very friendly and helpful. Great value and so much fun, would love to go again next time we are in Balii was even able to leave the compound and head to the main shop so i could pay by visa hello to all the staff cannot wait to see you all again :)

One of the best experiences I've ever had.. I visited the silver class based on the traveller reviews in trip advisor and they aren't wrong. I had a wonderful afternoon during which time I made two pieces, a ring and a necklace. I bought the design of the ring I wanted to make with me and everyone bent over backwards to help me, whilst still letting me do the work. Their guidance was really great and I now have two pieces of totally unique silver that I made. It is a wonderful experience and irreplaceable souvenir in one. They had plenty of books with ideas for those who didn't know what they wanted and they were so patient with all of us. There were two younger girls on the course, and they also excelled, it is suitable for absolutely everyone. I would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Bali. I travelled from Kuta for the class, I had lunch in Ubud and walked around the shops. For those hoping to make a day of it I would suggest doing the monkey forest in Ubud in the morning, lunch in one of the many restaurants, walk around the shops and then head to the class for 2pm. It is all within around a 5 minute drive from central Ubud.

Great service, price and atmosphere!. My mum and I went there and thoroughly enjoyed it! The two fellas were helpful, and taught us how to make our pendants. Mine was overly complicated, and they were soooooo helpful in allowing me to make my design!!! Such friendly people, a calm environment, and very friendly!!! Was a great way to spend an afternoon!!! Was also great to spend an arvo in a relaxing environment that feels more like the relaxing Byron Bay than the bustling Bali!!!

FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL. Dayna and I had a great time creating our pieces. Sutra and his staff were so helpful and frielndly, they made our pieces look so professional.If you have a spare couple of hours in Ubud you should definitely do this silver class, you get a keepsake from Bali that is individual.

Chez Monique - Buy Bali. Truth be told I didn't go to the class but have spent plenty of time in the shop - shopping, eating, laughing, talking. The best, best BEST thing about Bali is the people and Ibu Wayan, Ibu Monique and Pak Wayan are perfect examples of that.It's important when you go to Bali that you support the local shops - so many are owned by expats and the money often doesn't stay in the community or with the locals. This is the case for many jewelery shops, but not Chez Monique. Gorgeous jewelery, loving people. Go to Chez Monique and buy from the Balinese when in Bali.

Highlight of our trip. We spent a total of 15 days in Ubud, and creating original pieces of jewelry with Sunarta and his wonderful staff means our memories will always be with us. The setting is lovely, peaceful, and welcoming – especially so, since it is Sunarta and Monik's home. We were greeted with warm hugs and instantly felt at ease. There are plenty of inspiration binders, and you're free to create your own design. No matter what you decide to create, you can trust the staff to help you make it beautiful. My husband and I made rings our first visit and loved the experience so much we returned again to make a pendant and earrings. In a locale known for its artistry and craft, it feels wonderful to engage in a creative activity.This is the kind of experience that requires you to slow down, think about what you're doing, and take pleasure in making something unique. We can't recommend this class highly enough. Thank you, Chez Monique!

an amazing local experience!!. The chez monique silver smith class is well worth the time! I took a piece of jewelry home that I designed and made that will always remind me of such a life changing trip!

Great fun in Ubud. If your looking for something to do for 2 or 3 hours in Ubud you can't go past Chez Monique. The day we visited it was raining heavily. My daughter made a beautiful pendant and learnt some new skills. The staff are very friendly and make you feel very welcome. Highly recommended but don't even think about it if your in a wheel chair.

Great way to spend a morning!. Loved going to the house and making something original. We got to browse stacks of idea binders, sketch it out the right size, cut it then they help you make it beautiful. Now I have a gorgeous necklace to remember my trip to Bali. Highly recommend it!

Fantastic, creative & rewarding!!. Fantastic time and walked away with a surprisingly rewarding piece of jewellry. Hostbis eady going, flexible and approachable. You're welcomed into the hosts home/garden, given time to design something (with help from ideas books) and then get time to make (with a bit of help) it! Good fun and rewarding!!

Great way to spend the morning. My wife and I attended a morning workshop in December 2012. The class does not take place in the shop, but rather in the family compound a few streets away (so it also gives a bit of a glimpse into family life). It is walkable but depending on fitness/time it's probably worth getting a taxi up from the main street. We were shown various designs for silverwork and encouraged to design our own (for the creatives out there) or we could copy an existing design (still fun for those with somewhat less artistic talent). Friendly help was always on hand if we were'nt sure whether a design element would work or not. We broke several saw blades but they didn't seem worried. I'm sure it happens to everyone :) Because of some other reviews we were worried about being charged for additional silver, we made neck chain pendants that were roughly 5g each athough not weighed at the time. Something using more than 10g silver would be pretty big i.e. much larger than a ring or pendant.

Great Silver. I've bought a couple of pieces from here and needed to get the rings resized. I was expecting an exorbitant fee for this but it was done without hassle and no charge. Great quality silver and unique pieces . Worth a visit!

Great Experience. It was good to see how to make the jewellery seen in the shops in Ubud. The price included a small piece of silver to make a pendant and if you want a larger piece you could purchase a large piece. Not much instruction was given before you start but there was plenty of help provided in you needed it.I would suggest going there knowing what you'd like to make and allow between 2 to 4 hours depending on what you want to make.
So much fun.. Be warned, you will want to create more items once you get started. Friendly and very helpful, I have not done anything like this before and really enjoyed it.

Amazing, Awesome, Incredible, Fantastic, Stupendous. what more can I say! I totally loved doing this class in every way possible. I was saying to Sunarta (the owner) that this was my favourite experience in my whole Bali trip. I've been to Bali 5 times and none have come back with a memory such as this. As a female, I love jewellery. What female doesn't? This was no exception. To have the opportunity to create a piece out of silver on my very own, was just brilliant! I took my 13 year old daughter with me and we had such a great time, we went back a week later!Sunarta was the most warm hearted, beautiful soul. He welcomed us into his compound (family+ extended family housing lot) with open arms (literally!) and shared his world with us. He and his wife, Monik, were just wonderful. Monik makes the best ginger tea (Sorry Sunarta, your tea was not quite the same, as lovely as it was ;o) ) He is very well spoken and easy to understand. He guided us into what choices we could make or design our own. He and his 'mates' assisted us to cutting, sawing and stamping our own piece as we desired. Then his mates soldered ringlets etc and buffed and polished our piece until it looked like a professional had made it! I was blown away (as were others as I'd finished mine) with our creations. Would I go again? Most definitely! I wouldn't blink a second thought.

Had the best fun. Had a wonderful time - Wayan Sunarta and Monique and their staff are wonderful and the atmosphere in their compound is very welcoming and inviting. Definitely recommend to anyone and I will definitely put this onto my to do list when I next return to Bali

Great experience - a true recommendation!. A very special thing to do in Ubud; we made our own ring and earrings! Mr Sunarta 'improved' our creations when needed. Nice location, sitting outside in the shadow, in the family premises.

A Must-do at Ubud. Mr Sunarta was so friendly and helpful in the whole process, guiding me all along in making my own Ohm ring. It is definitely the highlight of my Ubud trip! There are other silver jewelry-making classes in town, but Sunarta's kind service makes him the best!

Wonderful experience and a holiday highlight.. This is a must to anyone coming to Ubud. I took my girls (12 and 13)to do something special and to create a memory of their trip to Bali. This was such a great experience for us all with beautiful jewlery to take home. We will be back on our next trip to Bali.Sumatra is so warm an welcoming to all that come to his classes and is a helpful and patient .

Once in a lifetime experience. I thought this was maybe a little pricey but figured when we we ever be able to learn how silver is made start to finish? We all came away with treasured pieces. It was very interesting and my 10 year old son really enjoyed using the different tools. I say take advantage of this opportunity. Wayan is very kind and his helpers patient.

Create amazing personalized silver gift!. We were travelling on our honeymoon to Ubud and decided to try the Silver Class based on the good reviews it had received online. And have to say were highly impressed with it. I made a personalized necklace for my wife with her initials and it came out brilliant. Sunarta was kind enough to help me patiently at every step of it whether it be sketching and helping me design it or be it the texturing or cutting step. I ended up using 4 or 5 blades but each time I broke it he would smilingly put a new one. Also, his team did a good job of finishing the workpiece so it looks complete professional as if purchased from a jewellery shop. An afternoon well spent and made an amazing gift for my wife! Thank you Sunarta! Must try for anyone in the Ubud area. Will not be disappointed!

Authentic Silversmith Class. I had an outstanding experience here. I was not sure what I was going to create when I arrived. But I browsed through a variety of photos of pendants, earrings, and rings and chose to make a ring. I expressed my idea and Wayne guided me along with some questions that helped me narrow my focus and to create a unique ring that is unique and stunning in a simple design. His assistants were wonderful and always at hand to help me when I needed their expertise. I highly recommend this workshop for anyone who is interested in how to make silver jewlery and get their hands busy. Thank you!

A highlight of my trip. I visited Sunarta after seeing the rating as number one on trip advisor and was not disappointed. This was a really fun way to spend a morning, engage with local people and leave with a souvenir that is meaningful and lasting.I was lucky that I was the first to arrive at chez monique as others were late so I had sunarta's undivided attention and help in selecting and making my design. So much so that it was all over too quickly, after only one hour. I really enjoyed making the ring, but would say, make sure you go with a idea of what you would really like to make,search for inspiration in the many silver shops n Ubud. If I were not travelling independently I would have loved to take this class with a group of girlfriends, or partner.I would definitely go back, with lots of designs that I would like to make. Be prepared that a lot of the finer points of the silversmithing are carried out by the professionals, necessarily so.

Good experience but limited hands on. Great opportunity to be involved in creating a memorable piece of jewelery but don't expect to be too involved. Other than initial design and some cutting the rest of the process was completed by the silversmiths. Our warm and friendly host Sonarta was distracted by other guests for most of our visit, so I think that perhaps we just happened to be there at an inconvenient time. Having said that the it was amazing to see the silversmiths turn a flat piece of silver into a beautiful piece of jewelery.Make sure you have the address for your taxi driver as the location of the class didn't seem to be well known. Otherwise it's a pleasant walk from the main street.
Good stuff. Real good fun. The people over there were really nice. No wonder why this is no 1 thing to do in Ubud.

Excellent silver class!. I travelled to bali in dec 2012, and saw this silver class on trip advisor so i joined up for the day. The teacher Wayan was so welcoming and friendly and so was his assistant. The way he taught us how to make our own custom one of a kind piece was very easy and simple. The class was only for the morning and gave us our pieces done on the day. Wayan also does custom jewellery which was very reasonably priced and executed beautifully.

Amazing. My husband thought I might enjoy this time away from the kids and enjoy it I did , everyone was so helpful,it was so peaceful there.I loved what I made , I even went back 4 days later with 3 other people and they loved it .if you want something totally different than the regular tourist thing this is it ,I'm definitely going back next time !

Wonderful way to spend your morning!. I went to Chez Monique after my mom told me how many great reviews it had...and the reviews aren't wrong! I had no idea what to expect when I got there...first off, the home is beautiful and the family is so kind to share even their bathroom with tourists! You get to choose from many books of what you want to create, or you can draw your own design! My original idea was so simple that I wouldn't have really done anything with the silver. Luckily they told me that so I actually got some silver handling experience! Everyone is so helpful and knowledgable about silver smithing (?) and very patient.I would definitely recommend this class to anyone with a creative side!

A surprising experience. Don't miss doing this!!. If you would like to experience something real in Bali, do this silversmith class. Held at Wayan's family compound surrounded by family the class is easily one of the best experiences our family have had and we have been coming to bali for years. with our boys aged 12 and 9. Wayan and team are very supportive and very happy to guide and assist you. So you walk away with a beautiful piece of jewelry.A stunning experience. Unique.
a thing to do. A very niece experience a most do in bali you can design your own silver jewelry, little dificult but it finish fine!

Silver making. My daughter and I recently had a few days in Bali. The idea of the trip was to visit some spas and just relax, but we decided there was a limit to the number of beauty treatment you could have in a day, so booked a silver making class in Ubud as well. We had a great time. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming, and it was interesting to see the ideas the others came up with for their silver making project. We came home with some new found skills and a lovely keepsake of our Bali visit. Thanks Sunatra.

The best thing I did in Ubud!. Chez Moniques silver smith class is a wonderful thing to do in Ubud. Wayan is so accommodating to everyone and is a truly wonderful teacher. Wayan was very open to my ideas about what I wanted to make and guided me throughout the whole process - I felt really proud of the ring that I made at the end of the workshop. I would recommend this class to anyone!

A must do! So cool and friendly!!. We did this based on a recommendation rom a friend of a friend, and I have to say I will STRONGLY be recommending it to a of my friends now. Sunarta and his team were SO lovely, patient and helpful. We really did feel welcome and had a great time... plus we walked away with some fantastic jewelry! Recommend booking, but we walked up and they were able to accommodate us... testament to how lovely they are.Do it, you'll regret it if you don't! Thank you Sunarta, hope to see you again!!!

Highly recommended!!!. We visited Chez Monique based on trip advisor reviews and were very glad we went. My friends and I wanted to make a piece of self-designed jewelry each, so we took quite a while sketching and brainstorming some ideas. Sunarta was very patient with us and with the guys' help, we managed to make our first silver jewelry, which turned out to be prettier than we expected. We couldn't wait to wear our personalized jewelry. It's the best souvenir we brought home from Bali. The whole experience was very relaxing and enjoyable. One of my friends wasn't satisfied with the outcome of the ring she made, Sunarta offered to help her alter it and to send it to our hotel. He kept his promise and sent the ring to our hotel personally the following day.

SO FUN. I would highly recomend this my partner and i made eachother a necklace and it was very romantical :) i would definately go for the ring option next time though . You can have as much or as little help as you need and wayan treats you like family as soon as you arrive . Such great value for money its a must for something different from the normal .

Great Experience. We visited Wayan's silversmith class based on trip advisor reviews and agree that it is one of the best things to do in Ubud. We had a great time designing and creating our pendants and everyone was so friendly! Wayan speaks very good English and made us feel very comfortable and welcome. We loved our final product and will definitely be recommending the class to friends and family visiting Bali.

Chez Monique Silver making class. We did this class this past week and really enjoyed it. Wayan is wonderful to work with - he has endless patience and speaks English very well. I made a pendant and my friend made a ring. Great memories from Bali.

Great idea to entertain yourself and get a "present". As the other reviewers here, I would also like to share some comments on the owner. He is a very welcoming and open-hearted guy, very positive, helpful and interesting to speak to (we actually talked to him for at least half an hour more after making our stuff). Also the jewellery you make together with him or his assistants is wearable at home and is a great memory. If we would have more days in Ubud, we would definitely come again.

lovely experience. Had a very lovely experience here,design first,then cutting and hammering,I made a pendat, a simple design,so my job completed quite quickly.after this,wayan and his assitant will help to fix it and polish it.i think if fixing and polishing it by myself would be a complete experience(like what i did in other workshop).anyway you will bring your own handmade pendant or ring home,good memory!

My favorite souvenir of Bali. Definitely a highlight of my trip. I love silver jewelry and this class was just right for me. The owner makes you feel at home - in HIS home - right away. Start off by looking at the books of sample designs, or come ready with your own. I chose a ring with the sign of infinity. Wayan and his staff help you all the way through. My hotel called and made a reservation for me. They drew me a little map and I walked over. Plan for a couple of hours and take time to meet the others in the class. Next time I'll make earrings.
Amazing Experience. Must do!!We made some beautiful jewelry which we will keep forever. Very fun and challenging and all that took the class were happy with the final result.

Charming experience in Ubud. Unique experience to design and make your own silver jewelry. The owner was sweet and very helpful, and the staff were patient and helped you shape your creation into a professional piece of wearable art.

Amazing Jewelry making. This was the highlight of my trip into Ubud (really my reason for going). I researched this before coming to Bali and thought I might like to do this. Once here in Bali I emailed Wayan and he responded back that he had room for us to do his class. The class is held at his home ( he makes you feel so welcome with a big hug and a welcome that is so warm). You pick your design and Wayan helps you sketch out your idea. Then you are ready to start. I was able to make both a ring and ear rings. Both look like a professional could have made them. I highly recommend the course.

Fantastic experience. Loved this class. Getting to design and create my own jewellery was an amazing experience. It was harder than I thought it would be, but I love the final piece. It not perfect but I still couldn't believe what I could create. Great value for money.
silver smith. liked bartering and the selection was good. Girls were happy to let you look and would take out the jewellery from the cases for you to see

AMAZING!!!. We honestly couldn't have asked for more! Sunarta made his home so welcome. With a hug to greet us an introductions made we set about sketching our designs, if a little help is needed there is loads of pictures to look through. With some cutting, hammering, filing and a few crows from the local rooster, we were well on our way to becoming silversmith's!We couldn't recommend the class any more, it was AMAZING! We will be back in January with family so say hello again, and make more beautiful handiwork.MUST DO!!!!!!

Lovely. I had a great time making a pair of earrings. Got there early in the morning, after making a booking very easily. The place is very relaxing and beautiful, and Nyoman is very helpful. I created my own design, then tried my best to work the silver... I did a terrible job!! ^^ The team was great at letting me try and practice, but at the same time, very much present to help out and fix all my mistakes, so I thought it was just the right balance. It was a lovely morning, and I would recommend a visit while in Ubud!PS: beware, Nyoman will try to hug you when you arrive! this seems to confuse everyone... just roll with it! ;)

Fun activity with something you can take home. My sister and I decided to attend a Chez Monique silver class on our recent trip to ubud. We were able to select what we wanted to make and with some help from our teachers (they called it teamwork!) our ideas were soon jewellery pieces that we were able to wear home. It ended up costing about $50 each, but the experience was fun, we were able to sit and chat to some other travellers also.

I made a puppy pendant. Woof.. This was too much fun! I got to draw what I wanted, cut it out and (with some help, of course) hammer in lines to create my pendant. I was impressed at how quickly it was brought to a mirror shine. All three men who worked there (father and two sons) were very nice and helpful.

Do it!. The process is simple - you pick out or draw a design you want on paper, it is applied to a small silver block which you then cut and shape according to your design. All the tools are provided. Staff was very friendly and patient.It was a worthwhile experience because we were involved in making the jewelry ourselves. This made us cherish it more than just buying it in a store. The end product was of quite good quality.

Awesome!. This was a great experience! The staff was very friendly, helpful and patient, even when I kept breaking the blade on my coping saw and they had to rethread it what seemed like 12 times. They have a ton of reference photos so you can decide to base your design off of something they already have done (like my dad did) or you can try your hand at something original (like I did) with experienced hands helping you along the way. All in all a great way to spend an afternoon. On a side note, the class is in a family compound and is a bit further up the road then we expected after looking at the map. So anyone who isn't up for a bit of a walk in the sun might want to take a cab. Just keep looking at the house numbers and it is easy to find! :)

Beautiful family and creative workshop. The workshop was casual and I was able to make whatever I liked. The silversmith was on hand for the technical work and being welcomed into Sunarta and Monique's home was a privilege. We met fellow travelers who were also busy making jewellry to their own designs and had a truly wonderful experience!

What a day!! My newly wed wife and I loved this experience. My wife checked this out on trip advisor while we were in Bali on our honeymoon.I didn't think it was going to be as good as it was.We first went to the the wrong address in town near some shops. this is the wrong address as we were told by some people working there. So the owner gave us a lift to the silver smith course.You need to look at a good map to find the road. It looks like it is on the main road which leads to the main temple with all the people trying to sell tickets outside of. its the road to the right of it.Really nice, peaceful and classically arts and craft moment. Made some excellent creations too.Worth a visit if your in Ubud for a few days.!!

Great experience! I Love my new ring!. I went to the silver smith class alone, but I still had a great time (great atmosphere!). There are hundreds of designs to choose from, and although not all of them are suitable for beginners, Sunarta can give advice on how to adapt them to your own level.I had no idea about how silver jewellery is made, so cutting it myself, polishing and so on was a lot of fun! Sunarta and his assistans take care of the more tricky parts like soldering and the final polishing so the final result looks AMAZING. I'm really proud of my new ring!!Totally recommended, regardless of how crafty you are. There are designs for all levels and tastes, so I'm sure you'll find something you can do. In my opinion, the rings with carvings are the easiest :)This class costs 400.000 and you get 10g of silver. I've checked other places that cost 350.000, but there you only get 5g, so Chez Monique is clearly a better deal!

Personalized attention with special momentos - who doesn't love silver jewelry?. This was such a find, thanks Tripadvisor! My sister and I were eagerly awaiting this activity. We arrived at Sunarta' house at our agreed upon time, and another couple was just finsihing up their designs. It didn't matter though, since Sunarta has so many designs to choose from (there are several binders full of designs), that it takes a while to make up your mind as to what you want to do. I chose to make a lotus flower necklace and my sister a tree of life design necklace. The tree was extremely time-consuming, as there were intricate cut-outs that needed to be done. My lotus flower was not as difficult but I did have trouble in imprinting the silver and carving the shape. You really do everything on your own! Sunurta and his helper teach you in making your dream design, and assist whenever you mess up (which happened several times to me), and they complete the product so that your chosen product looks professional! You can also personalize the jewelry by stamping the back. Such a great way to personalize your visit to Ubud/Bali!

fun with silver. My friend and I enjoyed our afternoon of designing and making our own silver jewellery. We had the most patient instructors and true feeling of accomplishment at the end, not to mention a sentimental and much loved piece of jewellery. Thanks for making this a wonderful experience! Danielle from Western Australia

Create beautiful jewellery AND great memories of Ubud!. I was recently in Ubud with a group and this was a great experience and momento from our time. Sunarta was an excellent host and even went the extra mile to drop off an extra piece of jewellery to our hotel that he completed for us. He was a fun and patient teacher and some of us left with spectacular pieces of jewellery (those with more patience and design sense!). I chose to do something simple as I was tired from the morning's running around, but it looks fantastic and I love it! You will leave with a professional looking piece of jewellery at half the price and have a great experience as well. Highly recommended!

Excellent,highly recommended. I found this class on tripadvisor while in Bali looking for things to do whilst we were in ubud for the day. We are getting married next year and thought we would try and make our wedding rings. We expected to leave the class with something unusable but thought that as its such good value for money it would be an experience anyway.We booked in for a class in the morning and booked a taxi to take us there from sanur.the taxi dropped us where he thought it was(going by the map and address on the website) we then spent 45 minutes trying to find the class and had to ask some locals,who also didn't know.in the end we decided to find the chez monique shop and get directions from there, by this time we were very late for our class but were kindly fitted in just after lunch .its hard to find the class,we met another few couples who were at the class and they had also struggled to find the class,so make sure you google map before you go.We were assisted when we needed it with our rings and came away with wedding rings we are proud of. Sunarta was so lovely and greeted us with hugs,such a lovely man,which made it such a more memorible day. thank you.

Wonderful!. A great, unusual and good value way of doing something different on your holiday in Bali. My finance and I made our wedding rings in the couple of hour session. Very relaxed, lovely guy. Very helpful staff. Nice to get off the crazy hot streets of Ubud. Everyone seemed very happy with what they made. Only one thing.....finding the place. Most drivers and taxi's can't find it. The map they give you is useless. If you want to know where it is drop me a message. Took us a 45 min walk to find it, and another couple an hour! Worth it though and actually only a 10 min walk from the main road!
Create a silver piece of jewellery. This was a high light of our trip. Making a ring from scratch to a momento to treasure. Will do again! Value for money too.

Simply wonderful!. One of my best friends got married in Uluwatu in July and I arranged for the hen do to be in Ubud simply because of the reviews I had read about Chez Monique, and we were not disappointed! 11 of us were welcomed into the studio by Monique and Wayan in 2 classes, and each and everyone of us left extremely happy! So happy some of us returned a second time! Everyone had expert tuition and as little or as much assistance as they required, with everyone ending up with a beautiful piece that they had designed and made themselves. Would recommend it to every and anyone!

Great Morning!. We both went this morning on the strength of the reviews we had read on here, and we were not disappointed. We were met by the owner with a friendly hug and within about 20 mins we were making a start on our rings we had designed! 3 hours later we left with 2 new rings that look just as good as in any shop! They were Sally friendly and if you want a bit of a local experience and to satisfy your creative juices then go! We loved it!

Own Hand made jewellery. It was a great experience going into someones family compound and making your own jewellery. There were lots of books to look through and try and decide what to make. The is no hurry or pressure. I was there about 2-3 hours. If you need help they will assist you without any worries and were very friendly. It is easy enough to find and if you ask someone in the street it's in they will know where to tell you to go. When you get to the entry of the compound there isn't a big sign so you need to really look closely.

Amazing. Even someone like myself with no artistic talent at all can have an awesome time and make something worth far more than any jewelry you can just buy. The atmosphere is really laid back - when we were there there was about 5 other people making jewelry so the process was very slow, however this wasn't a bad thing. It was nice just relaxing and the atmosphere wasn't rushed. Only potential downside is the lack of industrialisation - this makes the experience more authentic but much less time-efficient. The jewellers have pretty basic machinery that certainly wouldn't meet OH&S standards in most developed countries, but it definitely delivers. Price is also remarkably cheap.

Amazing fun!. Had the best experience with wayan and his staff at Chez Monique. The class was easy, fun and we were so proud of ourselves and our finished pendant. Will be back again to do more cause its so much more rewarding .Awesome time, recommended +++

A fun experience with a great memento. I can thoroughly recomend Chez and his workers. Arrived to find others intent on deciding what to make, all in the comfort of Chez's home. He supplied lots of folders containing photos and images of a silver piece you could make or you could supply your own drawing. His willing helpers showed us what to do, cut out the necessary silver and gave lots of help when needed. Excellent value for money - 4+ hours of tuition and a lovely ring and the company of other travellers also happlily making their own special piece..

Well worth doing. I had never attempted anything like this before. It was very satisfying to draw a design, and then cut a piece of silver to make it. The environment is really great - in the grounds of a home with chickens wandering nearby and kids coming home from school and so on - normal family activities happening around you while you work on making jewellery. It took about 2.5 hours and help was always on hand. Once you finish it (I needed quite a lot of help!) the staff polish it up and fire it etc and you watch while they transform it into a true work of art. It is an authentic experience, not at all touristy, but rather a true silver smithing class. I am now wearing my pendant which I never actually expected would happen when I signed up for the workshop!

A different activity to do in Bali. My daughter and i did this class together. We weren't offered to be picked up, so walked from our accommodation. Its quite centrally located in Ubud and the class is held towards the rear of the family compound. There is a sign at the entrance but nothing to indicate where to go or what to do once you enter through the gate. Keep walking down the path towards the chickens!There were 6 of us in the workshop with 3 silversmiths to assist. You create your own design and draw it up. They will advise if your design is too complex or may cost more because it involves more work.Sunarta and his assistants were very patient - I think I broke the fine saw blade about 6 times! They get you to do the basics and then they do the finishing touches. My daughter and i both made pendants. My daughter really loves her individually designed pendant and thought it was the best thing we did in Bali.

So much fun!. I arranged to have a jewellery class with I Wayan Sunata and made my daughter a pendant.It was such a special thing to do - and Sunata and his staff member were fabulous - helping me heaps to make a special piece.

Silver class. I loved my day at the silver making class. It happened to be my birthday, the day I attended. I made a ring that has a hammered finish and a pendent with the Kouri symbol. I am very happy with both. I had the most mememerable day ever. Everyone in the class made amazing pieces, as well. I was very impressed with the final product. Great people and staff.

Exceptional help to design and create my pendant. Warm and welcoming. A definite place to go again. Highly recommended!!. My friends and I spent Sunday afternoon at Chez Monique. Sunarta and Monique welcomed us into their home, giving us ideas to make our projects more achievable. I was able to work through every step of the way with assistance for parts that I couldn't do and watch the pendant come to life, adding my own touches. I am thrilled to bits with my family tree pendant and can't wait to show it off to friends and family when I get back to Sydney. I will DEFINITELY be back and will also recommend the class to others in the future. Many many thanks for a fabulous day.

My experience at Chez Monique jewellery class on 7th October, 2012. On recommendation we went to the silver making class (5 of us) yesterday! Well what a fabulous afternoon we all had. The staff were so unbelievably helpful and our pieces of jewellery were all so way beyond our expectations! Sunarta and his staff create a very memorable experience. A must do when travelling to Ubud.

Mrs Rosemary Early. My partner and i had one of the most interesting and relaxing afternoons in ubud. we were greeted as if old family members by wayan his staff and lovely family. do not rush this afternoon you need to enjoy. keep your ideas simple and you will enjoy. Wayan will give u a great deal of help. My partner made a truly beautiful turtle pendant and i made some simple spiral earrings which with another twist added to them gave them a whole different look. They are three really lovely pieces of jewelry to which i have had very many comments on by a lot of people since my return to darwin. Highly recommend

Nice way to own a ring. The silversmith is really nice and even showed us around the area after the session. Frankly I did very little - just the pattern on the ring. But, I was happy to kick back and let it happen. Am wearing the ring and even tho I,m not a jewelry type, it looks ok, I think.

Great experience! Earlier issues seem resolved. I had a great time doing this class, the teacher knew that most people had heard of him through Trip Advisor and was definitely taking into account some of the feedback from some earlier negative reviews. Among the things that seemed to be addressed were:Class size: I went with three friends, and last minute another two friends wanted to join but we were told the class was full. I was worried there might be too many people to really get a good experience but when we showed up there were only two others, so six of us altogether. This really gave us a good chance to get time with the teacher and the other two helping him.Amount of help: Some reviewers felt like their entire piece was made for them, I didn't feel like this at all. I felt like they kept a good balance between showing me how to do it, letting me do it on my own, and helping me out if I got a bit stuck.Overall I would definitely recommend this to anyone, and I'm so glad I came away with great memories and a pendant I will definitely be wearing often.

Amazing experience. I'll start by saying that this probably does seem and expensive thing to do but it is seriousy worth every penny. Everyone is so lovely and helpful, my husband and I got personal tuition and the jewellery we produced was utterly beautiful. Plus you will have one of the best cups of coffee ever!!!

Great experience with wonderful outcome. I booked Chez Monique for the first day after we arrived in Ubud and so glad as it was a fantastic experience. We were picked up from the centre of town and taken to the "compund" where the family live and were given an insight into how they live. We made a ring and necklace (albeit with much assistance) and it was fascinating to craft a piece that actually became a really fantastic piece of jewellery. I would determinately recommend this to anyone visiting Ubud.

A creative morning.. If you have a spare few hours in Ubud this is a very worthwhile course not only do you learn to make a piece, you can watch and learn as Sunarta and his instructors put the pieces together. The course is not long enough to make complicated pieces but arrangements can be made for longer lessons. I recommend that you have a design ready to make before you go though there are plenty of designs to choose from. See you next year Sunarta.

Delightful experience with Sunarta. My sister and I enjoyed so much at Chez Monique. Sunarta brought us through the whole process patiently. The workshop is at his baliese house. This was the first time we had stepped into a baliese house. He had even shared with us baliese culture. Would like to visit again the next time I return to Bali.

Fun to do and great results!. After drawing the design we made a pendant and a pair of earrings. It was fun working on it. Polishing done by the apprentice made it really beautiful. Well worth the money!

One of the more worthwhile activities in Bali. My friend and I did this workshop earlier this week and thoroughly enjoyed it. Working with handcrafted silver is a fascinating process and all the more so when done in the immaculate family compound of Wayan and Monique Sunarta. Wayan, the silversmith, is a charming gentleman who made us so welcome we felt like part of the family within the first 5 minutes. We soon found ourselves engrossed in turning our 10 gram beaten strips of 92.5% silver in beautiful pendants. In truth most of the work was done by Wayan and his team, but you can be as hands on as you wish and I discovered that Wayan is brilliant at patching up boo boos. We were delighted with the end results and my silver dragon pendant will always remind me of this fascinating and delightfully unpretentious morning in Ubud. Enormous to thanks to Wayan and Monique.

A Great Experience, you are mad not to try it !!!. I found this Silver Smith on this site, and my son asked if we could do this. So inqusitive as I was , I agreed. WELL AREN'T I GLAD i DID ! OMG, Excelent experience. Very friendly, and helpful. My 2 children and I really had no idea what to make. Ther are books full of example pieces to make.My daughter and I both made rings and my 9yr old son made a pendant which he turned into an arm band.Excellent experience. The staff were friendly, helpful and have a great attitude to young and old.This class is very child friendly. They are very paitent and helpful at all stages of the process.I will be returning to do another class.Thanks for this wonderful experience xxx
A great time. We had fun making matching rings and they kept our 3 kids busy too -- thank you so much, highly recommended!

Very enjoyable experience!. Chez Monique (his actual name is Wayan) was very helpful and patient with us! We chose a very complicated design which took us more than the allowed time to finish. In spite of being late, I Wayan helped us along and didn't rush us, and his wife even brought out some snacks. We ended up with two beautiful pieces. Thank you Wayan for being so patient with us! We appreciate it and definitely recommend you to anyone looking for an authentic silversmith experience in beautiful Bali.
Perfect. Relaxed, informative, fun and we came away with a good quality piece of handcrafted jewellry. A perfect afternoon in Ubud.

Excellent "me time". Loved getting back into the creative groove with Wayan Sunatra's help while staying in Ubud last month. The class has a very relaxed feel, without any pressure to perform or produce. They let you create anything you want and make sure you're happy with it. Well worth $40 USD!!Enjoy!

A fantastic, very different and special experience. We went to Sunatra's silversmith class this morning. We arranged the class at short notice yesterday evening and were fitted in first thing this morning. We were greeted with the warmest hello ever and then went on to make a silver ring and a very classy pendant. We had a great time; it's so good to be able to do something completely different and take away some beautiful handmade memories to keep. A great start to our honeymoon in Indonesia and a must for anyone visiting Ubud.

Explore your creative side. This was a great experience and one I highly recommend. Chez Monique was recommended to me by friends who had visited there a few weeks before. I contacted Sunatra by email before arriving in Ubud to arrange a time to participate in the class, as I was on a limited time frame. However, when I arrived in Ubud, I needed to rearrange the time. Sunatra was very accommodating and told us to come straight over which we did. There was only one other person there, so Sunatra was able to spend time with my friend and I sharing his expertise. We both made pendants, and my friend stayed on to make another. I was so surprised at what I had created, with Frank's help (Sunatra that is). It was awesome to walk out with a fantastic piece of jewellery I made, and apologies to Frank for breaking a 'few' blades!!!! Mad if you don't give this a try when you're in Ubud.

Fantastic!!!. I came across this in Trip Advisor and added it to my list of things to do while i was visiting Indonesia. I was greeted with open arms and a whole heap of crafting ideas as i wasnt sure exactly what i wanted to make. However after a few minutes i had come up with a double pendant for my necklace which, with the help of Sunatra and his artistic skills i created a fantastic piece which is prouldly shown to everyone now. I highly, highly recommend this class, its brilliant, you dont need to be an artist to come up with a great idea for jewellery, and with the support available you are sure to create something worth remembering. !!!Thankyou Sunatra.

Interesting experience. I had talked with Sunatra by mail and had reserved my class in the morning months in advance. He had told me to call when I arrived in Ubud, which I did. When he answered, he told me that the time slot had already been booked. As I was very determined not to miss out on this experience, I accepted his offer to go in the afternoon and change my schedule completely. When I arrived, Sunarta wasn't there and nobody knew what I was talking about. A woman told me that there was no class that afternoon, so she offered to call Sunarta and clear the matter. His attitude by the phone was OK and although we had to wait for him and his apprentice for about half an hour, it was worth it.The jewelry class was very interesting and now I have an even greater respect for jewelers: it's very very hard to craft jewelry! Of course, at the end I got to keep my frangipani pendant which I absolutely love!A big plus for the apprentice that helped me during this class. He was very patient and helpful.
Ear rings and gifts. Very helpful and willing to bargin over price, great display of handmade silver goods. Stall helpfull in showing the art of the silversmith.

Silver Fun. Design and make your own piece of Silverware using hand held tools, it is such a great thing to do and was so much fun. We came across this on Trip advisor while in Ubud; contacted Sunatra by email and got a prompt reply and booked in for the next morning. He welcomes you to his home/workshop with open arms and a warm hug, a genuinely great guy who loves his work! Highly recommend this...

A must do!. What a wonderful experience. My boyfriend and I made rings for each other. It was wonderful to have the opportunity to design something unique from scratch :) I definitely recommend this experience :))))

A must do in Ubud. Sunatra is such a beautiful man who was very understanding when we were running late for our class and then offered to pick us up from our Villa. Talk about going above and beyond. My friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our silver making class and we could not be happier with Sunatra, his family and the class. He has many designs to choose from and I suggest if you would like a gem/stone put in your design you bring it with you as there isn't any available at the class. I highly recommend this on you to do list in Ubud!

Sunarta's silver class. This was one of the highlights of our trip! Sunarta is so warm and friendly we feel like we have made a new friend and will be back to visit with him and his lovely wife Monique. My piece of jewellery is something I will treasure always. XVicki Armstrong

A Must do Experience!. We can’t say enough great things about this experience. From the moment you arrive you are greeted with warm smiles and hugs from Monik and Sunarta. On arrival we were offered coffee, tea and water. Monik and Sunarta treat you like you are a guest in their home. The studio environment is so beautiful, calm and a great place to work. We have never done anything like this before. We created our own unique pendant design and within 2 and a half hours and some help from Sunarta and his trusty associate Silversmith, we made our sketch become a reality. Our piece turned out better than we could have imagined. If you are not into custom designing your own piece, they have plenty of books to look at for inspiration. Sunarta and his helper were so patient in navigating us through the processes. Their kind hearts puts us at ease, which made it easy. We have a new appreciation for handcrafted jewelry and the time & energy it takes to create beautiful pieces. One suggestion if you are considering taking the class, would be to go to their studio to see some of the pieces and designs that they sell. This way you can get an idea / inspiration for the piece you want to create. This was such a experience working together as a couple, putting our love into our special piece. We couldn’t be happier. Here’s a little video of our day: http://youtu.be/WfPL2ZDaki8 We give Chez Monique Silver Smith Class our highest recommendation.

So enjoyable. When i arrived , i had no idea what to make. However there are books with examples, and after seeing them, i had too many ideas.. But decided on a hanger. I am not a very talented person in creative sense, but i got so much help, that even I made a beautiful piece of jewelry. Everybody is very helpfull and friendly, i had a lovely morning! If I ever come to Ubud again, i would definitely go there again to make one of my other ideas.

A fantastic experience everyone should try!. This is by far the best class I have ever attended. I am not creative or arty by any means but I came away with 2 masterpieces which I will treasure. I came with no idea of what I wanted to make but Wayan has plenty of photos to inspire and is at hand to help if needed. His explanations and guidance were clear and he helped as much as you needed. I made a bird pendant and a twisted heart pendant. I am so happy with the design and the finished article and it's great to come away with something unique.I would recommend this experience to anyone who wants a a class with a difference and to make something to treasure for years to come. Wayan treated us like family and we have already signed up for a second class!

Unique thing to do and souvenir of Bali. Yes Highly recommend this, main danger is deciding what to make and how to stop yourself making more, suggest you do some drawing of ideas before hand, though not essential. Sunarta and his worker easily help and advise. Not once was I asked if I want transport or massage (Bali Joke) I'm not a rings person...but now I'm considering making myself one!If you want a totally unique gift made partly by you for family friends or loved one's...this is the place for you!

Interesting, fun & creative way to spend an afternoon.. For the equivalent of about £25 per person we spent the afternoon in Wayan's studio and home where he taught us to make silver jewellery. He's incredibly friendly, accommodating and talented - with a great quality of teaching and a lovely family. We could easily come back time and time again, and for the price we just do so.

So Inspirational!! Wonderful Teachers of the trade!. This is an excellent class to take while in Ubud! Wayan & Harrison, the teachers, help you bring your ideas to life! I have wanted to experience the art of silversmithing for some time; and I am so glad that I did it here for the first time! Wayan is so warm and welcoming to all of his guests! I came in with something a bit different & time consuming than most, but Wayan & Harrison still helped make it happen and with great diligence! I had a stone to set, as well as a few bands to make, for me to assemble my final piece when I got home. (I didn't have the main piece, needed to complete it, with us on our trip) I finally assembled it last week & I am thrilled!! It turned out better than I could have ever imagined! Thanks to Wayan & Harrison! See you next time we visit Ubud! I highly recommend this class for artists of all ages & levels!

Experience of a lifetime. My wife and I decided to book the class after reading about it on trip advisor. The idea was to make rings for each other to celebrate our anniversary, but in addition to a pair of beautiful rings, we had an experience of a lifetime. Sunarta is a warm and ebullient man, who greeted us with hugs, not handshakes. He encouraged us to create our own unique designs and guided us through the process of making the rings. We are still in awe of the jewelry we created and will cherish the experience forever. Definitely a must-do activity in Bali, especially in the Ubud area.

Excellent in every way. I would definitely recommend this activity to everyone interested in getting a glimpse at the making of silver jewellery. It is a wonderful activity also for older children and teenagers. We booked a morning session via email for our teenage son and his friend. Mr Sunarta replied quickly. The workshop is at the back of a traditional Balinese compound. We were all greeted by with a big hug (kind of unexpected for Bali) by Mr Sunarta and his wife. The boys had prepared a design for a silver ring which they explained to Mr Sunarta. For 2.5 hours they worked on their rings together with a silversmith assigned to them. I think that the rings are exquisite and the boys are very pleased, proudly wearing them. They really enjoyed the experience and the company of Mr Sunarta and his team. Mr Sunarta has a book with design which are possible make, but it is a good idea if you come prepared with your own design, the simpler the better.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE! A MUST DO!. My partner and I looked on Trip Advisor and saw other peoples recommendations to go to the silver smith classes. We had never been to Ubud before however understood it was a 'creative' capital. I booked our class through the email system and Sunarta contacted me back almost immediately. He was always very kind and accommodating. In our group there were two other ladies. Both lovely. We stayed in the center of Ubud and decided to walk. In retrospect, we only gave ourselves 1/2 hour stroll but should have took more time as there is so much to see.The classes are held at the back of their family compound (he has many creative people in his family - painters etc). The compound holds all his family houses and a temple. It is amazing and a cultural experience in itself. When we arrived we entered the gates and followed the path to the back, a kind and very creative elderly gentleman who was painting the most AMAZING painting pointed us in the direction about half way down. Sunarta knew who I was instantly and was very warm. His english is amazing. My partner and I decided to make rings for each other. The tree ring with 6 branches, 1 branch for each kid (yes we have no TV). We really wanted our rings to mean something and Sunarta recommend that we make it together and then cut the ring down the middle so it was made from the same piece of silver. Was such a wonderful idea. Thank you Sunarta. Sunarta had 2 other men their helping us out. We paid approximately $135 AU for the 2, 4 hour classes, 3 men helping and all the extra silver purchases (we have big fingers and made heavy rings) and two tickets to the Fire Dance show. I can not tell you how much of a fantastic experience this was. All I can say to you is to go and do it. We are definitely going back. I would go back to Ubud to just go and say hello to him and his wife and do the class again. RECOMMENDED. :)

Highlight of our Ubud trip!. My husband and I visited the Chez Monique studio, which is really Wayan's house, last week. We had an incredibly EXCELLENT experience! Wayan greeted us with a hug, a smile, and helped us begin to sketch our visions for our silver pieces. After our sketches were complete, we got to work straight away. My husband and I were fortunate to be the only customers that day, so we got specialized attention throughout the entire experience. My husband wanted more of a hands-on experience, and he practically made his pendant all on his own! I wanted more assistance with my pendant, which a Chez Monique worker was happy to give. After several hours of fun work, we received our beautiful pendants. We couldn't be happier with how they turned out! Wayan made the class extremely personal, memorable, and warm. You MUST try his delicious coffee when you're there! This experience was certainly our highlight while staying in Ubud!

Best keepsake of a vacation. I had read of Chez Monique in Trip Advisor and decided to to add this on my trip itinerary while in Bali. Who needs another t-shirt?!As soon as I arrived I was greeted warmly by Sunarta and Monik! What gracious hosts they were! I drew out my design and with much guidance and help a wonderful pendant was created!!Every time I wear this I will remember the awesome time I had in Bali!!!!

Make your own unique souvenir. Our ten year old daughter wanted to do this silver class, so we walked up the street to the compound early on Sunday morning. There were only two other students present and two teachers. It is useful to already havesome kind of design in mind when you go for the class as your drawing will serve as the template for the silver cutting. There were however also plenty of examples/photos on hand. We were made to feel very welcome in this family compound, a glimpse of dialy Balinese life, which was an added bonus. Obviously our daughter needed some help with the more intricate parts.. She enjoyed the class very much.
