Design & make your own silver jewellery. Had a fantastic afternoon being taught various methods in silver jewellery making. Made my own pendant with lots of advice & help. It really made me appreciate what good craftsmanship is & I will look at each piece of hand crafted jewellery now in a different light.

Fun time. I asked for a design of the Balinese "Good luck" symbol for my jewelry. Both Sunarta & Monik were very welcoming & helped me have a most wonderful afternoon!! I will remember this experience each time I wear my new necklace! I will definitely sign up for another class whenever I visit Ubud in the future.
Great morning!. Greeted by a hug and smile, we had a fantastic time creating our silver jewelry peices in Ubud. The staff is extremely helpful and patient. Definately worth a visit for an afternoon.

A fabulous experience. I really enjoyed this silver jewellery workshop. I am thrilled with the pendant that I made (with some help!), and have impressed my friends with my hitherto unknown talent. I also enjoyed being able to work within a traditional Balinese compound setting - I felt that was an unexpected privilage. Thankyou to Sunarta and his collegues - and to his wife, who drove me to the studio on the back of her scooter. Suksma Mewali

A great afternoon out!. A friend and I found the Chez Monique Silver Smith Class on Trip Advisor and thought it was a "different" thing to do while in Ubud. We had a great time, and came away with something which looked really nice as a momento of our time.The class is run in a traditional family compound not far from the main street. It can be a little difficult to find however a sign has been posted out the front.The two guys running the class do so in a relaxed and casual manner. There isn't really "school room" feel about it, or set start and finish time, they just take groups on as they can and move between them. When they have more people, naturally, they are spread a bit thinner, but if you're fortunate enough to be there with only a couple of others it's great. There were probably about 8 including us when we first arrived, but only the two of us in the end.They start by showing you some books of pendants, earrings and rings so you can get an idea about what you want to make. My advice is to be realistic in your decision! Next they get you to sketch your design on some paper and they transfer this to the "raw" silver. If they think your design will need additional silver or work, you will be advised and given the opportunity to make alterations.Next you are on the tools cutting, filing and stamping your masterpiece, and let me tell you, at this point you think it looks pretty ordinary! The good news is that for novices like us, most mistakes can be fixed by the guys!For obvious reasons they aren't too keen on letting novices loose on blow-torches and grinders and let's be realistic here, by doing this for you they're turning your piece into something that you may actually wear. They are happy for you to watch over their shoulders, ask questions and take photos as they work on the final stages and to be honest we were happy for them to do that. In the end we were blown away by how good our pieces looked and it was a fun afternoon for only 400.000 rupiah (approx $40 AUD/USD).

One of the highlights of our trip. Honestly when my GF wanted to take me there I was not really enthusiastic as I have never been really interested in making my own jewelery! But it was really fun and the teacher and his staff was so patient and nice to us. I really liked it a lot. Besides, we came 30 min earlier because we were scared to be late but instead of just letting us wait outside, they let us started drawing and make the jewellery right away!When I go back to Bali, i'll go back there for sure!

Waste of money!. This definitely wasn’t what we expected. It’s more of a choose-a-design-and-we’ll-100%-make-it-for-you class. When we went, there were herds of tourists and only two “teachers” so there definitely wasn’t much teaching going on. We all made rings (and when I say “made” I mean we pointed to photos and did absolutely nothing besides watching the teachers make them) and then we were told that since our rings weighed more than ten grams (which they surely, surely didn‘t), they would cost 50,000rp more than the shop’s posted price of 400,000 ($40). RIP OFF.

A perfect morning!. We were staying in Ubud for 10 days and wanted to do something which took us slightly away from the usual tourist spots. Chez Monique's silver smith class was a great way to spend a couple of hours set on the outskirts of Ubud. After picking us up from the centre of Ubud we were taken to his compound and shown around his home. He talked to us about daily life in Bali, how they lived and answered any questions we had about Balinese life more generally. As an anthropology student our host was very welcoming and helpful with answering all my questions! We looked through some brochures and decided on the rings we wanted to make and were warned in advance that because they were more complex designs, they would cost slightly more. After confirming this was fine, we each drew out the designs and set to work cutting them out of silver. We were able to participate with as much or as little as we wanted. Whilst my mum had a go at everything, I chose to sit back during the finishing stages to make sure I had a top quality finish on my ring! We were lucky because we were the only ones in his class that morning so we had lots of attention. We were very pleased with our finished rings as they are such a great souvenir to help to remind us of the real Bali, behind closed doors! The class was 2.5 hours in total and the rings ended up costing 500,000 each (£33.70). Completely worth it for the detailed instructions, the friendly and warm welcome and a glimpse into the everyday life of the Balinese.Thank you Mr Sunarta for kindly welcoming us into your home and helping us to make beautiful pieces to remind us of Bali. Truly worth a visit.
Great time. I went there after finding on trip advisor & I'm glad I went had an awsome time making my Jewellery very friendly & inviting highly recommend thankyou from Bianca Australia...

Silversmithing made easy. I made a fantastic large ring with a little help from the wonderful Sunarta and his assistants. I was able to design, make and am now wearing it proudly as a reminder of my time in Bali

Not sure why it is so popular. We found the main shop selling products and asked how much to do the tour. We were told 400,000 for the two of us. I double checked and the shop lady said yes. However we were charged 850,000 on the completion of the jewelry making. There was very little interaction between us and the people who were supposed to be helping. I found this one a waste of time, money and don't understand why it is so popular.

Great activity. We had a lovely afternoon and ended up with some beautiful pieces of jewellery. Mr Sunarta, his assistant and his family were all very sweet and hospitable. The only issue is that there's a lot of waiting for the pieces to be completed once you've actually finished working on them. I would definitely visit again and recommend this to anyone in Ubud.

Very disappointing. My Fiancé and I were actually really disappointed with the whole experience. Long story short, besides the two of us there were nine other customers so the two employees were barely able to help us. We wanted to make plain, simple rings and all they would let us do was the engraving part. They wouldn't let us even cut the strips of metal and definitely said we couldn't help with soldering or polishing. Really? I thought this was a class!! It took us about thirty minutes to do the engraving then we had to sit and wait 2 1/2 hours before they could get to us for the soldering. Then, they ended up telling us to just come back that night to pick up our finished rings. Good thing we had a motorbike or we would have had to get a taxi because this place definitely isn't within walking distance! Then, when we came to pick up our rings, they charged us 450,000 rupiahs ($48 usd) for one of the rings (it's supposed to be 400,000) because the owner said that it was over ten grams. This was extra frustrating because before we started, we specifically asked if our rings were under the ten gram limit and the same man that overcharged us assured us that there'd be no extra fees. THEN, later we weighed the ring and IT WEIGHS FOUR GRAMS!!!!!!!!! Ahhhhh!!!!!!!! The next stop of our trip was in Yogyakarta, Java where we ended up seeing another silver class. We tried again and ended up having SO much fun! It was just us and one teacher. We were shown how to do all of the carving/cutting/sawing, soldering, and polishing ourselves - it's so much more special that way AND it only cost 120,000 rupiah (vs Chez Monique's 450,000).

Fun way to spend a rainy Ubud morning. Made a beautiful ring with the help of Mr Sunarta and his helpful assistant and found this to be an interesting and fun activity to do. There were 7 of us doing the workshop and we all went at our own pace. My piece was less complicated so I was finished within 2 hours. Workshops don't seem to be daily and the place is a little tricky to find so I would suggest getting your hotel to call ahead to book and get directions. Once you arrive at the family compound walk right to the back and down the stairs. Only negative - most people's pieces seemed to cost more than Rp 400,000 so I would recommend checking the price of the design before proceeding. Hopefully this isn't an indication of greediness that has the potential to ruin this business. Recommended if looking for an activity while in town.

Authentic and enjoyable. Our family spent 3 hours with Sunarta and his family making gorgeous jewelry that we designed ourselves. They were so patient and kind and it was great for our kids to get away from the traffic in Ubud and see how families live. We would recommend this to all visitors to Ubud.

A great morning out. I booked this for my husband and I to do in the morning and then to spend the rest of the day in Ubud and surrounds. It was such a great way to start of the day and we both loved it. My husband was not really sure what to expect and whether he would like it, but he loved it and made a beautiful pendant. It is a great thing to do and have a keepsake of our stay in Bali.Sunarta is very patient and helpful as well as all of his staff, nothing is too much trouble and the family compound that the classes are conducted at are very peaceful and you feel a million miles away. As other reveiwers have pointed out it is a good idea to have a think about what you want to make before going, but there are plenty of books with a good assortment of designs that you can also use and copy or add your own ideas to. A great morning spent and thank you Sunarta and your team for making our morning very fun and enjoyable.

awesome experience!. We had such a great time and sunarta and his family were so welcoming! the class took around 3 and a half hours and we all had beautiful silver jewellery after. The family home was beautiful and very relaxing atmosphere! I absolutley love the ring i made!! My friend made a more complex turtle pendant and nothing was too hard to accomplish. I definatley recommend doing this!

Excellent Experience. My partner and I truly enjoyed ourself at this silver jewellery making class. Sunarta is a friendly and well spoken man who instantly made us feel welcome and at home. He sets out to give clear instruction and on top of that, was very encouraging and also helpful in supporting us through our creation-process. If you are keen to attend this class, do spend some time first thinking of whether you would like to create a ring or pendant and the type of design that you would like to create. At the end of the project, Sunarta and his assistant would refine on your work and help you to polish the silver to a high polish. We are astounded by their skill and how the end product looks polished and well designed. You might just be inspired to explore jewellery making upon your return home. It certainly did for me.

A great experience!. Will definitely recommend this to anyone. Sunarta was wonderful and extremely patient. We had a lovely morning making our keepsakes and now we have something lasting to remember our trip from. I would also recommend (similar to other reviewers) that you decide what type of jewelery you'd like to make (i.e. pendant, ring...) beforehand as there is a lot to choose from and you may end up spending hours just looking at all the albums. All in all - a must do!

A honeymoon highlight. A totally different, yet thoroughly enjoyable morning.. Very welcoming once you locate the premises. Would advise that you give some thought to what you would like to make prior to arriving, but even though we pondered for some time, fashioned two very unique quality pieces of jewellery. Definitely recommended!

Great Afternoon!. This was a brilliant experience!, The class is held in the owners home and welcomes you with open arms, we booked a couple of days ahead as the class can get busy, showed up at the shop an a driver took us around to the workshop. Leave yourself at least a few hours to enjoy crafting your peice of silver.If you can draw its a bonus! you can design your own, but i had to trace a design from the many he has in his books. Really shows how talented and patient they are! would reccomend.

truly unique experience. We were thrilled with our creations and will definitely return to Chez Monique when we come back to Bali. It was amazing to see our ideas on paper transformed into such unique and beautiful pieces of jewellery. Thankyou Sunarta for your warm and friendly guidance. Fiona and Mario.

Good fun. Enjoyed the class and you really get an idea of how difficult it is to make good jewelry. The guys are really nice and helpful.Would recommend doing an early class. We got in at little notice but it was a bit crowded at first.

must do this in Ubud!. This was a highlight of our few days in Ubud. We did a silver class in the family compound and created 2 fantastic peices with the help of the wonderful staff.I recommend writing the address down to give to your driver so they can find it. There is a small "Silver Class" sign out the front of the family compound, so if you have the address is it easy to find.It was a lovely morning with a great insight also into family life in Bali. Sunarta and Monique were absolutely lovely and so welcoming. There were design books there to choose designs, or come prepared with your own ideas and designs.

Great experience. We really enjoyed our class. Sunarta was very professional and personable; he stayed late to help us finish our pieces. Recommendation: make something simple! and try to have you idea ahead of time. He has binders with ideas but it's a bit overwhelming if you don't know what you'll be making yet. The rings that people made in our class turned out very nicely.

Just fantastic. Be sure to do it. The other reviews are spot on. This place is amazing. Sunarta and Monik are so welcoming, the class sensational, the finished product something to be seriously proud of.Do yourself a favour and book it. Today. You'll never, ever regret it.

Booked and confirmed but they never showed up. Not really much of a review as the driver did not show up and left my Mum and her friend waiting in the lobby for an hour (after I had confirmed by phone only the day prior). It was sad as they did not have much time in Ubud and would have picked another activity but due to timing they could not. The owner did not call and I had to contact him for an apology. I am sure the class is very good but if you only have one day to do an activity you might want to find a more reliable operator.

Great experience with a lasting momento. This was a wonderful afternoon for both my girlfriend and (surprisingly) me too.This is the first time we've attempted to create something out of silver, and we were taken aback by the quality of what we managed to produce with the help of Sunarta and his colleague.The place is a little hard to find, but luckily our driver knew the way.Once there, we were given a warm welcome, a cup of tea, and several booklets full of ideas for jewellery. This helped get the creative juices flowing allowing us to sketch some ideas on to paper. Once we'd chosen what to produce, the sketch was placed on to sheet silver and, following a demonstration, we cut out our designs. After which they were polished and finished up to a high quality pendant. Other options involved stamping, oxidisation and a number of other skills depending on what you decide to make.It was a great experience with some lovely jewellery to take home as a momento.Be aware that the price of the item will depend somewhat on the amount of silver you use! Sunarta is very upfront about this from the off based on your design, but take some extra cash in case you decide to make something heavier or larger than the included 10grams. The time is also dependent on the complexity of what you make! 2 hrs is fine for something simple, but more complex things will take longer unless you're a wizz at it!

Best attraction in Bali. We found Bali overall disappointing after having heard for years about how delightful the people were, the pace slow and graceful and the island idyllic. However, the brightest star by far was the afternoon spent at Chez Monique in Ubud. The owner and staff were kind, gentle, patient, humorous, utterly delightful and so very helpful too. Not only did I come away with my faith restored in the gentle Balinese traditions, but I had a beautiful silver medallion as a keepsake of the best 4 hrs I spent in Bali. Thank you Chez Monique!

good if you wanna have some sweet memory!. We have a lot of fun and spent around 2-3 hours over here.this is the first time we have chance to create your own pendant/ring.You will select what you wanna make from a booklet provided...then once you decided what you want, then you will start doing it!Don't worry that it will be too hard for you, once you facing any difficulties, they will help and assists you. It's worth to pay a visit if you stay in Ubud...

A great day. This was a fantastic day. I made a ring which I love so much.It was great to visit & be welcomed into a family compound.Everyone was made to feel very welcome. I would recommend that everyone gives this a go.

Amazing experience. After checking put Trip Advisor for things to do in Bali, I knew I had to come and try this class and I wasn't disappointed! They make you create a design and assist in the process of making your own jewellery... We both made family pendants and love them! Thank you so much for such a great class!
Look what I made!. Fabulous afternoon and they helped me make a lovely keepsake

A different activity for your holiday. This was a really fun thing to do while in Ubud. My finace did a cooking class while I made a ring. It was quite relaxing, not hard at all. I would have liked to have found out more about the process...I kept asking what was happening - it's more going to design and make a ring rather than learning about it. But that's fine, it looks quite complicated and the session was really enjoyable. Definitely do it!

The most fun place!. After reviewing tripadvisor, I went to make perfume, make silver ring, and to the private spa wellness center. I have to say that making sliver rings with owner sunarta was the most fun experience which my best friend who went with me also agreed. You started by desinging the ring then Sunarta would give you all the assistance he could. The final products were fabulos!!! I agreed with other people who left the message said that it was definitely the highlight of the trip!!!

Unique experience. What an amazing afternoon I had making my very own lotus flower ring. I felt welcomed from the moment I entered the family compound and recieved a big hug from Sunarta and Monique. Thwy were excellent hosts and it was fascinating to learn about making jewellery in this way. I will never look at it the same way in the shops again! I loved every minute of my time at the workshop and I LOVE my finished piece. If you are thinking about doing this, don't think just book it!

A Highlight of Ubud. I looked into this as something special for my wife and I to do in Ubud as part of our honeymoon. We only had a few days and we are both so glad that we did this.After getting picked up and given (unusually for Bali) a big welcome hug we traveled five mins to a genuine Balinese family compound, a bonus for us to experience real balinese family life.There were no real rules or restrictions to what we could make during our workshop and we were supported to make our own jewellery and souvenirs based on our own imagination and a knowledge that the amount of silver included in the workshop price was obviously limited.I made a keyring and my wife made a pendant to keep as a honeymoon souvenir forever, also we met some wonderfully friendly people and were welcome inside their own family compound.Tx Wayan (Suksme!!!!)

Self-made silver souvenirs. We booked a class through email and it was confirmed without any problem. Sunarta, Monique and his assistant were so patient, helpful and kind while waiting for us to decide on what we wanted to make. Even for someone who is artistically challenged, the experience was memorable and we ended up with 2 beautiful and unique pieces of silver (some help is definitely required especially when it comes to the polishing part) as a memory of our wonderful holiday in Ubud! Definitely a must for those who do not mind spending a bit of money to experience something unique.

So Special. We booked a class via email and it was confirmed without any problem. We had a little trouble finding Sunarta's home but this was more to do with our map reading than anything else. He is very helpful and found us and brought us to his family home. I believe he often picks up people from his shop to attend the class. Sunarta was very warm and welcoming and it was a real pleasure to spend time with him and talk about family. The class was very interesting and Andrew and I made rings to remember our time spend in Ubud. I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this activity, maybe ensure you have a good map and directions or get Sunarta to pick you up.

i made unique souvenirs. My friend and I went to a silver smithing class and we both loved it! In the morning, it was just the 2 of us and Sunarta, Monique, and Harris were all so kind and helpful while we decided what to make. I enjoyed it so much that I stayed for the afternoon and made 2 more pieces of silver work! Their home is beautiful and Monique told us about Balinese culture and about the offerings she made while we were there. In the afternoon, there were many other students but I still felt that I got the attention that I needed. When I wear my silver jewellery, I just remember the lovely day that I spent in Ubud making it and the warmth and kindness of my teachers. I also met Sunarta's sister (I think), who also has a shop in Ubud and returned to her shop to buy some beautiful earrings. If I get the chance to return to Ubud, I would love to return and take another class. Oh, depending on the weight of your pieces, there may be an additional cost for the silver. Since I spent the whole day there, the afternoon fee was less than my morning.

Lovely Memory. It was a wonderful & memorable time for me and kong. I'm so happy that we are able to make our own couple pendant " doggy & piggy" as our Bali Trip 2012 souvenir.Thank you Sunarta & his assistant help. Both of them are so friendly, patient and spent such a long time for our pendants to make sure that we get the perfect piece. We were the first to reach there for the class and the last to go back with our LOVELY pendants.And, thank you Monik for her warmth hospitality. We love the Luwak Coffee.

Unique and fun Ubud activity!. How often do most people get to make silver jewelry? When we heard about this class, we decided it would be a great way to learn something new and by master jewelry makers. Sunarta and his family are absolute sweethearts and so welcoming to their home. Sunarta even picked us up from the Chez Monique Shop which was located nearer our hotel and drove us to his home/studio a few minutes to the north of Ubud. You can design pretty much anything you want and Sunarta and his team will help you to create the design. I sketched my mom's signature and we made it into a pendant for a necklace. Absolutely gorgeous and they helped me every step. To be fair, they do a lot of the technical work, but I got to see the process and learned a lot.Great way to spend a morning or afternoon in Ubud!

Fantastic! Great experience!. Oh such a loving family and great environment of being welcomed into their east to find home.Did this class today and was so impressed by the wonderful and caring family - their warmth and hospitality added to the delight of being able to create a wonderful piece of jewellery - the guidance and care were fantastic and this would be a top on my 'must do again!' list. The other Aussie doing the class was making a leaf ring (class on the 19th) and I did not seethe end product but want to!Again thank you so much it will be fondly remembered and eagerly recommended.

What fun!. I recently took a sliver jewelry making class in Ubud, Bali at Chez Monique. It was great fun and educational in that I learned how cuts outs were make (by hand - not moulded) in metal jewelry. The instructor and his assistant were very helpful, friendly, patient, and took a lot of time to ensure that each of us (4) produced a piece we would be proud to wear. It's really neat to have a hand made pendant that is a reminder of the exotic island of Bali. I found the class so interesting that I've started searching for one at home that will allow me to make earrings to go with the pendant.If you are looking for something a little unusual to do in Bali, give it a try. I would advise coming with a design - keep it simple and small. Cut outs take a lot of time!

Beautiful experience. I had the most beautiful morning with Sunarta and Monik. To walk into their home and be greeted with a hug, what better way to start the day. Being very artistically challenged with grand ideas of what to make, he was very patient and extremely helpful. His 'apprentice' was very talented as well. Monik was a gorgeous soul, very loving and welcoming. I will definitely be recommending Chez Monique to all I know and will no doubt return there again. This was a highlight of my holiday.

Great and Fun ~!. It is so special things must do in UBUD ! This is my first time to make own pendant. I feel this is very meaningful ! And so happy with their services also. They teach us slowly step by step and help a lot while doing the pendant. This is really great . :)

In response to Dave_O_the_world. I have had the pleasure of taking classes at Chez Monique and have never experienced any problems reaching him by phone; as a small businessman I'm sure he relies on phone calls from potential clients/students and would therefore not want to miss any potential business. I have found that the easiest way to communicate and book classes with him is directly on the Internet. I believe he checks his mail twice daily and his response is usually within 24 hours. Classes are held in Wayan and Monique's home where you not only experience their gracious hospitality but also get a glimps into the daily life of a Balinese family. Since classes are held in their home there is no signage but any taxi driver would be able to take you directly to the house. Classes are held at the back of the compound so don't be shy about entering. I look forward to taking another class with Wayan on my next visit to Bali.

Relaxing and taxing. Our morning with Wayan Sunarta and Harris was a challenge since we had never done anything like this before. However they guided and encouraged and when necessary rescued us from disaster to ensure we each ended with a lovely piece of jewellery. The atmosphere in a family compound was calming and we were able to appreciate a little of the life behind the walls in Balinese homes. Get clear directions if being dropped by a taxi. Use the email address as a contact and request a mobile phone number to ensure that you can connect if you get lost. Bring some water. Coffee is served. Bring some ideas with you but don't be too ambitious.

A wonderful experience in a place full of unique experiences.. Frankly, I had low expectations, but my wife wanted to take this class. We arrived at Chez Monique & inquired about the classes; the shop attendant rang up Mr. Sunarta, who came up on his scooter in about ten minutes & agreed to hold a class for us the next morning. I was amazed at how enjoyable it was to execute my design (with guidance)! Really fun!

Do-it-yourself Silver-smithing (with some help, of course). It's not hard to see why the Chez Monique Silver Smith Class has attracted such high praise from previous reviews. They have really done something special with this place.Wayan, his wife Monique and the rest of their team made welcomed us into their home with warmth to see how their silver-smithing is done behind-the-scenes. Wayan and Ari were attentive throughout, giving you as much direction and inspiration as needed. It was an insightful experience and a different way to spend the afternoon in Ubud.The course costs 400,000 baht (around 28 GBP) and lasts approximately three hours in total. This also includes 10 grams of sterling silver to make into whatever jewellery piece you wish to make. The only thing I would have wanted a little more of, was to be more hands on with the joining of parts and polishing of the piece. Having said that, when I asked to tumble/polish the silver ring I'd made - Wayan was more than helpful. We were there for three hours, so realistically it would take at least a day for us to learn all we needed for the soldering aspects of this course. In three hours, we covered designing the piece, cutting the design in sterling silver and adding any embellishments/stamping as necessary.This course is for anyone who wants to see how silver jewellery is soldered/melted and formed together. The nice added bonus (a fairly big bonus), is that you get to walk away with your new work of art! Note: You don't have to be particularly creative or artistic to do this, as there's plenty of help from the team.

Such a fun day with Sunarta!. Since this is the number one rated thing to do in Ubud, I wasn't sure I would be able to go when I called the day of to make a reservation for the class. We called around noon, and Sunarta picked us up around 1pm (granted, we did not visit during high season).We spent more than 5 1/2 hours with Sunarta. Four hours were spent designing and making beautiful jewelry. We learned so much about silver making. It was an amazing experience!!! Sunarta was very friendly and always smiling. The class is in his family's compound, which made it even more of a unique experience. If you have the time, you definitely need to do this!!The last hour and a half, Sunarta showed us around the area where he lives. It was above and beyond service that we were not expecting! We had such a great time with him and completely recommend a visit! It is well worth it. Thanks for an amazing day Sunarta!Courtney and Chris

Memorable moments. This would have to be an absolute must for any holiday! I had planned to do this before I left australia and was so looking forward to it. This class blew me away on how amazing I was to create a beautiful piece of jewellery. I must admit I did design a pendant that was a little larger than normal, and I really wanted to finish it as it was my 50th birthday the follwowing day and really wanted to wear it, so being the most outstanding host that wayan and his wife were, they finished it off for me and delivered it to the restaurant where I was having my birthday dinner! Do yourself a favour and make yourself a piece you will have for the rest of your life!

Fantastic even for those of us that are artistically challenged. Not the type of activity I would usually seek to do but went along with my partner as she was keen to do it. Turned out to be a very enjoyable experience. I gave the pendant I made to my daughter on my return home and she was amazed that I had made it. Wayan and his helper were very positive, patient and helpful.

Fun with Wayan!. We had a great afternoon with Wayan in his home. Upon arrival he was very welcoming and friendly. As others have mentioned it definitely helps to have an idea in mind as to what you want to make. Once designs were ready, you go to work. He thoroughly explained the process and would assist if you wished. Pricing for the experience and your own piece of handmade jewelry is very reasonable. Wayan really made this experience one to remember. Just a very kind man and you can tell he loves sharing his trade with those that visit. Thanks to Wayan, I ended up with a unique ring that I love and a reminder of my wonderful time in Ubud.

Fantastic experience!!. I had read all the trip adviser reviews and decided to book in with Sunarta and Monik as my husband and I like being creative and having unique experiences. I'm happy to say the reviews do not disappoint! Sunarta is so helpful and welcoming and my husband and I made a ring and pendant! Something for us to have that is special to both of us for the rest of our lives. Sunarta and Monik welcomed us into their beautiful home and are truly wonderful people. If you are even thinking about doing this it is worth every penny!

Fun and unique experience. My husband and I signed up for this class based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and our experience was similar to all the rave reviews. Wayan picked us up from the Chez Monique shop, and took us to his studio. Everyone was super friendly and made us feel welcome. We had a great time working on our projects, and ended up with jewelry pieces that are a unique and special reminder of our trip to Bali.It helps to have an idea of what you would like to make, before going to the class. Binders were available with lots of pictures of different ideas, but it can be a little daunting to try and design something on the spot. Ideally, you could arrive with a few ideas in mind, and get feedback or advice from Wayan. You will be drawing your design to scale on paper, and then Wayan and his assistant will help you turn it into a beautiful piece of jewelry.

making jewerly. it was a great expereince as it was a unquie thing to do. We were picked up by Wayan and taken to his studio, he was the most freindly person we have meet in bali and very honest. Part of the course is to design your piece or you can copy from one of the provided books with many examples. They were very helpful and patient with us, especially as we took time to draw our designs. Its enjoyable because they help with difficult/dangerous parts. Wayan took time to chat to us.

So much fun!!!. Thank you Sunarta and Monik for inviting us onto your home complex for such a creative and zen class! I was happy to find out that you were located in central Ubud (short walk from Jl Raya) and that classes ran twice a day every day. I looove my pendant and ring and enjoyed seeing them go from idea to reality before my eyes. It was so much fun and I cannot wait to do it again!! Warm regards to you all and thank you for your hospitality :D See you next time!

Great fun. Just a walk away from ubud centre to wayans house you will be guided step by step with assistance how to make your own jewellery. Brilliant fun and such a welcoming family with great satisfaction at the end with your unique piece. Only advice I'd give is draw out what you want to scale in advance as will save you time and consider keeping it simple as you will cut, etch, heat, solder etc your masterpiece. Great enjoyment and would recommend it to anyone- even my husband enjoyed making his piece!!

Spectacular! So much Fun!!!. My girlfriend and I took this class. When we arrived a family of 8 was just finishing so we got to see all they made: every piece looked so professional! We made rings which also turned out just beautiful! The class is so much fun! The instruction is clear, the instructor is so cheerful and encouraging - it was one of the highlights of our two weeks in Bali! We highly recommend the class! If you are going to Bali, it is an activity you do not want to miss! And you end up with a gorgeous piece at the end of it! 5 stars!!!!!

The Time Well Spent for a Great Memory Piece.. The workshop is located quite away from main shopping street, luckily we didn't walk or the heat will kill us! But the trip was so worth it. My daughter and I had made a ring and a bracelet for ourselves with the kind help of Mr. Sunarta (the owner) and his friend. We had a great time and came back with the first piece of jewellery we each ever made from our own design for the first time. Something to cherish be really happy about. We will definitely go to Chez Monique again for our next visit to Bali.

Number 1 thing to do in Ubud!!!. We did this class with 8 people, including kids and found it a great experience! In 3 hours we had all designed, made and personalized a piece of jewelry including 6 detailed necklaces and 2 amazing rings! We would deffinatley recommend this activity to anyone between the age of 6-100! The guys who helped us and ran the course were VERY helpful and friendly! One of them didn't speak much English but the other spoke a reasonable amount of English! Loved it!!! 1000000/10!!!! :D
Made nice ring. In three hours we made a nice ring for a friend and had some fun.Good activity for a lazy day in UbudThe team is very nice indeed!

Wayan is the Man!. We traveled to bali with another couple and they mentioned doing the silver smith class. It was a little out of the way from the Ubud Center, we entered Wayan's compound and he greeted us with a huge smile. Now...I was born and raised in New Jersey, so I am always hesitant about "overly nice people" but Wayan was genuine and he and his "little helper" (cant remember his name) gave a great class! we ended up making rings and we get complimented on them all the time. Wayan invited us to taste some coffee and even showed us some of his past work. I have no doubt we've made a true friend in Bali. Wayan, you're the Man, thanks again!Victor & Camille (Josep)

also the owner has class - balivouchers.net make this a real success. We have done this event 1 time and we have to say it is a must do thing on Bali. The course itself is already incredibly cheap but balivouchers.net makes it even cheaper.But not only the course is great. Wayan the owner is such a great person that if you have met him once, you want to come back whenever you can. He is a member of the Kecak Firedance, ask him for this attraction as well! We promise, you will love both attractions and don't forget to order the booklet or get it directly at the airport. You will get at the airport for free with the booklet a SIM CArd of XL Telekom also, you can use it for 100 minutes international calls to 50 selected countries such as Australia,Germany, USA...., it contains all activities on Bali including the tripadvisor rating with great discounts!!! For a trip to Ubud we highly recommend Good Day Bali Tours, we have found a voucher as well in the booklet.Enjoy the island of the gods with Wayan and balivouchers :)m.

Without a doubt one of the top highlights of the trip!. Do not be put of by the fact it is just on a balinese man's porch as he owns a gorgeous workshop there as well as a shop he tells me! His helper named Harris and him were incredibly patient with me and my companions as we designed our own pendants from just a block of silver! You can make anything you like though! from a celtic knot ring to just a simple bangle! you can even ingrave your own name or pattern onto your piece! It is such fun and a must!

A unique and memorable experience. When you visit a country you want to do something a little bit off the beaten track, a bit different to the norm which offers you a memory noone else has. Sunarta's class offers this. We were made to feel so at home from the moment we arrived and with careful and funny tutoring had soon designed a beautiful keepsake to remind us of Bali forever. I only wanted an anklet so was allowed to make an extra something free of charge. It was one the best things I've done while travelling so far. If I come backIll be visiting again! Thank you :-)

Great place to create perfect momentos. Spend a great afternoon with Wayan patiently instructing us what to do with our designs and we created our wedding anniversary momentos which turned out great! Really good instruction and patience. His craftsmen assisting us were great as well! 2 thumbs up!Thanks Wayan! It will bring us back great memories of time spent in Bali

Golden experience with a Balinese silversmith. Little did we realise what we could expect when we booked a slot of 3 hours to learn how to craft our silver souvenirs from the master silversmiths Sunarta and Harris. After the session, we were so glad that we made the trip there or else we might have regretted missing a truly memorable experience - crafting and bringing home a piece of your own artwork under the sincere guidiance of the masters. Do not miss this silver-crafting class when you are in Bali.

Professional spirit!. Thought I would be making crap for the two hours. But no, with all the professional help and guidance, it was one of a life time experience to see a real piece of Jewelry emerging from your pattern on paper to a shiny piece in real life. And the whole experience for the class was amazingly wonderful. Thanks to the hospitality and kindness of Sunarta. One unforgettable morning in Ubud.

Truely great experience with amazing people. We had an really memorable experience with Sunarta and Monik . They were so genuine and made us feel like part of there family . I would recommend this to anyone ...Andy and Ingrid (England)

So much fun. Wow, this was a great class and I will have the memory forever in the beautiful silver bracelet that I made. Hard to believe that I could make such a lovely memory. Wayan is warm and thoughtful and genuinely enjoys helping you create.
Creating beautiful memories. Lots of fun! Highly recommend it. You are in his studio/ house, a real glimpse of Bali life. Kids loved making jewelry... Memories created. Beautiful experience.

Silver memory at Sunarta and Monik's compound. We attended Chez Monique Silver Smith Class by a temporary decision, which turn out to be a smart decision. Monik and his man helped us to make our rough sketch into shining artwork. Tough I was a bit clumsy in hammering and cutting, they instructed and help me patiently.Very nice place to drop at when you are at Ubud,Bali

Great Hands On Experience. We were greeted by Sunarta and shown around his family compound before we got down to business. I made a ring and since we had already chosen our designs, Sunarta set us up with our flat piece of silver and some tools straight away. It was a real challenge stamping our design onto the silver but with Sunarta's knowledge guiding us we excelled. He then bent the silver and welded it together before sanding and polishing it to the desired finish. In the end it was great fun and a worthwhile experience.

The Real Deal. Plain and simple, you will not be disappointed. Picked up from hotel and a quick five minute drive to the family compound. Be prepared to feel like you are one of the family as you are escorted and shown about. 'Classes' are small at max four people and we got lots of personal attention from advice to Balinese coffee! A tour through the rice paddies finished our day in style. A for sure in Ubud.

New Appreciation of Jewellery. I went with a friend to Chez Monique Jewellery making class. Wayan (Sunarta) was very welcoming and his family were wonderful. I never realised what amount of intricate work it takes to make jewellery. Sunarta was very patient and a very good teacher as was his helper. Sunarta picked us up from central Ubud and dropped us off again where we requested. The class went for a few hours and we were offered tea and coffee. After we designed our jewellery pieces and were helped greatly to achieve this I get to go home with a memento to keep forever of my trip to Ubud and the Chez Monique Silver Smith Class.Check out the Chez Monique Jewellery Shop. I can guarantee you wont leave without a memento.

Brilliant afternoon. You won't regret taking part in this class... A lovely welcome, and a chance to spend time in a Bali family compound. The tuition is great (and you are given lots of help along the way!) meaning you end up with a far better item of jewellery than you imagined! We had a brilliant time

Happy with our original pieces. Home atmosphere, organized friendly approach.Help with jewellery design if needed. But good idea to go with a sketch of what you want to creat.Need to check what the costs will be upfront for additional silver per gram. Overall experience is unique and rewarding.

Wow, so worth the visit. A smiling Sunarta greeted us at his family compound and let the 3 of us loose on his silver. We all chose to create a ring with the same design. A family gift to each of us. The finished product was amazing, and the process was enjoyable, fun and challenging. It took us about 3 hours to finish the rings but it was definitely the most rewarding 3 hours we have spent and better still no one else will have a ring like ours.
Very interesting and lots of fun. Sunarta and Monik welcome us with smile and a good coffee. Very nice persons. Good experience and good satisfaction after the polishing of our jewel.Will come back!

A wonderful experience from beginning to end. Sunarta is a fabulous host! He made our afternoon of silver crafting enjoyable and educational. The class takes place in the family compound, and you are given information about the layout and design of the compound. You are encouraged to seek your own design, but also helped along if you struggle with the actual drawing part.I would strongly suggest that you come with a design in mind. Coming up with the idea and drawing it took by far the most time of the experience. After your design is complete, you craft your piece (with assistance as necessary from the craftsmen). I will disagree with a previous reviewer. Everyone in our group made a pendant, and there was no "weighing" of the pieces when we were done. We were charged exactly what Sunarta said we would be charged. There was no pressure to buy anything else or upsize the pieces in any way. I went with my 12 year old daughter and she enjoyed it every bit as much as I did. Highly recommended.

Be Creative - Have some Fun. Sunarta is a lovely man with a warm heart. We were greeted with a big smile and a hug.I wanted to try something a little different as there are heaps of cooking classes and massage available. I thought it was a great idea to make something unique out of silver as a symbol of the magical time we have had here.I highly recommend this class. It's just plain good fun and anyone can do it so book now and enjoy!

Not to be missed, would do it again next time I am in Ubud. My husband and I were greeted by Sunarta and his wife Monik like we were members of the family. With no real talent we both made beautiful pieces of silver jewellery under the professional and very skilled guidance of Wayan Sunarta. This is not only great value it is also lots of fun and is quite a romantic thing to do with your partner. One tip would be to have something in mind or drawn out before you go, it helps to make sure you are making something you really want. When in Ubud this is a must do.

A great experience. We made a beautiful pendant and a ring - I was surprised how much Sunarta and the team let you do yourself although they are very helpful and full of ideas to get your creativity flowing. It was a great way to spend an afternoon in Ubud, the 'artistic centre' of Bali. Best to book in advance as Chez Monique is getting very popular!

Really fun and unique. We booked this class last minute and it was totally worth itSunarta picked us up at our hotel and took us to his family compound for the class. He has a lot of ideas to get your creative mojo working so you can formulate your design. Loved our finished pieces and recommend this when you are in ubud

Just wonderful!. We took a class with them for a day. They were so professional! We designed and made our own jewels. I think it was one of the activities we loved the most while in Bali! So friendly and patient! I love what I did, and the pendant I made is just the perfect way to remind me of my wonderful holidays in Bali. I totally recommand! This class and the people were completely awesome!

Very good because we were happy with our end product. We had a great time and I have already put my pictures of the jewellery on Facebook for everyone to see.It is something we never thought we would do in Aus but what a lovely way to spend some time in Bali – especially when it’s hot and rainy! The best.It was lovely to meet Sunarta and the family in their family compound. Interesting to see a minor bird in the cage – such pretty eyes they have I had never noticed before - in Aus they are everywhere and considered a pest pretty much! LolI would recommend the silver jewellery making class to everyone and we are enjoying the flaws and beauty of our work every day.I also pretty much concur with what everyone else has said - the good and the 'could be better' details too, all of them - so won't repeat it. Would I recommend it yes. Would I do it again. Sunarta did seem a tad tired on our day but was warm and embracing and I did leave with jewellery I would wear.

My favourite afternoon in Bali!. We had a wonderful time in Sunarta's class. My father and I made pendants and my step mother made a ring. Yes, the ring was over the 10g inclusive allowance but it was beautiful and created with love. And in the scheme of things still alot cheaper and more sentimental than had you walked into a shop to purchase so this was never an issue for us.It was lots of fun and any mistakes we made were corrected. It was a 3 1/2 hour class, so nice and relaxed. Sunarta helped by giving us ideas for our work and was always on hand for questions and assistance.

Fantastic - I recommend this class. I read about this class on trip advisor and saw that it had great reviews and really liked the idea of owning a piece of jewellery that I had made myself however, I had no idea how nice the ring I designed would turn out. I drew a design at home before I went Bali and when I showed it to Sunarta, who by the way, is one of the most friendliest people I have ever met, he said "no problem, easy", with a massive smile on his face. The class itself was great fun, and Sunarta and his helper were very accommodating and friendly and nothing was too much trouble, even after snapping a cutting wire for the third time!!!! The end result was amazing, something I would buy in a shop and I am so proud of the fact that I designed and made it myself (with some help of course) But this class was well worth the 400brp I paid for it and now I have a beautiful butterfly ring to show for it too. Sunarta picked me up from my hotel at no extra cost even though my hotel was quite a way out fo town and he dropped me off afterwards, chatting and smiling all the way. I would recommend this class to anyone, its a great way to get a bit of balinese culture as Sunarta's workshop is within his family compound, its very interesting learning how jewellery is made, plus the coffee he serves is pretty damn good too.

Unique and enjoyable. I have been to Bali many times and done the usual sightseeing stuff so when I read about this class on TA I thought it would be a fun and interesting thing to doI was not disappointedI emailed Wayan and set up an appointment.He met me at his shop and transported me to his lovely family compound on a side street up from Jalan RayaHe sat me down,offered me cold water and explained what was going to happenOriginally I was just going to go with one of his set designs but then decided to try to design something of my own.Having no artistic skill whatsoever I gave him a rough idea and he did the restI felt very fortunate that I was the only person signed up so I got his and the assistants full time attention as well as lots of chatting about his trip to America to the city I call homeEvery process was explained and I was allowed to do as much or as little as i wanted.Being devoid of skills i just did a little and let them do the rest as I didn't want to muck up my piece!Because I was the only one in the class it finished early. Wayan was willing to let me hang out and observe him making other jewelry pieces while we chatted but I didn't want to hold him back.Instead he took me on a short tour of the surrounding countryside talking about what was going on in the community before he dropped me offI thought the price of 400,000 rp was reasonable considering the price of silver which has skyrocketed.over the past few years.I doubt anyone could get a personally designed jewelry piece weighing 10 grams for the equivalent of $44 from any jeweler which was the cost of the classThank you Wayan for allowing me this opportunity to see what you do and learn about the complex series of steps needed to make a custom jewelry pieceI thoroughly enjoyed my time there and your infectious smile!

Beautiful silver jewellery but a bit sneaky in the way they do things.. We had a friendly greeting and a few pictures of jewellery to help us think of a design and were told to draw what we wanted and the exact size. The man made recommendations on ring sizes and what silver pieces to use to make our design. The brochure said we would have '10g of silver included in the price for your creation enough to make a ring or a pendant' and that 'additional stone or silver may be purchased in class'. As we have never worked with silver before we had no idea how much 10g of silver was and so presumed from the wording in the brochure, the thick example rings and his recommendations that 10g was enough to make our design as there was no mention of the need to purchase any extra silver. We started making our designs, cutting silver, filing it, engraving the inner band and watching the soldering. One thing we were a bit disappointed in was that we weren't explained the process unless we asked about it. All was fine until it came to the finished product. He put my partners ring on the weighing scales and it came to 19g, 9g over the allowance. At £1.40/gram we were a bit shocked we had to pay an extra £12.60 when we believed we were inside the allowance. I felt like we had been tricked into using more silver than we thought. I thought we had a set amount to use and if our design was too big then he would "honestly" inform us that 10g would not be enough and what the extra price per gram was. We did not mind paying the extra £12.60, it wasn't the cost, it was more the way he went about it. He argued his case by saying it is "impossible" to tell how much the jewellery will weigh until the end. An experienced silversmith, who has tourists in everyday making similar pieces, most definitely knows roughly what size and design is possible without going over the included 10g! Any tourist could go to town drawing a design and think it is within the 10g but expects the professionalism and experience of the silversmith to guide them otherwise. He also tried claiming my toe ring was 1-2 grams more that it was aswell, even when the scales were obviously off balance. We had some lovely jewellery at the end of it but just becareful not to make a ring over 1cm wide and watch him as he weighs it. Flat pendants should be within the 10g inclusion.

Something different and very inspiring. My boyfriend and I decided to try this jewellery making day after reading about it on Trip Advisor. It was a little difficult to find as there is no sign outside the front of the family compound. Once we found the place we found Sunarta (the host), very accommodating and patient. I had an idea for a ring I wanted to make and my boyfriend improvised as he went along. We both found it thoroughly enjoyable. It was a relaxed atmosphere and turned out that we were the only 2 in that afternoon's session, so had a lot of one on one time. Once we had finished our pieces we were driven to the Chez Monique shop in town where we made several purchases of beautiful jewellery. A wonderful experience on a very rainy day!

Memorable, relaxed and a great piece of jewellery to take home!. We read the reviews and decided to do this class one afternoon while on our honeymoon. We were lucky that it was a quiet day and there were just the two of us. We made a ring and a necklace pendant both with a cut out design of a tree (theme from our wedding) and the guys finished off our pieces which turned out looking like we bought them from a shop. Neither of us can draw or are particularly arty so we were very impressed with our results.You sit outside in his families compound watching relatives go about their daily work and having a laugh while doing the creating. It really is easier than expected, you get a lot of help and it's very relaxing.Highly recommend the class. We went to his shop afterwards to buy a necklace to go with the pendant. This wasn't cheap but the class itself is a good price considering you walk away with an individual piece you made yourself and you have a moment of local Ubud rather than touristy Ubud.

Something Different In Bali. We really enjoyed the day with Wayan and Monique. We've been to Bali numerous times and enjoyed the surfing, food, massages etc but this was something different. The peaceful surrounds of the family home are a relief after the bustle of the streets and the activity itself was unique. Creating something you've designed out of silver is really something special and being able to watch the craftsmanship of artists like Wayan and Harris as they help you was just wonderful.

Great insight into balinese life.... I thoroughly enjoyed the morning I spent at Sunarta's family compound.I was picked up from my hotel & given a warm embrace upon introducing myself.The family compound is beautiful & relaxing, giving such a nice insight into traditional balinese life.I was the only one in the class so was lucky to get Sunarta's full attention. I made a ring but all I really got to do was file some silver, I must have designed quite a hard piece as Sunarta's assistant did most of the work!Still, it's a great way to spend a morning or an afternoon.

Chez Monique is a special Balinese experience..... I must admit I didn't take a jewelery class but I did spent hours in this beautiful jewelery shop, on numerous ocassions, in the company of the very kind and thoughtful Ibu Wayan and Ibu Monik. Ubud is filled with beautiful shops, with beautiful things ... but Chez Monique is special. The designs are unlike others you'll see in Bali, no doubt because they are created by Ibu Monik's creative and talented husband Wayan.If you want something truly gorgeous, unique and Balinese, spend some time at Chez Monique. Everyone who sees my jewelery remarks how special and beautiful it is and I love it even more because it reminds me of the time I spent with these gracious people.

Fantastic Class. Skilled and Lovely Host. A perfect morning in Ubud!. This was definitely one of our very favorite experiences of our entire 2 week holiday in Bali. We came to nickname our wonderful instructor 'Sunny' and that pretty much sums up the morning. The process of creating a personalized piece of silver jewelry is truly fascinating and you really will be amazed at what you can make! The class was so rewarding and the time with Sunny made it even better. Definitely pay him a visit when you're in Ubud!

A creative project teens and adults can enjoy together. Our family--two adults and two teens with no prior silversmithing experience--spent a lovely, satisfying afternoon in the shady courtyard of Master silversmith Wayan Sunarta creating our own pieces of silver jewellery. We were welcomed warmly, offered drinks, and waited while Wayan finished with previous clients. With very little introduction and even less guidance, we set to work making rings (husband and daughter) and pendants (son and self). Wayan and his assistant were always ready to help with technical questions and show us how to accomplish our ideas. It was very very laid back; the atmosphere was relaxed and the time flew by despite the heat and some of the frustration of working in a totally new medium. We were all really happy with our pieces--I am still wearing the hammered silver ring my husband made me. One criticism is that we were made to wait a long time, despite coming on time. That time could have been well used if Wayan had set us up with paper and pencil and some parameters for thinking about our projects. Having never worked with silver we had no ideas where to begin. It would have been helpful to know some of the techniques and tools available. Such as the tiny block letter chisels that allows one to hammer words into the silver. It was only after I was almost done that we learned about them. A photo book of some ideas and designs would have been helpful as well. I would suggest coming with some ideas or sketches as there is no guidance given around what to make. We all enjoyed the afternoon very much and would certainly return.

Fantastic experience - a must if you visit Ubud. My partner and I booked a silver smith class at Chez Monique after reading the positive reviews on TripAdvisor. Neither of us have any experience with jewellery making but fancied trying something new. We were blown away by the friendliness and expertise we encountered in our interactions with Sunatra and his co-worker. We were picked up from our hotel by Sunatra for no extra charge and made to feel welcome in his home compound. His wife was extremely hospitable offering us food and drinks. Every step of the silver smithing process was explained to us in detail and we were encouraged and helped in coming up with our own designs. Despite being complete novices we were guided through the design steps, and at the end of three hours were SO pleased to have created an individual and unique piece of jewellery . We had such a wonderful time and would most definitely return for an "advanced" class if and when we return to Ubud. An absolute must for those who visit Bali - great for all ages and skill levels!

A great momento of your visit to Bali. We were visiting Bali for my sister's birthday and I wanted her to have something special to remember it by. Wayan is a lovely man, very welcoming and serene. We both went with some ideas in mind, which I recommend and Wayan was very supportive in our choice of designs. We had also looked at all the beautiful jewellery in his shop before he picked us up to take us to his place. I'm so surprised at how easy it was and how beautiful my pendant looks. My sister loves her pendant so all around it was a great experience. I love that Wayan was so modest when I mentioned he was number one on Tripadvisor.

A highlight. Instead of buying a silver souvenir,take the class and make your own. We couldn't have nice memories than the superb service and treatment we received. My wedding ring was getting worn after 42 years and I make a new one for myself on other finger. Wife and son-in-law also give 5 stars

An amazing and memorable experience!. My husband and I did the silversmith course on January 24 and found it to be one of the most memorable things we did on our trip to Bali. Sunarta was so warm and friendly and made out experience enjoyable and made our designs come into reality. Even my husband, who has no interest in jewellery (much to my despair) made a pendant for me that he was very proud of and insists I wear it every day!! I cannot recommend this course highly enough!!!

Fantastic silver jewellery making class. Beautiful Balinese family compound and surrounds. Sunarta and his helpers are fabulous with exceptional friendliness. An extremely enjoyable class where you come away with a first class piece of jewellery that you have helped to make. It's a very good idea to come with a picture of your design design.

Fantastic activity for whole family. Our two kids aged 13 and 11 had a great time making a creative memory of Bali. They both made silver rings with their own decorations - having a plan / design is important so that you can save time. Both Monique and Wayan were very welcoming into their home compound. It is easy to see why so many people have enjoyed this experience.

What a lovely thing to do on holiday!. We needed to find an activity between checking out at 2 pm and flying out at 10 pm. Chez Monique was the answer, a fun and informative way to spend an afternoon. Special requirements no problem - we needed to do our class one hour after it usually started and we also only wanted to learn about soldering and polishing. Wayan was happy to oblige and also picked us up and dropped us off at our hotel. Couldn't be happier!

what an experience. From the moment Sunarta picked us up there was an immediate warm and friendship, hugs not handshakes. He took us to his compound and gave us an insight into the style of living and family of the Balinese. This was a rare insight for a tourist. He listened to our crazy designs and thoughts and showed us how to make them into a reality. It was a fantastic experience to create something that will have memories literally beaten into it. Our designs, though simple, turned into a magnificent piece of jewerly that will be worn all the time. Just to see and be a part of the process of forging jewerly in a completely unique environment was truely amazing. I would highly recommend Sunarta and his family of silversmiths to anyone looking for an experience that they can bring home with them and wear as a daily reminder of their trip.On a side note be sure to visit Sunarta's shop which is located a few minutes away from his home, where you will be constructing your masterpiece. Despite what the name indicates it is one of the few local owned and operated businesses in the area. This means that all of the profits stay in the local community not abroad. The shop has been in the same format and place for around 15years, I think and still manages to stand out in quality and atmosphere. Go on keep it local and try your hand a something totally unique. We did and loved it.

A totally different thing to enjoy. You find the siver shop in Ubud then someone will ring for Sunarta to come and pick you up and take you to his family compound. He has a helper who helps out for your whole stay (2-3hrs).There were 2 couples including myself and my partner, and another lady. The brochure states the cost is 300 000 but it is actually 350 000 and you get included in the price drinks, enough silver to make a pendant (50cent AUD) piece size. Best to come with a good drawing to speed up the process...thenthey stick your design to the silver, you cut it out using a tiny saw( oops, I broke 3), then silver snips, then you file through the inside and outside of your design.Then you're up to soldiering on the loop for a chain/earing setting, then the polishing begins.Sunarta called my first design a 'practice' and allowed me to start from scratch again...and with his help my piece turned out exremely well,This activity is for all...my partner also made me a pendant.We recieved hugs from Sunarta and his wife (Monique) when we left, and a nice follow up email the next day.The price is totally worth it and although you may think it sounds high....compare it to having a meal(which at the end you have nothing to show).A must do in Ubud as well as the Bali Eco downhill 25km bike ride.

surprise yourself, unlock your creativity, and support a local industry. From the moment Monique picks you up, to the moment he hugs you goodbye you feel you are in the company of a new friend. On arrival you are carefully explained the process, and supported at every step. No mater what your ability the team will get the best out of you. You are able to use all the tools, with help at any tricky stages - leaving with really personal high quality pieces and a great feeling of satisfaction. While there are pictures for inspiration i would recommend taking some ideas, or images of pieces you might like to copy as this will really help get the most out of the process - they will tell you which are best attempted. We had a wonderful day and highly recommend! there may be other classes emerging, but none are as charming, friendly, or run by a local and his lovely family. Enjoy

A lovely 3 hours. We did this class with 2 of our adult children in Sunata's lovely, quiet family compound. A charming host and teacher, as are his assistant silver smiths who helped the four of us to complete our own pieces.

Fantastic class - MUST DO IN UBUD!. I don't usually like structured group activities on holiday. I struggle to remember one I have liked until now. Wayan and Montik are two of the nicest people I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. I LOVED this class. They welcomed us so graciously into their family compound and helped us make the most beautiful silver jewellery. I made exactly what I wanted as did my boyfriend.We can't say enough to everyone we speak to about how fantastic this class is. Well worth the money.

Lovely thing to do. This was just the best thing to do in Ubud. We had a lovely morning creating our pieces of art with help from the craftsman. It was excellent to be crafting our silver within the family compound and getting a glimpse of Balinese life at the same time. Our fellow classmates were really nice people too. Well worth the money and would have loved to go back for more.

Fab!. We had a fantastic morning at Sunatra's home - cutting, hammering, polishing and welding our lovely handmade pendants! A lovely thing to do in Ubud..book ahead as this is getting really popular!

Fun!. This was a fun experience! For $35, I came away with a beautiful silver ring etched with a gekko (to remind me of Bali and the lil' guy that hung out on my hotel room wall!). Folks were super helpful, super friendly and made you feel very welcome (and capable!). I highly recommend doing this. Call ahead for an appointment. The warung is on the left (#57) of the road Sri Wedari- just go through the compound to the back. Afterwards, treat yourself to spa bliss IMAN spa which is just a couple doors up.

A highlight!. My two daughters and I spent a wonderful morning here. Sunarta and his wife Monique were just delightful. My girls had been looking forward to this from Australia and were not disappointed. We started by drawing our designs and finished with 2 rings and a pendant that are gorgeous. I'm pretty hopeless but Sunarta and his assistant were really helpful and made sure I would end up with something I loved. I would certainly recommend this workshop no matter your level of skill.

fun, fun, fun. I went to Wayan's jewelry making course months ago. I had a wonderful time and made a beautiful pair of earrings. Wayan is one of those people who immediately makes you feel comfortable. Traveling as a single female this was very important. I had not one but two teachers who were there to help me with my every need. I was very happy with the final product and am planning to take my 2 friends back when I return in February. I must do for the creative type! My only regret is that i cancelled the second day due to other commitments, and when i tried to re-book Wayan was sick. Thanks Wayan and sorry it's taken so long to write this review!

Not just for the girls. As a male, I must say I was sceptical about a jewellery making course. After much reassurance from my girlfriend, we booked in for an afternoon class before our late flight home.It was terrific and a great way to spend our last afternoon in Bali. Wayan Sunarta was so hospitable and helpful. The class was held at his family compound which adds to the experience. Sunarta is eager to share his Balinese culture and language.The best thing about the class is the freedom. You are not confined to making any one type of jewellery or one design. What you want to make is up to you. So if you have any clue about jewellery, then I would say it’s best to have a design sketched before you go. Don’t be alarmed though, Sunarta is happy to give you as much design time as you like. He is very patient!

don't miss this class !. We had an awesome time at the class. We had never done anything like this beforebut thought it might be an interesting experience. We were picked up and dropped offat our hotel so it was very convenient. We had decided to make gecko rings and werevery happy with the final product. At the end of the class we also had the opportunity totry walking with baskets on our heads. Lots of fun but I won't be carrying around mygroceries on my head anytime soon ! Extremely friendly and accomodating, I highlyrecommend it.

Cheap class suitable even for a novice. I have never done any sort of jewellery making or any arts really but seeing all the reviews here I thought I'd give it a go.The class was 350.000rp. I think the duration depends on how long you take to make your piece - I was picked up at 8.50am and got back around 11am so it was shorter than I expected.I was really pleased with the class. Sunarta gave me tips to help with the design and explained everything clearly.Now I have a fantastic souvenir of my time in Bali and great memories as well.

Nice more-than-just silversmith class. We spent really nice 4 hours in this course that we'll never forget:First, you get to enter a local Balinese home, or what's called "compound". You get to see how a large family lives together in one small zone and how things are arranged.Second, you get to do whatever you want with 20 grams of silver, which is a good value.Third, you are taught everything from cutting to soldering, which is very interesting for people who're into handcrafts in generalHaving limited time, forces you to work in the most simple and basic methods ever, and you're forced to do a simple design and can't go very far with your imagination. What's really admirable is that the tools they use in Ubud are the most basic tools we saw in any handcrafting ever. And this makes you appreciate the amount of effort these guys make to produce something complicated when in your home country technology have made things million times easier. Make sure you have a design in mind before you go to speed things up.Certainly a recommended course for anyone and everyone, try and you wont regret it.

A new and rewarding experience. We decided, one evening after looking through tripadvisor, to try this experience. Neither of us have any craft/artistic experience - but we know what we like! We phoned Sunarta that evening and he then gave us our homework and agreed to come and collect us the next morning.Right on time we were picked up and taken to his family compound where he and his wife Monik made us feel very welcome offering us drinks and fresh fruit. We showed Sunarta our photos taken from the internet of the type of designs we would like to make, a ring (for him) and a pair of earrings (for her). Sunarta smiled and said no problem and we then spent the next couple of hours cutting, stamping, smoothing, hammering until we (and they) were satisfied with our handiwork. We each had our own teacher (his helper a patient and observant young man) who not only showed us what to do and encouraged us, but helped finish off to give the items that professional look (come on a couple of hours won't make you an expert silversmith!). We wore our jewellery with pride as we walked back to the centre of Ubud, a leisurely ten minute walk. For a couple of first timers we very impressed and vowed to do this again when we return to Ubud.Take your camera and capture the stages and the final outcome. A very, very pleasing experience which we highly recommend. Diane and Andrew

Just the escape I needed. Had a great time making a pendant at this workshop. If you're looking to do something different, accompanied by tranquil surroundings, go give this workshop a try. I am definitely returning to finish my necklace project (I still have another pendant to make). Fee is now 350 thousand, they just haven't printed new flyers with the new fee.

Great Time Learning About Making Silver Jewelry and UBUD!. We contacted Wayan Sunutra and he was very accommodating to our schedule and timing. He welcomed us into his home "Compound", and we learned a great deal from him about the Indonesian culture, Ubud, and the making of silver jewelry. This was a really good way to explore a bit of Bali, and do something totally unique. Wayan is a very talented artist and he has a beautiful home and shop in Ubud. This was a very pleasurable time and we came away with our own unique keepsakes. It offers another way to see Bali, and is a good way to spend your time while there.

Great experience.. I made a ring at the workshop. Really enjoyed the experience - Wayan and Monik are lovely welcoming people. Would recommend this workshop however the prices on the brochure/internet are not correct. Class is now Rps 350,000 - or is that just what they charged me?

Had a blast and LOVE the pendant I made! My boyfriend had fun too!. This was the highlight of our time in Ubud. We were picked up at our hotel by Sunarta himself and brought to his beautiful home. We were allowed to design what we wanted to make. It took me a while to make up my mind but Sunarta was very patient. Sunarta and his helper pay really close attention to their students and in the end you leave with a beautiful peice of jewelry that YOU created! His class was a lovely way to spend a morning, and to use your artistic skills. I would love to do a more in depth class if I had the time! I made a beautiful tree prednant, and my boyfriend made a very nice ring. Thanks again!!!

Beautiful setting to work in.. Wayan, monique & made were excellent host/teacher. Rather than a straight away formal lesson, I got to learn a few things about their family which was great. I was the only one during the lesson and wayan had his relative (made) to help. We all helped to make a very simple ring I designed. After the it has been made, they offered me some local fruits to eat and I tell you, try one of the Balinese apples here, it's super sweet and crunchy! Thank you, wayan, monique & made. I will be back again for my advanced lesson.Shell

Enjoyable experience, very friendly teachers, great rings. we really wanted to do a silver ring making workshop and were lucky to find chez Monique, they were accomodating to our last minute needs and offered us a homely experience.we are really happy with the rings that we made with the help of Wayan and Made and would highly recommend them to anyone, beginners like us or more experienced.

An exceptional teacher provides a five star experience for students.. My sister and I have made jewelry before, but wanted to have a Master Silversmith teach us specific techniques, and answer the many questions we had regarding the process of making Balinese style jewelry.
