We were not disappointed, as Wayan and his co-worker, Made, were so very generous with the information that they shared with us. As a teacher, I was impressed with: how well-spoken Wayan’s English is; his ability to listen and connect with people in the creative process; how focused and joyful he is in helping others achieve their goals; and how willing he is to accommodate each student. His integrity is based in years of experience, but most importantly, he is able to translate his real love of helping others into concrete results. Consequently, we had a fabulous experience. The three other students in the class also came home with individually unique pieces that they were excited to have completed with his assistance. No matter what level your skills, if you are wanting a great teacher to get you excited about making jewelry, come to Wayan Sunarta.

Great silver class highly recomended. my girlfriend and i did the morning silversmith class with sunarta and one of his staff.we had a great time!!!! we went in not really knowing what we wanted to create and drew a few small drawingS of what we might like and sunarta told us what he thought and added his expert touch to the drawings and then off to work it was. Cutting, filing and souldering and 3 hours later i had a ring that was even better then i had imagined.The entire class was done in sunarta and moniks home and we were given refreshments and a snack. they are both very kind and friendly people and welcomed us into thier home!!! thanks for every thing guys keep uo the good work!!!for the same price as a bike ride or a tour around town we had a great time and even get to take home a silver handmade sovenier!!!!!!!!!!!HIGHLY RECOMEND THIS TO EVERY ONE WOULDNT MISS IT IN UBUD

Wonderful experience with the friendly Sunarta. When travelling recently in Bali with friends to celebrate a big birthday milestone one of the experiences we wanted on our trip while in Ubud was to make a piece of silver jewelry to mark the occasion. Although we hadn't booked we dropped into Sunarta's lovely home where he holds his classes to ask if he could fit us in the next day - which he very obligingly did even though he already had bookings.Sunarta, his co-worker and his wife were all very welcoming and hospitable. He gave us advice on the best pieces to make, guided us through the process, stepped in at the difficult points and had us out the door in time for lunch (which was a short stroll around the corner to the main street of Ubud).We've let Sunarta know he needs to get up with house no. quickly on his compound so it's easier to find the place, and that we couldn't find a phone no. on his website - otherwise I couldn't fault this class.

Want to design and make your own jewelry - this is the place. Chez Monque's Studio is on his familys compound in Ubud; walking distance from the main street. Upon arrival I was introduced to his other workers and asked if I would like tea, coffee or water to drink. Although it was warm out, we worked on a large veranda and were not in the sun. I had bought a jewelry catalog with me from the states which was a big help to show Wayan what I was thinking about making and the difficulty that would be involved. I might add Wayan speaks excellent english and was very easy to understand. I decided on a silver ring. Making this was nothing like I expected. The process was quite extensive. We started with a flat piece of silver which I hammered (see photo) to get a texture on my band. We soldered, sanded, and used different chemicals (which the master silversmiths did for me) to come up with my beautiful finished product.The total time spent was about 2-1/2 hours but I knew pretty much what I wanted.This is a class I will take again upon my return trip to Bali and I highly recommend it. There is nothing like designing your own piece of jewelry in Bali to bring home.

Lovely workshop, creative, interesting in local, very friendly atmosphere!. After seeing the result and enthusiastic story from another traveller, and being interested in jewelry and a nice souvenir for myself:-) I rang Wayan Sunarta for a workshop. He is a very nice guy, who can tell you a lot about the process, the business, Ubud in general and many more stories and information.The workshop is held on the family compound, not in the shop on Jalan Dewi Sita (also very nice to have a look and get some inspriation for designs) but a bit up the road on Jalan Sri Wedari. It is not signposted so ask mr Sunarta for directions or he's happy to pick you up from Nomads restaurant! If you have some ideas about what you want to make and a design, bring a drawing, picture or something. If you dont have that, that 's fine too! Together we designed a simple, but stylish ring (well most of that was his idea, as I had no cour:-)).Together with his friend they explained, showed and told me about the process, and of course I was encouraged to have a go myself! It is quite difficult, but once you get the hang of it...I had a great time, learned something new and have a lovely souvenir to take home.So......highly recommended!

Interesting silver jewelry making experience and excellent service!!!. My fiance and I love art so we had decided to join some art courses before we visited Ubud (as Ubud is famous of different kinds of art). We walked around Ubud downtown and found this silver jewelry shop (www.chezmoniquejewelry.com) The owner, Wayan Sunarta, is a super nice guy. Other than offering silver smith class, he also led us to look for wooden carving shops as we want to buy high quality wooden carving door / window. Without him, we couldn't know where they are and how to negotiate in local language. About the silver smith class, we arrived at Wayan's shop to choose the silver jewelry we want to make and ask for his advice. Since we're only beginners, we'd better make some simple jewelry. We finally decided to make a ring and a gecko brooch / pendant. It's a very interesting process and so different from the feeling that you just buy the jewelry from a shop! For the gecko brooch / pendant, we first cut the shape of a gecko from a piece of paper. According to this paper, we cut out the same shape of gecko from a silver sheet. Then bang the pattern by a thick needle on the silver sheet. Finally stick the hook and brooch pin at the back of gecko silver sheet. It sounds simple but it needs quite a lot of patience and details. The process of melting the silver hook and brooch pin to stick on the gecko back sounds easy but it's actually very difficult so control the instrument. For the ring, it's made from several pieces so we firstly needed to cut the silver sticks into several parts. Sticking them together by the flaming instrument. Then cut out two leaf shape of silver sheet, smoothen the edges and stuck them on the ring. The final process of any silver jewelry is to polish them until shiny by a polishing instrument. Again, it looks easy but you have to hold the jewelry really tight. After polishing them, the jewelry looks so different and beautiful!!! It's a memorable experience and cannot compare with just buying jewelry from shops since you don't know the making process. These two pieces of jewelry become so precious to us and very good souvenir for Bali!!!
